original: zhes byang chub tu sems bskyed pas sems can thams cad la snying rje chen po 'jug ste /
analyzed: zhes byang chub tu sems bskyed pas sems can thams cad la snying rje chen po 'jug ste /
translated: Thus, by generating the Thought of Enlightenment, great compassion enters into all sentient beings.

original: de bdag nyid kyis stong ba sna des ji ltar sha za bar 'gyur /
analyzed: de bdag nyid kyis stong ba sna des ji ltar sha za bar 'gyur /
translated: How could that one, who is empty of self, eat flesh?

original: gang yang nyan thos kyi theg pa pa snying rje med pa de yang bkag pa ste /
analyzed: gang yang nyan thos kyi theg pa pa snying rje med pa de yang bkag pa ste /
translated: Also, the one who is a Hearer, without compassion, is prohibited.

original: sha dang nya la sogs pa ni //
analyzed: sha dang nya la sogs pa ni //
translated: Meat, fish, and so on,

original: rab tu byung bas bsdos zos na //
analyzed: rab tu byung bas bsdos zos na //
translated: if the renunciate eats,

original: brtse ba med pa'i sems skye bas //
analyzed: brtse ba med pa'i sems skye bas //
translated: he will generate a mind without compassion,

original: de'i phyir gsod pa'ang 'byung bar 'gyur //üîΩzhes bya bas so //
analyzed: de'i phyir gsod pa'ang 'byung bar 'gyur // zhes bya bas so //
translated: and therefore killing will occur.

original: sha'i 'dod chen la goms te sdig pa'i las kyis sha za ba'i rigs su sha za bar 'gyur ba dang / lha dang klu dang / @47a * //
analyzed: sha'i 'dod chen la goms te sdig pa'i las kyis sha za ba'i rigs su sha za bar 'gyur ba dang / lha dang klu dang / @47a * //
translated: Thus, by the force of the sin of eating meat, one will be born in the family of flesh-eaters, and will eat meat.

original: gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po dang / mi dang mi ma yin pa la sogs pa'i sems can rnams sha'i ro myong ba la chags pa sems can la gnod pa'i sems ji ltar spong bar 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po dang / mi dang mi ma yin pa la sogs pa'i sems can rnams sha'i ro myong ba la chags pa sems can la gnod pa'i sems ji ltar spong bar 'gyur ba dang /
translated: How will the gods, nƒÅgas, yak·π£as, gandharvas, demigods, garu·∏ças, ki·πÉnaras, mahoragas, humans, non-humans, and other beings who are attached to the taste of flesh and who have the intention to harm sentient beings give up such thoughts?

original: mtha' gsum gtsang zhing lhung bzed du stsal ba 'bras la sogs pa bzhin du chags pa med cing btang snyoms kyi sems kyis 'tshol cig par thams cad mkhyen pas thun mong du chud par mdzad du gsol /
analyzed: mtha' gsum gtsang zhing lhung bzed du stsal ba 'bras la sogs pa bzhin du chags pa med cing btang snyoms kyi sems kyis 'tshol cig par thams cad mkhyen pas thun mong du chud par mdzad du gsol /
translated: The omniscient one should make it understood that all sentient beings, such as humans and non-humans, should seek food without attachment and with an attitude of equanimity, like rice in a begging bowl, pure in the three aspects, in order to abandon the thought of harming sentient beings who are attached to the taste of meat, such as yakshas, gandharvas, asuras, garudas, kinnaras, mahoragas, humans, and non-humans.

original: ji ltar ting nge 'dzin rgyal po las gsungs pa /
analyzed: ji ltar ting nge 'dzin rgyal po las gsungs pa /
translated: As it is said in the Samadhiraja Sutra:

original: mdzangs pa blo can mkhas pa yi //
analyzed: mdzangs pa blo can mkhas pa yi //
translated: The wise, the intelligent, the learned

original: zas gtsang zhim po cung zad 'gyur //
analyzed: zas gtsang zhim po cung zad 'gyur //
translated: may eat a little pure, clean food.

original: de nyid du ni bzhag med na //
analyzed: de nyid du ni bzhag med na //
translated: If it is not left there,

original: rnal can de za bkag med rung //
analyzed: rnal can de za bkag med rung //
translated: it is permissible for the yogi to eat it.

original: ya rabs dang ma rabs kyi tshig la mngon par chags pa'i blo dgag pa'i don du ji bzhin du sems can rnams kyi don chung bar 'gyur ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: ya rabs dang ma rabs kyi tshig la mngon par chags pa'i blo dgag pa'i don du ji bzhin du sems can rnams kyi don chung bar 'gyur ba de bzhin du /
translated: The purpose of the Buddha's teaching is to refute the idea that words are real, whether good or bad.

original: sangs rgyas kyi gsung rab tu sgra sbyong bar mdzad de /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi gsung rab tu sgra sbyong bar mdzad de /
translated: The Buddha's teaching is like a grammar,

original: des na de dang gzhan du yang yul dbus kyi bar klog go //
analyzed: des na de dang gzhan du yang yul dbus kyi bar klog go //
translated: because it is the same in the central country and elsewhere.

original: ji ltar thams cad mkhyen pas gsungs pa /
analyzed: ji ltar thams cad mkhyen pas gsungs pa /
translated: As the Omniscient One said:

original: dge slong dag phyi'i gtsug lag rnams ni lcags kyi se'u dang mtshungs te /
analyzed: dge slong dag phyi'i gtsug lag rnams ni lcags kyi se'u dang mtshungs te /
translated: Monks, the external sciences are like a iron bar.

original: 'bad pa chen pos khong du chud par bya ste /
analyzed: 'bad pa chen pos khong du chud par bya ste /
translated: They are to be understood with great effort,

original: khong du chud kyang 'dod chags dang bral ba dang zhi ba'i don med pas na 'bras bu med pa yin no //
analyzed: khong du chud kyang 'dod chags dang bral ba dang zhi ba'i don med pas na 'bras bu med pa yin no //
translated: but they are fruitless, because they do not lead to freedom from desire and to peace.üîΩWhy are the fields of the Buddhas

original: ji ltar zhing rnams nyi zla'i dbyibs //
analyzed: ji ltar zhing rnams nyi zla'i dbyibs //
translated: shaped like the sun and moon,üîΩlike Mount Meru, a lotus,

original: ri rab padmo 'dra ba dang // dpal be'u seng ge'i dbyibs 'dra ba //
analyzed: ri rab padmo 'dra ba dang // dpal be'u seng ge'i dbyibs 'dra ba //
translated: a swastika, and a vajra?

original: ci yi slad pa bdag la gsungs //
analyzed: ci yi slad pa bdag la gsungs //
translated: Please explain this to me.

original: zhes bya ba ni zhing rnam pa du mar gzhag pa ni ji ltar sems can rnams la mngon par dad pa'i rgyur 'gyur ba de ltar thams cad mkhyen pa gzugs rnam pa sna tshogs kyi rnal 'byor gyi dbang po rnams kyis byin gyis rlob par mdzad de /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni zhing rnam pa du mar gzhag pa ni ji ltar sems can rnams la mngon par dad pa'i rgyur 'gyur ba de ltar thams cad mkhyen pa gzugs rnam pa sna tshogs kyi rnal 'byor gyi dbang po rnams kyis byin gyis rlob par mdzad de /
translated: Thus, the various aspects of the field are established in accordance with the causes of sentient beings' faith, and the Lord of Yogins, the Omniscient One, blesses them with various forms.

original: ji ltar 'phags pa dri ma med par grags pas bstan pa las byung ba /
analyzed: ji ltar 'phags pa dri ma med par grags pas bstan pa las byung ba /
translated: As it is said in the teaching of the noble Vimalakirti:

original: bsam pa yongs su dag pa ni zhing yongs su dag pa'o zhes so //
analyzed: bsam pa yongs su dag pa ni zhing yongs su dag pa'o zhes so //
translated: A pure attitude is a pure field.

original: de nas nyi ma dang zla ba dang / ri rab dang / padmo dang / dpal be'u mngon par mdzes pa'i rgyan rnams kyi zhing bkod par mdzad do //
analyzed: de nas nyi ma dang zla ba dang / ri rab dang / padmo dang / dpal be'u mngon par mdzes pa'i rgyan rnams kyi zhing bkod par mdzad do //
translated: Then, the field is adorned with the ornaments of the sun, moon, Mount Meru, lotuses, and endless knots.

original: ji ltar 'phags pa 'jam dpal gyi zhing bkod pa'i rgyan @47b dang / bde ba can gyi zhing gi rgyan la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: ji ltar 'phags pa 'jam dpal gyi zhing bkod pa'i rgyan @47b dang / bde ba can gyi zhing gi rgyan la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: As in the ornament of the array of the field of the noble Manjusri, and the ornament of the field of Sukhavati, and so on.

original: steng dang 'og tu bkod pa dag / mig 'phrul 'dra ba ji lta bu //
analyzed: steng dang 'og tu bkod pa dag / mig 'phrul 'dra ba ji lta bu //
translated: The arrays above and below are like a magical illusion.

original: rin chen kun gyi zhing rnams kyang //
analyzed: rin chen kun gyi zhing rnams kyang //
translated: And the fields of all the jewels

original: ji ltar ci slad bdag la gsungs //
analyzed: ji ltar ci slad bdag la gsungs //
translated: Please tell me, why is this so?

original: zhes bya ba ni 'og dang / bar dang / ltag dang / glo dang / rgyun chags dang / bar chad du zhing gi snang ba rnam par gnas te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'og dang / bar dang / ltag dang / glo dang / rgyun chags dang / bar chad du zhing gi snang ba rnam par gnas te /
translated: The appearances of the fields are established in the lower, middle, upper, side, continuous, and interrupted directions.

original: de dag thams cad kyang phyi'i snang ba grub pa med bar sgyu ma dang 'dra zhing so sor snang ba'i rim pa sems can rnams kyi las kyi rnam pa sna tshogs su snang ngo //
analyzed: de dag thams cad kyang phyi'i snang ba grub pa med bar sgyu ma dang 'dra zhing so sor snang ba'i rim pa sems can rnams kyi las kyi rnam pa sna tshogs su snang ngo //
translated: All of these are like illusions without established external appearances, and the stages of individual appearances manifest as the various karmic appearances of sentient beings.

original: ji ltar rdo rje gcod pa las 'byung ba /
analyzed: ji ltar rdo rje gcod pa las 'byung ba /
translated: As it is said in the Diamond Cutter:

original: zhing gi rgyan zhing gi rgyan zhes bya ba de dag ni zhing gi rgyan ma yin par de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs so zhes pa'o //
analyzed: zhing gi rgyan zhing gi rgyan zhes bya ba de dag ni zhing gi rgyan ma yin par de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs so zhes pa'o //
translated: The so-called ornaments of the fields are not ornaments of the fields, as taught by the Tathagata.

original: sems can gang dag la bsod nams kyi tshogs rnam par smin pa so sor snang bar 'gyur zhing bsod nams kyi tshogs rnam par grub pa thams cad ni rin po cher snang ngo //
analyzed: sems can gang dag la bsod nams kyi tshogs rnam par smin pa so sor snang bar 'gyur zhing bsod nams kyi tshogs rnam par grub pa thams cad ni rin po cher snang ngo //
translated: For sentient beings, the accumulations of merit will manifest individually, and all the established accumulations of merit will appear as jewels.

original: pi wang rnga yi dbyibs 'dra dang // 'bras bu me tog sna tshogs 'dra //
analyzed: pi wang rnga yi dbyibs 'dra dang // 'bras bu me tog sna tshogs 'dra //
translated: Some have the shape of a lute, a drum, or a fruit, or are like various flowers.

original: nyi zla dag dang rnam bral ba //
analyzed: nyi zla dag dang rnam bral ba //
translated: They are free from the sun and moon.

original: ji ltar ci slad bdag la gsungs //
analyzed: ji ltar ci slad bdag la gsungs //
translated: Please tell me, how and why?

original: zhes bya ba ni pi wang la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyi dbyibs dang me tog dang 'bras bu lta bu'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni pi wang la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyi dbyibs dang me tog dang 'bras bu lta bu'o //
translated: The shape of the Buddha's body is like a lute, etc., like a fruit, or like various flowers.

original: nyi ma dang zla ba'i 'od dang bral ba ni rnam pa du ma'i bsod nams kyi khyad par gyi zhing gi rgyan dang rang gi 'od kyis so sor snang ngo //
analyzed: nyi ma dang zla ba'i 'od dang bral ba ni rnam pa du ma'i bsod nams kyi khyad par gyi zhing gi rgyan dang rang gi 'od kyis so sor snang ngo //
translated: They are free from the light of the sun and moon, and appear individually with the light of their own merit field of various special merits.

original: la la sprul pa'i sangs rgyas dang // sangs rgyas la la rnam smin byung //üîΩyang dag ye shes sangs rgyas rnams //
analyzed: la la sprul pa'i sangs rgyas dang // sangs rgyas la la rnam smin byung // yang dag ye shes sangs rgyas rnams //
translated: Some are emanation buddhas, some are buddhas arisen from evolution.

original: ji ltar ci slad bdag la gsungs //
analyzed: ji ltar ci slad bdag la gsungs //
translated: Please tell me, how and why?

original: zhes bya ba ni sprul pa gang dag mya ngan las 'da' bar byed pa de dag sprul pa'i sku'i sangs rgyas yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sprul pa gang dag mya ngan las 'da' bar byed pa de dag sprul pa'i sku'i sangs rgyas yin no //
translated: The emanations that perform nirvana are emanation body buddhas.

original: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs rnam par smin pa las byung ba gzugs rnam pa sna tshogs kyi rnal 'byor gyi dbang po lha la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor gyi dbang po mgu bar mdzad pa thog mar mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i
analyzed: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs rnam par smin pa las byung ba gzugs rnam pa sna tshogs kyi rnal 'byor gyi dbang po lha la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor gyi dbang po mgu bar mdzad pa thog mar mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i
translated: The one who is pleased with the yogis and yoginis who have arisen from the ripening of the accumulations of merit and wisdom, who has various forms, who is the lord of yogis and yoginis such as the gods, who is the omniscient one who first attained complete buddhahood,

original: snang ba dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin la zhugs te /
analyzed: snang ba dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin la zhugs te /

analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad kyi sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das btsun gtso de dag snang ngo //

original: gang gi tshe shes rab kyis sbom pa dang phra ba /
analyzed: gang gi tshe shes rab kyis sbom pa dang phra ba /
translated: when he is seen by wisdom, the coarse and subtle

original: gzugs ni rdul phran gzhigs pa na //
analyzed: gzugs ni rdul phran gzhigs pa na //

analyzed: rdul phran cha ni yod pa min //

analyzed: @48a * // zhes bya ba de'i tshe phyi'i don la mi dmigs te /
translated: At that time, external objects are not observed.

original: 'dzin pa dang gzung ba'i rnam pa dang bral nas bsam pa med cing snang ba med pa gnyis su med pa'i don dam pa'i bden pa de bzhin nyid la rang gi rig par zhugs pa de dag ni chos kyi sku'i de bzhin nyid kyi sangs rgyas bcom ldan
analyzed: 'dzin pa dang gzung ba'i rnam pa dang bral nas bsam pa med cing snang ba med pa gnyis su med pa'i don dam pa'i bden pa de bzhin nyid la rang gi rig par zhugs pa de dag ni chos kyi sku'i de bzhin nyid kyi sangs rgyas bcom ldan
translated: Free from the aspects of grasping and the grasped, without thought, without appearance, the meaning of nonduality, the suchness of ultimate truth, they enter into their own awareness. They are called the bhagavƒÅn buddhas of the suchness of the dharmakƒÅya.

original: 'das zhes bgyi las na thams cad mkhyen pas sku gsum gyi khyad par bstan du gsol /
analyzed: 'das zhes bgyi las na thams cad mkhyen pas sku gsum gyi khyad par bstan du gsol /
translated: Since that is so, please teach the differences of the three kƒÅyas.

analyzed: ci slad ji ltar 'dod khams su //
translated: Why is it that in the desire realm

analyzed: rnam sangs rgyas bdag la gsungs //
translated: the buddhahood is not taught to me?

original: ci yi slad du 'og min du //
analyzed: ci yi slad du 'og min du //

analyzed: chags bral khrod du mngon sangs rgyas //

original: zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i khams su sprul pa'i sku mngon par 'tshang rgya bar bstan pa ni rdzogs longs spyod pa'i sku bstan pa'i skal ba med cing rkyen du ma bab pa la sprul pa'i sku 'tshang rgya ba'i rim par ma bstan na 'dod pa'i khams kyi
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i khams su sprul pa'i sku mngon par 'tshang rgya bar bstan pa ni rdzogs longs spyod pa'i sku bstan pa'i skal ba med cing rkyen du ma bab pa la sprul pa'i sku 'tshang rgya ba'i rim par ma bstan na 'dod pa'i khams kyi
translated: The explanation of the buddhahood of the nirmƒÅ·πáakƒÅya in the desire realm is as follows: If the explanation of the sambhogakƒÅya is not the fortune of those who are not the proper condition, and if the stages of the buddhahood of the nirmƒÅ·πáakƒÅya are not explained, then the nirmƒÅ·πáakƒÅya will not be explained in the desire realm.

original: sems can rnams yid mi ches te /
analyzed: sems can rnams yid mi ches te /
translated: Beings do not believe this.

original: 'dod pa na spyod ba'i lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi 'am ci dang / lto 'bye chen po dang / mi dang mi ma yin pa'i sems can rnams drang ba'i don du bdud bcom nas 'dod pa'i khams su mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas par /üîΩci yi slad du 'og min du //
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod ba'i lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi 'am ci dang / lto 'bye chen po dang / mi dang mi ma yin pa'i sems can rnams drang ba'i don du bdud bcom nas 'dod pa'i khams su mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas par / ci yi slad du 'og min du //
translated: In order to lead the gods, nagas, yakshas, gandharvas, demigods, garu·∏ças, ki·πÉnaras, mahoragas, humans, and nonhumans of the desire realm, he conquered MƒÅra and manifested complete enlightenment in the desire realm.üîΩWhy did you attain manifest enlightenment

original: chags bral khrod du mngon sangs rgyas //üîΩzhes bya ba ni gzugs kyi khams su skyes nas gnas bcu bdun gyi bsam gtan la snyoms par zhugs pa rnams tshangs ba la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor la mngon par ya mtshan du 'dzin pa bsal ba'i don du der longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku rnam par snang mdzad
analyzed: chags bral khrod du mngon sangs rgyas // zhes bya ba ni gzugs kyi khams su skyes nas gnas bcu bdun gyi bsam gtan la snyoms par zhugs pa rnams tshangs ba la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor la mngon par ya mtshan du 'dzin pa bsal ba'i don du der longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku rnam par snang mdzad
translated: in Akani·π£·π≠ha, the realm of no-thought?üîΩIn order to dispel the amazement of those born in the form realm who are absorbed in the meditative concentration of the seventeen abodes, such as BrahmƒÅ, the enjoyment body Vairocana

original: mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba'i tshul gyis sangs rgyas te /
analyzed: mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba'i tshul gyis sangs rgyas te /
translated: manifested the attainment of manifest enlightenment in the form realm.

original: der rnal 'byor pa rnams la chos bshad par mdzad na mngon par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi ye shes kyi rgyun 'di bstan du gsol //
analyzed: der rnal 'byor pa rnams la chos bshad par mdzad na mngon par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi ye shes kyi rgyun 'di bstan du gsol //
translated: If you teach the Dharma to the yogins there, please teach this stream of the intuition of manifest, perfect enlightenment.

original: bde gshegs mya ngan 'das na ko //
analyzed: bde gshegs mya ngan 'das na ko //
translated: After the Sugata's nirvana,

original: bstan pa su zhig 'dzin par 'gyur //
analyzed: bstan pa su zhig 'dzin par 'gyur //
translated: who will uphold the teaching?

original: ston pa ji srid rab tu bzhugs //
analyzed: ston pa ji srid rab tu bzhugs //
translated: How long will the teacher remain?

original: tshul yang ji srid gnas par 'gyur //
analyzed: tshul yang ji srid gnas par 'gyur //
translated: How long will the system last?

original: zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyi bstan pa khyad par du theg pa chen po ni btsun gtso tshig gi dbang po la gtad par 'phags pa 'jam dpal gzhon nu'i rgyud las klog go //

translated: Thus, the holy lord of speech, Manjusri, the youthful one, is appointed to the special teaching of the Lord, the Great Vehicle, in the Manjusrimula Tantra.üîΩHere it also says:

original: 'di nyid du yang gsungs pa @48b lho phyogs be ta'i yul du ni //
analyzed: 'di nyid du yang gsungs pa @48b lho phyogs be ta'i yul du ni //
translated: In the south, in the land of Vidarbha,

original: dge slong dpal ldan cher grags pa //
analyzed: dge slong dpal ldan cher grags pa //
translated: a monk, glorious and greatly renowned,

original: de ming klu zhes bod pa ste //
analyzed: de ming klu zhes bod pa ste //
translated: called Nagarjuna,

original: yod dang med pa'i phyogs 'jig pa //üîΩnga yi theg pa 'jig rten du //
analyzed: yod dang med pa'i phyogs 'jig pa // nga yi theg pa 'jig rten du //
translated: will destroy the positions of existence and nonexistence.üîΩHaving well explained in the world

original: bla med theg chen rab bshad nas //
analyzed: bla med theg chen rab bshad nas //
translated: my vehicle, the unsurpassed Great Vehicle,

original: rab tu dga' ba'i sa bsgrub ste //
analyzed: rab tu dga' ba'i sa bsgrub ste //
translated: he will attain the stage of joy.

original: bde ba can du de 'gro'o //
analyzed: bde ba can du de 'gro'o //
translated: He will go to SukhƒÅvatƒ´.

original: gang na rtogs pa dang dge slong gi las yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur zhing nyams pa med par lo stong gi bar du bstan pa gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang na rtogs pa dang dge slong gi las yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur zhing nyams pa med par lo stong gi bar du bstan pa gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: There, the realization and the work of the monks will be completed, and the teaching will remain for a thousand years without decline.

original: dus dam pa yang lo brgyad khri bzhi stong nas dus dar te /
analyzed: dus dam pa yang lo brgyad khri bzhi stong nas dus dar te /
translated: The excellent time will be when the human life span is eighty-four thousand years.

original: skye dgu'i tshe lo brgyad khri na mchog tu yongs su dag cing 'dod chags dang bral ba thams cad mkhyen pa rnal 'byor gyi dbang po btsun gtso byams pa mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba'i bar du'o //

translated: When the human life span is eighty thousand years, Maitreya, the most pure and detached, the omniscient lord of yoga, will fully awaken to supreme enlightenment.

translated: The ≈õrƒÅma·πáera, the ≈õrƒÅma·πáerikƒÅ, and the bhik·π£u.

analyzed: brgya ni mtha' med par nye bar brtag par bya'o //

analyzed: gnas 'pho ba ni bstsal ba'o //

original: de la yod pa dang med pa'i rnam par rtog pa kun tu spangs pa na snang ba med pa brgya yang gnyis su med do //üîΩrang sangs rgyas dang / nyan thos dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin du rtogs @49a * //
analyzed: de la yod pa dang med pa'i rnam par rtog pa kun tu spangs pa na snang ba med pa brgya yang gnyis su med do // rang sangs rgyas dang / nyan thos dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin du rtogs @49a * //

original: pa mtshungs pa nyid do //
analyzed: pa mtshungs pa nyid do //
translated: The Solitary Realizers, Hearers, and Bodhisattvas have the same realization of the three doors of liberation, emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness, as the concentration of non-appearance.

analyzed: ji ltar 'phags ma shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las 'byung ba /

translated: ‚ÄúWhen they enter into those, they will understand the three knowledges.‚ÄùüîΩBy what supramundane higher perception

analyzed: 'jig rten 'das kyi'ang ji lta bur //

original: sems ni sa rnams bdun po yang //
analyzed: sems ni sa rnams bdun po yang //
translated: How is the mind on the seven stages?

original: ji ltar ci slad bdag la gsungs //
analyzed: ji ltar ci slad bdag la gsungs //

analyzed: gzhan gyi sems shes pa dang / sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa dang / lha'i mig dang / lha'i rna ba zhes bya ba mngon par shes pa lnga ni 'jig rten pa'i rnal 'byor ba dang thun mong pa'o //

analyzed: de 'byung bas 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal las thar bar 'gyur ro //

analyzed: sa gnyis dag ni gnas yin te //

analyzed: sa gzhan nga yi rang bzhin no //

analyzed: ji ltar 'di nyid du gsungs pa / dngos min dngos po min yang min //

analyzed: yod dang med par mi dmigs pa //
translated: not existent, not non-existent,

original: 'di ni dbu ma'i nan tan te //
analyzed: 'di ni dbu ma'i nan tan te //
translated: this is the practice of the middle way,

original: nga dang gzhan gyis bshad pa'o //
analyzed: nga dang gzhan gyis bshad pa'o //
translated: as explained by me and others.

original: ji ltar 'phags ma shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las 'byung ba /
analyzed: ji ltar 'phags ma shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las 'byung ba /
translated: As it is said in the noble Perfection of Wisdom:

original: zhes bya ba ni so sor thar pa'i sdom pa dang / gnyi ga sdom pa pa dang phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' chen po'i dge 'dun no //

analyzed: dge 'dun gyi dpes kyang nyan thos kyi theg pa pa dang 'gyur ro //
translated: The example of the Sa·πÖgha also applies to those of the ≈örƒÅvaka Vehicle.

original: gnas khang gcig tu gnas par mi bya ba dang / lam gcig tu 'gro bar mi bya ste /
analyzed: gnas khang gcig tu gnas par mi bya ba dang / lam gcig tu 'gro bar mi bya ste /

analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /

original: sems can gso ba'i gtsug lag tu gyur ba ni gti mug gi rgyu las sdig pa'i nad log pa'i ye shes kyis 'byung ba yang dag pa'i ye shes kyis ldog par 'gyur ba de de ltar thams cad mkhyen pas gsungs so //
analyzed: sems can gso ba'i gtsug lag tu gyur ba ni gti mug gi rgyu las sdig pa'i nad log pa'i ye shes kyis 'byung ba yang dag pa'i ye shes kyis ldog par 'gyur ba de de ltar thams cad mkhyen pas gsungs so //
translated: The science of healing sentient beings is taught by the Omniscient One in this way: the disease of evil karma arising from the cause of delusion is reversed by the pristine wisdom of the reversal of error through the pristine wisdom of reality.

analyzed: 'od srungs log par dad sel dang // gser thub kyang ni nga yin zhes //

original: thub pa chen po ci slad gsungs //
analyzed: thub pa chen po ci slad gsungs //

original: zhes bya ba ni mchog tu yongs su dag pa 'dod chags dang bral zhing thams cad mkhyen pa rnal 'byor gyi dbang po gzugs kyi cho 'phrul gyis mtha' yas pa'i sems can gyi rgyud mgu bar mdzad pa de ji bzhin pa rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas nga yang de
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni mchog tu yongs su dag pa 'dod chags dang bral zhing thams cad mkhyen pa rnal 'byor gyi dbang po gzugs kyi cho 'phrul gyis mtha' yas pa'i sems can gyi rgyud mgu bar mdzad pa de ji bzhin pa rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas nga yang de
translated: This is the meaning of the intention: The one who is supremely pure, free from attachment, omniscient, the lord of yoga, I, the perfect Buddha, am just like that, just as he is, the one who delights the mind-streams of infinite sentient beings with the magical display of form.

original: bzhin no zhes de ltar bu'i don dgongs pa mdo sde 'di nyid du gsung ba mdzad do //
analyzed: bzhin no zhes de ltar bu'i don dgongs pa mdo sde 'di nyid du gsung ba mdzad do //
translated: Thus it is said in this very sutra.

original: bdag dang sems can cis med brjod //
analyzed: bdag dang sems can cis med brjod //
translated: Self and sentient being are said to be nonexistent.

original: rtag dang 'jig gtam ji lta bu //üîΩci slad sems can yang dag nyid //
analyzed: rtag dang 'jig gtam ji lta bu // ci slad sems can yang dag nyid //
translated: How is it that the Buddha has not explained the doctrines of permanence and annihilation?

original: thams cad du na bshad mi mdzad //üîΩces bya ba la /
analyzed: thams cad du na bshad mi mdzad // ces bya ba la /
translated: Why has the TathƒÅgata not explained the reality of sentient beings in all its aspects?

original: bdag dang sems can med par 'chad pa ni rtag pa dang bdag tu zhen pa'i 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal ba bcad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag dang sems can med par 'chad pa ni rtag pa dang bdag tu zhen pa'i 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal ba bcad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Here, the explanation that there is no self and no sentient being is in order to cut off the suffering of sa·πÉsƒÅra, which is the adherence to permanence and self.

analyzed: rtag par 'dzin pa 'chad pa yang byed pa po smra ba bcad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The explanation that there is no permanence is in order to cut off the assertion of an agent.

original: rtag pa gang yang med de /
analyzed: rtag pa gang yang med de /
translated: There is no permanence at all.

original: de ma skyes pas na yod pa ma yin pa mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: de ma skyes pas na yod pa ma yin pa mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: Since that is not produced, it does not exist, like the son of a barren woman and so on.

original: yang dag pa nyid ni dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba don dam pa'i bden pa gnyis su med par yang dag par rig pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa nyid ni dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba don dam pa'i bden pa gnyis su med par yang dag par rig pa'o //

original: ci'i slad du sems tsam thams cad du bshad par mi mdzad ces bya ba de ltar blo gros chen po phyi phyir gsol @50a * //
analyzed: ci'i slad du sems tsam thams cad du bshad par mi mdzad ces bya ba de ltar blo gros chen po phyi phyir gsol @50a * //

original: bas na thams cad mkhyen pas bsgrub par mdzad pa gcig la bshad pa gang yin pa de ni gzhan la bshad pa min /
analyzed: bas na thams cad mkhyen pas bsgrub par mdzad pa gcig la bshad pa gang yin pa de ni gzhan la bshad pa min /

original: nad ba'i dbang las sman pa bzhin //
analyzed: nad ba'i dbang las sman pa bzhin //

original: sman ni so sor rtog pa'o //
analyzed: sman ni so sor rtog pa'o //

analyzed: zhes te / des na snod ma yin pa rnams la gnyis su med pa'i yang dag par ngas thams cad du mi 'chad do //

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /

analyzed: ci slad skyes bu na chung nor // aa ru ra dang skyu ru tshal //
translated: The wealth of a young man,üîΩthe myrobalan fruit, the forest,

translated: the Kailash mountain, the surrounding mountains,

analyzed: rdo rje sra ba'ang ji lta bu //
translated: and the vajra‚Äîhow are they?

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here,

analyzed: skyes bu dang na chung gi nor ni gang pho dang mo la mkho ba de thams cad ni nor te /

analyzed: ke la sa dang khor yug ri //

analyzed: rdo rje sra ba'ang ji lta bu //

analyzed: zhes bya ba ni ri rab kyi khor yug gi drung na rin po che'i 'byung gnas mi g-yo ba drang srong dang dri za rnams kyi gnas mchis ba bsod nams can gyi sems can rnams kyi bsod nams kyis rin po che'i 'byung gnas byung bar thams cad mkhyen
translated: This is in front of the Cakravada mountain surrounding Mount Meru, the immovable source of jewels, the abode of sages and gandharvas, the source of jewels by the merit of meritorious sentient beings.

original: par sgrub tu gsol /
analyzed: par sgrub tu gsol /
translated: Please establish it as omniscient.

original: gang gis sems can rnams kyi bsod nams mngon par spel ba'i slad du sems dang ba'i khyad par du 'gyur bar ro //
analyzed: gang gis sems can rnams kyi bsod nams mngon par spel ba'i slad du sems dang ba'i khyad par du 'gyur bar ro //
translated: In order to increase the merit of sentient beings, the mind becomes especially clear.

original: lha chen gyis ni gsan pa dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni btsun gtso'i sangs rgyas ni lha thams cad kyi lha chen po yin no //
analyzed: lha chen gyis ni gsan pa dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni btsun gtso'i sangs rgyas ni lha thams cad kyi lha chen po yin no //
translated: The great god has heard, etc. The Blessed One, the foremost of the holy, is the great god of all gods.

original: dris pa brgya rtsa brgyad slar bsal ba nas gang dag 'khor ba dang / log pa'i ye shes dang / sdug bsngal zad ba'i don du mkho ba'i dris pa de dag gi lan ni thog mar legs so zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: dris pa brgya rtsa brgyad slar bsal ba nas gang dag 'khor ba dang / log pa'i ye shes dang / sdug bsngal zad ba'i don du mkho ba'i dris pa de dag gi lan ni thog mar legs so zhes gsungs te /
translated: The answer to the questions that were asked, beginning with one hundred and eight, is excellent! for those who are in cyclic existence, for those with perverted knowledge, and for the sake of ending suffering.

original: gsung ngo // dris pa yang dag kyang rtsva dang shing la sogs pa'i khyad par @50b de dag la skyon che bar bshad cing de dag 'jig rten gyi ched du lan gsungs pa /
analyzed: gsung ngo // dris pa yang dag kyang rtsva dang shing la sogs pa'i khyad par @50b de dag la skyon che bar bshad cing de dag 'jig rten gyi ched du lan gsungs pa /
translated: The questions are answered with excellent! The distinctions of grass, trees, etc. are explained as faults, and the answers are given for the sake of the world.

original: theg pa che tshul sna tshogs pa //
analyzed: theg pa che tshul sna tshogs pa //
translated: The various ways of the Great Vehicle

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyi thugs mchog 'di //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyi thugs mchog 'di //
translated: are the supreme mind of the Buddhas.

original: sangs rgyas 'jig rten mkhyen pa'i phul //
analyzed: sangs rgyas 'jig rten mkhyen pa'i phul //
translated: The Buddhas are the foremost knowers of the world.

original: lha chen gyis ni gsan pa dang // zhes te /
analyzed: lha chen gyis ni gsan pa dang // zhes te /
translated: The great god heard it.

original: de 'dri ba brgya rtsa brgyad pa blang ba dang / dor ba'i bye brag gis theg pa chen po'i tshul sna tshogs ni sangs rgyas rnams kyi thugs mchog yin no //
analyzed: de 'dri ba brgya rtsa brgyad pa blang ba dang / dor ba'i bye brag gis theg pa chen po'i tshul sna tshogs ni sangs rgyas rnams kyi thugs mchog yin no //
translated: Thus, the various ways of the Great Vehicle, which are the supreme thought of the Buddhas, are the one hundred and eight questions, with their distinctions of acceptance and rejection.

original: der lha chen po thams cad mkhyen pa'i rnal 'byor gyi dbang po mchog tu yongs su dag cing 'dod chags dang bral ba btsun gtso'i sangs rgyas dang / btsun gtso'i byang chub sems dpa' chen po 'phags pa blo gros chen po la legs pa bstabs pa /
analyzed: der lha chen po thams cad mkhyen pa'i rnal 'byor gyi dbang po mchog tu yongs su dag cing 'dod chags dang bral ba btsun gtso'i sangs rgyas dang / btsun gtso'i byang chub sems dpa' chen po 'phags pa blo gros chen po la legs pa bstabs pa /
translated: There, the great god, the lord of yoga of omniscience, the supreme of the pure and passionless, the Buddha, and the supreme of the pure, the noble great bodhisattva MahƒÅmati, made an excellent offering.

original: shes rab chen po legs so legs //
analyzed: shes rab chen po legs so legs //
translated: Excellent, excellent, O great wisdom!

original: khyod kyis yongs su gang dris pa //
analyzed: khyod kyis yongs su gang dris pa //
translated: What you have asked

original: de ni rim gyis ngas bshad kyis //
analyzed: de ni rim gyis ngas bshad kyis //
translated: I will explain in stages.

original: blo chen nga las shes par byos //
analyzed: blo chen nga las shes par byos //
translated: O great mind, understand it from me.üîΩArising and non-arising,

original: skye dang skye ba med pa dang // ji ltar mya ngan 'das dang stong //
analyzed: skye dang skye ba med pa dang // ji ltar mya ngan 'das dang stong //
translated: and how nirvana is empty,

original: 'pho dang rang bzhin med pa dang // sangs rgyas pha rol phyin dang sras //
analyzed: 'pho dang rang bzhin med pa dang // sangs rgyas pha rol phyin dang sras //
translated: Buddhas, perfections, and sons.

original: zhes bya bar sngar dri ba ji ltar gsol ba bcom ldan 'das kyang de ltar bshad par mdzad de /
analyzed: zhes bya bar sngar dri ba ji ltar gsol ba bcom ldan 'das kyang de ltar bshad par mdzad de /
translated: The Blessed One explained just as they were asked,

original: dri ba gang dag la skyes bu'i don du mkho ba med cing skyon che ba de dag bcom ldan 'das kyis skyon che bar gsungs shing /
analyzed: dri ba gang dag la skyes bu'i don du mkho ba med cing skyon che ba de dag bcom ldan 'das kyis skyon che bar gsungs shing /
translated: Those questions that are of no use for the purpose of a person and have great faults, the Blessed One said have great faults.

original: blo gros chen po la lan mi stsol ba ni sal rdul ji snyed yod pa dang / ri rab la srang du yod pa dang / nyi zer gyi rdul phra mo ji tsam pa dang / rdul phra mo bdun nam brgyad la rdul phra mo thams cad kyang ji tsam yod pa ci'i phyir mi 'dri zhes te /
analyzed: blo gros chen po la lan mi stsol ba ni sal rdul ji snyed yod pa dang / ri rab la srang du yod pa dang / nyi zer gyi rdul phra mo ji tsam pa dang / rdul phra mo bdun nam brgyad la rdul phra mo thams cad kyang ji tsam yod pa ci'i phyir mi 'dri zhes te /
translated: Not answering the questions of Mahamati is like asking how many specks of dust there are, how many scales on Mount Meru, how many tiny particles in sunbeams, and how many sevens or eights it takes for all the tiny particles to be exhausted.

original: de ni rang bzhin gyis dngos bo med pas na dngos po med pa ste /
analyzed: de ni rang bzhin gyis dngos bo med pas na dngos po med pa ste /
translated: That is non-entity because it is naturally non-existent,

original: ji ltar mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ji ltar mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: Just like the son of a barren woman and so forth.

original: sgra ma gtogs pa rdul phra mo la rdzas brgyad do //
analyzed: sgra ma gtogs pa rdul phra mo la rdzas brgyad do //
translated: Except for sound, the subtle particles have eight substances.

original: mchog tu phra ba bdun la rdul bar mar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mchog tu phra ba bdun la rdul bar mar 'gyur ro //
translated: Seven of the most subtle particles is one particle of dust.üîΩ

original: de bdun la rdul lo //
analyzed: de bdun la rdul lo //
translated: Seven of the smallest particles is one minute particle.üîΩSeven of those is one louse egg.üîΩSeven of those is one louse.

original: de bdun bdun gyi gong ma'i grangs kyi ri bong dang / lug dang ba lang gi spu rdul dang / sro ma dang / shig dang / yungs kar dang / ma se dang / nam dang / to lo dang / 'dzin pa dang / gser srang gcig gi grangs la sogs pa'o //üîΩ'jig rten gyi ni brgyad las grangs du 'gro ba'o //üîΩ'dzin pa ni srang gi bzhi'i @51a * //üîΩchar grub pa'o //üîΩyungs kar bdun nam brgyad kyis nas gcig go //
analyzed: de bdun bdun gyi gong ma'i grangs kyi ri bong dang / lug dang ba lang gi spu rdul dang / sro ma dang / shig dang / yungs kar dang / ma se dang / nam dang / to lo dang / 'dzin pa dang / gser srang gcig gi grangs la sogs pa'o // 'jig rten gyi ni brgyad las grangs du 'gro ba'o // 'dzin pa ni srang gi bzhi'i @51a * // char grub pa'o // yungs kar bdun nam brgyad kyis nas gcig go //
translated: Seven of those is one barley grain.

original: nas brgyad la tshigs so //üîΩtshigs bzhi la sor mo'o //üîΩsor mo bcu gnyis la mtho'o //
analyzed: nas brgyad la tshigs so // tshigs bzhi la sor mo'o // sor mo bcu gnyis la mtho'o //
translated: Seven of those is one finger width.

original: mtho do la khru'o //
analyzed: mtho do la khru'o //
translated: Twelve of those is one cubit.

original: khru bzhi la gzhu'o //
analyzed: khru bzhi la gzhu'o //
translated: Four of those is one fathom.

original: gzhu lnga brgya la rgyang grags so //
analyzed: gzhu lnga brgya la rgyang grags so //
translated: Five hundred of those is one krosa.üîΩFour of those is one kro≈õa.

original: rgyang grags bzhi la dpag tshad gnyis kyi grangs la sogs pa yul lo //
analyzed: rgyang grags bzhi la dpag tshad gnyis kyi grangs la sogs pa yul lo //
translated: Two of those is one yojana.üîΩThe yojana is the measure of distance.

original: dus la sogs pa'ang ci'i phyir na mi 'dri /
analyzed: dus la sogs pa'ang ci'i phyir na mi 'dri /
translated: Why do you not ask about time, etc.?

original: de dag las dri ba'i gtso rnams kyis lan ni glan par 'gyur mod kyi /
analyzed: de dag las dri ba'i gtso rnams kyis lan ni glan par 'gyur mod kyi /
translated: The most important questions among them will be answered.

original: dri ba brgya rtsa brgyad po sangs rgyas kyis bsngags pa don dam pa'i bden pa yang dag ba nyid ces bya ba /
analyzed: dri ba brgya rtsa brgyad po sangs rgyas kyis bsngags pa don dam pa'i bden pa yang dag ba nyid ces bya ba /
translated: Listen to this question of one hundred and eight, praised by the Buddha, called the ultimate truth itself.

original: 'di ji nyon cig ces nas thams cad mkhyen pas ston par mdzad pa /
analyzed: 'di ji nyon cig ces nas thams cad mkhyen pas ston par mdzad pa /
translated: Having said, ‚ÄúListen to this,‚Äù the Omniscient One teaches.

original: skye ba'i tshig dang mi skye ba'i tshig ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: skye ba'i tshig dang mi skye ba'i tshig ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The words ‚Äúarisen‚Äù and ‚Äúun-arisen,‚Äù etc.

original: de la skye ba'i tshig ni kun rdzob tu gzhan gyi dbang gi gnyis kyis rnam pa'o //
analyzed: de la skye ba'i tshig ni kun rdzob tu gzhan gyi dbang gi gnyis kyis rnam pa'o //
translated: Therein, the words ‚Äúarisen‚Äù are the relative, the dependent, the two absences of self.

original: mi skye ba'i tshig ni bdag med pa gnyis la byed pa dang byed pa bo mngon par 'brel ba med pas snga ma'i 'og tu zhes bya ba na mi gnyis pa don dam pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: mi skye ba'i tshig ni bdag med pa gnyis la byed pa dang byed pa bo mngon par 'brel ba med pas snga ma'i 'og tu zhes bya ba na mi gnyis pa don dam pa'i tshig go //
translated: The words ‚Äúun-arisen‚Äù are the ultimate, the perfected, the two absences of self.

original: rtag pa'i tshig dang / mi rtag pa'i tshig ni rgyun rtag pas na rtag pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: rtag pa'i tshig dang / mi rtag pa'i tshig ni rgyun rtag pas na rtag pa'i tshig go //
translated: The words ‚Äúpermanent‚Äù and ‚Äúimpermanent‚Äù are the words ‚Äúpermanent‚Äù because of the permanence of the continuum.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid du mi rtag bas na mi rtag pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid du mi rtag bas na mi rtag pa'i tshig go //
translated: Since it is impermanent in terms of its own characteristic, it is the word impermanent.

original: mtshan nyid kyi tshig dang mtshan nyid med ba'i tshig ces bya ba la /
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyi tshig dang mtshan nyid med ba'i tshig ces bya ba la /
translated: The words character and no character are as follows.

original: mtshan nyid kyi tshig ni rang gi mtshan nyid la skad cig par thams cad mkhyen pas dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyi tshig ni rang gi mtshan nyid la skad cig par thams cad mkhyen pas dgongs pa'o //
translated: The word character is the thought of the Omniscient One that all things are momentary in terms of their own characteristics.

original: yang mtshan nyid ni mtshan ma ste don du ma'i phyir ro //üîΩdam ba'i chos dang mi 'gal ba'i sgra'i don du sbyor ba tsam du zad kyi /
analyzed: yang mtshan nyid ni mtshan ma ste don du ma'i phyir ro // dam ba'i chos dang mi 'gal ba'i sgra'i don du sbyor ba tsam du zad kyi /
translated: Moreover, character is a sign, because it is the object of many meanings.üîΩ The word no character is the thought of the Omniscient One that all things are unproduced in terms of their own characteristics.üîΩ The word no character is the thought of the Omniscient One that all things are unproduced in terms of their own characteristics.

original: khyad par ni thams cad mkhyen pas mkhyen to //üîΩmtshan nyid med pa'i tshig ni gang na mtshan ma cung zad kyang mtshan mar bya ba med pa'am /
analyzed: khyad par ni thams cad mkhyen pas mkhyen to // mtshan nyid med pa'i tshig ni gang na mtshan ma cung zad kyang mtshan mar bya ba med pa'am /
translated: The word no character is the thought of the Omniscient One that all things are unproduced in terms of their own characteristics.üîΩ The word no character is the thought of the Omniscient One that all things are unproduced in terms of their own characteristics.üîΩ The word no character is the thought of the Omniscient One that all things are unproduced in terms of their own characteristics.üîΩ The word no character is the thought of the Omniscient One that all things are unproduced in terms of their own characteristics.üîΩ The word no character is the thought of the Omniscient One that all things are unproduced in terms of their own characteristics.üîΩ The word no character is the thought of the Omniscient One that all things are unproduced in terms of their own characteristics.üîΩ The word no character is the thought of the Omniscient One that all things are unproduced in terms of their own characteristics.üîΩ The word no character is the thought of the Omniscient One that all things are unproduced in terms of their own characteristics.üîΩ The word no character is the thought of the Omniscient One that all things are unproduced in terms of their own characteristics.üîΩ The word no character is the thought of the Omniscient One that all things are unproduced in terms of their own characteristics.

original: rnam par rtog pa med pa dngos bo dang dngos po med par rnam par mi rtog pa de mi gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa med pa dngos bo dang dngos po med par rnam par mi rtog pa de mi gnyis pa'o //
translated: The word no character is the thought of the Omniscient One that all things are unproduced in terms of their own characteristics.üîΩ The word no character is the thought of the Omniscient One that all things

original: gnas gzhan du 'gyur ba'i tshig dang / gnas gzhan du 'gyur ba ma yin pa'i tshig ni skad cig pa dang skad cig pa ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: gnas gzhan du 'gyur ba'i tshig dang / gnas gzhan du 'gyur ba ma yin pa'i tshig ni skad cig pa dang skad cig pa ma yin pa ste /
translated: The words ‚Äúmomentary‚Äù and ‚Äúnon-momentary‚Äù refer to the transformation of the basis and the non-transformation of the basis.

original: thel dang zur gyi rim par rnam par rtog pa'i mu stegs can gyi blo'i rjes su mthun par mdzad de /
analyzed: thel dang zur gyi rim par rnam par rtog pa'i mu stegs can gyi blo'i rjes su mthun par mdzad de /
translated: The words ‚Äúmomentary‚Äù and ‚Äúnon-momentary‚Äù are in accordance with the views of the tƒ´rthikas who speculate about the stages of the particles and parts.

original: 'dus ma byas par dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas par dgongs pa'o //
translated: The intention is that they are uncompounded.

original: skad cig pa'i tshig dang / skad cig ba med pa'i tshig ni skyes ma thag tu 'jig pas na skad cig pa ste /
analyzed: skad cig pa'i tshig dang / skad cig ba med pa'i tshig ni skyes ma thag tu 'jig pas na skad cig pa ste /
translated: The words ‚Äúmomentary‚Äù and ‚Äúnon-momentary‚Äù refer to the arising and destruction of things.

original: thog @51b ma dang tha ma'i dus su gnas pa'i rnam pa'i cha dang bral ba ni se gol gyi sgra la sogs pa de ma thag tu 'jig pa bzhin no //üîΩskad cig pa med pa'i tshig ni rgyun rtag pa'am /
analyzed: thog @51b ma dang tha ma'i dus su gnas pa'i rnam pa'i cha dang bral ba ni se gol gyi sgra la sogs pa de ma thag tu 'jig pa bzhin no // skad cig pa med pa'i tshig ni rgyun rtag pa'am /
translated: The momentary is that which arises and is destroyed immediately, like the sound of a finger snap, which is devoid of the aspect of remaining at the beginning and end.

original: dngos po med pa ste /
analyzed: dngos po med pa ste /
translated: The words ‚Äúnon-momentary‚Äù refer to a continuous thing or to a non-thing.üîΩA continuous thing is permanent.

original: rtag pa ma skyes pas na dngos po med pa ni mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rtag pa ma skyes pas na dngos po med pa ni mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: A non-thing is not arisen, like the son of a barren woman.

original: skad cig pa ma yin pa ni rim dang cig car du don byed par 'gal lo //
analyzed: skad cig pa ma yin pa ni rim dang cig car du don byed par 'gal lo //
translated: It is contradictory for something that is not momentary to function either gradually or instantaneously.

original: gang la don byed pa'i mthu med pa de dngos po ma yin te ri bong gi rva bzhin no //
analyzed: gang la don byed pa'i mthu med pa de dngos po ma yin te ri bong gi rva bzhin no //
translated: That which lacks the power to function is not a thing, like the horn of a donkey.

original: rang bzhin yod ba'i tshig dang rang bzhin med pa'i tshig ni gang la bsregs pa dang 'tshed pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du don byed nus pa sra ba dang / rlan pa dang / dro ba dang / g-yo ba la sogs pa des 'byung ba'i rang bzhin smos par bya'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin yod ba'i tshig dang rang bzhin med pa'i tshig ni gang la bsregs pa dang 'tshed pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du don byed nus pa sra ba dang / rlan pa dang / dro ba dang / g-yo ba la sogs pa des 'byung ba'i rang bzhin smos par bya'o //
translated: The words ‚Äúwith intrinsic reality‚Äù and ‚Äúwithout intrinsic reality‚Äù should be applied to the elements in terms of their intrinsic nature, which is the capacity to function as solidity, fluidity, heat, and motility, etc.,

original: gang yang rnam pa thams cad kyi rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba /
analyzed: gang yang rnam pa thams cad kyi rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba /
translated: That which is free from all conceptualization,

original: yod pa dang med par brjod du med pa dang / gnyis su med pa yang dag par rig pa de la yang rang bzhin med do //
analyzed: yod pa dang med par brjod du med pa dang / gnyis su med pa yang dag par rig pa de la yang rang bzhin med do //
translated: inexpressible as existent or nonexistent, and nondual, that is also without intrinsic reality.

original: stong pa nyid kyi tshig dang / stong pa nyid ma yin pa'i tshig ni yongs su grub pa'i chud pa gnyis kyi rnam pas stong pa nyid de /
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi tshig dang / stong pa nyid ma yin pa'i tshig ni yongs su grub pa'i chud pa gnyis kyi rnam pas stong pa nyid de /
translated: The words ‚Äúemptiness‚Äù and ‚Äúnonemptiness‚Äù refer to emptiness in the sense of the emptiness of the two kinds of self-existence in the perfected nature.

original: ji ltar 'phags pa btsun gtso byams pas gsungs pa /
analyzed: ji ltar 'phags pa btsun gtso byams pas gsungs pa /
translated: As the noble Maitreya has said:

original: gnyis med med pa'i dngos po ni //
analyzed: gnyis med med pa'i dngos po ni //
translated: The non-dual, non-existent entity

original: stong pa yi ni mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: stong pa yi ni mtshan nyid do //
translated: Is the characteristic of emptiness.

original: zhes so // stong ba ma yin pa yang gzhan gyi dbang gi rnam par shes pa gnyis kyi rnam bas mi stong ba ste /
analyzed: zhes so // stong ba ma yin pa yang gzhan gyi dbang gi rnam par shes pa gnyis kyi rnam bas mi stong ba ste /
translated: And the non-empty is the dependent consciousness, which is not empty of the two.

original: der byis pa rnams dngos por mngon par chags par 'jug pa ni ji ltar 'di nyid du gsungs pa /
analyzed: der byis pa rnams dngos por mngon par chags par 'jug pa ni ji ltar 'di nyid du gsungs pa /
translated: And as for the childish who engage in attachment to entities, it is as stated here:

original: lus dang longs spyod gnas snang ba //
analyzed: lus dang longs spyod gnas snang ba //
translated: The body, enjoyments, and abode appear

original: kun gzhi kun tu 'byung ba ste //
analyzed: kun gzhi kun tu 'byung ba ste //
translated: As the universal ground, universally occurring.

original: rnam brgyad rnam dgu de bzhin du //
analyzed: rnam brgyad rnam dgu de bzhin du //
translated: In the same way, the eight and the nine

original: rgya mtsho'i rlabs rnams bzhin du'o //
analyzed: rgya mtsho'i rlabs rnams bzhin du'o //
translated: Are like waves in the ocean.

original: chad ba'i tshig dang chad pa ma yin pa'i tshig ni skad cig ba chad pa dang / rgyun mi 'chad pa ste /
analyzed: chad ba'i tshig dang chad pa ma yin pa'i tshig ni skad cig ba chad pa dang / rgyun mi 'chad pa ste /
translated: The words of discontinuity and non-discontinuity refer to the momentary discontinuity and the uninterrupted continuity.

original: khyad bar du dgongs pa'i don ni thams cad mkhyen pas mkhyen to //
analyzed: khyad bar du dgongs pa'i don ni thams cad mkhyen pas mkhyen to //
translated: The meaning of the special intention is known by the Omniscient One.

original: sems kyi tshig dang / sems med pa'i tshig ni gang na sems 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: sems kyi tshig dang / sems med pa'i tshig ni gang na sems 'jug pa ste /
translated: The words of mind and the words of no-mind are where the mind engages.

original: gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa dang / brjod pa dang / rjod pa dang / byed pa dang / byed ba por tshig tu rnam par rtog pas mngon par 'brel ba de ni sems kyi tshig go //
analyzed: gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa dang / brjod pa dang / rjod pa dang / byed pa dang / byed ba por tshig tu rnam par rtog pas mngon par 'brel ba de ni sems kyi tshig go //
translated: The word of the mind is the connection with the verbal discrimination of subject and object, of expression and expressed, of action and agent.

original: tshig ni 'gro ba ste /
analyzed: tshig ni 'gro ba ste /
translated: The word is the world,

original: gang na sems kyang rgyu ba med na rtog @52a * //
analyzed: gang na sems kyang rgyu ba med na rtog @52a * //
translated: where the mind does not move, much less the concepts.

original: pa rnams kyi yi ge lta ci smos te de ni sems med pa'i tshig ste /
analyzed: pa rnams kyi yi ge lta ci smos te de ni sems med pa'i tshig ste /
translated: That is the word of the mindless.

original: mi gnyis par yang dag rig par bsam pa med cing snang ba med pa don dam pa'i bden pa dngos po dang dngos po med par mi rtog pa'o //
analyzed: mi gnyis par yang dag rig par bsam pa med cing snang ba med pa don dam pa'i bden pa dngos po dang dngos po med par mi rtog pa'o //
translated: The word of the nondual is the ultimate truth, free from the discrimination of existence and nonexistence, free from thought and appearance.

original: dbu ma'i tshig dang / dbu ma ma yin pa'i tshig ni gang de na dngos po dang dngos po med bar rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba ni dbu ma'i tshig go //
analyzed: dbu ma'i tshig dang / dbu ma ma yin pa'i tshig ni gang de na dngos po dang dngos po med bar rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba ni dbu ma'i tshig go //
translated: The word of the middle way and the word of the nonmiddle way are the word of the middle way, free from the discrimination of existence and nonexistence.

original: ji ltar 'di nyid du gsungs pa /üîΩyod pa'i zlas drangs med pa ste //
analyzed: ji ltar 'di nyid du gsungs pa / yod pa'i zlas drangs med pa ste //
translated: As it is said here:üîΩNonexistence is implied by existence,

original: yod pa'ang med pa'i zlas drangs so //
analyzed: yod pa'ang med pa'i zlas drangs so //
translated: and existence is implied by nonexistence.

original: de bas med par shes mi bya //
analyzed: de bas med par shes mi bya //
translated: Therefore, one should not understand it as nonexistent.

original: yod par yang ni mi rtag go //
analyzed: yod par yang ni mi rtag go //
translated: Nor should one understand it as existent.

original: ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las gsungs pa /
analyzed: ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las gsungs pa /
translated: As it is said in the Perfection of Wisdom:

original: dngos po mngon par rtogs par mi 'byung ba dang / dngos po med pas kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: dngos po mngon par rtogs par mi 'byung ba dang / dngos po med pas kyang ma yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúOne does not realize a thing by a non-thing, nor by a thing.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is it?

original: dngos po dang dngos po med pa mnyam pas so //
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med pa mnyam pas so //
translated: By the equality of thing and non-thing.

original: dngos po dang dngos po med par rnam par rtog pa de spangs pas chud par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med par rnam par rtog pa de spangs pas chud par 'gyur ro //
translated: By abandoning the discrimination of thing and non-thing, one is liberated.

original: dbu ma ma yin pa'i tshig kyang gang na dngos po dang dngos po med par rnam par rtog par 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: dbu ma ma yin pa'i tshig kyang gang na dngos po dang dngos po med par rnam par rtog par 'byung ba'o //
translated: The words ‚Äònot the middle‚Äô are where the discrimination of thing and non-thing occurs.

original: ther zug pa'i tshig dang / ther zug ma yin pa'i tshig ces bya ba la /
analyzed: ther zug pa'i tshig dang / ther zug ma yin pa'i tshig ces bya ba la /
translated: The words ‚Äòpermanent‚Äô and ‚Äòimpermanent‚Äô are as follows:

original: ther zug pa'i tshig ni 'dus ma byas pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: ther zug pa'i tshig ni 'dus ma byas pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: The word ‚Äòpermanent‚Äô is unconditioned and nirvana.

original: ther zug ma yin pa'i tshig ni 'gro ba ste /
analyzed: ther zug ma yin pa'i tshig ni 'gro ba ste /
translated: The word ‚Äòimpermanent‚Äô is the world,

original: skye nas 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye nas 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it goes after being born.

original: rkyen gyi tshig dang / rkyen ma yin pa'i tshig ces bya ba la /
analyzed: rkyen gyi tshig dang / rkyen ma yin pa'i tshig ces bya ba la /
translated: The words ‚Äúconditioned‚Äù and ‚Äúunconditioned‚Äù are as follows.

original: rkyen gyi tshig ni rgyus gang 'bras bu byed pa'o //
analyzed: rkyen gyi tshig ni rgyus gang 'bras bu byed pa'o //
translated: The words ‚Äúconditioned‚Äù are those that are produced by causes.

original: rkyen ma yin pa'i tshig ni gang mi byed pa ste /
analyzed: rkyen ma yin pa'i tshig ni gang mi byed pa ste /
translated: The words ‚Äúunconditioned‚Äù are those that are not produced,

original: ri bong gi rva la sogs pa bzhin du des rtag pa'o //
analyzed: ri bong gi rva la sogs pa bzhin du des rtag pa'o //
translated: like the horns of a rabbit, and so on.

original: rgyu'i tshig dang / rgyu med pa'i tshig ni rgyu dang rkyen 'dus tshogs nas 'bras bur dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu'i tshig dang / rgyu med pa'i tshig ni rgyu dang rkyen 'dus tshogs nas 'bras bur dgongs pa'o //
translated: The words ‚Äúcaused‚Äù and ‚Äúcauseless‚Äù are those that are intended to be the result of the aggregation of causes and conditions.

original: yang na rgyu'i tshig ni gang bsgrub bar bya bsgrub ba'i rgyus de ltar sgrub bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: yang na rgyu'i tshig ni gang bsgrub bar bya bsgrub ba'i rgyus de ltar sgrub bar byed pa'o //
translated: Or, the words ‚Äúcaused‚Äù are those that are established by the cause of what is to be established.

original: yang na rgyu med ba'i tshig ni rgyu dngos po med pas gang bsgrub par bya ba de mi 'grub pa'o //
analyzed: yang na rgyu med ba'i tshig ni rgyu dngos po med pas gang bsgrub par bya ba de mi 'grub pa'o //
translated: Or, the words ‚Äúcauseless‚Äù are those that are not established because the cause is nonexistent.

original: nyon mongs pa'i tshig dang / nyon mongs pa med pa'i tshig ni 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug la sogs pa ni nyon mongs pa'i tshig ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i tshig dang / nyon mongs pa med pa'i tshig ni 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug la sogs pa ni nyon mongs pa'i tshig ste /
translated: The words ‚Äúafflicted‚Äù and ‚Äúunafflicted‚Äù are those that are afflicted by desire, hatred, ignorance, and so on.

original: skye ba'i sdug bsngal lo //
analyzed: skye ba'i sdug bsngal lo //
translated: They are the suffering of birth.

original: nyon mongs pa med pa'i tshig ni bden pa'i ye shes te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa med pa'i tshig ni bden pa'i ye shes te /
translated: The expression ‚Äúwithout afflictions‚Äù is the knowledge of reality.

original: sdug bsngal zad par byed pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal zad par byed pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: It is the cause for the destruction of suffering.

original: sred pa med pa'i tshig @52b ces bya ba la /
analyzed: sred pa med pa'i tshig @52b ces bya ba la /
translated: The expression ‚Äúwithout craving‚Äù is the state of nirvana.

original: skye ba'i sdug bsngal gyi gnas ni sred pa'i rgyu las so //
analyzed: skye ba'i sdug bsngal gyi gnas ni sred pa'i rgyu las so //
translated: The state of birth is the cause of craving.

original: sred pa med pa'i tshig ni mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
analyzed: sred pa med pa'i tshig ni mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
translated: The expression ‚Äúwithout craving‚Äù is nirvana.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba la skye ba mi snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba la skye ba mi snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because birth does not appear in the absence of passion.

original: btsas ma thag pa la rga ba dang / 'jig pa dang / mya ngan yang dag par rtogs pas na blang ba dang / dor ba dang / btang snyoms kyi blo rnams bde ba dang sdug bsngal bar bsgrub bar nges pa sngar yod pa'i phyir des na sngon gyi goms pa yod par rjes su dpag go //
analyzed: btsas ma thag pa la rga ba dang / 'jig pa dang / mya ngan yang dag par rtogs pas na blang ba dang / dor ba dang / btang snyoms kyi blo rnams bde ba dang sdug bsngal bar bsgrub bar nges pa sngar yod pa'i phyir des na sngon gyi goms pa yod par rjes su dpag go //
translated: The expressions ‚Äútaking up‚Äù and ‚Äúputting down‚Äù and ‚Äúequanimity‚Äù are established as pleasure and suffering because of the prior existence of the mind that takes up, puts down, and is equanimous. Therefore, the existence of prior habituation is inferred.

original: thabs kyi tshig dang / thabs ma yin pa'i tshig ni shes rab dang thabs la mkhas pas gang na dgos par byed nus pa de ni thabs kyi tshig go //
analyzed: thabs kyi tshig dang / thabs ma yin pa'i tshig ni shes rab dang thabs la mkhas pas gang na dgos par byed nus pa de ni thabs kyi tshig go //
translated: The expressions ‚Äúmeans‚Äù and ‚Äúnot means‚Äù are the expressions of means and not means in the case of the skillful and the unskillful.

original: gang na byed mi nus pa de ni thabs med pa'i tshig ste dus dang yul la ltos te gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: gang na byed mi nus pa de ni thabs med pa'i tshig ste dus dang yul la ltos te gzhag par bya'o //
translated: The words that are not applicable are the words that are not applicable in terms of time and place.

original: mkhas pa'i tshig dang / mkhas pa ma yin pa'i tshig ni gang dpyad cing shes rab kyis sbyor bar byed pa ni mkhas pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: mkhas pa'i tshig dang / mkhas pa ma yin pa'i tshig ni gang dpyad cing shes rab kyis sbyor bar byed pa ni mkhas pa'i tshig go //
translated: The words of the wise and the words of the unwise are the words of the wise who are engaged in analysis and wisdom.

original: gang na yang sbyor bar mi byed pa de ni mkhas pa ma yin pa'i tshig go //üîΩdag pa'i tshig dang / dag pa ma yin pa'i tshig ni mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / mdzes pa ma yin pa dang / stong pa'i ye shes ni dag pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: gang na yang sbyor bar mi byed pa de ni mkhas pa ma yin pa'i tshig go // dag pa'i tshig dang / dag pa ma yin pa'i tshig ni mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / mdzes pa ma yin pa dang / stong pa'i ye shes ni dag pa'i tshig go //
translated: The words that are not engaged in that are the words of the unwise.üîΩThe pure words and the impure words are the words of the pure that are the wisdom of impermanence, suffering, ugliness, and emptiness.

original: rtag pa dang / bdag dang / sdug bsngal ba med pa dang / mdzes pa dang / stong pa ma yin pa'i dngos por phyin ci log gi shes pa ni dag pa ma yin pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: rtag pa dang / bdag dang / sdug bsngal ba med pa dang / mdzes pa dang / stong pa ma yin pa'i dngos por phyin ci log gi shes pa ni dag pa ma yin pa'i tshig go //
translated: The words of the impure are the words of the impure that are the knowledge of the opposite of permanence, self, the absence of suffering, beauty, and emptiness.

original: rigs pa'i tshig dang / rigs pa ma yin pa'i tshig ni mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med pa dang / mdzes pa ma yin pa dang / stong pa'i tshul gyi tshad mas khyad par shes pa ni rigs pa'i tshig ste /
analyzed: rigs pa'i tshig dang / rigs pa ma yin pa'i tshig ni mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med pa dang / mdzes pa ma yin pa dang / stong pa'i tshul gyi tshad mas khyad par shes pa ni rigs pa'i tshig ste /
translated: The words of reasoning and the words of non-reasoning are the knowledge of the valid cognition of impermanence, suffering, selflessness, ugliness, and the mode of emptiness, which are the words of reasoning.

original: rang bzhin gsum pa'i mtshan ma mngon par brjod par bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rang bzhin gsum pa'i mtshan ma mngon par brjod par bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning to be expressed is the sign of the three natures.

original: rigs pa ma yin pa'i tshig ni rtag pa dang / bdag dang / sdug bsngal ba ma yin pa dang / mdzes pa la sogs pa'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: rigs pa ma yin pa'i tshig ni rtag pa dang / bdag dang / sdug bsngal ba ma yin pa dang / mdzes pa la sogs pa'i shes pa'o //
translated: The words of non-reasoning are the knowledge of permanence, self, non-suffering, beauty, and so forth.

original: dpe'i tshig dang / dpe med pa'i tshig ni tshad ma khyab pa'i tshul gyis don gang la 'jig rten gyi rtog pa po rnams kyi blo mtshungs pa de ni dpe'o //
analyzed: dpe'i tshig dang / dpe med pa'i tshig ni tshad ma khyab pa'i tshul gyis don gang la 'jig rten gyi rtog pa po rnams kyi blo mtshungs pa de ni dpe'o //
translated: The words of example and the words of non-example are the example of the object to which the worldly thinkers' minds are similar by the mode of the valid cognition.

original: de las ldog ba ni dpe ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: de las ldog ba ni dpe ma yin pa'o //
translated: The opposite of that is the non-example.

original: des na smras pa /
analyzed: des na smras pa /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: bsgrubs pas rgyu dang 'brel ba byed //
analyzed: bsgrubs pas rgyu dang 'brel ba byed //
translated: By establishing, one makes a connection with the cause.

original: bsgrub pa med pa'ang med pa nyid /
analyzed: bsgrub pa med pa'ang med pa nyid /
translated: Even without establishment, there is non-existence.

original: @53a * // gang na dpe ni brjod bya ba //
analyzed: @53a * // gang na dpe ni brjod bya ba //
translated: When there is a debate,

original: phyogs bcas phyogs med nyid du'o //
analyzed: phyogs bcas phyogs med nyid du'o //
translated: it is with one who has a position or one who does not.üîΩThe words of a disciple and the words of one who is not a disciple are as follows:

original: slob ma'i tshig dang / slob ma ma yin pa'i tshig ni tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa phan 'dogs pa bla ma rnams dang rtsod pa ni slob ma'i tshig go //
analyzed: slob ma'i tshig dang / slob ma ma yin pa'i tshig ni tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa phan 'dogs pa bla ma rnams dang rtsod pa ni slob ma'i tshig go //
translated: To debate with one's spiritual friends, benefactors, and superiors is the words of a disciple.üîΩTo debate with adversaries is the words of one who is not a disciple.

original: slob ma ma yin pa'i tshig ni 'gran nga ba rnams dang thub thub tu smra zhing 'di ni bla ma yang ma yin slob ma yang ma yin zhes bas na phal 'dus pa'i nang du gzhan pham par bya ba'i rigs so snyam nas chos dang bcas pas rgolüîΩba po tshar gcod pa'o //
analyzed: slob ma ma yin pa'i tshig ni 'gran nga ba rnams dang thub thub tu smra zhing 'di ni bla ma yang ma yin slob ma yang ma yin zhes bas na phal 'dus pa'i nang du gzhan pham par bya ba'i rigs so snyam nas chos dang bcas pas rgol ba po tshar gcod pa'o //
translated: Thinking, This is not a superior, nor a disciple, so it is appropriate to defeat him in the assembly of the people, one debates with Dharma.üîΩThe words of a superior and the words of one who is not a superior are as follows:

original: bla ma'i tshig dang / bla ma ma yin pa'i tshig ni gang dam ba'i chos ston par byed pa de ni bla ma'o //
analyzed: bla ma'i tshig dang / bla ma ma yin pa'i tshig ni gang dam ba'i chos ston par byed pa de ni bla ma'o //
translated: One who teaches the true Dharma is a superior.

original: gang yang phyir rgol bar byed pa de ni bla ma ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: gang yang phyir rgol bar byed pa de ni bla ma ma yin pa'o //
translated: One who opposes is not a superior.

original: rigs kyi tshig dang / rigs med pa'i tshig ni byang chub sems dpa'i tshig dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / nyan thos rnams kyi rigs te /
analyzed: rigs kyi tshig dang / rigs med pa'i tshig ni byang chub sems dpa'i tshig dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / nyan thos rnams kyi rigs te /
translated: The bodhisattva's family is the family of the bodhisattvas, and the family of the pratyekabuddhas and sravakas is the non-bodhisattva family.

original: sems can rnams mtshan ma rnams kyis shes par 'gyur ba ni ji ltar chos bcu ba las gsungs pa /
analyzed: sems can rnams mtshan ma rnams kyis shes par 'gyur ba ni ji ltar chos bcu ba las gsungs pa /
translated: The signs by which sentient beings know the bodhisattva's family are as described in the Dasadharmasutra:

original: du bas me ni shes par byed //
analyzed: du bas me ni shes par byed //
translated: Smoke is the sign of fire,

original: bya bzhad kyis ni chur shes byed //üîΩbyang chub sems dpa' blo chen gyi //
analyzed: bya bzhad kyis ni chur shes byed // byang chub sems dpa' blo chen gyi //
translated: and the ruddy duck is the sign of water.üîΩThe signs of the bodhisattva's family

original: rigs ni mtshan ma rnams kyis shes //
analyzed: rigs ni mtshan ma rnams kyis shes //
translated: are known through his great compassion.

original: de ni rang bzhin snying rje can yin la /
analyzed: de ni rang bzhin snying rje can yin la /
translated: He is compassionate by nature,

original: longs spyod ches dang sbyin pa de la de'i sems rab tu 'jug go //
analyzed: longs spyod ches dang sbyin pa de la de'i sems rab tu 'jug go //
translated: and his mind is engaged in generosity and in great wealth.

original: nyan thos pa ni bdag la phan par zhugs pa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyang bdag la phan par zhugs pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: nyan thos pa ni bdag la phan par zhugs pa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyang bdag la phan par zhugs pa nyid yin no //
translated: The sravaka is engaged in benefiting himself, and the pratyekabuddha is also engaged in benefiting himself.

original: gang la byang chub gsum du'ang sems mi 'jug la /
analyzed: gang la byang chub gsum du'ang sems mi 'jug la /
translated: But the one in whom the thought of the three enlightenments does not arise

original: 'khor bar mngon par dga' zhing skyo ba med pa ni bdud kyi rigs pa yin pas na rigs med do //
analyzed: 'khor bar mngon par dga' zhing skyo ba med pa ni bdud kyi rigs pa yin pas na rigs med do //
translated: The absence of spiritual potential is due to the fact that one is of Mara's clan because of one's manifest delight in samsara and one's lack of disenchantment with it.

original: theg pa gsum gyi tshig dang / theg pa gsum med pa'i tshig ni /
analyzed: theg pa gsum gyi tshig dang / theg pa gsum med pa'i tshig ni /
translated: The words of the three vehicles and the words of the non-existence of the three vehicles.

original: chos dang gang zag la bdag med pa'i theg pa ni theg pa gsum gyi tshig go //üîΩrtag pa'i bdag dang / tshangs pa dang / dbang bo la bsnyen bkur byed cing khrus dang / sbyin sreg dang / gad pa dang / g-yang sa dang / bkra shis dang / bkra shis ma yin pa dang / 'bras bu dang / rtsa ba za ba dang /
analyzed: chos dang gang zag la bdag med pa'i theg pa ni theg pa gsum gyi tshig go // rtag pa'i bdag dang / tshangs pa dang / dbang bo la bsnyen bkur byed cing khrus dang / sbyin sreg dang / gad pa dang / g-yang sa dang / bkra shis dang / bkra shis ma yin pa dang / 'bras bu dang / rtsa ba za ba dang /
translated: The words of the three vehicles refer to the vehicle of the non-substantiality of the person and of the elements of existence.üîΩThe words of the non-existence of the three vehicles refer to the belief that one is liberated by worshipping the eternal self, Brahma, and Indra, by bathing, by burnt offerings, by scraping, by jumping, by good luck, by bad luck, by eating fruit and roots,

original: rin po che dang gser la sogs pa 'chang bas thar bar rtogs pa ni theg pa gsum med pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: rin po che dang gser la sogs pa 'chang bas thar bar rtogs pa ni theg pa gsum med pa'i tshig go //
translated: and by wearing precious stones, gold, etc.

original: thal bas skud pa dang / skra 'bal ba dang / ral @53b pa'i cod pan gyis brgyan pa dang / gar dang / glu dang / ba lang gi brtul zhugs dang rma bya'i brtul zhugs la sogs pa 'di ni bdag tu zhen par sbyor ba yin gyi /
analyzed: thal bas skud pa dang / skra 'bal ba dang / ral @53b pa'i cod pan gyis brgyan pa dang / gar dang / glu dang / ba lang gi brtul zhugs dang rma bya'i brtul zhugs la sogs pa 'di ni bdag tu zhen par sbyor ba yin gyi /
translated: the practice of the five essences,üîΩthe practice of the five yogas,üîΩthe practice of the five yogas of Ma√±ju≈õrƒ´,üîΩthe practice of the five yogas of the Buddha,

original: skye ba'i sdug bsngal gyi gnyen por gyur ba'i thar ba'i rgyu ma yin te /üîΩbdag med pa nyid thar ba'i rgyu yin pas ni 'di thams cad theg pa gsum med pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: skye ba'i sdug bsngal gyi gnyen por gyur ba'i thar ba'i rgyu ma yin te / bdag med pa nyid thar ba'i rgyu yin pas ni 'di thams cad theg pa gsum med pa'i tshig go //
translated: the practice of the five yogas of the bodhisattvas,üîΩthe practice of the five yogas of the pratyekabuddhas,üîΩthe practice of the five yogas of the ≈õrƒÅvakas,üîΩthe practice of the five yogas of the ·∏çƒÅkinƒ´s,üîΩthe practice of the five yogas of the ·∏çƒÅkas,

original: snang ba'i tshig dang / snang ba med pa ma yin pa'i tshig ni shes rab kyis dpyad par bya ba /üîΩgzugs ni rdul phran gzhigs pa na //
analyzed: snang ba'i tshig dang / snang ba med pa ma yin pa'i tshig ni shes rab kyis dpyad par bya ba / gzugs ni rdul phran gzhigs pa na //
translated: the practice of the five yogas of the ·∏çƒÅkinƒ´s,üîΩthe practice of the five yogas of the ·∏çƒÅkas,

original: rdul phran cha ni med pa ste //üîΩphyi yi dngos po med par yang //
analyzed: rdul phran cha ni med pa ste // phyi yi dngos po med par yang //

original: zhes bya bar ro //
