original: bdag dang gzhan gyi rgyud kyi dbang gis dkrugs pa'i mthu dang mnyam bar 'jog pa med pa'i ma rig pa dang las rnam par smin pa las slongs te mgo 'khor ba dang / brgyal ba la sogs pa bzhin du rnam pa sna tshogs kyi rnam par shes pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan gyi rgyud kyi dbang gis dkrugs pa'i mthu dang mnyam bar 'jog pa med pa'i ma rig pa dang las rnam par smin pa las slongs te mgo 'khor ba dang / brgyal ba la sogs pa bzhin du rnam pa sna tshogs kyi rnam par shes pa 'byung ngo //
translated: The consciousness arises in various forms, like a whirling firebrand, due to the power of the agitation of one‚Äôs own and others‚Äô mental continuums, and due to the ignorance that is not in equipoise, and due to the karma that is not yet exhausted.

original: gang gi tshe shes par bya ba sbom po dang / phra ba phyogs kyi char rnam par phye ba na med par gyur nas gzugs la sogs pa thams cad stong par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe shes par bya ba sbom po dang / phra ba phyogs kyi char rnam par phye ba na med par gyur nas gzugs la sogs pa thams cad stong par 'gyur te /
translated: When the object of cognition, which is coarse and subtle, is divided into parts and becomes non-existent, all forms and so forth become empty.

original: bsam pa med pa dang / snang ba med pa dang / don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis par yang dag par rig pa nyid gnas par 'gyur ba ni snang ba med pa'i tshig ste /
analyzed: bsam pa med pa dang / snang ba med pa dang / don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis par yang dag par rig pa nyid gnas par 'gyur ba ni snang ba med pa'i tshig ste /
translated: The absence of thought, the absence of appearance, and the non-duality of ultimate reality are the true awareness, and they become the basis of the absence of appearance.

original: dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i rnam par rtog pa thams cad kyi snang ba dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i rnam par rtog pa thams cad kyi snang ba dang bral ba'o //
translated: It is free from the appearance of all conceptual thoughts of existence and non-existence.

original: snang ba med pa ma yin pa'i tshig ni gzhan gyi dbang gi rnam pa gnyis kyi rnam par shes pa so sor snang ste /
analyzed: snang ba med pa ma yin pa'i tshig ni gzhan gyi dbang gi rnam pa gnyis kyi rnam par shes pa so sor snang ste /
translated: The words ‚Äúnot non-appearance‚Äù refer to the appearance of the two aspects of the other-dependent consciousness.

original: sems can thams cad kyi 'khor ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi 'khor ba nyid yin no //
translated: It is the cyclic existence of all sentient beings.

original: smon pa'i tshig dang / smon pa med pa'i tshig ni bzang po spyod pa'i smon lam ste /
analyzed: smon pa'i tshig dang / smon pa med pa'i tshig ni bzang po spyod pa'i smon lam ste /
translated: The words ‚Äúaspiration‚Äù and ‚Äúnon-aspiration‚Äù refer to the aspiration for good conduct.

original: shes rab dang snying rje dang ldan pas na /
analyzed: shes rab dang snying rje dang ldan pas na /
translated: Because it is endowed with wisdom and compassion,

original: bdag dang gzhan gyi don dang / thams cad mkhyen pas sangs rgyas thob par byed pa'i tshig dang / gnas kyi tshig go //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan gyi don dang / thams cad mkhyen pas sangs rgyas thob par byed pa'i tshig dang / gnas kyi tshig go //
translated: it is the words that accomplish the aims of self and other and the attainment of Buddhahood through omniscience.

original: tshig ni 'gro ba dang / tshig ni gsum yang sbyor te /
analyzed: tshig ni 'gro ba dang / tshig ni gsum yang sbyor te /
translated: The words ‚Äúplace‚Äù and ‚Äúgoing‚Äù and the words ‚Äúthree‚Äù are applied.

original: sgra rnams ni don du ma'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgra rnams ni don du ma'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the words have many meanings.

original: ji ltar tshig rgyud las 'byung ba //
analyzed: ji ltar tshig rgyud las 'byung ba //
translated: As it is said in the Tantra of Words:üîΩThe signs that explain the meaning,üîΩthe approach to other words,

original: don 'grel pa yi mtshan ma dang // sgra gzhan la ni bsnyen pa dang // mtho ba yul dang dus rnams kyang //
analyzed: don 'grel pa yi mtshan ma dang // sgra gzhan la ni bsnyen pa dang // mtho ba yul dang dus rnams kyang //
translated: the high, the place, and the time,

original: khyad par dran pa'i rgyu rnams so //üîΩzhes bya'o // @54a * //
analyzed: khyad par dran pa'i rgyu rnams so //üîΩzhes bya'o // @54a * //
translated: are the causes of special recollection.

original: smon pa med pa'i tshig ni 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi rtogs nas bdag gi don du mya ngan las 'da' ba'o //
analyzed: smon pa med pa'i tshig ni 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi rtogs nas bdag gi don du mya ngan las 'da' ba'o //
translated: The words ‚Äúwithout expectancy‚Äù mean that, having realized the four noble truths, one passes into nirvana for one‚Äôs own sake.

original: 'khor gsum gyi tshig dang / 'khor gsum med pa'i tshig ni shes pa dang / shes par bya ba dang / shes pas shes zhes bya ba dang 'khor gsum mo //
analyzed: 'khor gsum gyi tshig dang / 'khor gsum med pa'i tshig ni shes pa dang / shes par bya ba dang / shes pas shes zhes bya ba dang 'khor gsum mo //
translated: The words ‚Äúthree spheres‚Äù and ‚Äúabsence of three spheres‚Äù mean that, when one knows, one knows through knowledge, and so there are three spheres.

original: gang gi tshe shes rab kyis spyad de gzugs rnam par bshig nas rdul phra mo la yang yan lag med de //
analyzed: gang gi tshe shes rab kyis spyad de gzugs rnam par bshig nas rdul phra mo la yang yan lag med de //
translated: But when one practices with wisdom, and having analyzed form, one sees that even the most subtle particle has no parts,

original: 'khor gsum mi mthong ba de'i tshe /
analyzed: 'khor gsum mi mthong ba de'i tshe /
translated: then one does not see the three spheres.

original: nad stong pa nyid dang / phyi stong pa nyid dang / tshogs su mi gnas pa dang / 'jig pa nyid kyi phyir 'khor gsum stong pa ni 'khor gsum med pa'i tshig ste /
analyzed: nad stong pa nyid dang / phyi stong pa nyid dang / tshogs su mi gnas pa dang / 'jig pa nyid kyi phyir 'khor gsum stong pa ni 'khor gsum med pa'i tshig ste /
translated: At that time, because of the emptiness of disease, the emptiness of the external, the non-abiding of the aggregates, and their destruction, the three spheres are empty, and so there are no three spheres.

original: de lta bas rga 'khrul ba med ces bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas rga 'khrul ba med ces bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is said that there is no aging and death.

original: mtshan ma'i tshig dang / mtshan ma med pa'i tshig ni bsam gtan gang la mi rtag pa dang / bdag med pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / mi mdzes pa la sogs pas gzugs kyi mtshan ma 'dzin pa de ni mtshan ma'i tshig go //
analyzed: mtshan ma'i tshig dang / mtshan ma med pa'i tshig ni bsam gtan gang la mi rtag pa dang / bdag med pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / mi mdzes pa la sogs pas gzugs kyi mtshan ma 'dzin pa de ni mtshan ma'i tshig go //
translated: That is the word of signs.

original: gzugs ni rdul phran gzhigs pa na //
analyzed: gzugs ni rdul phran gzhigs pa na //
translated: Form is analyzed into atoms.

original: rdul phran cha ni med pa ste //
analyzed: rdul phran cha ni med pa ste //
translated: The atom has no parts.

original: zhes bya bar gang na gzugs kyi mtshan ma mi 'dzin pa dang / tshor ba dang / tshor ba po'i rnam par tshor ba la sogs pa la yang mi 'dzin pa ni mtshan ma med pa'i tshig ste /
analyzed: zhes bya bar gang na gzugs kyi mtshan ma mi 'dzin pa dang / tshor ba dang / tshor ba po'i rnam par tshor ba la sogs pa la yang mi 'dzin pa ni mtshan ma med pa'i tshig ste /
translated: Thus, the sign of form is not grasped, and the feeling, the one who feels, and the feeling, etc. are not grasped. That is the word of signlessness.

original: dngos po dang dngos po med par rnam par mi rtog go //
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med par rnam par mi rtog go //
translated: One does not conceptualize entity and non-entity.

original: don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis par yang dag par rig pa'o //
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis par yang dag par rig pa'o //
translated: It is the ultimate truth, the perfect knowledge of non-duality.

original: yod med kyi phyogs kyi tshig dang / yod med kyi phyogs ma yin pa'i tshig ni phyi'i bdag nyid du yod par 'gyur ba dang / khyad par gyi bdag nyid du med par 'gyur ba dang / spyi dang khyad par gyis dag nyid du yod kyang yod la med kyang med par 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: yod med kyi phyogs kyi tshig dang / yod med kyi phyogs ma yin pa'i tshig ni phyi'i bdag nyid du yod par 'gyur ba dang / khyad par gyi bdag nyid du med par 'gyur ba dang / spyi dang khyad par gyis dag nyid du yod kyang yod la med kyang med par 'gyur ba dang /
translated: The words of the positions of existence and nonexistence and the words that are not the positions of existence and nonexistence would exist as the nature of the external, would not exist as the nature of the internal, and would exist as the nature of the general and the specific, but would not exist as the nature of the general and the specific.

original: spyi'i bdag nyid du yod par 'gyur ba yang khyad par gyi bdag nyid du smra bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: spyi'i bdag nyid du yod par 'gyur ba yang khyad par gyi bdag nyid du smra bar mi bya'o //
translated: And the existence as the nature of the general should not be said to be the nature of the specific.

original: ka ba dang dngos po la sogs pas spyir rdza mar 'gyur ba dang ka ba chu 'dzin pa la sogs pas rdza ma med par 'gyur ba dang / ka ba gra ba la sogs pas rdza mar gyur kyang gru bzhi dang / zlum po la sogs pas ka ba rdza mar byed do /
analyzed: ka ba dang dngos po la sogs pas spyir rdza mar 'gyur ba dang ka ba chu 'dzin pa la sogs pas rdza ma med par 'gyur ba dang / ka ba gra ba la sogs pas rdza mar gyur kyang gru bzhi dang / zlum po la sogs pas ka ba rdza mar byed do /
translated: A vase would be a pillar because of being a thing and so on, and a vase would not exist because of being a pillar, holding water, and so on, and a vase would be a pillar because of being a wall and so on, but a pillar would be a vase because of being square, round, and so on.

original: de bzhin du smra bar mi bya bar yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du smra bar mi bya bar yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Likewise, it should be applied that it should not be said.

original: ka ba dngos po la sogs bas spyir rdza mar @54b gyur kyang khyad par gyi bdag nyid du smra bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: ka ba dngos po la sogs bas spyir rdza mar @54b gyur kyang khyad par gyi bdag nyid du smra bar mi bya'o //
translated: and so on, is a pot in general, but it should not be said to be the particular self.üîΩAnd although it is in existence as the particular self of the pot, it should not be said to be the general self.

original: khyad par gyi bdag nyid du bu ma pa la sogs pa'i dgos pas yod par gyur kyang spyi'i bdag nyid du smra bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: khyad par gyi bdag nyid du bu ma pa la sogs pa'i dgos pas yod par gyur kyang spyi'i bdag nyid du smra bar mi bya'o //
translated: Although it is in existence as the particular self of the pot, it should not be said to be the general self.üîΩAnd although the pillar is a pot in general, it should not be said to be the particular self.

original: bum pa'i khyad par gyi bdag nyid du yod par gyur kyang ka ba la sogs pas spyir smra bar mi bya ba dang / ka ba spyi'i bdag nyid du rdza mar gyur kyang khyad par gyi bdag nyid du smra bar mi bya ba ni ka ba spyi dang khyad par gyi bdag nyid du rdza mar gyur kyang cig car smra bar mi bya ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bum pa'i khyad par gyi bdag nyid du yod par gyur kyang ka ba la sogs pas spyir smra bar mi bya ba dang / ka ba spyi'i bdag nyid du rdza mar gyur kyang khyad par gyi bdag nyid du smra bar mi bya ba ni ka ba spyi dang khyad par gyi bdag nyid du rdza mar gyur kyang cig car smra bar mi bya ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Although the pillar is a pot in general and the particular self, it should not be said to be both simultaneously.

original: spyi dang khyad par gyi bdag nyid du yod kyang yod la med kyang med par 'gyur ba ni cig cer smra bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: spyi dang khyad par gyi bdag nyid du yod kyang yod la med kyang med par 'gyur ba ni cig cer smra bar mi bya'o //
translated: Although it is in existence as the general and particular self, it should not be said to be both simultaneously.

original: yul dang / dus dang / rim dang / rnam pa la ltos nas thams cad yod pa dang med do zhes ksha pa na kas rnam pa bdun du 'byung bar smra ba'i tshig ni yod med kyi tshig go //
analyzed: yul dang / dus dang / rim dang / rnam pa la ltos nas thams cad yod pa dang med do zhes ksha pa na kas rnam pa bdun du 'byung bar smra ba'i tshig ni yod med kyi tshig go //
translated: The words of existence and non-existence are the words of the Kashmiri Vaibhasikas who say that everything exists in terms of seven aspects, in terms of object, time, sequence, and aspect.

original: yod med kyi phyogs ma yin pa'i tshig ni dngos po dang dngos po med par rnam par mi rtog cing don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis par yang dag par rig pa'o //
analyzed: yod med kyi phyogs ma yin pa'i tshig ni dngos po dang dngos po med par rnam par mi rtog cing don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis par yang dag par rig pa'o //
translated: The words that are not the position of existence and non-existence are the correct understanding of non-dual ultimate truth, without conceptualizing existence and non-existence.

original: gnyis ka'i tshig dang / gnyis ka ma yin pa'i tshig ni grangs can rnams kyi bsal ba dang / mi bsal ba thams cad yod pa dang / spyod pa rnams kyi tha dad pa dang / tha dad pa ma yin pa'i gzugs yod ces pa de rnam pa de lta bu'i byis pa rnams kyi rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis ka'i tshig dang / gnyis ka ma yin pa'i tshig ni grangs can rnams kyi bsal ba dang / mi bsal ba thams cad yod pa dang / spyod pa rnams kyi tha dad pa dang / tha dad pa ma yin pa'i gzugs yod ces pa de rnam pa de lta bu'i byis pa rnams kyi rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: The words of both and the words of neither are the concepts of childish beings, such as the Samkhyas saying that all manifestations exist and do not exist, and the Carvakas saying that different and non-different forms exist.

original: gsal ba'i don dang spyi dang / khyad par can gyi dngos po thams cad dmigs su yod do zhes ne yi ya yi ka dang / khyad par can rnams rtog par byed pa'i 'khrul ba'i shes pa bsal ba'i don du thams cad mkhyen pas gnyis ka ma yin pa'i tshig bsgrub par gsungs pa ni rang gi mtshan nyid kyi don gyi bya ba ni nus kyis spyir sgro btags pa ni rnam par rtogüîΩpar mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: gsal ba'i don dang spyi dang / khyad par can gyi dngos po thams cad dmigs su yod do zhes ne yi ya yi ka dang / khyad par can rnams rtog par byed pa'i 'khrul ba'i shes pa bsal ba'i don du thams cad mkhyen pas gnyis ka ma yin pa'i tshig bsgrub par gsungs pa ni rang gi mtshan nyid kyi don gyi bya ba ni nus kyis spyir sgro btags pa ni rnam par rtog par mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: The meaning of the nature of things is that the function of the nature of things is able to impute in general, but it is not imputed as a conception.

original: so sor rang gi 'phags pa'i ye shes kyi tshig dang / so so rang gi 'phags pa'i ye shes med pa'i tshig ni gang gi tshe shes rab kyis dpyad pas stong pa nyid de /
analyzed: so sor rang gi 'phags pa'i ye shes kyi tshig dang / so so rang gi 'phags pa'i ye shes med pa'i tshig ni gang gi tshe shes rab kyis dpyad pas stong pa nyid de /
translated: The words of individual, noble wisdom and the words of the absence of individual, noble wisdom are when emptiness is analyzed with wisdom.

original: phung por mi gnas pa dang / 'jig pa nyid rgyur shes shing phung po gnas pa thams cad khang pa dang / sde dang / nags tshal la sogs pa bzhin du phyogs kyi char rnam par phye ba na stong par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phung por mi gnas pa dang / 'jig pa nyid rgyur shes shing phung po gnas pa thams cad khang pa dang / sde dang / nags tshal la sogs pa bzhin du phyogs kyi char rnam par phye ba na stong par 'gyur ro //
translated: Not dwelling in the aggregates, knowing that destruction itself is the cause, and when all the dwelling of the aggregates is divided into directional parts, like a house, an army, a forest, and so on, it becomes empty.

original: rtag pa ma skyes pas ni ri bong gi rva lta bur @55a * //
analyzed: rtag pa ma skyes pas ni ri bong gi rva lta bur @55a * //
translated: Since the permanent is unborn, like the horn of a rabbit,

original: dngos po yod pa ma yin pa de'i tshe chos dang gang zag las dag med pa yongs su shes pa ni so so rang gi 'phags pa'i ye shes kyi tshig go //
analyzed: dngos po yod pa ma yin pa de'i tshe chos dang gang zag las dag med pa yongs su shes pa ni so so rang gi 'phags pa'i ye shes kyi tshig go //
translated: when there is no existent thing, the thorough knowledge of the nonexistence of karma and persons is the word of one's own individual noble wisdom.

original: de rang gi rigs ni skad cig pa'i rgyun 'byung ba dang dngos po dang dngos po med par rtog pa med par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de rang gi rigs ni skad cig pa'i rgyun 'byung ba dang dngos po dang dngos po med par rtog pa med par gyur pa'o //
translated: That is one's own lineage, the arising of the stream of moments, and the non-conceptuality of existence and nonexistence.

original: gang yang bdag dang / gtsang ba dang / bde bar bsgom pa'i phyin ci log gi shes bde ni so so rang gi 'phags pa'i ye shes med pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: gang yang bdag dang / gtsang ba dang / bde bar bsgom pa'i phyin ci log gi shes bde ni so so rang gi 'phags pa'i ye shes med pa'i tshig go //
translated: Also, the knowledge of the error of meditating on the self, purity, and bliss is the word of one's own individual noble wisdom.

original: mthong ba'i chos la bde ba'i tshig dang / mthong ba'i chos la bde ba med pa'i tshig ces bya ba mi 'gog pas snyoms par 'jug pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i rnam par thar ba'i sgo ni khams gsum gyi 'dod chags dang bral ba'i mthong ba'i chos kyi bde ba'o //
analyzed: mthong ba'i chos la bde ba'i tshig dang / mthong ba'i chos la bde ba med pa'i tshig ces bya ba mi 'gog pas snyoms par 'jug pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i rnam par thar ba'i sgo ni khams gsum gyi 'dod chags dang bral ba'i mthong ba'i chos kyi bde ba'o //
translated: The door of liberation of emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness is the happiness of this life that is free from attachment to the three realms.

original: bzhengs nas dag pa ye shes kyi 'jig rten la zhugs pa thugs rje chen pos gzhan don mdzad pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa la mthong ba'i chos kyi bde ba med pa'o //
analyzed: bzhengs nas dag pa ye shes kyi 'jig rten la zhugs pa thugs rje chen pos gzhan don mdzad pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa la mthong ba'i chos kyi bde ba med pa'o //
translated: Having arisen, the omniscience that engages the world of pure wisdom and acts for the benefit of others with great compassion is the unhappiness of this life.

original: zhing gi tshig dang / zhing med pa'i tshig gi sems mnyam par ma gzhag pa'i bdag dang / gzhan gyi rgyud kyi dbang gi mthu las mgo 'khor ba dang / brgyal ba la sogs pa bzhin du 'jig rten chags pa'i zhing bkod pa'i rnam par shes pa'i rnam pa sna tshogs du ma'i rnam par snang ngo //
analyzed: zhing gi tshig dang / zhing med pa'i tshig gi sems mnyam par ma gzhag pa'i bdag dang / gzhan gyi rgyud kyi dbang gi mthu las mgo 'khor ba dang / brgyal ba la sogs pa bzhin du 'jig rten chags pa'i zhing bkod pa'i rnam par shes pa'i rnam pa sna tshogs du ma'i rnam par snang ngo //
translated: The words ‚Äúfield‚Äù and ‚Äúnon-field‚Äù are the mind that is not in equipoise, and due to the power of the continuum of self and other, various appearances of the world arise, such as the various appearances of the consciousness that creates the array of fields.

original: gang gi tshe na shes par bya bsgom pa dang phra ba shes rab kyis phyogs kyi cha tha dad par rnam par phye ba na stong par mthong ba de'i tshe zhing ni zhing med pa'i tshig tu don dam par mi gnyis par shes so //
analyzed: gang gi tshe na shes par bya bsgom pa dang phra ba shes rab kyis phyogs kyi cha tha dad par rnam par phye ba na stong par mthong ba de'i tshe zhing ni zhing med pa'i tshig tu don dam par mi gnyis par shes so //
translated: When one meditates on the knowable and analyzes the different aspects of the subtle with wisdom, at that time one sees emptiness. Then, the words ‚Äúfield‚Äù and ‚Äúnon-field‚Äù are understood to be non-dual in the ultimate.

original: rdul gyi tshig dang rdul med pa'i tshig ni rdul gyi tshogs sbom por snang ba la ni zhing gi 'du shes su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rdul gyi tshig dang rdul med pa'i tshig ni rdul gyi tshogs sbom por snang ba la ni zhing gi 'du shes su 'gyur ro //
translated: The words ‚Äúparticle‚Äù and ‚Äúnon-particle‚Äù are the perception of the appearance of a coarse collection of particles, which becomes the perception of a field.

original: gang gi tshe na rdul mchog tu phra ba nyid phyogs kyi char 'byed pas phye ba na stong par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe na rdul mchog tu phra ba nyid phyogs kyi char 'byed pas phye ba na stong par 'gyur te /
translated: When the most subtle particle itself is divided into directional parts, it becomes empty.

original: de'i tshe rdul med pa'i tshig ste /
analyzed: de'i tshe rdul med pa'i tshig ste /
translated: At that time, the word ‚Äúwater‚Äù is the word ‚Äúno water.‚Äù

original: 'dzin pa dang / gzung ba dang bral ba gnyis su med pa'i don dam pa'i bden pa yang dag par rig par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dzin pa dang / gzung ba dang bral ba gnyis su med pa'i don dam pa'i bden pa yang dag par rig par 'gyur ro //
translated: The meaning of non-dual ultimate truth, free from grasping and the grasped, is truly known.

original: chu'i tshig dang / chu med pa'i tshig ni phyi'i don med pas na tshul sogs pa 'byung ba rnams med pa'i phyir chu'i tshig ni chu med pa'i tshig yin no //
analyzed: chu'i tshig dang / chu med pa'i tshig ni phyi'i don med pas na tshul sogs pa 'byung ba rnams med pa'i phyir chu'i tshig ni chu med pa'i tshig yin no //
translated: The word ‚Äúwater‚Äù and the word ‚Äúno water‚Äù are the word ‚Äúwater‚Äù is the word ‚Äúno water‚Äù because the elements such as water do not exist due to the non-existence of external objects.

original: bkru ba dang / ltung bar nges pa 'dzin pa ji lta bu lags snyam pa la thams cad mkhyen pas gsungs pa /
analyzed: bkru ba dang / ltung bar nges pa 'dzin pa ji lta bu lags snyam pa la thams cad mkhyen pas gsungs pa /
translated: How is it that washing and holding down are certain? The Omniscient One said:

original: @55b rmongs pa'i tshig dang / rmongs pa med pa'i tshig ni chu la sogs pa rmongs pa'i shes pa ye shes kyis spong ste /
analyzed: @55b rmongs pa'i tshig dang / rmongs pa med pa'i tshig ni chu la sogs pa rmongs pa'i shes pa ye shes kyis spong ste /
translated: The word ‚Äúdelusion‚Äù and the word ‚Äúno delusion‚Äù are the word ‚Äúdelusion‚Äù is the word ‚Äúno delusion‚Äù because the wisdom of the mind of delusion is abandoned by wisdom.

original: shes rab kyis dpyad na gang gi tshe na phyi'i sbom pa dang / phra bar mi dmigs pa de'i tshe rmongs pa'i tshig ni rmongs pa med pa'i tshig tu 'gyur te /
analyzed: shes rab kyis dpyad na gang gi tshe na phyi'i sbom pa dang / phra bar mi dmigs pa de'i tshe rmongs pa'i tshig ni rmongs pa med pa'i tshig tu 'gyur te /
translated: When, through the analysis of wisdom, one does not perceive external things as gross or subtle, then the word ‚Äúarisen‚Äù becomes the word ‚Äúnon-arisen.‚Äù

original: 'khrul ba dang / 'bral ba mi gnyis par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'khrul ba dang / 'bral ba mi gnyis par 'gyur ro //
translated: The word ‚Äúarisen‚Äù becomes the word ‚Äúnon-arisen‚Äù because of the absence of error and the absence of duality.

original: byung ba'i tshig dang / byung ba ma yin pa'i tshig ni /
analyzed: byung ba'i tshig dang / byung ba ma yin pa'i tshig ni /
translated: The word ‚Äúarisen‚Äù and the word ‚Äúnon-arisen‚ÄùüîΩare intended to refer to burning, cooking, etc., and to washing, rubbing, etc.

original: bsregs pa dang / 'tshed pa la sogs pa'i dgongs pa dang / khrus dang / 'bog la sogs pa ni byung ba la gnas pas ni de byung ba'i tshig go //
analyzed: bsregs pa dang / 'tshed pa la sogs pa'i dgongs pa dang / khrus dang / 'bog la sogs pa ni byung ba la gnas pas ni de byung ba'i tshig go //
translated: The word ‚Äúarisen‚Äù refers to that which exists in the arisen,

original: 'khrul ba las rmi lam la sogs pa bzhin du snang bas na byung ba'i tshig ma yin no //
analyzed: 'khrul ba las rmi lam la sogs pa bzhin du snang bas na byung ba'i tshig ma yin no //
translated: but the word ‚Äúarisen‚Äù is not the word for that which appears like a dream due to error.

original: shes rab kyis dpyod pas gang gi tshe na sbom pa dang / phra ba rnam par gzhigs shing phyi rol gyi mi dmigs pa de'i tshe byung ba med pa'i tshig tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shes rab kyis dpyod pas gang gi tshe na sbom pa dang / phra ba rnam par gzhigs shing phyi rol gyi mi dmigs pa de'i tshe byung ba med pa'i tshig tu 'gyur ro //
translated: When, through the analysis of wisdom, one does not perceive external things as gross or subtle, then the word ‚Äúarisen‚Äù becomes the word ‚Äúnon-arisen.‚Äù

original: grangs dang rtsis kyi tshig dang / grangs dang rtsis med pa'i tshig ni yul dang dus la sogs pa'i grangs su 'byed pa phyi'i don med pa mi rung ste /
analyzed: grangs dang rtsis kyi tshig dang / grangs dang rtsis med pa'i tshig ni yul dang dus la sogs pa'i grangs su 'byed pa phyi'i don med pa mi rung ste /
translated: The words of enumeration and calculation and the words of non-enumeration and non-calculation are not suitable for the absence of external objects, because the division into enumerations of place, time, etc.

original: sa'i rdul phra mor phyogs kyi char 'byed pas dbye khas na stong par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sa'i rdul phra mor phyogs kyi char 'byed pas dbye khas na stong par 'gyur ro //
translated: is refuted by the analysis of the direction-parts of the subtle particles of earth.

original: rdul bdun nam brgyad kyi grangs kyi rim pas phra ba'i spu'i thog ma dang / de las 'dus pa'i yan lag dang / sro ma dang / yungs kar gyi 'bru dang / nas dang / tshigs dang / sor mo dang / mtho dang / khru dang /
analyzed: rdul bdun nam brgyad kyi grangs kyi rim pas phra ba'i spu'i thog ma dang / de las 'dus pa'i yan lag dang / sro ma dang / yungs kar gyi 'bru dang / nas dang / tshigs dang / sor mo dang / mtho dang / khru dang /
translated: The enumeration of seven or eight particles is the order of subtlety, beginning with the hair-tip, and from that, the limb, the louse, the mustard seed, the barley, the finger, the span, the cubit,

original: gzhu brgya dag gi rim pas rgyang grags dang / dpag tshad stong dang / 'bum dang / bye ba'i khyad par rnams kyis grangs su bgrang pa rnams ni phyi'i don la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: gzhu brgya dag gi rim pas rgyang grags dang / dpag tshad stong dang / 'bum dang / bye ba'i khyad par rnams kyis grangs su bgrang pa rnams ni phyi'i don la gnas pa'o //
translated: the distance a stone is thrown, the hundred bows, the kro≈õa, the yojana, the thousand, the hundred thousand, the ten million, etc.

original: dus bgrang pa yang /
analyzed: dus bgrang pa yang /
translated: The enumeration of time is also like that.

original: grang ba dang / dro ba la sogs pa'i rim gyis bye brag nyid kyang phyi'i don la gnas pa ste /
analyzed: grang ba dang / dro ba la sogs pa'i rim gyis bye brag nyid kyang phyi'i don la gnas pa ste /
translated: and cold, warm, and so on.üîΩ

original: phyi'i don kyang med pas na grangs dang rtsis kyi tshig ni grangs dang rtsis med pa'i tshig yin no //
analyzed: phyi'i don kyang med pas na grangs dang rtsis kyi tshig ni grangs dang rtsis med pa'i tshig yin no //

original: phyi'i don med pas na thams cad stong pa'i phyir mngon par shes pa'i tshig ni mngon par shes pa med pa'i tshig tu 'gyur te gnyis kyi rnam pa dang bral ba @56a * //
analyzed: phyi'i don med pas na thams cad stong pa'i phyir mngon par shes pa'i tshig ni mngon par shes pa med pa'i tshig tu 'gyur te gnyis kyi rnam pa dang bral ba @56a * //
translated: The words of the ultimate truth are the words of the non-ultimate truth, because of the absence of external objects.

original: gnyis su med par yang dag par rig cing don dam pa'i bden pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gnyis su med par yang dag par rig cing don dam pa'i bden pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The words of the ultimate truth

original: skyo ba'i tshig dang / skyo ba med pa'i tshig ni phyi rol gyi don la mngon par chags pa'i phyi'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi rdza ma can dang / skong ba dang / gtong ba'i rlung la goms par bya ba dang / rgyas pa can yang skyo ba'i tshig go //
analyzed: skyo ba'i tshig dang / skyo ba med pa'i tshig ni phyi rol gyi don la mngon par chags pa'i phyi'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi rdza ma can dang / skong ba dang / gtong ba'i rlung la goms par bya ba dang / rgyas pa can yang skyo ba'i tshig go //
translated: The words ‚Äúdiscouragement‚Äù and ‚Äúnon-discouragement‚Äù refer to the yogis who are attached to external objects, and who practice the winds of the pot, the filling, and the releasing.

original: de las phyogs gcig pa'i dbugs 'byung ba dang / rdzus pa rjes su dran pa de yang skyo ba'i tshig ces bya'o //
analyzed: de las phyogs gcig pa'i dbugs 'byung ba dang / rdzus pa rjes su dran pa de yang skyo ba'i tshig ces bya'o //
translated: The words ‚Äúdiscouragement‚Äù also refer to the practice of the breath of one direction, and the recollection of the miraculous birth.

original: shes rab kyis dpyad de gang gi tshe shes par bya ba ci'ang mi dmigs pa de'i tshe na /
analyzed: shes rab kyis dpyad de gang gi tshe shes par bya ba ci'ang mi dmigs pa de'i tshe na /
translated: When, through the analysis of wisdom, one does not observe anything to be known,

original: ye shes skyo ba med pa'i tshig bdag nyid kyis gnas so //
analyzed: ye shes skyo ba med pa'i tshig bdag nyid kyis gnas so //
translated: then the words of the non-discouragement of wisdom abide in oneself.

original: stug po'i tshig dang / stug po ma yin pa'i tshig ces bya ba la /
analyzed: stug po'i tshig dang / stug po ma yin pa'i tshig ces bya ba la /
translated: The words ‚Äúdense‚Äù and ‚Äúnon-dense‚Äù refer to

original: stug po ni rdul phra mo rnams 'dus pa snang ba'o //
analyzed: stug po ni rdul phra mo rnams 'dus pa snang ba'o //
translated: the appearance of the gathering of subtle particles.

original: yang na stug po ni sprin rnams su rnam par rtog pa ste /
analyzed: yang na stug po ni sprin rnams su rnam par rtog pa ste /
translated: Or, the dense is the conception of clouds.

original: phyi'i don med pas na de gnyis ka dang stug po ma yin pa'i tshig yin no //
analyzed: phyi'i don med pas na de gnyis ka dang stug po ma yin pa'i tshig yin no //
translated: Since there are no external objects, both of those are words of non-density.

original: bzo dang sgyu rtsal rig pa'i tshig dang / bzo dang sgyu rtsal rig pa med pa'i tshig ni rnam pa gnyis kyi rnam par shes pa las bzo dang sgyu rtsal rig pa'i tshig gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bzo dang sgyu rtsal rig pa'i tshig dang / bzo dang sgyu rtsal rig pa med pa'i tshig ni rnam pa gnyis kyi rnam par shes pa las bzo dang sgyu rtsal rig pa'i tshig gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: Words of the knowledge of arts and crafts and words of the absence of the knowledge of arts and crafts are words that remain in the consciousness of the two aspects.

original: shes rab kyis dpyad na rab rib dang / rmi lam dang / mig 'phrul la sogs pa'i rang bzhin bzhin du rnam pa gnyis pa thams cad ma skyes par mthong bas na mi gnyis pa'i shes pa la bzo dang / sgyu rtsal rig pa'i tshig ni tshig med pa ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyis dpyad na rab rib dang / rmi lam dang / mig 'phrul la sogs pa'i rang bzhin bzhin du rnam pa gnyis pa thams cad ma skyes par mthong bas na mi gnyis pa'i shes pa la bzo dang / sgyu rtsal rig pa'i tshig ni tshig med pa ste /
translated: When analyzed with wisdom, since all two aspects are seen as unproduced, like the nature of cataracts, dreams, and illusions, the words of the knowledge of arts and crafts are words that do not exist in nondual consciousness.

original: ldog par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: ldog par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: They will be reversed.

original: rlung gi tshig dang / rlung med pa'i tshig ni nan tan gyis dkrug nas 'byung ba dang / rngub pa la sogs pa'i khyad par du 'byed pa na sgra'i mtshan ma ni rlung gi tshig ste /
analyzed: rlung gi tshig dang / rlung med pa'i tshig ni nan tan gyis dkrug nas 'byung ba dang / rngub pa la sogs pa'i khyad par du 'byed pa na sgra'i mtshan ma ni rlung gi tshig ste /
translated: Words of the vƒÅyu and words of the absence of the vƒÅyu are the sign of sound when the differences of exhalation, inhalation, and so on are differentiated by the vƒÅyu.

original: gang gi tshe shes rab kyis dpyad de stong par mthong ba de'i tshe rlung gi tshig ni rlung med pa'i tshig tu 'grub po //
analyzed: gang gi tshe shes rab kyis dpyad de stong par mthong ba de'i tshe rlung gi tshig ni rlung med pa'i tshig tu 'grub po //
translated: When one sees emptiness through the analysis of wisdom, then the word ‚Äúwind‚Äù is established as the word ‚Äúnon-wind.‚Äù

original: sa'i tshig dang / sa med pa'i tshig ni snang ba dang bcas pa'i rnal 'byor la sa'i tshig ste /
analyzed: sa'i tshig dang / sa med pa'i tshig ni snang ba dang bcas pa'i rnal 'byor la sa'i tshig ste /
translated: The word ‚Äúearth‚Äù and the word ‚Äúnon-earth‚Äù are the word ‚Äúearth‚Äù for the yoga with appearance.

original: sems med cing snang ba med pa mi gnyis pa'i don dam pa'i bden pa yang dag par rig pa la gnyis kyi rnam pa'i sa thams cad kyi tshig ni shes rab kyis dpyad pas stong par mthong ste /
analyzed: sems med cing snang ba med pa mi gnyis pa'i don dam pa'i bden pa yang dag par rig pa la gnyis kyi rnam pa'i sa thams cad kyi tshig ni shes rab kyis dpyad pas stong par mthong ste /
translated: In the non-conceptual, non-apparent, non-dual ultimate truth, the word ‚Äúall stages‚Äù is seen as empty through the analysis of wisdom.

original: snang ba med pa la rim ci yang ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: snang ba med pa la rim ci yang ces bya ba'o //
translated: In the non-apparent, there is no stage at all.

original: bsam pa'i tshig dang // bsam pa med pa'i tshig ni rnam pa gnyis kyi rnam par shes pa la @56b bsam pa 'jug ste /
analyzed: bsam pa'i tshig dang // bsam pa med pa'i tshig ni rnam pa gnyis kyi rnam par shes pa la @56b bsam pa 'jug ste /
translated: The word ‚Äúthought‚Äù and the word ‚Äúnon-thought‚Äù are the engagement of thought in the consciousness of the two aspects.

original: shes rab kyis dpyad pa na gang gi tshe shes par bya ba cung zad kyang mi dmigs pa de'i tshe bsam pa'i tshig ni bsam pa med pa'i tshig ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyis dpyad pa na gang gi tshe shes par bya ba cung zad kyang mi dmigs pa de'i tshe bsam pa'i tshig ni bsam pa med pa'i tshig ste /
translated: When, through the analysis of wisdom, one does not observe even the slightest object of cognition, then the word ‚Äúthought‚Äù is the word ‚Äúnon-thought.‚Äù

original: gnyis su med cing bsam du med pa snang ba med pa'i don dam pa'i bden pa yang dag par rig pa gnas so //
analyzed: gnyis su med cing bsam du med pa snang ba med pa'i don dam pa'i bden pa yang dag par rig pa gnas so //
translated: The nondual, inconceivable, nonappearing ultimate truth is the abode of perfect knowledge.

original: gdags pa'i tshig dang / gdags pa med pa'i tshig ni rnam pa gnyis kyi rnam par shes pa la phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched la sogs par 'dogs par byed de /
analyzed: gdags pa'i tshig dang / gdags pa med pa'i tshig ni rnam pa gnyis kyi rnam par shes pa la phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched la sogs par 'dogs par byed de /
translated: The words of designation and the words of non-designation are the two kinds of consciousness that designate the aggregates, elements, sense-fields, and so on.

original: gang mi gnyis pa dang sems pa med pa dang / snang ba med pa der 'dogs bar mi 'jug go //
analyzed: gang mi gnyis pa dang sems pa med pa dang / snang ba med pa der 'dogs bar mi 'jug go //
translated: That which is nondual, inconceivable, and nonappearing is not engaged in designation.

original: rang bzhin gyi tshig dang / rang bzhin gyi med pa'i tshig ni gang la 'dzin pa dang / gzung ba'i dngos po dang / brjod pa dang / rjod pa'i rnam bas dngos por bsdom par bya ba de ni rang bzhin gyi tshig go //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi tshig dang / rang bzhin gyi med pa'i tshig ni gang la 'dzin pa dang / gzung ba'i dngos po dang / brjod pa dang / rjod pa'i rnam bas dngos por bsdom par bya ba de ni rang bzhin gyi tshig go //
translated: The words of nature and the words of the absence of nature are the things that are included in the categories of the object of grasping, the grasper, the expressed, and the expresser.

original: shes rab kyis dpyad na gang gi tshe na dmigs par bya ba cung zad la'ang mi dmigs pa de'i tshe rang bzhin med pa mi dmigs pa'i tshig tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shes rab kyis dpyad na gang gi tshe na dmigs par bya ba cung zad la'ang mi dmigs pa de'i tshe rang bzhin med pa mi dmigs pa'i tshig tu 'gyur ro //
translated: When, through the analysis of wisdom, one does not observe even the slightest object of observation, at that time, the words of the absence of nature become the words of the non-observation of the absence of nature.

original: phung po'i tshig dang / phung po med pa'i tshig ni 'dus pa las phung por 'du shes 'jug ste /
analyzed: phung po'i tshig dang / phung po med pa'i tshig ni 'dus pa las phung por 'du shes 'jug ste /
translated: The term ‚Äúaggregate‚Äù and the term ‚Äúnon-aggregate‚Äù are used in the Sa·πÉgraha

original: 'byung ba'i sgo dang / rigs kyi don rnams su phung po dang // skye mched dang / khams rnams te /
analyzed: 'byung ba'i sgo dang / rigs kyi don rnams su phung po dang // skye mched dang / khams rnams te /
translated: to refer to the aggregates, bases, and elements in terms of the doors of arising and the meanings of the families.

original: ji srid du gnyis kyi rnam pa'i rnam par shes pa yod pa de srid du gcig dang du mar 'dus pa'i 'du shes 'jug ste /
analyzed: ji srid du gnyis kyi rnam pa'i rnam par shes pa yod pa de srid du gcig dang du mar 'dus pa'i 'du shes 'jug ste /
translated: As long as there is consciousness with the aspect of duality, there is the notion of the collection of one and many.

original: gang gi tshe shes rab kyis shes par bya ba cung zad kyang mi dmigs pa de'i tshe phung po'i tshig ni phung po med pa'i tshig tu chud par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi tshe shes rab kyis shes par bya ba cung zad kyang mi dmigs pa de'i tshe phung po'i tshig ni phung po med pa'i tshig tu chud par 'gyur ro //
translated: When nothing at all is observed as an object of wisdom, then the term ‚Äúaggregate‚Äù is included in the term ‚Äúnon-aggregate.‚Äù

original: sems can gyi tshig dang / sems can med pa'i tshig ni mig la sogs pa'i skye mched rnams kyis sems can du gdags par kun tu rtog pa ste /
analyzed: sems can gyi tshig dang / sems can med pa'i tshig ni mig la sogs pa'i skye mched rnams kyis sems can du gdags par kun tu rtog pa ste /
translated: The term ‚Äúsentient being‚Äù and the term ‚Äúinsentient being‚Äù are used in the Sa·πÉgraha to refer to the designation of sentient beings by means of the bases such as the eyes, etc.

original: gang gi tshe na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe na /
translated: When,

original: gzugs ni rdul phran gzhigs pa na //
analyzed: gzugs ni rdul phran gzhigs pa na //
translated: form is analyzed into atoms,

original: rdul phran cha ni med pa ste //
analyzed: rdul phran cha ni med pa ste //
translated: the atom is without parts.

original: phyi yi dngos po med par yang //
analyzed: phyi yi dngos po med par yang //
translated: Even without external entities,

original: sems ni rnam pa gnyis su snang //
analyzed: sems ni rnam pa gnyis su snang //
translated: Mind appears as two kinds.

original: zhes bya ba de'i tshe phyi'i don med pas sems can gyi tshig ni sems can med pa'i tshig tu shes rab kyis shes so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba de'i tshe phyi'i don med pas sems can gyi tshig ni sems can med pa'i tshig tu shes rab kyis shes so //
translated: At that time, since there are no external objects, the words of sentient beings are known by wisdom to be the words of the absence of sentient beings.

original: mu stegs can gyis brtags pa'i sems can du kun brtags pa yang ma skyes pa'i phyir dngos po med pa ni mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa bzhin no //üîΩblo'i tshig dang / blo @57a * //
analyzed: mu stegs can gyis brtags pa'i sems can du kun brtags pa yang ma skyes pa'i phyir dngos po med pa ni mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa bzhin no // blo'i tshig dang / blo @57a * //
translated: Also, the imagined sentient beings imputed by non-Buddhists are unborn, so they are non-existent, like the son of a barren woman and so on.

original: med pa'i tshig ces bya ba la /
analyzed: med pa'i tshig ces bya ba la /
translated: The words of mind and the words of no mind.

original: blo ni chud par bya ba la 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: blo ni chud par bya ba la 'jug pa ste /
translated: Here, mind is that which engages in grasping.

original: gang gi tshe na chud par bya ba shes rab kyis mi dmigs pa de'i tshe blo'i tshig ni blo med pa'i mchog tu 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe na chud par bya ba shes rab kyis mi dmigs pa de'i tshe blo'i tshig ni blo med pa'i mchog tu 'gyur te /

original: stong pa gnyis su med cing gnyis kyi rnam pa dang bral ba don dam pa'i bden pa yang dag par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: stong pa gnyis su med cing gnyis kyi rnam pa dang bral ba don dam pa'i bden pa yang dag par rig par bya'o //

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i tshig dang / mya ngan las 'das pa med pa'i tshig ni dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang bral zhing /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i tshig dang / mya ngan las 'das pa med pa'i tshig ni dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang bral zhing /

analyzed: gnyis su med pa ni don dam pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'o //

original: 'phags pa nyan thos rnams kyis mi shes pa dang / nyon mongs pa dang / las kyi mya ngan las 'das pa ni kun rdzob tsam mo //
analyzed: 'phags pa nyan thos rnams kyis mi shes pa dang / nyon mongs pa dang / las kyi mya ngan las 'das pa ni kun rdzob tsam mo //

analyzed: gang dag pa der yang 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das par rnam par rtog pa med pa ni /
translated: In that purity, there is no conceptualization of sa·πÉsƒÅra and nirvƒÅ·πáa.

original: ji ltar dbu ma las 'byung ba //

original: mya ngan 'da' bar rnam rtog med //

original: su zhig rnam par rtog par bya //
analyzed: su zhig rnam par rtog par bya //

original: len med dang ni mya ngan 'das //
analyzed: len med dang ni mya ngan 'das //

analyzed: len pa len min 'dzin pa'o //

analyzed: 'khor ba'i mtha' yang gang yin pa // de gnyis par ni chung zad kyang //

analyzed: spros pa rnams kyis ma spros pa //

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa mi mthong ngo // stong pa zhes par smra bya min //
translated: Who do not see the TathƒÅgata.üîΩOne should not say ‚Äúempty,‚Äù

original: mi stong zhes par 'gyur ba min //
analyzed: mi stong zhes par 'gyur ba min //

analyzed: gnyis dang mi gnyis zhes pa yang //

original: rnam bzhi zhe la ga la zhig / des na mya ngan las 'das pa'i tshig ni dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba ste /
analyzed: rnam bzhi zhe la ga la zhig / des na mya ngan las 'das pa'i tshig ni dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba ste /

analyzed: de nyid mya ngan las 'das pa @57b med pa'i tshig ste /

analyzed: mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: yang na rnal 'byor pa'i ye shes ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i tshig go //

original: 'khor ba sred pa dang / mi shes pa dang / tshul khrims dang / brtul zhugs snyems ba la sogs pa ni mya ngan ldas 'das pa med pa'i tshig go //

analyzed: shes bya'i tshig dang / shes bya med pa'i tshig ni gzugs la sogs par shes par bya ste /

original: gzugs rdul phran du gzhigs ba na rdul phra mo'i cha med pas shes rab kyis stong par mthong ste /
analyzed: gzugs rdul phran du gzhigs ba na rdul phra mo'i cha med pas shes rab kyis stong par mthong ste /

analyzed: shes bya'i tshig de ni shes bya med pa'i tshig tu shes so //

original: mu stegs can gyi tshig dang / mu stegs can med pa'i tshig ni ji ltar khyad par can gyi rdzas dang / yon tan dang / las dang spyi dang / khyad par dang / 'brel ba dang / tshig gi don drug yongs su zhes pas thar bar kun tu rtog pa dang /

translated: The words of the tƒ´rthikas and the words of the absence of tƒ´rthikas are like the six categories of substance, quality, action, universal, particular, and inherence, which are imagined to be the means of liberation.

original: bdag rtag cing gcig dang du ma bar rig sngags kyi mthar smra ba dang / zhi ba dang / ne yi ya yi ka dang / grangs can dang / ksha pa na ka la sogs pas kun tu rtog pas sngar bshad pha bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: bdag rtag cing gcig dang du ma bar rig sngags kyi mthar smra ba dang / zhi ba dang / ne yi ya yi ka dang / grangs can dang / ksha pa na ka la sogs pas kun tu rtog pas sngar bshad pha bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The eternal self, which is one and not many, is imagined by the VedƒÅntins, the Mƒ´mƒÅ·πÉsakas, the NaiyƒÅyikas, the SƒÅ·πÉkhyas, the Ka≈õmƒ´rans, and so on, as explained before.

original: des na rtag pa dang / bdag su stegs can gyi tshig ni phyi'i don du rtog pa las byung ba ste /
analyzed: des na rtag pa dang / bdag su stegs can gyi tshig ni phyi'i don du rtog pa las byung ba ste /
translated: Therefore, the words of the tƒ´rthikas are based on the conception of external objects.

original: shes rab kyis dpyad pa na mu stegs can med pa'i tshig tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shes rab kyis dpyad pa na mu stegs can med pa'i tshig tu 'gyur ro //
translated: When analyzed with wisdom, they become the words of the absence of tƒ´rthikas.

original: khrag khrug gi tshig dang / khrag khrug ma yin pa'i tshig ces bya ba la /
analyzed: khrag khrug gi tshig dang / khrag khrug ma yin pa'i tshig ces bya ba la /
translated: The words of confusion and the words of the absence of confusion are as follows.

original: khrag khrug ni 'khrul pa ste /
analyzed: khrag khrug ni 'khrul pa ste /
translated: The word ‚Äúturbid‚Äù means ‚Äúconfused.‚Äù

original: 'khrul pa yang rtag pa dang / bdag dang / bde ba dang / mdzes pa dang / gtsang bar sgro 'dogs pa'i phyin ci log ste /
analyzed: 'khrul pa yang rtag pa dang / bdag dang / bde ba dang / mdzes pa dang / gtsang bar sgro 'dogs pa'i phyin ci log ste /
translated: Confusion is a mistake, a misapprehension that superimposes permanence, a self, pleasure, beauty, and purity on things that are impermanent, painful, insubstantial, ugly, and impure.

original: mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med pa dang / mi gtsang ba dang / stong pa'i dngos po rnams la shes rab kyis dpyad de /
analyzed: mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med pa dang / mi gtsang ba dang / stong pa'i dngos po rnams la shes rab kyis dpyad de /
translated: By investigating with wisdom the things that are impermanent, painful, insubstantial, ugly, and impure,

original: rtag pa dang / bdag dang / phyi'i don bsal bas khrag khrug gi tshig ni khrag khrug ma yin pa'i tshig tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rtag pa dang / bdag dang / phyi'i don bsal bas khrag khrug gi tshig ni khrag khrug ma yin pa'i tshig tu 'gyur ro //
translated: one eliminates the superimpositions of permanence, a self, and external objects. The word ‚Äúturbid‚Äù becomes the word ‚Äúnon-turbid.‚Äù

original: skyu ma'i tshig dang / sgyu ma med pa'i tshig ni gnyis kyi rnam pa'i rnam par shes pa ni sgyu ma'i tshig go //
analyzed: skyu ma'i tshig dang / sgyu ma med pa'i tshig ni gnyis kyi rnam pa'i rnam par shes pa ni sgyu ma'i tshig go //
translated: The word ‚Äúillusion‚Äù and the word ‚Äúnon-illusion‚Äù are words that refer to consciousness that has the aspect of duality.

original: don dam pa'i bden pa gnyis su med par yang dag par rig pa ni sgyu ma med pa'i tshig ste /
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pa gnyis su med par yang dag par rig pa ni sgyu ma med pa'i tshig ste /
translated: The word ‚Äúnon-illusion‚Äù refers to the correct understanding of ultimate truth, which is non-dual.

original: ji ltar rdo rje gcod pa las byung ba /
analyzed: ji ltar rdo rje gcod pa las byung ba /
translated: As it is said in the Vajracchedika:

original: ji tsam du mtshan phun sum tshogs pa de tsam du brdzun no //
analyzed: ji tsam du mtshan phun sum tshogs pa de tsam du brdzun no //
translated: ‚ÄúTo the extent that there is perfection of marks, to that extent there is falsity.‚Äù

original: ji tsam du mtshan phun sum @58a * //
analyzed: ji tsam du mtshan phun sum @58a * //
translated: To the extent that the signs are complete,üîΩ

original: tshogs pa med pa de tsam du mi brdzun no //
analyzed: tshogs pa med pa de tsam du mi brdzun no //
translated: To the extent that there is no perfection of the characteristics, to that extent there is no falseness.

original: rmi lam gyi tshig dang / rmi lam ma yin pa'i tshig ni mnyam par mi 'jog pa'i ma rig pa dang / las rnam par smin pa las gzhan pa gzhan gyi dbang gi gnyis kyi rnam pa'i rnam par shes pa ni rmi lam gyi tshig go //
analyzed: rmi lam gyi tshig dang / rmi lam ma yin pa'i tshig ni mnyam par mi 'jog pa'i ma rig pa dang / las rnam par smin pa las gzhan pa gzhan gyi dbang gi gnyis kyi rnam pa'i rnam par shes pa ni rmi lam gyi tshig go //
translated: The words of a dream and the words of no dream are the consciousness of the two aspects of the other-dependent, which is ignorance of non-absorption and the ripening of karma, other than other.

original: gnyis kyi rnam pas stong zhing bsam du med pa dang / snang ba med pa don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis pa yang dag par rig par grub pa ni rmi lam ma yin pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: gnyis kyi rnam pas stong zhing bsam du med pa dang / snang ba med pa don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis pa yang dag par rig par grub pa ni rmi lam ma yin pa'i tshig go //
translated: The words of no dream are the ultimate truth of non-duality, which is the establishment of the inconceivable, non-apparent, and ultimate knowledge, empty of the two aspects.

original: smig rgyu'i tshig dang / smig rgyu med pa'i tshig ni byed pa'i snang ba tsam gyis nor ba'i shes pa'i tshig ni smig rgyu'i tshig go //
analyzed: smig rgyu'i tshig dang / smig rgyu med pa'i tshig ni byed pa'i snang ba tsam gyis nor ba'i shes pa'i tshig ni smig rgyu'i tshig go //
translated: The words of a mirage and the words of no mirage are the words of mistaken consciousness by the mere appearance of the activity of the mirage.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rnam par shes pa las 'gyur ba gsal ba snang ba dang mtshungs pas so //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa las 'gyur ba gsal ba snang ba dang mtshungs pas so //
translated: Because it is similar to the appearance of the transformation of consciousness.

original: ji ltar rmi lam du yang myang ma gyi thang la sogs pa 'chur shes pa gdon mi za bar 'gyur ba de bzhin du rmi lam med pa'i dus na yang phyi'i don med par mya ngam gyi smig rgyu la sogs pa la chur sgro 'dogs par byed de
analyzed: ji ltar rmi lam du yang myang ma gyi thang la sogs pa 'chur shes pa gdon mi za bar 'gyur ba de bzhin du rmi lam med pa'i dus na yang phyi'i don med par mya ngam gyi smig rgyu la sogs pa la chur sgro 'dogs par byed de
translated: Just as in a dream, one certainly knows that there is water in a mirage, and so on, in the same way, when one is not dreaming, one falsely imputes water to a mirage, and so on, in the absence of external objects.

original: / des na smig rgyu'i tshig ni smig rgyu med pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: / des na smig rgyu'i tshig ni smig rgyu med pa'i tshig go //
translated: Therefore, the word ‚Äúmirage‚Äù is the word for ‚Äúno mirage.‚Äù

original: gzugs brnyan gyi tshig dang / gzugs brnyan med pa'i tshig ni phyi'i don med pas na bzhin gyi gzugs nyid med na /
analyzed: gzugs brnyan gyi tshig dang / gzugs brnyan med pa'i tshig ni phyi'i don med pas na bzhin gyi gzugs nyid med na /
translated: The word ‚Äúreflection‚Äù and the word ‚Äúno reflection‚Äù are as follows: Since there is no external object, if there is no face,

original: de las gzugs brnyan du gyur pa ltag la zhig ste /
analyzed: de las gzugs brnyan du gyur pa ltag la zhig ste /
translated: how could there be a reflection?

original: rmi lam du rmi lam gzhan pa lta bu bas na gzugs brnyan gyi tshig ni gzugs brnyan med pa'i tshig tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rmi lam du rmi lam gzhan pa lta bu bas na gzugs brnyan gyi tshig ni gzugs brnyan med pa'i tshig tu 'gyur ro //
translated: Since it is like another dream within a dream, the word ‚Äúreflection‚Äù becomes the word for ‚Äúno reflection.‚Äù

original: yang na gzugs ni lus te /
analyzed: yang na gzugs ni lus te /
translated: Or, ‚Äúform‚Äù is the body.

original: phyi'i don med pa'i phyir de yang gzugs med pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: phyi'i don med pa'i phyir de yang gzugs med pa'i tshig go //
translated: Since there is no external object, that is the word for ‚Äúno form.‚Äù

original: 'khor lo'i tshig dang / 'khor lo med pa'i tshig ni 'gal ba nyid yongs su ma grub pa ste /
analyzed: 'khor lo'i tshig dang / 'khor lo med pa'i tshig ni 'gal ba nyid yongs su ma grub pa ste /
translated: The words of a wheel and the words of a non-wheel are not established as contradictory.

original: de'i tshe de'i 'bras bu gzugs brnyan ni 'khor lo med pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: de'i tshe de'i 'bras bu gzugs brnyan ni 'khor lo med pa'i tshig go //
translated: At that time, its result, the reflection, is the words of a non-wheel.

original: dri za'i tshig dang dri za ma yin pa'i tshig ni dri za'i grong khyer phyi'i rnam par grub pa med pas na de las lhag pa'i dgos pa grub pa lta ci smos te /
analyzed: dri za'i tshig dang dri za ma yin pa'i tshig ni dri za'i grong khyer phyi'i rnam par grub pa med pas na de las lhag pa'i dgos pa grub pa lta ci smos te /
translated: The words of a gandharva and the words of a non-gandharva are not established externally, so what need is there to speak of establishing a higher purpose?

original: des na dri za'i tshig ni dri za ma yin pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: des na dri za'i tshig ni dri za ma yin pa'i tshig go //
translated: Therefore, the words of a gandharva are the words of a non-gandharva.

original: lha'i tshig dang / lha ma yin pa'i tshig ni phyi'i don med pas na lha'i tshig gnas ni lha'i tshig ma yin no //
analyzed: lha'i tshig dang / lha ma yin pa'i tshig ni phyi'i don med pas na lha'i tshig gnas ni lha'i tshig ma yin no //
translated: The words of a god and the words of a non-god are not established externally, so the words of a god are not the words of a god.

original: zas skom gyi tshig dang / zas skom med pa'i tshig ni rmi lam gyi dus na yang zas dang skom bza' btung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: zas skom gyi tshig dang / zas skom med pa'i tshig ni rmi lam gyi dus na yang zas dang skom bza' btung bar 'gyur te /
translated: The words of food and drink and the words of non-food and drink are food and drink that are eaten and drunk even at the time of a dream.

original: phyi'i don med pas na de yod pa'ang ma yin te /
analyzed: phyi'i don med pas na de yod pa'ang ma yin te /
translated: Since there is no external object, they do not exist.

original: de bas na zas skom gyi tshig 'di @58b zas skom med pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: de bas na zas skom gyi tshig 'di @58b zas skom med pa'i tshig go //
translated: Therefore, the words ‚Äúfood and drink‚Äù are words for the absence of food and drink.

original: 'khrig pa'i tshig dang / 'khrig pa med pa'i tshig ni lus yod na ni 'khrig par yang 'gyur na /
analyzed: 'khrig pa'i tshig dang / 'khrig pa med pa'i tshig ni lus yod na ni 'khrig par yang 'gyur na /
translated: The words ‚Äúsexual intercourse‚Äù and ‚Äúabsence of sexual intercourse‚Äù are as follows: If there were a body, there would be sexual intercourse.

original: ji ltar lus ni /
analyzed: ji ltar lus ni /
translated: But how can there be a body?

original: gzugs ni rdul phran gzhigs pa na //
analyzed: gzugs ni rdul phran gzhigs pa na //
translated: Form is analyzed into atoms.

original: rdul phran cha ni yod pa min //
analyzed: rdul phran cha ni yod pa min //
translated: Atoms are not established as having parts.

original: de lta bur phyi'i don med pas na /
analyzed: de lta bur phyi'i don med pas na /
translated: Since external objects do not exist in that way,

original: de'i lus nyid la stong par mthong na /
analyzed: de'i lus nyid la stong par mthong na /
translated: when one sees one‚Äôs own body as empty,

original: de'i tshe mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med pa dang / mdzes pa ma yin pa dang / stong par bsgoms pas 'khrig pa'i tshig ni 'khrig pa ma yin pa'i tshig tu khong du chud par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med pa dang / mdzes pa ma yin pa dang / stong par bsgoms pas 'khrig pa'i tshig ni 'khrig pa ma yin pa'i tshig tu khong du chud par 'gyur ro //
translated: at that time, by meditating on impermanence, suffering, selflessness, and repulsiveness, and on emptiness, one will understand that the words ‚Äúsexual intercourse‚Äù are words for the absence of sexual intercourse.

original: lta ba'i tshig dang / lta ba med pa'i tshig ni gzugs la sogs par lta ba ste /
analyzed: lta ba'i tshig dang / lta ba med pa'i tshig ni gzugs la sogs par lta ba ste /
translated: The words ‚Äúview‚Äù and ‚Äúabsence of view‚Äù are as follows: The view is the view of form and so on.

original: shes rab kyis sbom po dang phra mo rnam par dbye ba na khang pa dang / sde dang tshal la sogs pa bzhin du stong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: shes rab kyis sbom po dang phra mo rnam par dbye ba na khang pa dang / sde dang tshal la sogs pa bzhin du stong bar 'gyur te /
translated: When discriminating wisdom analyzes the gross and subtle, they become empty like a house, an army, a forest, and so on.

original: des na lta ba'i tshig ni lta ba med pa'i tshig tu shes so //üîΩpha rol tu phyin pa'i tshig dang / pha rol tu phyin pa med pa'i tshig ni gnyis kyi rnam pa'i shes pas sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshogs su 'gyur ba gang gzhan gyi dbang gis gnyis kyi rnam par shes pa kun rdzob kyi bden pa rmi lam dang mig 'phrul la
analyzed: des na lta ba'i tshig ni lta ba med pa'i tshig tu shes so // pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshig dang / pha rol tu phyin pa med pa'i tshig ni gnyis kyi rnam pa'i shes pas sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshogs su 'gyur ba gang gzhan gyi dbang gis gnyis kyi rnam par shes pa kun rdzob kyi bden pa rmi lam dang mig 'phrul la
translated: Therefore, the words of views are known to be words without views.üîΩThe words of the perfections and the words of the absence of perfections are the words of the accumulation of the perfections of generosity and so on by the consciousness of the two extremes.

original: sogs pa bzhin du don dam par grub pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sogs pa bzhin du don dam par grub pa ma yin te /
translated: The relative truth, which is the consciousness of the two extremes, is not ultimately established, like a dream, an illusion, and so on.

original: gnyis su med pa'i ye shes la mi snang ngo //
analyzed: gnyis su med pa'i ye shes la mi snang ngo //
translated: It does not appear in the nondual pristine consciousness.

original: shes rab kyis dpyod pa na shes par bya ba mi dmigs pa'i rnal 'byor bsam du med pa /
analyzed: shes rab kyis dpyod pa na shes par bya ba mi dmigs pa'i rnal 'byor bsam du med pa /
translated: When analyzed by wisdom, the object of knowledge is the inconceivable yoga of the nonobservation of the object.

original: snang ba med cing don dam pa'i bden pa gnyis kyi mi gnyis bar yang dag par rig pa dngos po dang / dngos po med pa rnam par mi rtog pa la dge ba dang ma dge ba'i chos rnam pa gnyis pa thams cad mi snang ngo //
analyzed: snang ba med cing don dam pa'i bden pa gnyis kyi mi gnyis bar yang dag par rig pa dngos po dang / dngos po med pa rnam par mi rtog pa la dge ba dang ma dge ba'i chos rnam pa gnyis pa thams cad mi snang ngo //
translated: The two kinds of dharmas, the wholesome and the unwholesome, do not appear.üîΩThe words of morality and the words of immorality are:

original: tshul khrims kyi tshig dang tshul khrims med pa'i tshig ni 'di ni bya ba'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi tshig dang tshul khrims med pa'i tshig ni 'di ni bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThis is to be done,

original: 'di ni mi bya'o zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'di ni mi bya'o zhes bya ba ste /
translated: and this is not to be done.‚Äù

original: gnyis kyi rnam pa'i shes pa la tshul khrims su rnam par rtog par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: gnyis kyi rnam pa'i shes pa la tshul khrims su rnam par rtog par 'gyur gyi /
translated: Morality is conceptualized in terms of dualistic cognition.

original: shes rab kyis dpyad pas gnyis kyi rnam pa thams cad ma skyes pa dang / stong ba dang / sems pa dang / bral ba dang / snang ba med cing mi gnyis pa'i tshul khrims don dam pa'i bden pa yang dag par rig pa dngos po med par rnam par mi rtog par mthong ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyis dpyad pas gnyis kyi rnam pa thams cad ma skyes pa dang / stong ba dang / sems pa dang / bral ba dang / snang ba med cing mi gnyis pa'i tshul khrims don dam pa'i bden pa yang dag par rig pa dngos po med par rnam par mi rtog par mthong ste /
translated: However, through the analysis of wisdom, all dualistic aspects are seen to be unborn, empty, devoid of thought, non-appearing, and non-dual. The ultimate truth, the non-conceptual perception of the non-existent, is morality.

original: des na tshul khrims thams cad du rnam par @59a * //
analyzed: des na tshul khrims thams cad du rnam par @59a * //
translated: Therefore, morality is seen to be non-existent in every way.

original: rtag pa'i phyir tshul khrims kyi tshig ni tshul khrims med pa'i tshig tu 'gyur ro /
analyzed: rtag pa'i phyir tshul khrims kyi tshig ni tshul khrims med pa'i tshig tu 'gyur ro /
translated: Because of permanence, the words of morality become the words of immorality.

original: nyi zla dang skar ma'i tshig dang / nyi zla dang skar ma med pa'i tshig ni bdag dang gzhan gyi rgyun gyi dbang dang / dam pa dang dam pa ma yin pa'i chos bstan pa la sogs pas dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las las gnas rnam pa sna tshogs mang po 'byung zhing /üîΩ'jig rten gyi mgon po la sogs par snang ba gnyis kyi rnam pa'i rnam par shes pa thams cad ni gzhan gyi dbang ste /
analyzed: nyi zla dang skar ma'i tshig dang / nyi zla dang skar ma med pa'i tshig ni bdag dang gzhan gyi rgyun gyi dbang dang / dam pa dang dam pa ma yin pa'i chos bstan pa la sogs pas dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las las gnas rnam pa sna tshogs mang po 'byung zhing / 'jig rten gyi mgon po la sogs par snang ba gnyis kyi rnam pa'i rnam par shes pa thams cad ni gzhan gyi dbang ste /
translated: The words of the sun, moon, and stars, and the words of the nonexistence of the sun, moon, and stars, are the dependent nature, because of the arising of many different kinds of states from virtuous and nonvirtuous actions, through the power of one‚Äôs own and others‚Äô continua, the teaching of the Dharma of the holy and the unholy, and so on.

original: rmi lam dang / mig 'phrul la sogs pa bzhin bas na nyi zla dang skar ma'i tshig ni don dam par stong pas nyi zla dang skar ma med pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: rmi lam dang / mig 'phrul la sogs pa bzhin bas na nyi zla dang skar ma'i tshig ni don dam par stong pas nyi zla dang skar ma med pa'i tshig go //
translated: All consciousnesses that appear as the lords of the world and so on are the dependent nature, because they are like dreams, illusions, and so on. Therefore, the words of the sun, moon, and stars are the words of the ultimate emptiness that is the nonexistence of the sun, moon, and stars.

original: bden pa'i tshig dang / bden pa med pa'i tshig ni bden pa bzhi'i shes pa shes rab kyis dpyad pa na thams cad gnyis su med par rtogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: bden pa'i tshig dang / bden pa med pa'i tshig ni bden pa bzhi'i shes pa shes rab kyis dpyad pa na thams cad gnyis su med par rtogs par 'gyur te /
translated: The words of truth and the words of the absence of truth are all realized as non-dual when one analyzes with wisdom the knowledge of the four noble truths.

original: de bas na bden pa'i tshig ni bden pa med pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: de bas na bden pa'i tshig ni bden pa med pa'i tshig go //
translated: Therefore, the words of truth are the words of the absence of truth.

original: 'bras bu'i tshig dang / 'bras bu med pa'i tshig ni rtse mo nyi shur 'phags pa 'jig tshogs la lha ba'i ri ye shes kyi rdo rjes bcom ba ste dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu mngon sum du 'thob bo zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i tshig dang / 'bras bu med pa'i tshig ni rtse mo nyi shur 'phags pa 'jig tshogs la lha ba'i ri ye shes kyi rdo rjes bcom ba ste dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu mngon sum du 'thob bo zhes bya'o //
translated: The words of the result and the words of the absence of result are the twenty peaks of the mountain of the view of the transitory collection that are destroyed by the vajra of wisdom, and one directly attains the result of an arhat.

original: de la rtse mo nyi shu zhes pa ni gzugs bdag go bar kun tu mthong ba dang / bdag gzugs can pa dang / bdag gi gzugs dang / bdag la gzugs zhes par mthong ba de bzhin du tshor ba la sogs pa'i phung po bzhi rnams la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de la rtse mo nyi shu zhes pa ni gzugs bdag go bar kun tu mthong ba dang / bdag gzugs can pa dang / bdag gi gzugs dang / bdag la gzugs zhes par mthong ba de bzhin du tshor ba la sogs pa'i phung po bzhi rnams la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: In this regard, the so-called twenty peaks are the views that form is the self, the self has form, the self possesses form, and form is in the self, and in the same way, the four aggregates of feeling and so on are applied.

original: rmi lam dang mig 'phrul la sogs pa bzhin du gnyis kyi rnam pa'i shes pa thams cad ni stong pa yin te /
analyzed: rmi lam dang mig 'phrul la sogs pa bzhin du gnyis kyi rnam pa'i shes pa thams cad ni stong pa yin te /
translated: All consciousnesses that have the aspect of duality are empty, like dreams, illusions, and so forth.

original: ji ltar 'dir gzung ba dgra bcom pa ni sems kyi 'khrul ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ji ltar 'dir gzung ba dgra bcom pa ni sems kyi 'khrul ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Here, the object of apprehension is called the ‚Äúconfusion of the mind of an arhat.‚Äù

original: ji ltar rdo rje gcod pa las 'byung ba /
analyzed: ji ltar rdo rje gcod pa las 'byung ba /
translated: As it is said in the Diamond Cutter:

original: rab 'byor bdag gis dgra bcom pa thob po zhes pa dgra bcom pa la ci ste snyam du 'gyur ram bcom ldan 'das ma lags so //
analyzed: rab 'byor bdag gis dgra bcom pa thob po zhes pa dgra bcom pa la ci ste snyam du 'gyur ram bcom ldan 'das ma lags so //
translated: ‚ÄúSubh≈´ti, if it occurs to an arhat, ‚ÄòI have attained arhatship,‚Äô then the Blessed One has not declared that person to be an arhat.

original: dgra bcom pa zhes bgyi ba'i chos de gang yang ma mchis so zhes te /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa zhes bgyi ba'i chos de gang yang ma mchis so zhes te /
translated: Blessed One, there is no such dharma as ‚Äòarhatship.‚Äô‚Äù

original: de de ltar na shes rab kyis dpyad pas gang zag la bdag med pa gnyis kyi rnam pa'i ye shes kyang stong par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de de ltar na shes rab kyis dpyad pas gang zag la bdag med pa gnyis kyi rnam pa'i ye shes kyang stong par 'gyur te /
translated: In this way, when analyzed with wisdom, the wisdom that has the aspect of the two types of selflessness with regard to the person is also empty.

original: chos la bdag med pa don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis par yang dag par rig pa la dngos po dang / dngos po med par rnam par mi @59b rtog pas na 'bras bu'i tshig ni 'bras bu med pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: chos la bdag med pa don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis par yang dag par rig pa la dngos po dang / dngos po med par rnam par mi @59b rtog pas na 'bras bu'i tshig ni 'bras bu med pa'i tshig go //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúresult‚Äù is a phrase that is not a result, because the knowledge of the ultimate truth, which is the selflessness of phenomena, is not conceptualized as either an existent or a nonexistent entity.

original: 'gog pa'i tshig dang / 'gog pa med pa'i tshig ni gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa med pa'i phyir gdags par bya ba yang med pas na /
analyzed: 'gog pa'i tshig dang / 'gog pa med pa'i tshig ni gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa med pa'i phyir gdags par bya ba yang med pas na /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúcessation‚Äù is a phrase that is not a cessation, because there is no designation of something to be designated, since there is no apprehended object and no apprehending subject.

original: 'gog pa'i tshig ni 'gog pa med pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: 'gog pa'i tshig ni 'gog pa med pa'i tshig go //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúcessation‚Äù is a phrase that is not a cessation.

original: phung po lhag ma dang bcas pa'i 'gog par bdag gi skye ba zad pa dang / tshangs pa'i spyod pa spyad pa dang / 'di las srid pa gzhan mi shes te /
analyzed: phung po lhag ma dang bcas pa'i 'gog par bdag gi skye ba zad pa dang / tshangs pa'i spyod pa spyad pa dang / 'di las srid pa gzhan mi shes te /
translated: The cessation that is associated with the remaining aggregates is the exhaustion of one‚Äôs birth, the practice of pure conduct, and the non-perception of any existence beyond this one.

original: 'di lta bur bden pa bzhir bsgyur ba slob pa dang mi slob pa rnams la shes par bya ba dang / shes pa la sogs par sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'di lta bur bden pa bzhir bsgyur ba slob pa dang mi slob pa rnams la shes par bya ba dang / shes pa la sogs par sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The four noble truths should be understood in this way by those who are training and by those who are beyond training, and they should be applied to knowledge and so forth.

original: rnam pa gnyis ni shes pa thams cad ni mi gnyis pa ste /
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis ni shes pa thams cad ni mi gnyis pa ste /
translated: All knowledge is nondual.

original: don dam pa'i bden pa yang dag par rig pa dngos po dang dngos po med par rtog cing /
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pa yang dag par rig pa dngos po dang dngos po med par rtog cing /
translated: The ultimate truth is the cognition of reality, free from the concepts of existence and nonexistence.

original: sems med pa la mi snang ste /
analyzed: sems med pa la mi snang ste /
translated: It does not appear to the mindless.

original: de bas na 'gog pa'i tshig ni 'gog pa med pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: de bas na 'gog pa'i tshig ni 'gog pa med pa'i tshig go //
translated: Therefore, the word ‚Äúcessation‚Äù is the word for ‚Äúnoncessation.‚Äù

original: 'gog pa las ldang ba'i tshig dang // 'gog pa las ldang ba med pa'i tshig ni nyon mongs pa 'gog pa bden pa'i ting nge 'dzin las ldang ba ste /
analyzed: 'gog pa las ldang ba'i tshig dang // 'gog pa las ldang ba med pa'i tshig ni nyon mongs pa 'gog pa bden pa'i ting nge 'dzin las ldang ba ste /
translated: The word ‚Äúarising from cessation‚Äù and the word ‚Äúnonarising from cessation‚Äù are the arising from the meditative stabilization of the truth of the cessation of afflictions.

original: mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med pa dang / gtsang ba ma yin pa'i rnam pa dag 'jig rten gyi bsam gtan gnyis kyi rnam pa snang ba rmi lam dang // mig 'phrul dang gzugs brnyan la sogs pa'i shes pa bzhin du don dam pa'i bden pas stong pa ste /
analyzed: mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med pa dang / gtsang ba ma yin pa'i rnam pa dag 'jig rten gyi bsam gtan gnyis kyi rnam pa snang ba rmi lam dang // mig 'phrul dang gzugs brnyan la sogs pa'i shes pa bzhin du don dam pa'i bden pas stong pa ste /
translated: The aspects of impermanence, suffering, selflessness, and impurity appear as the aspects of the two worldly meditative stabilizations, like the consciousness of a dream, an illusion, a reflection, and so on, empty of ultimate reality.

original: gnyis su med pa don dam pa'i bden pa yang dag par rig pa la mi snang bas na 'gog pa las ldang ba'i tshig ni 'gog pa las ldang ba med pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: gnyis su med pa don dam pa'i bden pa yang dag par rig pa la mi snang bas na 'gog pa las ldang ba'i tshig ni 'gog pa las ldang ba med pa'i tshig go //
translated: Since the ultimate truth of nonduality does not appear to correct cognition, the words of rising from cessation are the words of non-rising from cessation.

original: the tshom gyi tshig dang / the tshom med pa'i tshig ni 'di ci ltar yin nam ma yin zhes pa gnyis kyi rnam pa'i shes pa la mos par 'gyur gyi gnyis su med pa la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: the tshom gyi tshig dang / the tshom med pa'i tshig ni 'di ci ltar yin nam ma yin zhes pa gnyis kyi rnam pa'i shes pa la mos par 'gyur gyi gnyis su med pa la ni ma yin no //
translated: The words of doubt and the words of non-doubt are the two aspects of the cognition that thinks, ‚ÄúIs this so or not?‚Äù but it is not nonduality.

original: gang gi tshe shes rab kyis dpyad de stong pa nyid la phung por gnas pa med pa dang / 'jig pa nyid yin par rtogs par 'gyur ba de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe shes rab kyis dpyad de stong pa nyid la phung por gnas pa med pa dang / 'jig pa nyid yin par rtogs par 'gyur ba de'i tshe /
translated: When, through analysis with wisdom, one realizes that in emptiness there is no abiding of the aggregates and that they are destroyed,

original: rtag pa dang / bdag dang / phyi'i don du 'khrul ba spangs te /
analyzed: rtag pa dang / bdag dang / phyi'i don du 'khrul ba spangs te /
translated: then one abandons the error of permanence, self, and external objects.

original: bsam pa dang bral zhing snang ba med pa don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis par yang dag par rig pa dngos po dang / dngos po med pa rnam par mi rtog pa /
analyzed: bsam pa dang bral zhing snang ba med pa don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis par yang dag par rig pa dngos po dang / dngos po med pa rnam par mi rtog pa /
translated: Free from thought and appearances, one correctly cognizes the nondual ultimate truth, free from the concepts of things and nonthings.

original: dogs pa dang bral pa gnyis gnas @60a * //
analyzed: dogs pa dang bral pa gnyis gnas @60a * //
translated: The two, free from doubt, are the basis.

original: so // mtshan gyi tshig dang / mtshan med pa'i tshig ni chos dang / chos can dang / yon tan dang / las dang / spyi dang / khyad par la sogs pa'i brtag pa ni mtshan nyid kyi tshig go //
analyzed: so // mtshan gyi tshig dang / mtshan med pa'i tshig ni chos dang / chos can dang / yon tan dang / las dang / spyi dang / khyad par la sogs pa'i brtag pa ni mtshan nyid kyi tshig go //
translated: The words of definition and the words of non-definition are the words of definition, which are the analysis of phenomena, subjects, qualities, actions, universals, particulars, etc.

original: gang de'i gzhi yin ba'i rang gi mtshan nyid ni sgra'i don du sgro btags nas spyi'i rnam par mngon par brjod pa ste /
analyzed: gang de'i gzhi yin ba'i rang gi mtshan nyid ni sgra'i don du sgro btags nas spyi'i rnam par mngon par brjod pa ste /
translated: The definition of its basis is the meaning of the word, which is superimposed, and is the expression of the universal.

original: ji ltar slob dpon dha rma k'irtis smras pa /üîΩdon dam de ni bdag nyid kyis //
analyzed: ji ltar slob dpon dha rma k'irtis smras pa / don dam de ni bdag nyid kyis //
translated: As master Dharmikaƒ´rti says:üîΩThat ultimate is not applied

original: sbyor ba med cing tha dad med //
analyzed: sbyor ba med cing tha dad med //
translated: by itself, nor is it different.

original: gzugs ni gcig dang tha dad par //
analyzed: gzugs ni gcig dang tha dad par //
translated: Form is neither one nor different.

original: de dag blo yi 'khrul pa'o //
analyzed: de dag blo yi 'khrul pa'o //
translated: Those are errors of the mind.

original: ji ltar dbu ma las 'byung ba //
analyzed: ji ltar dbu ma las 'byung ba //
translated: As it occurs in the Madhyamaka:

original: mtshon bya mtshan nyid gal te gzhan //
analyzed: mtshon bya mtshan nyid gal te gzhan //
translated: If the definiendum has a different definition,

original: mtshan la mtshan nyid med par 'gyur //
analyzed: mtshan la mtshan nyid med par 'gyur //
translated: the definition would be without a definiendum.

original: gcig na'ang de gnyis mi 'grub ste //
analyzed: gcig na'ang de gnyis mi 'grub ste //
translated: If they are the same, those two are not established.

original: tha dad na yang gzhan du med //
analyzed: tha dad na yang gzhan du med //
translated: If they are different, there is no other.

original: de bzhin chos dang chos can te //
analyzed: de bzhin chos dang chos can te //
translated: Likewise, the Dharma and the person who practices the Dharma.

original: des na mtshan gyi tshig ni mtshan med pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: des na mtshan gyi tshig ni mtshan med pa'i tshig go //
translated: Therefore, the word ‚Äúsign‚Äù is the word for ‚Äúsignless.‚Äù

original: yan lag gi tshig dang / yan lag med pa'i tshig ces bya ba la /
analyzed: yan lag gi tshig dang / yan lag med pa'i tshig ces bya ba la /
translated: The word ‚Äúpart‚Äù and the word ‚Äúpartless‚Äù are as follows:

original: yan lag ni lus te /
analyzed: yan lag ni lus te /
translated: ‚ÄúPart‚Äù means the body.

original: phyi'i don med pas na /
analyzed: phyi'i don med pas na /
translated: Since there are no external objects,

original: de yang med de des na yan lag gi tshig ni yan lag med pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: de yang med de des na yan lag gi tshig ni yan lag med pa'i tshig go //
translated: that also does not exist. Therefore, the word ‚Äúpart‚Äù is the word for ‚Äúpartless.‚Äù

original: sgyu rtsal rig pa'i tshig dang / sgyu rtsal rig pa med pa'i tshig ni yan lag med pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: sgyu rtsal rig pa'i tshig dang / sgyu rtsal rig pa med pa'i tshig ni yan lag med pa'i tshig go //
translated: The word ‚Äúart‚Äù and the word ‚Äúnon-art‚Äù are the word for ‚Äúpartless.‚Äù

original: sgyu rtsal gyi tshig tu 'gyur gyi gnyis su med pa la de mi snang ngo //
analyzed: sgyu rtsal gyi tshig tu 'gyur gyi gnyis su med pa la de mi snang ngo //
translated: The word ‚Äúart‚Äù is a word for a part, but that does not appear in the nondual.

original: bsam gtan gyi tshig dang / bsam gtan med pa'i tshig ni bsam gtan pa dang / bsam gtan du bya ba dang / bsam gtan dang de gsum ni phyi'i don mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / mi mdzes par bsgom pa la snang ngo //
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi tshig dang / bsam gtan med pa'i tshig ni bsam gtan pa dang / bsam gtan du bya ba dang / bsam gtan dang de gsum ni phyi'i don mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / mi mdzes par bsgom pa la snang ngo //
translated: The word ‚Äúmeditation‚Äù and the word ‚Äúnon-meditation‚Äù appear in the meditation, the object of meditation, and the meditator, which are the impermanence, suffering, and ugliness of external objects.

original: gang gi tshe shes rab kyis dpyad de sbom po dang / phra mo gzhigs te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe shes rab kyis dpyad de sbom po dang / phra mo gzhigs te /
translated: When one analyzes with wisdom, the coarse and subtle are broken down.

original: mi dmigs pa de'i tshe mi gnyis pa bdag nyid kyis gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa de'i tshe mi gnyis pa bdag nyid kyis gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: When one does not observe them, then one abides in nonduality by oneself.
