original: nor pa'i tshig dang / nor pa ma yin pa'i tshig ni gnyis kyi rnam pa'i shes pa nor ba'i tshig ste /
analyzed: nor pa'i tshig dang / nor pa ma yin pa'i tshig ni gnyis kyi rnam pa'i shes pa nor ba'i tshig ste /
translated: The words of error and the words of nonerror are the words of error of a consciousness that has the aspect of duality.

original: de gnyis shes rab kyis dpyad pa na gnyis kyi rnam pa'i nor ba dang bral ba nor pa med pa'i tshig tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de gnyis shes rab kyis dpyad pa na gnyis kyi rnam pa'i nor ba dang bral ba nor pa med pa'i tshig tu 'gyur ro //
translated: When one analyzes those two with wisdom, one is free from the error that has the aspect of duality, and one‚Äôs words become the words of nonerror.

original: snang ba'i tshig dang / snang ba med pa'i tshig ni gzugs la sogs pa snang ba'i tshig ste /
analyzed: snang ba'i tshig dang / snang ba med pa'i tshig ni gzugs la sogs pa snang ba'i tshig ste /
translated: The words of appearance and the words of nonappearance are the words of the appearance of form and so on.

original: gzugs ni rdul phran gzhigs pa na //
analyzed: gzugs ni rdul phran gzhigs pa na //
translated: Form is broken down into atoms.

original: rdul phran cha ni med pa ste //
analyzed: rdul phran cha ni med pa ste //
translated: The atom has no parts.

original: zhes bya bas de de ltar song ste /
analyzed: zhes bya bas de de ltar song ste /
translated: Thus it goes,

original: snang ba med pa'i tshig tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: snang ba med pa'i tshig tu 'gyur ro //
translated: and one‚Äôs words become the words of nonappearance.

original: srung ba'i tshig @60b dang / bsrung ba med pa'i tshig ni 'dis bsrung bar bya ba dang / 'di srung bar mi bya ba dang / gnyis kyi rnam pa'i rnam par rtog pa las srung bar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: srung ba'i tshig @60b dang / bsrung ba med pa'i tshig ni 'dis bsrung bar bya ba dang / 'di srung bar mi bya ba dang / gnyis kyi rnam pa'i rnam par rtog pa las srung bar 'gyur gyi /
translated: The words of protection and the words of non-protection are the protection from the conceptualization of the two aspects of this and that which is to be protected and this and that which is the protector.

original: gnyis su med pa las de ldog ste /
analyzed: gnyis su med pa las de ldog ste /
translated: But from the non-dual, that is averted.

original: de bas na srung ba'i tshig ni bsrung ba med pa'i tshig tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas na srung ba'i tshig ni bsrung ba med pa'i tshig tu 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the words of protection become the words of non-protection.

original: rus kyi tshig dang / rus med pa'i tshig ces bya ba la /
analyzed: rus kyi tshig dang / rus med pa'i tshig ces bya ba la /
translated: The words of lineage and the words of no lineage are as follows.

original: rus ni rgyud yin te /
analyzed: rus ni rgyud yin te /
translated: Lineage is the continuum.

original: de yang gnyis kyi rnam pa'i shes pas 'dzin gyi gnyis su med pa la mi snang bas na rus med pa'i tshig tu yang dag par rtog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yang gnyis kyi rnam pa'i shes pas 'dzin gyi gnyis su med pa la mi snang bas na rus med pa'i tshig tu yang dag par rtog par 'gyur ro //
translated: And that is apprehended by the consciousness of the two aspects, but does not appear in the non-dual, so the words of no lineage are fully realized.

original: drang srong gi tshig dang / drang srong ma yin pa'i tshig ni pa tan dza la'i rnal 'byor la yan lag brgyad yod pa /
analyzed: drang srong gi tshig dang / drang srong ma yin pa'i tshig ni pa tan dza la'i rnal 'byor la yan lag brgyad yod pa /
translated: The words of the sage and the words of the non-sage are the eight branches of the yoga of the pƒÅramitƒÅs.

original: sdom pa dang / nges pa dang / stan dang / srog gi 'bad pa dang / phyis bsgrub pa dang / bsam gtan dang / 'dzin pa dang / ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: sdom pa dang / nges pa dang / stan dang / srog gi 'bad pa dang / phyis bsgrub pa dang / bsam gtan dang / 'dzin pa dang / ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: the vow, the certainty, the seat, the effort of the life-force, the subsequent practice, and the concentration.

original: drang srong aa gasta'i rnal 'byor yang //
analyzed: drang srong aa gasta'i rnal 'byor yang //
translated: The yoga of the sage AgastyaüîΩis the effort of the life-force, likewise concentration,üîΩthe subsequent practice, then retention,

original: srog 'bad de bzhin bsam gtan dang // phyis bsgrub de nas 'dzin pa dang // rtog ge ting 'dzin de bzhin du //
analyzed: srog 'bad de bzhin bsam gtan dang // phyis bsgrub de nas 'dzin pa dang // rtog ge ting 'dzin de bzhin du //
translated: and likewise the concentration of reasoning.

original: yan lag drug gi rnal 'byor brjod //
analyzed: yan lag drug gi rnal 'byor brjod //
translated: It is said to be the yoga of the six limbs.

original: drang srong na ka'i rnal 'byor ni //
analyzed: drang srong na ka'i rnal 'byor ni //
translated: The yoga of the sage NƒÅrada

original: 'dzum pa phye ba de bzhin du //
analyzed: 'dzum pa phye ba de bzhin du //
translated: is the opening of the smile,

original: thal mo tsam du rnam shes bya //
analyzed: thal mo tsam du rnam shes bya //
translated: and the consciousness is known as mere palms.

original: de bzhin bcu gnyis tsam po ni //
analyzed: de bzhin bcu gnyis tsam po ni //
translated: Likewise, the mere twelve

original: srog 'bad par ni mngon brjod bya //
analyzed: srog 'bad par ni mngon brjod bya //
translated: are expressed as the effort of the life-force.

original: srog 'bad bcu gnyis 'dzin pa ste //
analyzed: srog 'bad bcu gnyis 'dzin pa ste //
translated: The effort of the life-force is the twelve retentions,

original: 'dzin pa gnyis ni rnal 'byor yin //
analyzed: 'dzin pa gnyis ni rnal 'byor yin //
translated: and the two retentions are the yoga.

original: de ltar rnal 'byor ldan pa la //
analyzed: de ltar rnal 'byor ldan pa la //
translated: Thus, for one endowed with yoga,

original: dbang phyug rab tu 'grub par 'gyur //
analyzed: dbang phyug rab tu 'grub par 'gyur //
translated: mastery is fully accomplished.

original: bdag gi mchog ni gzi brjid kyis //
analyzed: bdag gi mchog ni gzi brjid kyis //
translated: By the splendor of one's supreme self,

original: de ni 'bar bar mthong ba'o //
analyzed: de ni 'bar bar mthong ba'o //
translated: that is seen as blazing.

original: de de ltar drang srong gi rigs srog gi 'bad pa la sogs pa'i dka' thub dka' bas kun tu nyon mongs par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de de ltar drang srong gi rigs srog gi 'bad pa la sogs pa'i dka' thub dka' bas kun tu nyon mongs par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Thus, the sages are tormented by the afflictions of austerities such as the striving for life.

original: 'khor ba'i rgyu ni nyon mongs pa ma yin la /
analyzed: 'khor ba'i rgyu ni nyon mongs pa ma yin la /
translated: The cause of cyclic existence is not the afflictions.

original: bdag tu zhen pa yongs su zad par byed pa'i rgyu ni bdag med pa'i rnal 'byor yin pa de dag gis mi shes te /
analyzed: bdag tu zhen pa yongs su zad par byed pa'i rgyu ni bdag med pa'i rnal 'byor yin pa de dag gis mi shes te /
translated: The cause of the complete exhaustion of the clinging to a self is the yoga of selflessness. Those sages do not know that.

original: de mi shes pas grol ba med de //
analyzed: de mi shes pas grol ba med de //
translated: Because they do not know that, they are not liberated.

original: 'khor bas na drang srong gi tshig ni drang srong ma yin pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: 'khor bas na drang srong gi tshig ni drang srong ma yin pa'i tshig go //
translated: Therefore, the words of the sages are not the words of sages.

original: ji ltar ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyal po las gsungs pa /
analyzed: ji ltar ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyal po las gsungs pa /
translated: As it is said in the King of Meditations Sutra:

original: gang dag bdag tu 'du shes gnas //
analyzed: gang dag bdag tu 'du shes gnas //
translated: Those who abide in the conception of a self

original: de dag sdug bsngal shin tu gnas //üîΩgang na sdug bsngal med pa yis //
analyzed: de dag sdug bsngal shin tu gnas // gang na sdug bsngal med pa yis //
translated: Abide in suffering.üîΩThose who do not know selflessness

original: bdag med de dag mi shes so //
analyzed: bdag med de dag mi shes so //
translated: Do not know the absence of suffering.

original: rgyal po'i srid kyi tshig dang / rgyal po'i @61a * //
analyzed: rgyal po'i srid kyi tshig dang / rgyal po'i @61a * //
translated: The words of the king of the Dharma

original: srid ma yin pa'i tshig ni rtag pa dang / bdag dang / bde ba dang / mdzes pa'i dngos po phyin ci log bas dbang phyug 'dod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: srid ma yin pa'i tshig ni rtag pa dang / bdag dang / bde ba dang / mdzes pa'i dngos po phyin ci log bas dbang phyug 'dod par 'gyur ro //
translated: The words of sovereignty are the words of non-sovereignty, because of the inverted perception of permanence, self, happiness, and beauty.

original: shes rab kyis dpyad de mi rtag pa dang / bdag med pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / mdzes pa ma yin pa dang / stong par shes pa na rgyal po'i srid kyi tshig ni rgyal po'i srid ma yin pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: shes rab kyis dpyad de mi rtag pa dang / bdag med pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / mdzes pa ma yin pa dang / stong par shes pa na rgyal po'i srid kyi tshig ni rgyal po'i srid ma yin pa'i tshig go //
translated: When one examines with wisdom and knows impermanence, selflessness, suffering, ugliness, and emptiness, the words of sovereignty are the words of non-sovereignty.

original: skye ba dang / 'chi ba dang / mngal du gnas pa dang / ngan 'gror 'gro ba la sogs pa'i gnod pa thams cad la skyob bar 'gyur ba yang rgyal po'i srid kyi tshig ni rgyal po'i srid ma yin pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: skye ba dang / 'chi ba dang / mngal du gnas pa dang / ngan 'gror 'gro ba la sogs pa'i gnod pa thams cad la skyob bar 'gyur ba yang rgyal po'i srid kyi tshig ni rgyal po'i srid ma yin pa'i tshig go //
translated: The words of sovereignty are the words of non-sovereignty, because they protect from all harms such as birth, death, dwelling in the womb, going to lower realms, and so on.

original: gsung ba'i tshig dang / gzung ba med pa'i tshig ni shes pa 'di sa chud par byed de /
analyzed: gsung ba'i tshig dang / gzung ba med pa'i tshig ni shes pa 'di sa chud par byed de /
translated: The words of speech and the words of non-apprehension are the words that cause this knowledge to be attained.

original: rtogs par byed 'dzin par skyed pas na gzung ba'i tshig go //
analyzed: rtogs par byed 'dzin par skyed pas na gzung ba'i tshig go //
translated: The words of apprehension are the words that cause realization and generation of apprehension.

original: ji ltar 'phags pa btsun gtso byams pas gsungs pa /
analyzed: ji ltar 'phags pa btsun gtso byams pas gsungs pa /
translated: As the noble Maitreya has said:

original: bdag dang sems can don rnams shes //
analyzed: bdag dang sems can don rnams shes //
translated: Knowing the aims of self and other,

original: snang ba rab tu skye ba ni //
analyzed: snang ba rab tu skye ba ni //
translated: the light of wisdom arises.

original: rnam shes de yang don med de //
analyzed: rnam shes de yang don med de //
translated: Consciousness also is without object,

original: de med pas na de yang med //
analyzed: de med pas na de yang med //
translated: and because that does not exist, it also does not exist.

original: ces byas bas na gzung ba med pa'i phyir gzung ba'i tshig ni gzung ba med pa'i tshig ste /
analyzed: ces byas bas na gzung ba med pa'i phyir gzung ba'i tshig ni gzung ba med pa'i tshig ste /
translated: Thus, because there is no object, the word ‚Äúobject‚Äù is the word ‚Äúnon-object.‚Äù

original: 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin gyis stong par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin gyis stong par 'gyur ro //
translated: It is empty of the nature of the apprehender.

original: rin po che'i tshig dang / rin po che med pa'i tshig ni mdzes pa'i rnam par rin po che brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: rin po che'i tshig dang / rin po che med pa'i tshig ni mdzes pa'i rnam par rin po che brjod pa yin te /
translated: The word ‚Äújewel‚Äù and the word ‚Äúnon-jewel‚Äù are the expression of a jewel in a beautiful form.

original: de yang las rnam pa sna tshogs las skyes pa gnyis kyi rnam pa'i shes pas snang gi /
analyzed: de yang las rnam pa sna tshogs las skyes pa gnyis kyi rnam pa'i shes pas snang gi /
translated: Moreover, it appears to the consciousness that has the aspect of the two that arises from various kinds of karma.

original: gnyis su med pa'i don dam pa'i bden pa yang dag par rig pa la ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gnyis su med pa'i don dam pa'i bden pa yang dag par rig pa la ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not the nondual ultimate truth that is known correctly.

original: des na rin po che'i tshig ni rin po che ma yin pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: des na rin po che'i tshig ni rin po che ma yin pa'i tshig go //
translated: Therefore, the word ‚Äújewel‚Äù is the word ‚Äúnon-jewel.‚Äù

original: lung bstan pa'i tshig dang / lung bstan pa med pa'i tshig ni 'di rnams kyis lung ston par byed pas na tshig gi lung ston pa'o //
analyzed: lung bstan pa'i tshig dang / lung bstan pa med pa'i tshig ni 'di rnams kyis lung ston par byed pas na tshig gi lung ston pa'o //
translated: The words of prediction and the words of non-prediction are the words of prediction because they cause prediction.

original: gzugs kyi bung po med pas na de yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gzugs kyi bung po med pas na de yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: The mass of form does not exist, and that also does not exist.

original: des na lung bstan pa'i tshig ni lung bstan pa med pa'i tshig go //üîΩ'dod chen pa'i tshig dang / 'dod chen pa med pa'i tshig ni longs spyod kyis mngon pa'i nga rgyal bskyed cing /
analyzed: des na lung bstan pa'i tshig ni lung bstan pa med pa'i tshig go // 'dod chen pa'i tshig dang / 'dod chen pa med pa'i tshig ni longs spyod kyis mngon pa'i nga rgyal bskyed cing /
translated: Therefore, the words of prediction are the words of non-prediction.üîΩThe words of great desire and the words of non-great desire are the words of great desire because they generate pride through enjoyment,

original: lhag pa la sogs pas na 'dod chen pa'i tshig ni 'dod chen pa med pa'i tshig ste /
analyzed: lhag pa la sogs pas na 'dod chen pa'i tshig ni 'dod chen pa med pa'i tshig ste /
translated: and the words of non-great desire are the words of great desire.

original: ji ltar 'di nyid du gsungs pa /
analyzed: ji ltar 'di nyid du gsungs pa /
translated: As it is said here:

original: longs spyod la mos pa ni gnyis kyi rnam par shes pa la snang gi / gnyis su med cing bsam pa med pa snang ba med pa'i don dam pa'i bden pa yang dag par rig pa la ni @61b ma yin te /
analyzed: longs spyod la mos pa ni gnyis kyi rnam par shes pa la snang gi / gnyis su med cing bsam pa med pa snang ba med pa'i don dam pa'i bden pa yang dag par rig pa la ni @61b ma yin te /
translated: The one who is devoted to enjoyment appears in the consciousness of two, but not in the ultimate truth that is non-dual, non-conceptual, and free from appearance, which is to be known correctly.

original: lhag ma ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: lhag ma ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The rest is as before.

original: pho smos dang / ma ning gi tshig dang / pho smos dang / ma ning med pa'i tshig ces bya ba ni phyi'i don yod na ni pho smos dang / ma ning gi tshig tu rnam par rtag par yang 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: pho smos dang / ma ning gi tshig dang / pho smos dang / ma ning med pa'i tshig ces bya ba ni phyi'i don yod na ni pho smos dang / ma ning gi tshig tu rnam par rtag par yang 'gyur gyi /
translated: The terms ‚Äúmasculine‚Äù and ‚Äúneuter‚Äù and the terms ‚Äúwithout masculine and neuter‚Äù are used when external objects exist.

original: gang gi tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe /
translated: But when

original: gzugs ni rdul phran gzhigs pa na //
analyzed: gzugs ni rdul phran gzhigs pa na //
translated: form is analyzed into atoms,

original: rdul phran cha ni med pa ste //
analyzed: rdul phran cha ni med pa ste //
translated: atoms are without parts.

original: zhes bya bas phyi'i don med par 'gyur bas de'i tshe pho smos dang ma ning gi tshig ni pho smos dang ma ning med pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: zhes bya bas phyi'i don med par 'gyur bas de'i tshe pho smos dang ma ning gi tshig ni pho smos dang ma ning med pa'i tshig go //
translated: Since external objects do not exist, then the terms ‚Äúmasculine‚Äù and ‚Äúneuter‚Äù are terms ‚Äúwithout masculine and neuter.‚Äù

original: bro ba'i tshig dang / bro ba med pa'i tshig ni /
analyzed: bro ba'i tshig dang / bro ba med pa'i tshig ni /
translated: The terms ‚Äútaste‚Äù and ‚Äúwithout taste‚Äù are used

original: rlom sems dpa' bo bzhin byad ngan //
analyzed: rlom sems dpa' bo bzhin byad ngan //
translated: when the mind is like a conceited hero,

original: gtum po rtsed mo 'jigs byed rnams //
analyzed: gtum po rtsed mo 'jigs byed rnams //
translated: a villain, a cruel one, a frightening one,

original: snying rje rmad byung zhi ba yang //üîΩgar gyi bro ni dgu zhes bya //
analyzed: snying rje rmad byung zhi ba yang // gar gyi bro ni dgu zhes bya //
translated: a compassionate one, a marvelous one, a peaceful one,üîΩand a dancing one.

original: kha cig la ni bro rnam pa brgyad de /
analyzed: kha cig la ni bro rnam pa brgyad de /
translated: Some say that there are eight kinds of dance:

original: zhi ba ni thog ma dang / tha mar gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: zhi ba ni thog ma dang / tha mar gnas pa yin te /
translated: peaceful, at the beginning and at the end;

original: zhi ba nyid las 'gyur ba'i rim pa dang / rlom sems la sogs pa'i bro 'byung ngo //
analyzed: zhi ba nyid las 'gyur ba'i rim pa dang / rlom sems la sogs pa'i bro 'byung ngo //
translated: The sequence of changes from peacefulness, and the arising of the humors such as arrogance,

original: dngos po thams cad kho na las //
analyzed: dngos po thams cad kho na las //
translated: are from the very same things

original: gang gis gzugs ni mang 'gyur ba //
analyzed: gang gis gzugs ni mang 'gyur ba //
translated: from which the many forms arise.

original: de ni bro la gnas par bsam //
analyzed: de ni bro la gnas par bsam //
translated: One should think that they abide in the humors,

original: lhag ma 'pho bar 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: lhag ma 'pho bar 'dod pa'o //
translated: and the rest in the desire for transference.üîΩTransference, sadness, sickness,üîΩcruelty, intoxication, laziness,üîΩcruelty of mind, delusion,

original: 'pho ba skyo ba na ba dang // brtse med rgyags gnas le lo dang // brtse ba'i sems dang gti mug dang // dran pa myos la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'pho ba skyo ba na ba dang // brtse med rgyags gnas le lo dang // brtse ba'i sems dang gti mug dang // dran pa myos la sogs pa'o //
translated: memory, intoxication, and so on.

original: rlom sems la sogs pa'i rgyur bsam pa ni 'gyur ba'i gnas thob pa ste /
analyzed: rlom sems la sogs pa'i rgyur bsam pa ni 'gyur ba'i gnas thob pa ste /
translated: The thought of the cause of arrogance and so on is the attainment of the state of change.üîΩLaughter, joy, sorrow,

original: dgod pa dga' ba mya ngan dang // khro ba spro ba de bzhin 'jigs //
analyzed: dgod pa dga' ba mya ngan dang // khro ba spro ba de bzhin 'jigs //
translated: anger, delight, and likewise fear,

original: rmad dang ya mtshan zhes pa ni //
analyzed: rmad dang ya mtshan zhes pa ni //
translated: wonder, and amazement

original: gnas pa'i dngos po bsgrags pa'o //
analyzed: gnas pa'i dngos po bsgrags pa'o //
translated: are proclaimed to be the things of abiding.

original: 'dir rnal 'byor gyis dpyad ba rtsom bas na bro ba'i dngos po dpyad ba de 'dir spor bar mi bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir rnal 'byor gyis dpyad ba rtsom bas na bro ba'i dngos po dpyad ba de 'dir spor bar mi bya ste /
translated: Here, since the yogi begins the analysis, that analysis of the things of the humors is not to be applied here.

original: rgya cher ni ba ra ta'i gtsug lag las rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rgya cher ni ba ra ta'i gtsug lag las rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be known in detail from the VƒÅrƒÅhi Tantra.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: thams cad mkhyen pa 'dod chags dang bral ba mchog tu yongs su dag cing /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa 'dod chags dang bral ba mchog tu yongs su dag cing /
translated: The one who is omniscient, free from attachment, supremely pure,

original: tshig gi dbang po rnal 'byor la mnga' dbang brnyes pas gzhan gyi don du thugs rje can gyi spong ba'i char gsungs par mdzad do //
analyzed: tshig gi dbang po rnal 'byor la mnga' dbang brnyes pas gzhan gyi don du thugs rje can gyi spong ba'i char gsungs par mdzad do //
translated: and has attained mastery over the faculty of speech, for the sake of others, the compassionate one, has taught this as the Dharma of renunciation.

original: rtag pa dang / bdag dang / bde ba dang / gtsang ba'i dngos por phyin ci log pa rnams kyis rlom sems la sogs par 'gyur ba'i phyi'i don med par yongs su shes pas gang chags par 'gyur ba dang / gang du chags par 'gyur ba dang /üîΩgang gis chags par 'gyur ba'i chos des de @62a * //
analyzed: rtag pa dang / bdag dang / bde ba dang / gtsang ba'i dngos por phyin ci log pa rnams kyis rlom sems la sogs par 'gyur ba'i phyi'i don med par yongs su shes pas gang chags par 'gyur ba dang / gang du chags par 'gyur ba dang / gang gis chags par 'gyur ba'i chos des de @62a * //
translated: Those who are mistaken about permanence, self, pleasure, and purity, due to the absence of external objects, completely understand conceit, etc.,

original: kun tu mi mthong ste /
analyzed: kun tu mi mthong ste /
translated: and do not see any phenomenon by which one would become attached, to which one would become attached,üîΩor through which one would become attached.

original: de bas na bro ba'i tshig ni srong med pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: de bas na bro ba'i tshig ni srong med pa'i tshig go //
translated: Therefore, the word ‚Äútaste‚Äù is a word without meaning.

original: gzhan yang 'o ma dang bu ram la sogs pa myong ba phyi'i don med par rmi lam tshor ba bzhin pas na gnyis kyi rnam pa thams cad ni gnyis su med pa don dam pa'i bden pa yang dag par rig pa la mi 'jug pas bro ba medüîΩpa'i tshig go //
analyzed: gzhan yang 'o ma dang bu ram la sogs pa myong ba phyi'i don med par rmi lam tshor ba bzhin pas na gnyis kyi rnam pa thams cad ni gnyis su med pa don dam pa'i bden pa yang dag par rig pa la mi 'jug pas bro ba med pa'i tshig go //
translated: Moreover, since the experience of milk, molasses, and so on, like the sensations in a dream, are not external objects, all aspects of duality do not engage with the ultimate truth, which is nondual and perfectly cognized. Therefore, it is the word of no taste.

original: byed pa'i tshig dang / byed pa med pa'i tshig ni /
analyzed: byed pa'i tshig dang / byed pa med pa'i tshig ni /
translated: The word of action and the word of non-action are as follows:

original: 'dus byas thams cad skad cig pa //
analyzed: 'dus byas thams cad skad cig pa //
translated: All conditioned things are momentary.üîΩHow can the impermanent be an agent?

original: mi brtan byed pa ga la zhig / gang byung byed pa de nyid de //üîΩbyed pa por yang de nyid brjod //
analyzed: mi brtan byed pa ga la zhig / gang byung byed pa de nyid de // byed pa por yang de nyid brjod //
translated: That which arises is the very agent.

original: ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: ces bya ba ste /
translated: It is also called the agent.

original: byed pa po dang byed pa por tha dad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: byed pa po dang byed pa por tha dad pa ma yin te /
translated: The agent and the action are not different.

original: skad cig pa'i tshig gi don byung ma thag tu 'jig pas ni byed pa po de'i byed pa lta ga la yod pas des na byed pa'i tshig ni byed pa med pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: skad cig pa'i tshig gi don byung ma thag tu 'jig pas ni byed pa po de'i byed pa lta ga la yod pas des na byed pa'i tshig ni byed pa med pa'i tshig go //
translated: How can the momentary object of meaning, which disintegrates as soon as it arises, be the agent's action? Therefore, the word of action is the word of non-action.

original: rgyu'i tshig dang / rgyu med pa'i tshig ces bya ba la /
analyzed: rgyu'i tshig dang / rgyu med pa'i tshig ces bya ba la /
translated: The word of cause and the word of no cause are as follows:

original: rgyu ni byed pa po ste /
analyzed: rgyu ni byed pa po ste /
translated: The cause is the agent.

original: gang gi dus na rgyu yod pa de'i dus na /
analyzed: gang gi dus na rgyu yod pa de'i dus na /
translated: At the time when the cause exists,üîΩthe effect does not exist.

original: 'bras bu med pa de'i skad cig pa ni zhig pa dang ma zhig pa gang dang yang mi 'bral te /
analyzed: 'bras bu med pa de'i skad cig pa ni zhig pa dang ma zhig pa gang dang yang mi 'bral te /
translated: That moment is not separated from either the disintegration or non-disintegration of the effect.

original: bya ba med pas ni snga ma'i 'og tu 'di yod na 'di yod par 'gyur zhes rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba 'ba' zhig ste /
analyzed: bya ba med pas ni snga ma'i 'og tu 'di yod na 'di yod par 'gyur zhes rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba 'ba' zhig ste /
translated: Since there is no action, it is said that ‚Äúif this exists, that comes into being,‚Äù which is dependent origination alone.

original: des na rgyu'i tshig ni rgyu med pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: des na rgyu'i tshig ni rgyu med pa'i tshig go //
translated: Therefore, the word ‚Äúcause‚Äù is the word ‚Äúnon-cause.‚Äù

original: lus kyi tshig dang / lus med pa'i tshig ni phyi'i don du sgro btags pa de lus su kun tu rtog pa ste /
analyzed: lus kyi tshig dang / lus med pa'i tshig ni phyi'i don du sgro btags pa de lus su kun tu rtog pa ste /
translated: The word ‚Äúbody‚Äù and the word ‚Äúnon-body‚Äù are the superimposition of external objects, which is the conception of a body.

original: gzugs ni rdul phran gzhigs pa na //
analyzed: gzugs ni rdul phran gzhigs pa na //
translated: Form is analyzed into atoms.

original: rdul phran cha ni med pa ste //
analyzed: rdul phran cha ni med pa ste //
translated: Atoms are partless.

original: zhes bya bas phyi'i don sngar sun phyung ba bzhin du /
analyzed: zhes bya bas phyi'i don sngar sun phyung ba bzhin du /
translated: Thus, just as external objects were refuted earlier,

original: phyi'i don med pas na lus kyi tshig ni lus med pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: phyi'i don med pas na lus kyi tshig ni lus med pa'i tshig go //
translated: since external objects do not exist, the word ‚Äúbody‚Äù is the word ‚Äúnon-body.‚Äù

original: rtog ge'i tshig dang / rtog ge med pa'i tshig ces bya ba la rtog gi ni tshad ma dang gzhal ba ste /
analyzed: rtog ge'i tshig dang / rtog ge med pa'i tshig ces bya ba la rtog gi ni tshad ma dang gzhal ba ste /
translated: The word ‚Äúlogic‚Äù and the word ‚Äúnon-logic‚Äù are logic and the object of logic.

original: de yang gnyis kyi rnam pa'i rnam par shes pa las 'byung ba rmi lam dang / mig 'phrul la sogs pa bzhin du don dam par yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang gnyis kyi rnam pa'i rnam par shes pa las 'byung ba rmi lam dang / mig 'phrul la sogs pa bzhin du don dam par yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Moreover, like dreams, illusions, and so on, they do not exist ultimately, but arise from consciousness in the aspect of duality.

original: gang ne yi ya yi ka la sogs pas tshig gi don bcu drug dang / drug dang / nyid du lnga dang / yod par 'gyur ba rnam pa bdun dang / tha dad pa dang / tha dad pa ma yin pa dang / spyi dang byad par du kun tu brtags pas tshad ma dang gzhal ba la sogs pa ni phyi'i don med pas shes rab kyis dpyad pa ni phung por mi gnas 'jig pa nyid kyi phyir stong pa yin no //
analyzed: gang ne yi ya yi ka la sogs pas tshig gi don bcu drug dang / drug dang / nyid du lnga dang / yod par 'gyur ba rnam pa bdun dang / tha dad pa dang / tha dad pa ma yin pa dang / spyi dang byad par du kun tu brtags pas tshad ma dang gzhal ba la sogs pa ni phyi'i don med pas shes rab kyis dpyad pa ni phung por mi gnas 'jig pa nyid kyi phyir stong pa yin no //
translated: The sixteen categories of the Vai≈õe·π£ikas, the six categories of the NaiyƒÅyikas, the five categories of the Samkhyas, the seven categories of the CƒÅrvƒÅkas, and the categories of sameness and difference imagined by the Jains‚Äîall these, being devoid of external objects, are empty, because they are not established when examined by wisdom, and because they are destroyed.

original: phyi rol gyi phung por gnas pa sbom po dang phra mo @62b rnam par gzhigs pa na khyim dang / sde dang nags tshal la sogs pa bzhin du stong par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi phung por gnas pa sbom po dang phra mo @62b rnam par gzhigs pa na khyim dang / sde dang nags tshal la sogs pa bzhin du stong par 'gyur ro //
translated: When the external aggregates are analyzed into coarse and subtle parts, they become empty, like a house, an army, a forest, and so on.

original: rtag pa ni ma skyes pas na ri bong gi rva ltar dngos po med do //
analyzed: rtag pa ni ma skyes pas na ri bong gi rva ltar dngos po med do //
translated: Since the permanent is unarisen, it is non-existent like the horn of a rabbit.

original: des na rtag pa dang / bdag dang phyi'i don du kun tu brtags pa'i mu stegs can gyi rtog ge'i tshig ni rtog ge med pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: des na rtag pa dang / bdag dang phyi'i don du kun tu brtags pa'i mu stegs can gyi rtog ge'i tshig ni rtog ge med pa'i tshig go //
translated: Therefore, the words of the tƒ´rthika‚Äôs logic that imagine permanence, a self, and external objects are words without logic.

original: g-yo ba'i tshig dang / g-yo ba med pa'i tshig ni skye ba dang / 'gog pa la sogs pa kun tu rtog pa gnyis kyi rnam pa'i shes pa la 'gyur gyi mi gnyis pa bsam pa med cing snang ba med pa don dam pa'i bden pa yang dag par rig pa /
analyzed: g-yo ba'i tshig dang / g-yo ba med pa'i tshig ni skye ba dang / 'gog pa la sogs pa kun tu rtog pa gnyis kyi rnam pa'i shes pa la 'gyur gyi mi gnyis pa bsam pa med cing snang ba med pa don dam pa'i bden pa yang dag par rig pa /
translated: The words of movement and the words of non-movement are the consciousnesses that have the aspect of the two imaginations of arising, cessation, and so on. The ultimate truth, which is not imagined, is not an object of the mind and is not an appearance.

original: dngos po dang dngos po med par rnam par rtog pa la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med par rnam par rtog pa la ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not an object of the imagination of things and non-things.

original: dbang po'i tshig dang / dbang po med pa'i tshig ni lus la sogs pa'i tshig ste /
analyzed: dbang po'i tshig dang / dbang po med pa'i tshig ni lus la sogs pa'i tshig ste /
translated: The words of the sense faculties and the words of the absence of sense faculties are the words of the body and so on.

original: lus dang dbang po la sogs pa'i tshig gi bshad pa ni phyi'i don sun dbyung ba bzhin no //
analyzed: lus dang dbang po la sogs pa'i tshig gi bshad pa ni phyi'i don sun dbyung ba bzhin no //
translated: The explanation of the words of the body, sense faculties, and so on is like the refutation of external objects.

original: ring po la sogs pa'i dbyibs med pas na /
analyzed: ring po la sogs pa'i dbyibs med pas na /
translated: Since there is no shape such as long and so on,

original: de bzlog pa'i don du rnam pa mang po bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: de bzlog pa'i don du rnam pa mang po bshad pa yin te /
translated: For the sake of countering that, many aspects have been explained.

original: lang kar gshegs pa 'phags ma shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang 'dra bar dam pa'i chos thams cad 'grel ba yin pas na thams cad mkhyen pa'i gsung der lhag chad kyi skyon du mi 'gyur bar bsam mo //
analyzed: lang kar gshegs pa 'phags ma shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang 'dra bar dam pa'i chos thams cad 'grel ba yin pas na thams cad mkhyen pa'i gsung der lhag chad kyi skyon du mi 'gyur bar bsam mo //
translated: The La·πÖkƒÅvatƒÅra is similar to the noble Perfection of Wisdom, since it explains all of the excellent teachings. Therefore, one should think that the speech of the Omniscient One is not faulty in terms of additions or omissions in that s≈´tra.

original: 'dus byas kyi tshig dang / 'dus byas med pa'i tshig ni rgyu dang rkyen gyis byas pa ni 'dus byas so //
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi tshig dang / 'dus byas med pa'i tshig ni rgyu dang rkyen gyis byas pa ni 'dus byas so //
translated: The words ‚Äúconditioned‚Äù and ‚Äúunconditioned‚Äù are as follows: that which is made by causes and conditions is conditioned.

original: 'dus ma byas pa ni dngos po med pa'o //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas pa ni dngos po med pa'o //
translated: The unconditioned is a non-thing.

original: kha cig gis 'chad pa ni chud pa gnyis kyi rnam pas stong zhing yongs su dag pa ni 'dus ma byas pa nyid do //
analyzed: kha cig gis 'chad pa ni chud pa gnyis kyi rnam pas stong zhing yongs su dag pa ni 'dus ma byas pa nyid do //
translated: Some explain that it is completely pure, empty of the two extremes, and unconditioned.

original: ji ltar dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa las 'byung ba /
analyzed: ji ltar dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa las 'byung ba /
translated: As it says in the S≈´tra Unravelling the Intended Meaning:

original: rigs kyi bu 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas zhes bya ba 'di ni ston pas btags pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas zhes bya ba 'di ni ston pas btags pa'i tshig go //
translated: ‚ÄúSon of noble family, ‚Äòconditioned‚Äô and ‚Äòunconditioned‚Äô are terms designated by the Teacher.

original: skad cig pa ni 'dus byas so //
analyzed: skad cig pa ni 'dus byas so //
translated: The momentary is conditioned.

original: rgyun du 'grel pa ni 'dus ma byas so //
analyzed: rgyun du 'grel pa ni 'dus ma byas so //
translated: The commentary always says that it is uncompounded.

original: 'di ni sus kyang mi bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ni sus kyang mi bya ste /
translated: No one makes it.

original: chos kyi chos nyid de yongs su gyur pa'o zhes rgya cher ro //
analyzed: chos kyi chos nyid de yongs su gyur pa'o zhes rgya cher ro //
translated: It is the dharmata of dharmas, the transformation.

original: 'dir 'dus ma byas kyi tshig 'di 'dzin pa dang / gzung ba dang bral ba'i stong ba don dam pa bden pa mi gnyis pa yang dag bar rig pa la dgongs par rtog go //
analyzed: 'dir 'dus ma byas kyi tshig 'di 'dzin pa dang / gzung ba dang bral ba'i stong ba don dam pa bden pa mi gnyis pa yang dag bar rig pa la dgongs par rtog go //
translated: Here, the word uncompounded is understood to refer to the ultimate truth, the emptiness free from the apprehended and apprehender, the nondual perfect knowledge.

original: rgyu dang rkyen gyis byas pa rnam pa sna tshogs kyi rnam pa ni rmi lam dang / mig 'phrul la sogs pa skye ba bzhin du skye @63a * //
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen gyis byas pa rnam pa sna tshogs kyi rnam pa ni rmi lam dang / mig 'phrul la sogs pa skye ba bzhin du skye @63a * //
translated: The various aspects produced by causes and conditions are like dreams, illusions, and so on, which are produced without any nature.

original: ba'i rang bzhin med bas na yongs su grub pa yang dag par rig pa'i rang bzhin 'ba' zhig la gnod pa med do //
analyzed: ba'i rang bzhin med bas na yongs su grub pa yang dag par rig pa'i rang bzhin 'ba' zhig la gnod pa med do //
translated: Therefore, the perfect nature, which is the nature of the perfect knowledge, is not harmed at all.

original: 'phags ma shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bdun brgya ba bshad pa dang / dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa bshad pa'i rtsod pa'i gnas su bdag gis zhib tu bshad kyis 'dir yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'phags ma shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bdun brgya ba bshad pa dang / dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa bshad pa'i rtsod pa'i gnas su bdag gis zhib tu bshad kyis 'dir yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: I have explained this in detail in the commentary on the noble Perfection of Wisdom in Seven Hundred Lines and in the commentary on the Unraveling the Intent S≈´tra, and I will apply it here as well.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i tshig dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu med pa'i tshig ces bya ba la /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i tshig dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu med pa'i tshig ces bya ba la /
translated: The words ‚Äúcause and effect‚Äù and ‚Äúno cause and effect‚Äù are as follows.

original: rgyu ni byed pa ste /
analyzed: rgyu ni byed pa ste /
translated: A cause is an agent.

original: gang gi tshe na 'bras bu yod pa de'i tshe na rgyu med do //
analyzed: gang gi tshe na 'bras bu yod pa de'i tshe na rgyu med do //
translated: When an effect exists, there is no cause.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: skad cig pa gcig ni thog ma dang / tha ma'i skad cig pa dang mi 'brel ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: skad cig pa gcig ni thog ma dang / tha ma'i skad cig pa dang mi 'brel ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because a single moment is not related to a beginning or an end.

original: snga ma'i 'og tu 'di yod pas 'di yod par 'gyur ro zhes rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba 'ba' zhig go //
analyzed: snga ma'i 'og tu 'di yod pas 'di yod par 'gyur ro zhes rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba 'ba' zhig go //
translated: Since this exists after that, this will come into being is only dependent origination.

original: des na phyed pa dang byed pa por 'brel par gzhan gyis kun brtags pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bu'i tshig ni rgyu dang 'bras bu med pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: des na phyed pa dang byed pa por 'brel par gzhan gyis kun brtags pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bu'i tshig ni rgyu dang 'bras bu med pa'i tshig go //
translated: Therefore the words ‚Äúcause and effect‚Äù imputed by others as related to an agent and an action are the words ‚Äúno cause and effect.‚Äù

original: 'og ma'i tshig dang / 'og min gyi tshig ces bya ba la /
analyzed: 'og ma'i tshig dang / 'og min gyi tshig ces bya ba la /
translated: The words ‚Äúlower‚Äù and ‚ÄúAkanistha‚Äù are used.

original: 'og ma'i tshig ni 'khor bar gnas pa na'o //
analyzed: 'og ma'i tshig ni 'khor bar gnas pa na'o //
translated: The words ‚Äúlower‚Äù are used when one is dwelling in samsara.

original: yang rnal 'byor bsgom pa na mchog tu phyin nas mchog ni 'og min gyi tshig go //
analyzed: yang rnal 'byor bsgom pa na mchog tu phyin nas mchog ni 'og min gyi tshig go //
translated: But when one has reached the highest stage of meditation, the highest is called the words ‚ÄúAkanistha‚Äù.

original: dus kyi tshig dang / dus med pa'i tshig ni phyi'i don yod na ni grang pa dang dro ba la sogs pa'i byad par gyi dus kyi tshig kyang kun tu brtags na phyi'i don med pas dus kyi tshig ni dus med pa'i tshig yin no //
analyzed: dus kyi tshig dang / dus med pa'i tshig ni phyi'i don yod na ni grang pa dang dro ba la sogs pa'i byad par gyi dus kyi tshig kyang kun tu brtags na phyi'i don med pas dus kyi tshig ni dus med pa'i tshig yin no //
translated: The words ‚Äútime‚Äù and ‚Äúnon-time‚Äù are used. If external objects exist, there are the words ‚Äútime‚Äù in terms of cold, heat, etc. But when one examines them, there are no external objects, so the words ‚Äútime‚Äù are the words ‚Äúnon-time‚Äù.

original: gang gi tshe shes rab kyis dpyad de /
analyzed: gang gi tshe shes rab kyis dpyad de /
translated: When one examines with wisdom

original: sbom po dang / phra ba rnam par gzhigs pa na /
analyzed: sbom po dang / phra ba rnam par gzhigs pa na /
translated: and analyzes the coarse and the subtle,

original: khang pa dang / sde dang / nags tshal la sogs pa mi dmigs pa de'i tshe sngar bshad pa bzhin du thams cad gnyis su med pa dang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: khang pa dang / sde dang / nags tshal la sogs pa mi dmigs pa de'i tshe sngar bshad pa bzhin du thams cad gnyis su med pa dang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: then one does not observe houses, villages, forests, etc. At that time, as explained above, one should apply everything to non-duality.

original: shing dang shing gel ba dang / lcug ma gyes pa'i tshig dang / shing dang / shing gel ba dang / lcug ma gyes pa med pa'i tshig ni rab tu rmongs pa rnams kyis de lta bur snang ba tsam la phyi'i don du kun tu rtog par byed de /üîΩde dag la rmi lam gyi dus na yang shing dang yang /
analyzed: shing dang shing gel ba dang / lcug ma gyes pa'i tshig dang / shing dang / shing gel ba dang / lcug ma gyes pa med pa'i tshig ni rab tu rmongs pa rnams kyis de lta bur snang ba tsam la phyi'i don du kun tu rtog par byed de / de dag la rmi lam gyi dus na yang shing dang yang /
translated: The words ‚Äútree,‚Äù ‚Äúshrub,‚Äù and ‚Äúvine‚Äù and the words ‚Äúno tree,‚Äù ‚Äúno shrub,‚Äù and ‚Äúno vine‚Äù are mere appearances to the confused, who imagine external objects.üîΩEven in dreams, the words ‚Äútree,‚Äù ‚Äúshrub,‚Äù and ‚Äúvine‚Äù appear.

original: shing gel pa dang / lcug ma gyes pa'i tshig snang ba de bzhin du rmi lam med pa'i dus na yang phyi'i don du kun tu rtog pa na /
analyzed: shing gel pa dang / lcug ma gyes pa'i tshig snang ba de bzhin du rmi lam med pa'i dus na yang phyi'i don du kun tu rtog pa na /
translated: In the same way, when one imagines external objects in the waking state,

original: gzugs ni rdul phran gzhigs pa na //
analyzed: gzugs ni rdul phran gzhigs pa na //
translated: Form is analyzed into atoms.

original: rdul phran cha ni med pa ste //
analyzed: rdul phran cha ni med pa ste //
translated: Atoms are analyzed into parts.

original: phyi yi dngos po med par yang //
analyzed: phyi yi dngos po med par yang //
translated: Even though external things do not exist,

original: sems ni rnam pa gnyis su snang //üîΩ@63b zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sems ni rnam pa gnyis su snang //üîΩ@63b zhes bya ste /
translated: The mind appears as two things.

original: des na shing dang / shing gel pa dang / lcug ma gyes pa'i tshig ni shing dang / shing gel ba dang / lcug ma gyes pa med pa'i tshig ste gang gi tshe na shes rab kyis dpyad de /
analyzed: des na shing dang / shing gel pa dang / lcug ma gyes pa'i tshig ni shing dang / shing gel ba dang / lcug ma gyes pa med pa'i tshig ste gang gi tshe na shes rab kyis dpyad de /
translated: Therefore, the words ‚Äútree,‚Äù ‚Äúshrub,‚Äù and ‚Äúvine‚Äù are the words for ‚Äúno tree,‚Äù ‚Äúno shrub,‚Äù and ‚Äúno vine.‚Äù When one analyzes with wisdom,

original: ci yang mi snang zhing mi dmigs pa de'i tshe don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis pa yang dag par rig pa nyid gnyis pa yang dag par rig pa nyid gnas so //
analyzed: ci yang mi snang zhing mi dmigs pa de'i tshe don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis pa yang dag par rig pa nyid gnyis pa yang dag par rig pa nyid gnas so //
translated: nothing appears and nothing is observed. At that time, the ultimate truth, non-duality, and right knowledge itself abide.

original: sna tshogs kyi tshig dang sna tshogs med pa'i tshig ces bya ba la /
analyzed: sna tshogs kyi tshig dang sna tshogs med pa'i tshig ces bya ba la /
translated: The words ‚Äúvariety‚Äù and ‚Äúnon-variety‚Äù are as follows:

original: sna tshogs ni gang gzhan gyi dbang nye bar skye ba ste /
analyzed: sna tshogs ni gang gzhan gyi dbang nye bar skye ba ste /
translated: Variety is what arises from other things.

original: de gnyis kyi rnam 'don dam par skye pa'i rang bzhin med pas na rmi lam dang / mig 'phrul la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: de gnyis kyi rnam 'don dam par skye pa'i rang bzhin med pas na rmi lam dang / mig 'phrul la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: Since those two do not have the nature of arising, they are like dreams, illusions, and so on.

original: ji ltar slob dpon dharma k'irtis smras pa /
analyzed: ji ltar slob dpon dharma k'irtis smras pa /
translated: As Master Dharmika Kirti said:

original: dngos po gang gis brtag bya ba //
analyzed: dngos po gang gis brtag bya ba //
translated: The thing by which one is to be examined

original: yang dag de ni gzugs med de //
analyzed: yang dag de ni gzugs med de //
translated: Is not real and is formless.

original: gang phyir gcig dang du mar ni //
analyzed: gang phyir gcig dang du mar ni //
translated: Because it is neither one nor many,

original: de dag gzugs ni yod ma yin //
analyzed: de dag gzugs ni yod ma yin //
translated: Their form does not exist.

original: gang gi tshe na shes rab kyis shes par bya ba sbom po dang / phra mo rnam par gzhigs te cung zad kyang mi dmigs pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe na shes rab kyis shes par bya ba sbom po dang / phra mo rnam par gzhigs te cung zad kyang mi dmigs pa de'i tshe /
translated: When the objects of knowledge, coarse and subtle, are analyzed by wisdom and not even the slightest thing is observed,

original: bsam pa dang bral zhing snang ba med pa don dam pa'i bden pa yang dag par rig pa gnyis su med par grub pa nyid gnas so //
analyzed: bsam pa dang bral zhing snang ba med pa don dam pa'i bden pa yang dag par rig pa gnyis su med par grub pa nyid gnas so //
translated: then, free from thought and devoid of appearances, the ultimate truth, which is the establishment of nonduality, abides.

original: de'i phyir dngos po dang / dngos po med par rnam par mi rtog pa gnyis su med pa la rnam pa sna tshogs thams cad mi 'jug ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir dngos po dang / dngos po med par rnam par mi rtog pa gnyis su med pa la rnam pa sna tshogs thams cad mi 'jug ste /
translated: Therefore, in nonconceptuality, which is nondual and neither existent nor nonexistent, all varieties do not occur.

original: de bas na sna tshogs kyi tshig ni sna tshogs med pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: de bas na sna tshogs kyi tshig ni sna tshogs med pa'i tshig go //

original: gnyis kyi rnam pa'i rnam par rtog pa 'byung ba thams cad ni don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis pa'i tshul khrims las ldog pas na dge slong gi tshig ni dge slong med pa'i tshig go //

translated: The word ‚Äúmonk‚Äù is the word for the absence of a monk, because all the conceptual thoughts that have the aspect of duality turn away from the morality of the nondual ultimate truth.

original: byin gyi rlabs kyi tshig dang / byin gyi rlabs med pa'i tshig ni des 'di byin gyi rlabs zhes bya ba rnam gnyis kyi shes pa gnyis su med pa las sngogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: byin gyi rlabs kyi tshig dang / byin gyi rlabs med pa'i tshig ni des 'di byin gyi rlabs zhes bya ba rnam gnyis kyi shes pa gnyis su med pa las sngogs par 'gyur te /

original: de bas na byin gyi rlabs kyi tshig ni byin gyi rlabs med pa'i tshig ste /
analyzed: de bas na byin gyi rlabs kyi tshig ni byin gyi rlabs med pa'i tshig ste /

original: mi gnyis pa ni snga ma bzhin no //

original: yi ge'i tshig dang / yi ge med pa'i tshig ces bya ba la /

analyzed: gang las 'gro ba'i rab byed 'byung //

original: tshangs pa sgra ni yang dag pa //

original: sgra tsam las ni byung ba yang //
analyzed: sgra tsam las ni byung ba yang //

original: de nyid du ni zhi bar 'gyur //
analyzed: de nyid du ni zhi bar 'gyur //

original: zhes so // des na yi ge dang 'byor ba'i gnyis kyi rnam pa'i rnam par rtog ba'i zhes pa thams cad ni yi ge med pa'i tshig ste /

analyzed: yan lag med pa'i sgra gcig la //

analyzed: rim ni blo rjes sgrub pa'o //

analyzed: brjod pas so sor blos mi mthun //

original: tshul smra rnams kyi rnam pa mang //
analyzed: tshul smra rnams kyi rnam pa mang //

analyzed: kha cig la la yi ge dang // tshig dang ngag ni brjod pa ste // yi ge ma gtogs tshig ces pa //

original: ngag rnams las ni ston nas su //

original: ji snyed ci 'dra gang dag kyang //
analyzed: ji snyed ci 'dra gang dag kyang //

original: des na yi ge don chos nyid //

original: ces rim ba gang zhig gi don gang zhig rjod par byed pa zhes so //

original: yi ge yan lag ltar the tshom bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yi ge yan lag ltar the tshom bskyed pa'i phyir ro //

original: rtag par smra ba sangs rgyas pa la sogs pa rnams la ni btags pa'i tha snyad pas na gnyis kyi rnam pa'i rnam par shes pa thams cad don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis pa'i shes pa las ldog pa ste /
analyzed: rtag par smra ba sangs rgyas pa la sogs pa rnams la ni btags pa'i tha snyad pas na gnyis kyi rnam pa'i rnam par shes pa thams cad don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis pa'i shes pa las ldog pa ste /
translated: For the eternalists, such as the Buddhists and so on, since it is a conventional designation, all consciousnesses that have the aspect of duality are turned away from the nondual consciousness of ultimate truth.

original: des na yi ge'i tshig ni yi ge med pa'i tshig ces 'phags pa blo gros chen pos dri ba brgya rtsa brgyad gsol ba'i lan thams cad mkhyen pas mi gnyis pa'i tshig tu bka' stsal to //
analyzed: des na yi ge'i tshig ni yi ge med pa'i tshig ces 'phags pa blo gros chen pos dri ba brgya rtsa brgyad gsol ba'i lan thams cad mkhyen pas mi gnyis pa'i tshig tu bka' stsal to //
translated: The Omniscient One has declared that the nondual word is the word of the absence of letters.

original: gang gnyis su med pa dang / rnam pa gnyis su mi 'byed pa dang / chad pa med pa dang / phye ba med pa dang / bden pa yang dag par rig pa de ni mi gnyis pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang gnyis su med pa dang / rnam pa gnyis su mi 'byed pa dang / chad pa med pa dang / phye ba med pa dang / bden pa yang dag par rig pa de ni mi gnyis pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The nondual is that which is nondual, which is not divided into two aspects, which is not interrupted, which is not differentiated, which is the knowledge of the truth.

original: thams cad mkhyen pas sems can thams cad so sor chud par bya ba'i don du blang ba dang spang ba'i khyad par du lhag pa dang / chad pa dang / zlos pa dang / rnam grangs kyi sgra'i don tha dad pas rgya cher bsgrub pa ni sems can rnam ba mang po rab tu chud par 'jug pas na brgal bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pas sems can thams cad so sor chud par bya ba'i don du blang ba dang spang ba'i khyad par du lhag pa dang / chad pa dang / zlos pa dang / rnam grangs kyi sgra'i don tha dad pas rgya cher bsgrub pa ni sems can rnam ba mang po rab tu chud par 'jug pas na brgal bar mi bya'o //
translated: The Omniscient One has extensively established the difference between what is to be taken up and what is to be rejected for the sake of the individual understanding of all sentient beings, through the different meanings of the words of excess, interruption, repetition, and enumeration. One should not dispute this, since it is the means of engaging in the understanding of the many different kinds of sentient beings.

original: sems can gyi don du ji ltar 'gyur ba de bzhin du thams cad mkhyen pa'i tshig gi dbang po mchog tu @65a * //
analyzed: sems can gyi don du ji ltar 'gyur ba de bzhin du thams cad mkhyen pa'i tshig gi dbang po mchog tu @65a * //
translated: Just as it is for the sake of sentient beings, so it is for the sake of omniscience.üîΩThe supreme faculty of speech is completely purified.

original: yongs su dag pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba gzugs rnam pa sna tshogs kyi rnal 'byor gyi dbang po cho 'grul sna tshogs kyis mtha' yas pa'i sems can gyi bsam pa rangs par mdzad pa rnams sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yongs su dag pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba gzugs rnam pa sna tshogs kyi rnal 'byor gyi dbang po cho 'grul sna tshogs kyis mtha' yas pa'i sems can gyi bsam pa rangs par mdzad pa rnams sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das su 'gyur ro //
translated: The various yogic powers of the form realm, such as the various miracles, satisfy the wishes of infinite sentient beings.

original: de'i phyir ye shes bzang dpal gyis tshig brgya rtsa brgyad sangs rgyas kyis blo gros chen po la gsungs pa 'di rigs pa dang / lung dang / bdag dang / gzhan gyi grub pa'i mtha'i rjes su mthun par bshad do //

translated: Therefore, the one hundred and eight verses spoken by the Buddha to MahƒÅmati are explained by J√±ƒÅnasiddhi≈õrƒ´ in a way that accords with reasoning, scripture, and the tenets of our own and others' schools.

original: rtag tu bdag la chags pas srid pa 'byung //
analyzed: rtag tu bdag la chags pas srid pa 'byung //

original: de zad nyid las thar par 'gyur ba ste //

original: ye shes dpal bzang tshad ma tshul gnyis ni //
analyzed: ye shes dpal bzang tshad ma tshul gnyis ni //

original: mkhas bas skye mthar nan tan gyis //
analyzed: mkhas bas skye mthar nan tan gyis //

analyzed: de nas yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po blo gros chen pos bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then again, the bodhisattva mahƒÅsattva MahƒÅmati made a request to the Blessed One:

original: bcom ldan 'das rnam par shes pa rnams kyi skye ba dang / gnas pa dang / 'gag pa rnam pa du mchis /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rnam par shes pa rnams kyi skye ba dang / gnas pa dang / 'gag pa rnam pa du mchis /
translated: ‚ÄúBlessed One, how many kinds of arising, abiding, and ceasing are there of the consciousnesses?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal ba /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal ba /
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: blo gros chen po rnam par shes pa rnams ni skye ba dang / gnas pa dang / 'gag pa la rnam pa gnyis yod de //
analyzed: blo gros chen po rnam par shes pa rnams ni skye ba dang / gnas pa dang / 'gag pa la rnam pa gnyis yod de //
translated: ‚ÄúMahƒÅmati, the consciousnesses have two kinds of arising, abiding, and ceasing,

original: rtog pa pa rnams kyis khong du mi chud do //
analyzed: rtog pa pa rnams kyis khong du mi chud do //
translated: but they are not understood by the conceptualists.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: rgyun 'gag pa dang / mtshan nyid 'gag pa'o //
analyzed: rgyun 'gag pa dang / mtshan nyid 'gag pa'o //
translated: The cessation of the continuum and the cessation of characteristics.

original: rnam par shes pa rnams kyi skye ba yang rnam pa @65b gnyis te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa rnams kyi skye ba yang rnam pa @65b gnyis te /
translated: The arising of the consciousnesses is also twofold:

original: rgyun skye ba dang / mtshan nyid skye ba'o //
analyzed: rgyun skye ba dang / mtshan nyid skye ba'o //
translated: The arising of the continuum and the arising of characteristics.

original: gnas pa'ang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: gnas pa'ang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Abiding is also twofold:

original: rgyun gnas pa dang / mtshan nyid gnas ba'o zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa blo gros chen po gnyis kyi rnam pa'i zhu ba brgya rtsa brgyad kyi lan ni bcom ldan 'das kyis gnyis su med pa don dam pa'i tshig brgya rtsa brgyad kyis spangs mod kyi /
analyzed: rgyun gnas pa dang / mtshan nyid gnas ba'o zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa blo gros chen po gnyis kyi rnam pa'i zhu ba brgya rtsa brgyad kyi lan ni bcom ldan 'das kyis gnyis su med pa don dam pa'i tshig brgya rtsa brgyad kyis spangs mod kyi /
translated: The passage, ‚ÄúThe abiding of the stream and the abiding of the characteristics‚Äù is the reply of the Lord to the one hundred and eight questions of the noble MahƒÅmati concerning the two aspects.

original: 'on kyang 'phags pa blo gros chen pos gzhan gyi ched du spyi dang khyad par gyi rnam pa dri bar byed pa /
analyzed: 'on kyang 'phags pa blo gros chen pos gzhan gyi ched du spyi dang khyad par gyi rnam pa dri bar byed pa /
translated: However, the noble MahƒÅmati asks for the sake of others, in general and in particular.

original: bcom ldan 'das rnam par shes pa rnams kyi skye ba dang / gnas pa dang / 'gag pa rnam pa du mchis zhes pa la /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rnam par shes pa rnams kyi skye ba dang / gnas pa dang / 'gag pa rnam pa du mchis zhes pa la /
translated: ‚ÄúLord, how many kinds of arising, abiding, and ceasing of the consciousnesses are there?‚Äù

original: skye ba rnam pa gnyis zhes so //
analyzed: skye ba rnam pa gnyis zhes so //
translated: ‚ÄúArising is of two kinds.‚Äù

original: des na de la rgyun skye ba ni gang la kun 'dus pa'i dbang gis rang gi mtshan nyid 'phen nus pa ste /
analyzed: des na de la rgyun skye ba ni gang la kun 'dus pa'i dbang gis rang gi mtshan nyid 'phen nus pa ste /
translated: Thus, the arising of the stream is that which is able to project its own characteristics by the power of the collection of causes.

original: ji ltar bgegs med pa'i chu rgyun du 'bab pa la sogs pa 'dra ba'i skad cig pa gzhan 'debs nus pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar bgegs med pa'i chu rgyun du 'bab pa la sogs pa 'dra ba'i skad cig pa gzhan 'debs nus pa'o //
translated: It is like the uninterrupted flow of a river, which is able to project other moments of a similar kind.

original: ji ltar se gol gyi sgra dang / glog la sogs pa thog ma dang / tha ma'i dus su gnas pa'i rnam pa'i cha dang bral ba'i skad cig pa rnams kyis skad cig pa mngon sum du 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar se gol gyi sgra dang / glog la sogs pa thog ma dang / tha ma'i dus su gnas pa'i rnam pa'i cha dang bral ba'i skad cig pa rnams kyis skad cig pa mngon sum du 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Just as the sound of a finger snap and lightning, etc., are momentary, being devoid of a part of a state that endures from beginning to end, they are directly perceived as momentary.

original: rtog pa pa rnams kyis khong du mi chud pa zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe se gol gyi sgra bzhin du 'dra ba'i skad cig pa gzhan 'phen pa med pa de'i tshe mngon sum gyis skad cig pa 'dzin to zhes thams cad mkhyen pas der dgongs pa'o
analyzed: rtog pa pa rnams kyis khong du mi chud pa zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe se gol gyi sgra bzhin du 'dra ba'i skad cig pa gzhan 'phen pa med pa de'i tshe mngon sum gyis skad cig pa 'dzin to zhes thams cad mkhyen pas der dgongs pa'o
translated: The Omniscient One intended that when there is no other moment projected, like the sound of a finger snap, then the moment is directly perceived.

original: // de la grangs can dang ne yi ya yi ka dang / khyad par can gang dag gis dngos po skad cig pa drug gi bar du gnas par 'dod pa de dag gi skad cig pa'i mtshan nyid dang rgyun gyi mtshan nyid khong du mi chud do //
analyzed: // de la grangs can dang ne yi ya yi ka dang / khyad par can gang dag gis dngos po skad cig pa drug gi bar du gnas par 'dod pa de dag gi skad cig pa'i mtshan nyid dang rgyun gyi mtshan nyid khong du mi chud do //
translated: The Enumerators, the Nihilists, and the Vai≈õe·π£ikas, who assert that things endure for six moments, do not understand the characteristics of a moment and the characteristics of a continuum.

original: ji ltar grangs can gyi 'gyur ba cha drug tu 'dod pa ni skye ba dang / yod pa dang / 'gyur ba dang / rnam par 'phel bar 'gyur ba dang / 'grib pa dang / 'jig pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: ji ltar grangs can gyi 'gyur ba cha drug tu 'dod pa ni skye ba dang / yod pa dang / 'gyur ba dang / rnam par 'phel bar 'gyur ba dang / 'grib pa dang / 'jig pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The Samkhyas assert that change is sixfold: arising, existence, change, increase, decrease, and destruction.

original: bro dang / sgra dang / ma myur du 'jig pa rnams la yang ngo //
analyzed: bro dang / sgra dang / ma myur du 'jig pa rnams la yang ngo //
translated: They also assert that sound, taste, and touch are destroyed quickly.

original: rim dang cig car gcig tu yang rtag tu med na myur du 'jig pa'i rang bzhin la ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: rim dang cig car gcig tu yang rtag tu med na myur du 'jig pa'i rang bzhin la ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: If it is not possible for something to be permanent, gradual, or instantaneous, how could it be possible for something that is quickly destroyed?

original: ne yi ya yi ka dang / khyad bar can rnams kyis skad cig pa drug tu gnas par kun tu rtog pa ni yod pa dang / 'brel ba'i dus dang gnas pa'i dus dang / tha mar yon tan skye ba'i dus dang / dmigs pa'i dus dang /
analyzed: ne yi ya yi ka dang / khyad bar can rnams kyis skad cig pa drug tu gnas par kun tu rtog pa ni yod pa dang / 'brel ba'i dus dang gnas pa'i dus dang / tha mar yon tan skye ba'i dus dang / dmigs pa'i dus dang /
translated: The NaiyƒÅyikas and the Vai≈õe·π£ikas imagine that something endures for six moments: the time of existence, the time of connection, the time of endurance, the time of the arising of qualities, the time of the object,

original: @66a * // 'jig pa'i rgyu bsnyen pa'i dus zhes so //
analyzed: @66a * // 'jig pa'i rgyu bsnyen pa'i dus zhes so //
translated: and the time of the approach of the cause of destruction.

original: de ste myur du 'jig pa /
analyzed: de ste myur du 'jig pa /
translated: If something is quickly destroyed,

original: skad cig pa drug tu gnas par kun tu rtog na de'i tshe /
analyzed: skad cig pa drug tu gnas par kun tu rtog na de'i tshe /
translated: if it is imagined that it endures for six moments,üîΩthen at the time of the arising of the cause of destruction,

original: skad cig pa drug re re la yang skad cig pa drug gnas par kun tu rtog par gyis /
analyzed: skad cig pa drug re re la yang skad cig pa drug gnas par kun tu rtog par gyis /
translated: And in each of the six moments, imagine that there are six further moments.

original: de nas rtog pa pa rnams rtag par 'khrul te /
analyzed: de nas rtog pa pa rnams rtag par 'khrul te /
translated: Then, the theorists are completely confused about permanence.

original: rtsva dang skra la sogs pa bcad nas yang skyes pa de bzhin du rgyun gyi rang bzhin la'ang ba'i skad cig pa gzhan 'byung ba mi shes pas na smad cig pa'i mtshan nyid khong du mi chud do //
analyzed: rtsva dang skra la sogs pa bcad nas yang skyes pa de bzhin du rgyun gyi rang bzhin la'ang ba'i skad cig pa gzhan 'byung ba mi shes pas na smad cig pa'i mtshan nyid khong du mi chud do //
translated: Just as when grass, hair, and so on are cut, they grow again, so too, they do not understand that another moment arises in the nature of a continuum, and thus they do not comprehend the characteristic of momentariness.

original: rtog pa pa rnams kyi shes pa ni tshad ma ste /
analyzed: rtog pa pa rnams kyi shes pa ni tshad ma ste /
translated: The cognition of the theorists is valid.

original: ji ltar gang gi lha sbyin 'di de nyid yin zhes pa dang / nyam chung ba dang / tsho ba dang / kha dog 'di nyid pa dang / ring ba dang / thung ba dang / de sdug bsngal can 'di nyid dang / bde ba can zhes de de ltar de dag rgyun la rtag par 'khrul nas de'i phyir rtog pa pa rnams kyis khong du mi chud do //
analyzed: ji ltar gang gi lha sbyin 'di de nyid yin zhes pa dang / nyam chung ba dang / tsho ba dang / kha dog 'di nyid pa dang / ring ba dang / thung ba dang / de sdug bsngal can 'di nyid dang / bde ba can zhes de de ltar de dag rgyun la rtag par 'khrul nas de'i phyir rtog pa pa rnams kyis khong du mi chud do //
translated: Just as when they say, ‚ÄúThis Devadatta is the same one,‚Äù or ‚ÄúThis is weak, this is strong, this is the same color, this is tall, this is short, this is suffering, this is happy,‚Äù they are confused about permanence in a continuum. Therefore, the theorists do not comprehend.

original: de de ltar thams cad mkhyen pas skye ba dang / gnas pa dang / 'gog pa mtshan nyid dang / rgyun rnam pa gnyis su dgongs la /
analyzed: de de ltar thams cad mkhyen pas skye ba dang / gnas pa dang / 'gog pa mtshan nyid dang / rgyun rnam pa gnyis su dgongs la /
translated: Thus, the Omniscient One considers arising, enduring, and ceasing to be characteristics and the continuum to be twofold.

original: rtog pa pa rnams kyis rgyun la rtag par kun tu rtog pa ni ji ltar mu stegs can ksha pa na kas kun tu rtog pa spyi bdag nyid du rtog par 'gyur ba dang / spyi dang khyad par gyi bdag nyid du rtag kyang rtag la mi rtag par 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: rtog pa pa rnams kyis rgyun la rtag par kun tu rtog pa ni ji ltar mu stegs can ksha pa na kas kun tu rtog pa spyi bdag nyid du rtog par 'gyur ba dang / spyi dang khyad par gyi bdag nyid du rtag kyang rtag la mi rtag par 'gyur ba dang /
translated: The conception of permanence in the continuum is like the conception of the tƒ´rthika Ka≈õyapƒ´ya, who conceives of the self as a generality.üîΩIt is also not to be said that the self as a generality is permanent and the self as a particular is impermanent.üîΩIt is also not to be said that the self as a particular is impermanent and the self as a generality is permanent.

original: spyi bdag nyid du rtag par 'gyur ba yang khyad par gyi bdag nyid du smra bar mi bya ba dang / khyad par gyi bdag nyid du mi rtag par 'gyur ba yang spyi'i bdag nyid du smra bar mi bya ba dang / spyi dang khyad par gyi bdag nyid du rtag kyang rtag la mi rtag par 'gyur ba yang cig car smra bar mi bya ba dang /
analyzed: spyi bdag nyid du rtag par 'gyur ba yang khyad par gyi bdag nyid du smra bar mi bya ba dang / khyad par gyi bdag nyid du mi rtag par 'gyur ba yang spyi'i bdag nyid du smra bar mi bya ba dang / spyi dang khyad par gyi bdag nyid du rtag kyang rtag la mi rtag par 'gyur ba yang cig car smra bar mi bya ba dang /
translated: It is also not to be said that the self as a generality is permanent and the self as a particular is impermanent.

original: spyi dang khyad par gyi bdag nyid du rtag par 'gyur ba yang cig car smra bar mi bya ste /
analyzed: spyi dang khyad par gyi bdag nyid du rtag par 'gyur ba yang cig car smra bar mi bya ste /
translated: It should not be said that the self is permanent in the sense of being a universal or a particular.üîΩBecause it would follow that everything would exist in terms of object, time, sequence, and aspect, and it would follow that everything would not exist, and it would follow that nothing could be said.

original: yul dang / dus dang / rim pa dang / rnam pa la ltos te thams cad yod par 'gyur ba dang / thams cad med par 'gyur ba dang / smra bar mi bya bar zhes bya ba de de ltar spyi dang khyad bar du rtog pa pa rnams kyi gang don gyi bya ba nus pa de nyid de ltar gyi dus na tshad mas rtogs par bya ba gzhal bar rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: yul dang / dus dang / rim pa dang / rnam pa la ltos te thams cad yod par 'gyur ba dang / thams cad med par 'gyur ba dang / smra bar mi bya bar zhes bya ba de de ltar spyi dang khyad bar du rtog pa pa rnams kyi gang don gyi bya ba nus pa de nyid de ltar gyi dus na tshad mas rtogs par bya ba gzhal bar rnam par gzhag go //
translated: Therefore, the object of the activity of the self, which is capable of that, is established as the object of valid cognition at that time.

original: gang yang 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa de ni med pa nyid de /
analyzed: gang yang 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa de ni med pa nyid de /
translated: Moreover, the past and future do not exist.

original: rgyud kyi rgyun la rnal 'byor pa'i rtog pa pa rnams kyis rtag pa 'ba' zhig kun tu rtog pa ste /
analyzed: rgyud kyi rgyun la rnal 'byor pa'i rtog pa pa rnams kyis rtag pa 'ba' zhig kun tu rtog pa ste /
translated: The yogis and yoginis imagine only permanence in the continuum of the aggregates.

original: ji ltar dpyod pa can rnams rtogs par @66b byed pa /
analyzed: ji ltar dpyod pa can rnams rtogs par @66b byed pa /
translated: How do the Vaibhasikas understand this?

original: dngos po'i gzugs ni gcig min te //
analyzed: dngos po'i gzugs ni gcig min te //
translated: The form of an entity is not one.

original: cig car dang ni rim gyis ni //
analyzed: cig car dang ni rim gyis ni //
translated: Simultaneously or sequentially,

original: 'dod pa bzhin du rtogs par byed //
analyzed: 'dod pa bzhin du rtogs par byed //
translated: It is understood just as one wishes.

original: tshig ni rnam pa gzhan med do //üîΩ'dres pa'i tshon la ji lta bu'i //
analyzed: tshig ni rnam pa gzhan med do // 'dres pa'i tshon la ji lta bu'i //
translated: There is no other kind of word.üîΩJust as one grasps a color

original: 'dod pa bzhin du 'dzin par byed //
analyzed: 'dod pa bzhin du 'dzin par byed //
translated: Mixed with other colors as one wishes,

original: rnam grangs dngos po de bzhin du //
analyzed: rnam grangs dngos po de bzhin du //
translated: So too, in the case of synonyms,

original: tha dad 'thad min 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: tha dad 'thad min 'dzin pa'o //
translated: One grasps them as distinct without distinction.

original: ji ltar gcig po rnam grangs kyis //
analyzed: ji ltar gcig po rnam grangs kyis //
translated: Just as one thing, through synonyms,

original: yul gzhan du ni 'gro ba yang //üîΩtha dad yul gyis tha mi dad //
analyzed: yul gzhan du ni 'gro ba yang // tha dad yul gyis tha mi dad //
translated: Is said to be in another place,üîΩSo too, without distinction of place,

original: sgra yang de bzhin dbyer med do //
analyzed: sgra yang de bzhin dbyer med do //
translated: The word is undifferentiated.

original: su zhig cig car shes pa ltar //
analyzed: su zhig cig car shes pa ltar //
translated: Just as one understands simultaneously,

original: yang yang shes par 'gyur ba na //
analyzed: yang yang shes par 'gyur ba na //
translated: So too, one understands again and again.

original: dus kyi rim par dbyer med pa //
analyzed: dus kyi rim par dbyer med pa //
translated: Without distinction of temporal stages,

original: de bzhin sgra ni dbyer med do //
analyzed: de bzhin sgra ni dbyer med do //
translated: The word is undifferentiated.

original: de ste dngos po du ma dang bral ba'i dngos po gcig med par gyur na ni /
analyzed: de ste dngos po du ma dang bral ba'i dngos po gcig med par gyur na ni /
translated: If there is no single thing that is devoid of multiplicity,

original: de'i tshe gcig med na du mar yang ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: de'i tshe gcig med na du mar yang ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: Then, if the one does not exist, how could the many exist?

original: tha dad pa dang tha dad pa ma yin par rtag pa yang sgro btags te /
analyzed: tha dad pa dang tha dad pa ma yin par rtag pa yang sgro btags te /
translated: One imputes permanence to what is distinct and what is not distinct.

original: sgra'i don gyi tha snyad kun tu brtags par gyis /
analyzed: sgra'i don gyi tha snyad kun tu brtags par gyis /
translated: Consider the conventional usage of the meaning of words.

original: don dam par na gang gcig gi rang bzhin yin pa de ni /
analyzed: don dam par na gang gcig gi rang bzhin yin pa de ni /
translated: In reality, how could that which is the nature of one thing

original: gnyis po ji ltar na 'gyur /
analyzed: gnyis po ji ltar na 'gyur /
translated: be the nature of two?

original: de'i tshe bdag gi gzugs dang / gzhan gyi gzugs dbyer med pas na bdag gi gzugs dang / gzhan gyi gzugs cis na yin /
analyzed: de'i tshe bdag gi gzugs dang / gzhan gyi gzugs dbyer med pas na bdag gi gzugs dang / gzhan gyi gzugs cis na yin /
translated: At that time, since one‚Äôs form and another‚Äôs form are inseparable, how could one‚Äôs form and another‚Äôs form be different?

original: 'jug pa'i rgyu'i khyad par med par tha dad pa dang / tha dad pa ma yin par rnam par rtog pa yang ji ltar na rung /
analyzed: 'jug pa'i rgyu'i khyad par med par tha dad pa dang / tha dad pa ma yin par rnam par rtog pa yang ji ltar na rung /
translated: How could it be tenable that there is no difference in the cause of engagement, and yet there is difference and non-difference?

original: rnam grangs gcig par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam grangs gcig par 'gyur ro //
translated: There would be a single enumeration.

original: 'on te tha dad pa dang / tha dad pa ma yin par 'jug pa'i rgyu'i khyad par yod do zhe na ni de'i tshe der 'jug pa'i rgyu'i khyad par bzhin du dngos po thams cad khyad par yod do //
analyzed: 'on te tha dad pa dang / tha dad pa ma yin par 'jug pa'i rgyu'i khyad par yod do zhe na ni de'i tshe der 'jug pa'i rgyu'i khyad par bzhin du dngos po thams cad khyad par yod do //
translated: But if there is a difference in the cause of engagement, in that case, like the difference in the cause of engagement, all things would have a difference.

original: gang dag yang tshangs pa dang / dbang po la sogs pa gzugs gcig pa'i 'gro ba kun tu rtog pa de dag la yang grol ba dang / ma grol ba dang / phyug dbul la sogs pa gcig pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang dag yang tshangs pa dang / dbang po la sogs pa gzugs gcig pa'i 'gro ba kun tu rtog pa de dag la yang grol ba dang / ma grol ba dang / phyug dbul la sogs pa gcig pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro //
translated: Also, for those who imagine that Brahma, Ishvara, and so on, are the creators of the world, there would be the fault that those who are liberated and those who are not liberated, the rich and the poor, and so on, would all be the same.

original: sangs rgyas pa ni gnyis par smra ba rnams kyis chud pa mang ba dang / de dag nyid dag pa na thams cad mkhyen par 'gyur te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas pa ni gnyis par smra ba rnams kyis chud pa mang ba dang / de dag nyid dag pa na thams cad mkhyen par 'gyur te /
translated: The Buddhists who are proponents of two truths say that the many are included in the one, and when those are purified, they become omniscient.

original: snang ba dang bcas pa dang snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin thob nas btsun gtso sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das sems can gyi don la bzhugs so //
analyzed: snang ba dang bcas pa dang snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin thob nas btsun gtso sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das sems can gyi don la bzhugs so //
translated: Having attained the samadhis of light and no light, the Bhagavan Buddha, the Lord of the Holy Ones, abides for the benefit of sentient beings.

original: thams cad mkhyen pas so sor rang gis rtogs pa'i spyod yul don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis par yang dag par rig pa ston pa'i tshig brgya rtsa brgyad kyis phyi'i @67a * //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pas so sor rang gis rtogs pa'i spyod yul don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis par yang dag par rig pa ston pa'i tshig brgya rtsa brgyad kyis phyi'i @67a * //
translated: The one who knows all things, the one who has realized the object of individual knowledge, the one who teaches the ultimate truth of nonduality, with one hundred and eight words, the one who is the essence of the three secrets, the one who is the essence of the three kayas, the one who is the essence of the three times, the one who is the essence of the three realms, the one who is the essence of the three worlds, the one who is the essence of the three worlds, the one who is the essence of the three worlds, the one who is the essence of the three worlds, the one who is the essence of the three worlds, the one who is the essence of the three worlds, the one who is the essence of the three worlds, the one who is the essence of the three worlds, the one who is the essence of the three worlds, the one who is the essence of the three worlds, the one who is the essence of the three worlds, the one who is the essence of the three worlds, the one who is the essence of the three worlds, the one who is the essence of the three worlds, the one who is the essence of the three worlds, the one who is the essence of the three worlds, the one who is the essence of the three worlds, the one who is the essence of the three worlds, the one who is the essence of the three worlds, the one who is the essence of the three worlds, the one who is the essence of the three worlds, the one who is the essence of the three worlds, the one who is the essence of the three worlds, the one who is the essence of the three worlds, the one who is the essence of the three worlds, the one who is the essence of the three worlds, the one who is the essence of the three worlds, the one who is the essence of the three worlds, the

original: don gsal ba dang / 'jig rten rgyang phan pa'i rtog pa gang dag gis rnam par shes pa'i rgyun chad pa'i gling bslang ba skad cig pa gcig las rgyun ni tha dad pa yin nam /
analyzed: don gsal ba dang / 'jig rten rgyang phan pa'i rtog pa gang dag gis rnam par shes pa'i rgyun chad pa'i gling bslang ba skad cig pa gcig las rgyun ni tha dad pa yin nam /
translated: The meaning is clear.

original: gal te tha dad na tshig gi don gzhan zhig rtag par kun tu brtags par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: gal te tha dad na tshig gi don gzhan zhig rtag par kun tu brtags par gyur pa'o //
translated: If the continuum of consciousness is different from the momentary consciousness that is the basis for the arising of the island of the cessation of consciousness, then it is a permanent, all-pervading imputed object.

original: gal te tha mi dad na ni de'i tshe skad cig pa ma gtogs par rgyun gyi tshig gi don gang yin yang med do zhes pa ni gleng pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te tha mi dad na ni de'i tshe skad cig pa ma gtogs par rgyun gyi tshig gi don gang yin yang med do zhes pa ni gleng pa ma yin te /
translated: If it is not different, then at that time, apart from the momentary consciousness, there is no object that is the meaning of the word continuum.üîΩThis is not a new point,

original: snga ma'i 'og tu 'di yod pas 'di yod par 'gyur ro zhes bya ste /
analyzed: snga ma'i 'og tu 'di yod pas 'di yod par 'gyur ro zhes bya ste /
translated: because if this exists after that exists, then this arises.

original: ji ltar sngon myong ba dran pa dang / snga ma zhig nas de'i 'og tu skyes pa'i sa bon dang / myu gu la sogs pa rgyu dang 'bras bur 'brel ba ji bzhin pa de bzhin du dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las kyi rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu so so'i nges pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar sngon myong ba dran pa dang / snga ma zhig nas de'i 'og tu skyes pa'i sa bon dang / myu gu la sogs pa rgyu dang 'bras bur 'brel ba ji bzhin pa de bzhin du dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las kyi rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu so so'i nges pa'o //
translated: Just as the memory of a previous experience and the seed that arises after the previous one ceases are related as cause and effect, so too is the individual certainty of the fruitions that are the results of virtuous and nonvirtuous karma.

original: de ltar slob pa rnams kyi mngon sum dang / thos pa dang / sems pa la sogs pas sbyangs pa las rim gyis shes rab kyi khyad par du gyur pa de bzhin du btsas ma thag pa rnams kyis yang shes rab la sogs pa'i khyad par rnams kun dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar slob pa rnams kyi mngon sum dang / thos pa dang / sems pa la sogs pas sbyangs pa las rim gyis shes rab kyi khyad par du gyur pa de bzhin du btsas ma thag pa rnams kyis yang shes rab la sogs pa'i khyad par rnams kun dmigs pa ste /
translated: Just as the differences in the wisdom, etc. of those who are being trained are observed to be due to the differences in their study, reflection, etc., in the same way, the differences in the wisdom, etc. of those who are just born are observed to be due to the differences in their previous practice.

original: des na sngon gyi bag chags la goms par rjes su dpag go //
analyzed: des na sngon gyi bag chags la goms par rjes su dpag go //
translated: Therefore, one infers that they are habituated to the predispositions from before.

original: de der 'jig rten gzhan sgrub pa'i tshad ma ni ye shes kyi bla ma'i khyad par gang dang gang yin pa de dang de dag ni snga ma snga ma thos pa dang / sems pa la sogs pa'i 'du byed thog mar byas pa las te /
analyzed: de der 'jig rten gzhan sgrub pa'i tshad ma ni ye shes kyi bla ma'i khyad par gang dang gang yin pa de dang de dag ni snga ma snga ma thos pa dang / sems pa la sogs pa'i 'du byed thog mar byas pa las te /
translated: The measure of the establishment of another world by that is this: whatever the differences in the wisdom, etc. of the wise, they are due to the differences in their previous study, reflection, etc.

original: slob ma rnams kyi shin tu mkhas pa'i khyad par bzhin no //
analyzed: slob ma rnams kyi shin tu mkhas pa'i khyad par bzhin no //
translated: Just as the differences in the wisdom, etc. of the students are due to the differences in their previous study, reflection, etc.

original: skyes ma thag pa'i shes rab la sogs pa'i khyad par dga' ba dang 'jig pa dang / mya ngan rtogs pa yang yod de /
analyzed: skyes ma thag pa'i shes rab la sogs pa'i khyad par dga' ba dang 'jig pa dang / mya ngan rtogs pa yang yod de /
