translated: There is also joy, destruction, and realization of sorrow in the differences in the wisdom, etc. of those who are just born.

original: blang ba dang / dor ba dang / btang snyoms kyi blo rnams la bde ba dang / sdug bsngal du sgrub par nges pa sngar yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: blang ba dang / dor ba dang / btang snyoms kyi blo rnams la bde ba dang / sdug bsngal du sgrub par nges pa sngar yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is certain that the mind has already established pleasure and pain in relation to the ideas of taking up, putting down, and indifference.

original: skyes ma thag pa la yang yul kha cig tu yang khro zhing dngang ba dang / kha cig tu ni dga' ba ste /
analyzed: skyes ma thag pa la yang yul kha cig tu yang khro zhing dngang ba dang / kha cig tu ni dga' ba ste /
translated: Even in the newborn, in some places there is anger and fear, and in some places there is joy.

original: de ltar kha cig tu 'dor ba dang / kha cig tu blang bar yang mthong ste /
analyzed: de ltar kha cig tu 'dor ba dang / kha cig tu blang bar yang mthong ste /
translated: Thus, in some places there is the idea of taking up, and in some places there is the idea of putting down.

original: des na sngon gyi goms pa yod par rjes su dpag go //
analyzed: des na sngon gyi goms pa yod par rjes su dpag go //
translated: Therefore, we infer that there is prior habituation.

original: de bas na sems kyi rgyud kyi rgyun ma chad pa ste /
analyzed: de bas na sems kyi rgyud kyi rgyun ma chad pa ste /
translated: Thus, the continuum of the mind is uninterrupted.

original: 'khor bar kun tu nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba rnam par gzhag pa de nyid kyi dbang du byas te /
analyzed: 'khor bar kun tu nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba rnam par gzhag pa de nyid kyi dbang du byas te /
translated: In that very context, the afflictions and purification are established in cyclic existence.

original: las dang 'bras bur 'brel pa yin gyi phyi'i don gyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: las dang 'bras bur 'brel pa yin gyi phyi'i don gyis ni ma yin no //
translated: The connection between action and effect is due to that, not due to external objects.

original: de'i phyir 'phags pa blo gros chen pos gzhan gyi don du khyad par du @67b shes par 'dod nas zhus pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'phags pa blo gros chen pos gzhan gyi don du khyad par du @67b shes par 'dod nas zhus pa /
translated: Therefore, the noble MahƒÅmati, desiring to understand the meaning of the TathƒÅgata‚Äôs teaching for the sake of others, asked:

original: thams cad mkhyen pas kyang spyi dang khyad par gyi bye brag tu de bzhin rgya cher sgrub pa mdzad pa /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pas kyang spyi dang khyad par gyi bye brag tu de bzhin rgya cher sgrub pa mdzad pa /
translated: The Omniscient One also extensively proves that in general and in particular.

original: rnam par shes pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Consciousness is of three kinds:

original: 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid dang / las kyi mtshan nyid dang / rigs kyi mtshan nyid do zhes pa ste /
analyzed: 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid dang / las kyi mtshan nyid dang / rigs kyi mtshan nyid do zhes pa ste /
translated: that characterized by engagement, that characterized by activity, and that characterized by type.

original: de dag ni gzugs la sogs pa'i yul du snang ba rnams la mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa gang 'jug pa de dag 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams so //
analyzed: de dag ni gzugs la sogs pa'i yul du snang ba rnams la mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa gang 'jug pa de dag 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams so //
translated: Those are the consciousnesses of engagement, which engage the appearances of objects such as form in the eye consciousness and so on.

original: gang de ma thag pa'i shes pa bya ba'i nan tan pa de ni las kyi mtshan nyid pa'o //
analyzed: gang de ma thag pa'i shes pa bya ba'i nan tan pa de ni las kyi mtshan nyid pa'o //
translated: The consciousness that is the immediate antecedent of the consciousness that is the basis of activity is that characterized by activity.

original: gang khyab pa po kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni rigs kyi mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: gang khyab pa po kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni rigs kyi mtshan nyid de /
translated: The all-pervading consciousness that is the foundation of all is that characterized by type.

original: ji ltar 'di nyid du sgrub par mdzad pa /
analyzed: ji ltar 'di nyid du sgrub par mdzad pa /
translated: How is that established in this text?

original: lus dang longs spyod gnas snang ba //
analyzed: lus dang longs spyod gnas snang ba //
translated: The body, enjoyments, and the appearance of the abode

original: kun gzhi kun tu 'byung ba ste //
analyzed: kun gzhi kun tu 'byung ba ste //
translated: arise from the foundation consciousness.

original: rnam brgyad rnam dgu de bzhin du //
analyzed: rnam brgyad rnam dgu de bzhin du //
translated: It is also of eight kinds and nine kinds.

original: rgya mtsho rlabs rnams bzhin du'o //
analyzed: rgya mtsho rlabs rnams bzhin du'o //
translated: Like the ocean and its waves.

original: rmi lam gyi dus su rnam par shes pa gcig pu nyid yul dang yul can gyi dngos po du mar 'byung ste /
analyzed: rmi lam gyi dus su rnam par shes pa gcig pu nyid yul dang yul can gyi dngos po du mar 'byung ste /
translated: In the dream state, a single consciousness arises as the multiplicity of subject and object.

original: der gzugs la sogs pa yul yang med la /
analyzed: der gzugs la sogs pa yul yang med la /
translated: There are no objects such as forms,

original: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa yang med de /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa yang med de /
translated: and there are no eye consciousnesses, etc.

original: yul thams cad du khyab pa 'dzin pa dang / gzung ba'i dngos por kun gzhi rnam par shes pa gcig pu nyid snang ngo //
analyzed: yul thams cad du khyab pa 'dzin pa dang / gzung ba'i dngos por kun gzhi rnam par shes pa gcig pu nyid snang ngo //
translated: The all-base consciousness alone appears as the all-pervading apprehender and as the thing apprehended.

original: thams cad mkhyen pas mdo de nyid las rnam pa gnyis su grub pa mdzad pa /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pas mdo de nyid las rnam pa gnyis su grub pa mdzad pa /
translated: The Omniscient One has established this in two ways in that very s≈´tra.

original: blo gros chen pos mtshan nyid brgyad du gsungs pa'i rnam par shes pa ni mdor rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: blo gros chen pos mtshan nyid brgyad du gsungs pa'i rnam par shes pa ni mdor rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The consciousness spoken of by MahƒÅmati in terms of eight characteristics is, in brief, of two kinds:

original: snang ba'i rnam par shes pa dang / dngos po so sor rnam par rtog pa'i rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: snang ba'i rnam par shes pa dang / dngos po so sor rnam par rtog pa'i rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: the consciousness of appearance and the consciousness that discriminates individual things.

original: blo gros chen po ji ltar me long la gzugs brnyan bzhin du snang ba la snang ba'i rnam par shes pa 'dzin to zhes pa kun tu rig pa la /
analyzed: blo gros chen po ji ltar me long la gzugs brnyan bzhin du snang ba la snang ba'i rnam par shes pa 'dzin to zhes pa kun tu rig pa la /
translated: MahƒÅmati, just as a reflection is apprehended in a mirror, so the consciousness of appearance apprehends appearances.

original: de bzhin du gzugs 'dzin pa dang / gzugs su snang ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzugs 'dzin pa dang / gzugs su snang ba'o //
translated: In the same way, there is the apprehension of form and the appearance of form.

original: blo gros chen po snang ba'i rnam par shes pa dang dngos po so sor rnam par rtog pa'i rnam par shes pa de nyid ni zhes bya ba yul gyi rnam par chud pa'i rnam par shes pa dag go //
analyzed: blo gros chen po snang ba'i rnam par shes pa dang dngos po so sor rnam par rtog pa'i rnam par shes pa de nyid ni zhes bya ba yul gyi rnam par chud pa'i rnam par shes pa dag go //
translated: MahƒÅmati, the consciousness of appearance and the consciousness that discriminates individual things are the consciousnesses that are filled with objects.

original: snang ba'i rnam par shes pa'i mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa'i bar du'o //üîΩdngos po so sor rnam par rtog pa'i rnam par shes pa ni /
analyzed: snang ba'i rnam par shes pa'i mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa'i bar du'o // dngos po so sor rnam par rtog pa'i rnam par shes pa ni /
translated: The consciousness of appearance is the eye consciousness up to the mental consciousness.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: The consciousness that discriminates individual things is the mental consciousness.

original: gang gzugs la sogs pa'i dngos po so sor rnam par rtog @68a * //
analyzed: gang gzugs la sogs pa'i dngos po so sor rnam par rtog @68a * //
translated: It discriminates individual things such as form.

original: pa'o // mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa ni thams cad mkhyen pas rnam par mi rtog pa nyid du gsungs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: pa'o // mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa ni thams cad mkhyen pas rnam par mi rtog pa nyid du gsungs par rig par bya'o //
translated: The eye consciousness, etc. should be understood as taught by the Omniscient One to be non-conceptual.

original: de nyid ni mtshan nyid tha mi dad cing zhes bya ba ni chud pa tsam gyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid ni mtshan nyid tha mi dad cing zhes bya ba ni chud pa tsam gyi phyir ro //
translated: It is the same in terms of the characteristic, i.e., the same in terms of the mere appearance.

original: gcig gi rgyu gcig go zhes bya ba ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams kyi de ma thag pa'i rkyen byed pa dang / mig la sogs pa'i shes pa de dag kyang yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i de ma thag pa'i rkyen du nye bar 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig gi rgyu gcig go zhes bya ba ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams kyi de ma thag pa'i rkyen byed pa dang / mig la sogs pa'i shes pa de dag kyang yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i de ma thag pa'i rkyen du nye bar 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The cause of one is the cause of the other, i.e., the mental consciousness acts as the immediately preceding condition of the eye consciousness, etc., and those eye consciousnesses, etc. approach as the immediately preceding condition of the mental consciousness.

original: blo gros chen po de la snang ba'i rnam par shes pa ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i bag chags yongs su 'gyur ba'i rgyu las 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: blo gros chen po de la snang ba'i rnam par shes pa ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i bag chags yongs su 'gyur ba'i rgyu las 'byung ba'o //
translated: MahƒÅmati, the appearance consciousness arises from the cause of the transformation of inconceivable habitual tendencies.

original: dngos po so sor rnam par rtog pa'i rnam par shes pa ni zhes pa mgo 'khor ba dang / brgyal ba la sogs pa bzhin du der phyi'i don rgyu ma yin par thog ma med pa'i dus kyi bag chags dang / mnyam par 'jog pa med pas btab pa'i sems dang /üîΩdam pa dang dam pa ma yin pa'i chos bstan pa la sogs pa'i rgyud kyi dbang las rnam pa sna tshogs su rnam par gsal ba'i rnam par rtog pa'i rnam par shes pa skye ste /
analyzed: dngos po so sor rnam par rtog pa'i rnam par shes pa ni zhes pa mgo 'khor ba dang / brgyal ba la sogs pa bzhin du der phyi'i don rgyu ma yin par thog ma med pa'i dus kyi bag chags dang / mnyam par 'jog pa med pas btab pa'i sems dang / dam pa dang dam pa ma yin pa'i chos bstan pa la sogs pa'i rgyud kyi dbang las rnam pa sna tshogs su rnam par gsal ba'i rnam par rtog pa'i rnam par shes pa skye ste /
translated: The consciousness that conceives of individual things is like the consciousnesses of those who are dizzy, faint, and so on. It is not caused by external objects. It arises from beginningless time due to latent propensities and the mind being affected by the absence of meditative equipoise.üîΩIt is the consciousness that conceives of various aspects due to the power of the continuum of the mind, such as the teaching of the Dharma by sublime beings and by non-sublime beings.

original: 'on kyang rnam pa sna tshogs su 'khrul pa'i rnam pas ni nang glongs nas skyes pa rnams mngon sum dang gcig nas gcig tu brgyud de gcig gi rgyu gcig yin pa ni dbang po'i rnam par shes pa dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa dag phan tshun du de ma thag pa'i rkyen yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang rnam pa sna tshogs su 'khrul pa'i rnam pas ni nang glongs nas skyes pa rnams mngon sum dang gcig nas gcig tu brgyud de gcig gi rgyu gcig yin pa ni dbang po'i rnam par shes pa dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa dag phan tshun du de ma thag pa'i rkyen yin te /
translated: However, the various aspects of the consciousness that conceives of individual things arise from within. They are directly perceived and are the cause of one another. The consciousnesses of the five sense doors and the mental consciousness are the immediately preceding condition of each other.

original: de ltar 'jig rten phyi ma grub pas na 'khor ba thog ma med pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar 'jig rten phyi ma grub pas na 'khor ba thog ma med pa'o //
translated: Since the next world is thus established, cyclic existence is beginningless.

original: de la blo gros chen po de dbang po'i rnam par shes pa thams cad 'gag pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la blo gros chen po de dbang po'i rnam par shes pa thams cad 'gag pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: ‚ÄúMahƒÅmati, the cessation of all the sense consciousnesses is as follows:

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i yang dag pa ma yin par kun tu rtog pa'i bag chags sna tshogs 'gog pa ste /
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i yang dag pa ma yin par kun tu rtog pa'i bag chags sna tshogs 'gog pa ste /
translated: It is the cessation of the various habitual tendencies of unreal imagination in the foundation consciousness.

original: blo gros chen po 'di ni mtshan nyid 'ga' ba'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: blo gros chen po 'di ni mtshan nyid 'ga' ba'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: MahƒÅmati, this is the cessation of characteristics.

original: dbang po'i rnam par shes pa thams cad ni rang gi mtshan nyid du snang ba lnga po rnams bsam du med pa'i rnam par 'byung ba dang / de'i 'og tu yid kyi rnam par shes pa ste /
analyzed: dbang po'i rnam par shes pa thams cad ni rang gi mtshan nyid du snang ba lnga po rnams bsam du med pa'i rnam par 'byung ba dang / de'i 'og tu yid kyi rnam par shes pa ste /
translated: All the sense consciousnesses arise in an inconceivable manner, appearing as the five individual characteristics, and after that comes the mental consciousness.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la yang dag pa ma yin pa kun tu rtog pa'i bag chags la sogs pa'i rgyus 'gag par 'gyur ro //üîΩlen pa'i rnam par shes pa las ni 'dir //
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la yang dag pa ma yin pa kun tu rtog pa'i bag chags la sogs pa'i rgyus 'gag par 'gyur ro // len pa'i rnam par shes pa las ni 'dir //
translated: The foundation consciousness ceases due to the cause of the habitual tendencies of unreal imagination and so on.üîΩFrom the appropriating consciousness

original: shes pa bdun ni skye ba @68b ste //
analyzed: shes pa bdun ni skye ba @68b ste //
translated: The seven consciousnesses arise here.

original: de dag der ni sa bon sogs //
analyzed: de dag der ni sa bon sogs //
translated: They are the cause of the accumulation of seeds,

original: bsags nyid brtas par byed pa ste //
analyzed: bsags nyid brtas par byed pa ste //
translated: and the cause of the growth of the seeds.

original: 'di ni mtshan nyid 'gag pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni mtshan nyid 'gag pa'o //
translated: This is the cessation of characteristics.

original: zhes bya ba ni rang gi mtshan nyid du byas pa 'gag par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rang gi mtshan nyid du byas pa 'gag par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: This is the cessation of the activity of the characteristics.

original: blo gros chen po rgyun 'gag pa ni gang las 'byung ba yin te /
analyzed: blo gros chen po rgyun 'gag pa ni gang las 'byung ba yin te /
translated: MahƒÅmati, the cessation of the continuum is from what?

original: blo gros chen po gang las zhes bya ba ni gang la gnas pa dang / gang la dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: blo gros chen po gang las zhes bya ba ni gang la gnas pa dang / gang la dmigs pa'o //
translated: MahƒÅmati, from what is it? It is from what is the basis and what is the object.

original: gang la gnas pa zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pa la gnas te /
analyzed: gang la gnas pa zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pa la gnas te /
translated: What is the basis? It is the basis in the eyes, etc.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa 'byung ba'o //
translated: The eye consciousness arises.

original: gang la dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa la dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: gang la dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa la dmigs pa'o //
translated: What is the object? It is the object in form, etc.

original: de la gang la gnas pa zhes bya ba ni thog ma med pa'i dus kyi spros pa gnas ngan len gyi bag chags so //
analyzed: de la gang la gnas pa zhes bya ba ni thog ma med pa'i dus kyi spros pa gnas ngan len gyi bag chags so //
translated: There, what is the basis? It is the beginningless time of the bad habit of conceptual proliferation.

original: gang la dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni bdag gi sems snang ba rnam par shes pa'i yul du rnam par rtog pa'o zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gang la dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni bdag gi sems snang ba rnam par shes pa'i yul du rnam par rtog pa'o zhes bya ste /
translated: What is the object? It is the conceptualization of one's own mind's appearances as the object of consciousness.

original: 'khrul pa rnam pa sna tshogs kyi bag chags kyis nang gi mig la sogs pa'i skye mched rnams la nang gi 'bras bu'i nang du go snyod kyi me tog gi snang ba rnams la gnas su kun rtog par byed pa'i rmi lam la sogs pa bzhin du 'dzin
analyzed: 'khrul pa rnam pa sna tshogs kyi bag chags kyis nang gi mig la sogs pa'i skye mched rnams la nang gi 'bras bu'i nang du go snyod kyi me tog gi snang ba rnams la gnas su kun rtog par byed pa'i rmi lam la sogs pa bzhin du 'dzin
translated: The various habitual tendencies of delusion cause the inner sense sources such as the eyes to appear as the inner results, like the appearances of the flowers of the go≈õƒ´r·π£a plant in a dream.

original: pa dang / gzung ba'i bag chags yongs su smin pa'i snang ba ni bdag gi sems snang ba'i yul gyi rnam pa tsam du zad kyi /
analyzed: pa dang / gzung ba'i bag chags yongs su smin pa'i snang ba ni bdag gi sems snang ba'i yul gyi rnam pa tsam du zad kyi /
translated: The appearances that are the fully ripened habitual tendencies of the apprehended are merely the aspects of the objects that appear to one‚Äôs mind.

original: des skye mched gnyis kang yang phyi'i don med pa ni /
analyzed: des skye mched gnyis kang yang phyi'i don med pa ni /
translated: Therefore, the two sense sources are devoid of external objects.üîΩThe Buddha said,

original: gang bdag sa bon las rnam shes //
analyzed: gang bdag sa bon las rnam shes //
translated: ‚ÄúThe consciousness arises from the seed.

original: gang snang rab tu skye ba ste //
analyzed: gang snang rab tu skye ba ste //
translated: Whatever appears is its arising.

original: skye mched rnam pa gnyis par ni //
analyzed: skye mched rnam pa gnyis par ni //
translated: The two kinds of sense sources

original: de dag de yi thub pas gsungs //
analyzed: de dag de yi thub pas gsungs //
translated: are taught to be that by the Sage.‚Äù

original: nang 'khrugs pa'i mthu las 'khrul pa rnam pa sna tshogs la rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: nang 'khrugs pa'i mthu las 'khrul pa rnam pa sna tshogs la rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: There are two kinds of delusion that arise from the power of inner agitation.

original: kha cig gsal ba'i rang bzhin pa ni mgo 'khor ba dang / brgyal ba la sogs pa'i dngos po bzhin no //
analyzed: kha cig gsal ba'i rang bzhin pa ni mgo 'khor ba dang / brgyal ba la sogs pa'i dngos po bzhin no //
translated: Some say that it is of the nature of clarity, like the things that occur in a dizzy spell or a faint.

original: kha cig mi gsal ba ste /
analyzed: kha cig mi gsal ba ste /
translated: Some say that it is not clear,

original: gang rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa yin te /
analyzed: gang rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa yin te /
translated: but is associated with discursive thought.

original: rnam pa gnyis ka yang rmi lam la sogs pa bzhin du snang ngo //
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis ka yang rmi lam la sogs pa bzhin du snang ngo //
translated: Both of these are like dreams, etc.

original: gnas ngan len gyi bag chags ni skyon gyi bag chags te /
analyzed: gnas ngan len gyi bag chags ni skyon gyi bag chags te /
translated: The latent impressions of negative conditioning are the latent impressions of faults.

original: 'khor ba'i gnas su mnyam par 'jog pa med pa'i ma rig par 'gyur ba'i dus yin te /
analyzed: 'khor ba'i gnas su mnyam par 'jog pa med pa'i ma rig par 'gyur ba'i dus yin te /
translated: The time when there is no meditative equipoise in the state of samsara is the time of ignorance.

original: shes rab kyis dpyad pa ni chos dang gang zag la bdag med pa'i kun shes pas ldog go //
analyzed: shes rab kyis dpyad pa ni chos dang gang zag la bdag med pa'i kun shes pas ldog go //
translated: The analysis by means of wisdom is stopped by the complete understanding of the selflessness of phenomena and persons.

original: blo gros chen po 'di lta ste dper na 'jim pa'i rdul bra rab dang 'jim pa'i gong bu gcig pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: blo gros chen po 'di lta ste dper na 'jim pa'i rdul bra rab dang 'jim pa'i gong bu gcig pa yang ma yin /
translated: MahƒÅmati, it is like this: for example, the particles of clay and the lump of clay are not the same,

original: tha dad pa yang ma yin ji ltar @69a * //
analyzed: tha dad pa yang ma yin ji ltar @69a * //
translated: but they are also not different.

original: gser dang rgyan bzhin te /
analyzed: gser dang rgyan bzhin te /
translated: Like gold and ornaments.

original: blo gros chen po ji ste 'dzin pa'i rdul phra rab tha dad pa zhig yin na ni de dag las brtsams pa ma yin par 'gyur na de ni 'jim pa'i rdul phra rab de dag las brtsams pas na de'i phyir tha dad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: blo gros chen po ji ste 'dzin pa'i rdul phra rab tha dad pa zhig yin na ni de dag las brtsams pa ma yin par 'gyur na de ni 'jim pa'i rdul phra rab de dag las brtsams pas na de'i phyir tha dad pa ma yin no //
translated: If, Mahamati, the particles of matter that are grasped were different, they would not be based on them, but since they are based on those particles of matter, therefore they are not different.

original: de ste tha dad pa ma yin na ni 'jim pa'i gong bu dang / rdul phra rab bye brag med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ste tha dad pa ma yin na ni 'jim pa'i gong bu dang / rdul phra rab bye brag med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If they are not different, the lump of clay and the particles of matter would be without distinction.

original: de bzhin du blo gos chen po 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i rigs kyi mtshan nyid dang gal te tha dad pa yin na ni kun gzhi'i rgyu las 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du blo gos chen po 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i rigs kyi mtshan nyid dang gal te tha dad pa yin na ni kun gzhi'i rgyu las 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, Mahamati, if the consciousnesses that engage with objects are different from the characteristic of the nature of the consciousness that is the ground of all, they would not arise from the cause of the ground of all.

original: de ste tha dad ba ma yin na ni 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa 'gags na'ang kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'ang 'gag par 'gyur na zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgya cher ro //
analyzed: de ste tha dad ba ma yin na ni 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa 'gags na'ang kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'ang 'gag par 'gyur na zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgya cher ro //
translated: If they are not different, then when the consciousnesses that engage with objects cease, the consciousness that is the ground of all would also cease.

original: rab tu phra ba'i rdul tshogs par snang ba nyid rim pa gong ma thob na gong bu'i sgrar mngon par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: rab tu phra ba'i rdul tshogs par snang ba nyid rim pa gong ma thob na gong bu'i sgrar mngon par brjod par bya'o //
translated: The appearance of the aggregation of atoms is called a gross object when it is the object of a higher stage.üîΩThe substance of the effect, which is a whole, is composed of parts, like a house, an army, a forest, etc. It is not perceived apart from the aggregation of its parts.

original: 'bras bu'i khyad par yan lag can gyi rdzas ni rdul gyis brtsams pa zhes ji ltar khyad par can dang / ni yi ya yi ka kun tu rtog pa ni khang pa dang / sde dang / nags tshal la sogs pa bzhin du 'dus pa'i yul ma gtogs par de mi dmigs so //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i khyad par yan lag can gyi rdzas ni rdul gyis brtsams pa zhes ji ltar khyad par can dang / ni yi ya yi ka kun tu rtog pa ni khang pa dang / sde dang / nags tshal la sogs pa bzhin du 'dus pa'i yul ma gtogs par de mi dmigs so //
translated: The parts are not outside the whole, just as the waves are not outside the water.üîΩThe parts are not inside the whole, just as the waves are not inside the water.üîΩThe parts are not identical with the whole, just as the waves are not identical with the water.

original: gang dag gis so so'i rim pa'i khyad par yin pa de de dag rang gi rigs las mi 'da' pa ni rgya mtsho mching nam gyi rlabs chu'i rigs las mi 'da' ba bzhin no //üîΩde bzhin du ni chen po'i tshad ni mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pas tshad kyi gzhi la gnas pa med la til gyi 'bru tsam gyi tshad kyi yul du bcad pa nyid ri tsam gyi tshad dam /
analyzed: gang dag gis so so'i rim pa'i khyad par yin pa de de dag rang gi rigs las mi 'da' pa ni rgya mtsho mching nam gyi rlabs chu'i rigs las mi 'da' ba bzhin no //üîΩde bzhin du ni chen po'i tshad ni mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pas tshad kyi gzhi la gnas pa med la til gyi 'bru tsam gyi tshad kyi yul du bcad pa nyid ri tsam gyi tshad dam /
translated: The parts are not different from the whole, just as the waves are not different from the water.üîΩThe parts are not permanent, just as the waves are not permanent.üîΩThe parts are not impermanent, just as the waves are not impermanent.

original: 'on te yul chung du dang yul mang po gnyis kang yang tshad chen po rnams 'byung zhe na ni de'i tshe de'i char 'gyur te yan lag can gyi rdzas pa 'dus pa'i rang bzhin gyi skyon du 'gyur bas na de de ltar shin tu phra ba'i rdul 'dusüîΩpa las gong bu ma yin no //
analyzed: 'on te yul chung du dang yul mang po gnyis kang yang tshad chen po rnams 'byung zhe na ni de'i tshe de'i char 'gyur te yan lag can gyi rdzas pa 'dus pa'i rang bzhin gyi skyon du 'gyur bas na de de ltar shin tu phra ba'i rdul 'dus pa las gong bu ma yin no //
translated: But if you say that the great elements arise from a small object and from many objects, then they would be parts of it, and the fault of the composite nature of the substance of the whole would arise. Therefore, the gross object is not composed of the aggregation of such subtle particles.

original: ji ltar grangs can rnams kun tu rtog par phyogs de dang der lci ba dang / de kha dog ste de dag ma gtogs par rdzas gzhan par mi dmigs pas na de'i phyir phra ba'i rdul tshogs ma gtogs par rdzas gzhan pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar grangs can rnams kun tu rtog par phyogs de dang der lci ba dang / de kha dog ste de dag ma gtogs par rdzas gzhan par mi dmigs pas na de'i phyir phra ba'i rdul tshogs ma gtogs par rdzas gzhan pa ma yin no //
translated: Just as the SƒÅ·πÉkhyas imagine, the gross object is not a different substance from the subtle particles, because apart from heaviness, fluidity, and color, no other substance is observed in that place. Therefore, apart from the aggregation of subtle particles, there is no other substance.

original: rmi lam la sogs pa bzhin du gzhan pa dang / gzhan pa ma yin par yang 'da' bar mi bya bas na khang pa dang / sde dang / tshal la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rmi lam la sogs pa bzhin du gzhan pa dang / gzhan pa ma yin par yang 'da' bar mi bya bas na khang pa dang / sde dang / tshal la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: Like a dream, etc., it is not beyond being different or not different, like a house, an army, a forest, etc.

original: @69b kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i gzung ba'i rnam pa dang 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa'i 'dzin pa'i rnam pa ni thams cad la chud pa'i rang bzhin tha mi dad pa yod pas na thams cad mkhyen pa'i tshad ma kun tu brtags pa kun gzhi la yod
analyzed: @69b kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i gzung ba'i rnam pa dang 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa'i 'dzin pa'i rnam pa ni thams cad la chud pa'i rang bzhin tha mi dad pa yod pas na thams cad mkhyen pa'i tshad ma kun tu brtags pa kun gzhi la yod
translated: The aspect of the apprehended of the foundation consciousness and the aspect of the apprehender of the active consciousnesses are not different natures that pervade everything, so the omniscient valid knowledge that imputes the foundation consciousness does not exist.

original: do // ji ltar gsungs pa /üîΩji ltar sa bon rkyen las myu gu ste //
analyzed: do // ji ltar gsungs pa / ji ltar sa bon rkyen las myu gu ste //
translated: As it is said:üîΩFrom a seed, a sprout arises,

original: sa bon gang yin myu gu de nyid min //
analyzed: sa bon gang yin myu gu de nyid min //
translated: but the seed is not the sprout.

original: de las gzhan min de nyid kyang ma yin //
analyzed: de las gzhan min de nyid kyang ma yin //
translated: It is not different from it, nor is it that itself.

original: de ltar chad med rtog med stong nyid do //
analyzed: de ltar chad med rtog med stong nyid do //
translated: Thus, it is not annihilated, not imputed, and empty.

original: ji ltar rdul 'dus pa las snang ba las //
analyzed: ji ltar rdul 'dus pa las snang ba las //
translated: Just as from a collection of atoms, an appearance arises,

original: sa'i gong bu gcig pa dang tha dad pa mi rung ba de bzhin du kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ma gtogs par mig la sogs pa 'jug pa'i shes pa gcig pa'i tha dad par yang mi rung ngo //
analyzed: sa'i gong bu gcig pa dang tha dad pa mi rung ba de bzhin du kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ma gtogs par mig la sogs pa 'jug pa'i shes pa gcig pa'i tha dad par yang mi rung ngo //
translated: just as it is not tenable that a single mass of earth is the same as or different from that, so too it is not tenable that the active consciousnesses such as the eye consciousness are the same as or different from the foundation consciousness.

original: rmi lam gyi dus na rnam par shes pa gcig po nyid yul dang yul can rnam pa du mar 'dzin pa dang / gzung ba'i dngos po der tha dad pa dang / tha dad pa ma yin par dpyad par mi rung ngo //
analyzed: rmi lam gyi dus na rnam par shes pa gcig po nyid yul dang yul can rnam pa du mar 'dzin pa dang / gzung ba'i dngos po der tha dad pa dang / tha dad pa ma yin par dpyad par mi rung ngo //
translated: At the time of dreams, it is not appropriate to analyze whether the single consciousness apprehends the many aspects of object and subject, or whether the apprehended thing is different or not different from that.

original: ji srid du 'khor ba'i gnas yod pa de srid du bdag dang gzhan gyi rgyud kyi dbang las skyes pa nang glongs shing mnyam par mi 'jog pa'i ma rig pas mgo 'khor ba dang / brgyal ba la sogs pa bzhin du sems can rnams la rnam pa sna tshogs kyi sems sbyor bar byed do //
analyzed: ji srid du 'khor ba'i gnas yod pa de srid du bdag dang gzhan gyi rgyud kyi dbang las skyes pa nang glongs shing mnyam par mi 'jog pa'i ma rig pas mgo 'khor ba dang / brgyal ba la sogs pa bzhin du sems can rnams la rnam pa sna tshogs kyi sems sbyor bar byed do //
translated: As long as there is a basis for cyclic existence, consciousness is engaged in various ways in sentient beings, due to the power of the continuum of self and other, through ignorance that is not pacified and not in equipoise, like one who is dizzy or unconscious and so on.

original: gang gi tshe shes rab kyis dpyad de shes par bya ba sbom po dang / phra mo rnam par phye ste mi dmigs pas de dag mi gnyis par 'gyur ba de'i tsho dngos po dang / dngos po med par rnam par mi rtog cing /
analyzed: gang gi tshe shes rab kyis dpyad de shes par bya ba sbom po dang / phra mo rnam par phye ste mi dmigs pas de dag mi gnyis par 'gyur ba de'i tsho dngos po dang / dngos po med par rnam par mi rtog cing /
translated: When one analyzes with wisdom, coarse and subtle objects of knowledge are distinguished and not observed, and they become nondual. At that time, one is free from conceptualization of things and nonthings.

original: bsam pa dang bral ba dang / yang dag par rig pa tsam du gdon mi za bar bdag nyid kyis gnas so //
analyzed: bsam pa dang bral ba dang / yang dag par rig pa tsam du gdon mi za bar bdag nyid kyis gnas so //
translated: It is free from conceptualization, and it is indubitably the mere awareness of reality.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i rigs gcig dang 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa so sor snang ba tsam gyis gnas dang gnas pa can gyi dngos por dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i rigs gcig dang 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa so sor snang ba tsam gyis gnas dang gnas pa can gyi dngos por dgongs pa'o //
translated: The omniscient one has in mind the fact that the store-consciousness and the actual consciousnesses are the same kind of consciousness, and that the objective referent and the consciousness are merely the appearance of each other.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa dang / 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams kyis yang rnam pa tha dad par dmigs pa'i phyir der snang ba rnams la tha dad pa med pa ma yin te /
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa dang / 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams kyis yang rnam pa tha dad par dmigs pa'i phyir der snang ba rnams la tha dad pa med pa ma yin te /
translated: The store-consciousness and the actual consciousnesses are perceived as different, and therefore the appearances as the objective referent and the consciousness are not undifferentiated.

original: ji ltar slob dpon dharma k'irtis smras pa /
analyzed: ji ltar slob dpon dharma k'irtis smras pa /
translated: As ƒÄcƒÅrya DharmƒÅkara says:

original: gzhan la gzhan du 'grib pa yang //
analyzed: gzhan la gzhan du 'grib pa yang //
translated: The other is not the other,

original: dbyer med min te gzugs mthong phyir //
analyzed: dbyer med min te gzugs mthong phyir //
translated: because they are not undifferentiated, since form is seen.

original: rang bzhin tha dad mi mthong bas //
analyzed: rang bzhin tha dad mi mthong bas //
translated: Since the nature is not seen to be different,

original: blos ni tha dad mi rtogs so //üîΩdngos po gang gis @70a * //
analyzed: blos ni tha dad mi rtogs so // dngos po gang gis @70a * //
translated: the mind does not perceive a difference.üîΩThe thing

original: brtag bya ba //
analyzed: brtag bya ba //
translated: by which one is to be examined

original: de gzugs yang dag yod ma yin //
analyzed: de gzugs yang dag yod ma yin //
translated: does not exist as the real form.

original: gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin du //
analyzed: gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin du //
translated: Nor is it of the nature of one or many.üîΩ

original: de dag yod pa ma yin phyir //
analyzed: de dag yod pa ma yin phyir //
translated: Because they do not existüîΩAs having the nature of one or many.

original: 'on kun gzhi rnam par shes pa dang 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa gcig yin no zhes de ltar dogs nas thams cad mkhyen pas gsungs pa de ste tha dad pa ma yin na ni zhes te /
analyzed: 'on kun gzhi rnam par shes pa dang 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa gcig yin no zhes de ltar dogs nas thams cad mkhyen pas gsungs pa de ste tha dad pa ma yin na ni zhes te /
translated: If the foundation consciousness and the active consciousnesses were not different,

original: de'i tshe 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa 'gags na kun gzhi rnam par shes pa 'ang 'gag par 'gyur na /
analyzed: de'i tshe 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa 'gags na kun gzhi rnam par shes pa 'ang 'gag par 'gyur na /
translated: then when the active consciousnesses ceased, the foundation consciousness would also cease.

original: de ltar bdag gi rigs kyi mtshan nyid 'gag par yang mi 'gyur te zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar bdag gi rigs kyi mtshan nyid 'gag par yang mi 'gyur te zhes bya'o //
translated: But it is not the case that the characteristics of the class of the self cease.

original: de bas na slob dpon dharma k'irtis 'di skad du smras pa /
analyzed: de bas na slob dpon dharma k'irtis 'di skad du smras pa /
translated: Therefore, the master Dharmottara said:

original: gzhan du dngos po gcig po la //
analyzed: gzhan du dngos po gcig po la //
translated: In another way, in one thing

original: rnam grangs gzugs ni snang ba can //
analyzed: rnam grangs gzugs ni snang ba can //
translated: The enumeration of forms appears.

original: rnam pa bden par ji ltar rung //
analyzed: rnam pa bden par ji ltar rung //
translated: How can the aspects be real?

original: de yis gcig pa 'grib med do //
analyzed: de yis gcig pa 'grib med do //
translated: By that, the one is not diminished.

original: yang dag rig pa'i rigs kyi mtshan nyid de'i gcig pa yang 'grib par mi 'gyur ro zhes thams cad mkhyen pas dgongs pa'i don du brtag go //
analyzed: yang dag rig pa'i rigs kyi mtshan nyid de'i gcig pa yang 'grib par mi 'gyur ro zhes thams cad mkhyen pas dgongs pa'i don du brtag go //
translated: The characteristic of the family of the perfect knowledge is that it is not diminished by the one.

original: lus dang longs spyod gnas snang ba //
analyzed: lus dang longs spyod gnas snang ba //
translated: The body, the enjoyments, the place, and the light

original: kun gzhi kun tu 'byung ba ste //üîΩrnam brgyad rnam dgu de bzhin du //
analyzed: kun gzhi kun tu 'byung ba ste // rnam brgyad rnam dgu de bzhin du //
translated: are the alaya, the universal ground.

original: rgya mtsho rlabs rnams bzhin du'o //
analyzed: rgya mtsho rlabs rnams bzhin du'o //
translated: The eight and the nine are like the waves of the ocean.

original: rmi lam gyi dus na kun tu rig pa tsam gcig pa nyid rnam pa mang po'i yul dang yul can du 'dzin pa dang / gzung ba'i dngos po rnam par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: rmi lam gyi dus na kun tu rig pa tsam gcig pa nyid rnam pa mang po'i yul dang yul can du 'dzin pa dang / gzung ba'i dngos po rnam par 'byung ngo //
translated: In the state of a dream, the one, the mere awareness, is the many, the subject and object of apprehension, and the apprehended things arise.

original: de de ltar chud pa'i phyir khyab pa yin gyi der gzugs las bya ba'i yul dang / mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams kyang med la /
analyzed: de de ltar chud pa'i phyir khyab pa yin gyi der gzugs las bya ba'i yul dang / mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams kyang med la /
translated: Because it is like that, it is all-pervading, but there is no object of action for the eye consciousnesses and so forth in that place.

original: der lus dang longs spyod blo myang ba la sogs pa'i kun tu tshor ba med de 'on kyang so sor snang ba de bzhin du gnyid kyis ma log pa'i dus na yang /
analyzed: der lus dang longs spyod blo myang ba la sogs pa'i kun tu tshor ba med de 'on kyang so sor snang ba de bzhin du gnyid kyis ma log pa'i dus na yang /
translated: There is no feeling of the body, wealth, mind, and so on, but nevertheless, just as they appear individually, so it is at the time of not being asleep.

original: rnam pa sna tshogs su nang 'khrugs pa dang / ma rig pa dang / 'gyur ba'i mthu las rnam pa sna tshogs su 'khrul ba'i rnam pa rnams la tha dad pa dang / tha dad pa ma yin par kun tu tshol bar gyur ba shes rab kyis dpyad pa na stong zhing mig gnyis pa nyid gnas so zhes thams cad mkhyen pas dgongs pa'i don du brtag go //
analyzed: rnam pa sna tshogs su nang 'khrugs pa dang / ma rig pa dang / 'gyur ba'i mthu las rnam pa sna tshogs su 'khrul ba'i rnam pa rnams la tha dad pa dang / tha dad pa ma yin par kun tu tshol bar gyur ba shes rab kyis dpyad pa na stong zhing mig gnyis pa nyid gnas so zhes thams cad mkhyen pas dgongs pa'i don du brtag go //
translated: When one investigates with wisdom, the various internal disturbances, the various appearances of delusion due to the power of ignorance and change, whether they are different or not, are empty and remain as mere appearances. This should be understood as the intended meaning of the Omniscient One.

original: rigs kyi mtshan nyid kyi rnam par shes pa 'gag par mi 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: rigs kyi mtshan nyid kyi rnam par shes pa 'gag par mi 'gyur gyi /
translated: The consciousness characterized by the lineage does not cease.

original: las kyi mtshan nyid ni 'gag go zhes pa ni so sor rig pa'i rjes su mthun pas rnam par shes pa'i rgyun kha cig 'chad pa med par 'khor bar 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: las kyi mtshan nyid ni 'gag go zhes pa ni so sor rig pa'i rjes su mthun pas rnam par shes pa'i rgyun kha cig 'chad pa med par 'khor bar 'jug pa'o //
translated: The characteristic of karma ceases. This is the uninterrupted engagement in cyclic existence of some continuums of consciousness, in accordance with the individual experiences.

original: @70b skyes ma thag pa'i shes rab la sogs pa'i khyad par kun gyis dmigs su yod de /
analyzed: @70b skyes ma thag pa'i shes rab la sogs pa'i khyad par kun gyis dmigs su yod de /
translated: The difference between the wisdom that arises immediately and so forth is observed by everyone.

original: de bas na sngar thos pa dang / sems pa la sogs pas sbyangs par rjes su dpag go //
analyzed: de bas na sngar thos pa dang / sems pa la sogs pas sbyangs par rjes su dpag go //
translated: Therefore, it is inferred that one is trained by previous learning, reflection, and so forth.

original: byung ba rnams ni med pa nyid de /
analyzed: byung ba rnams ni med pa nyid de /
translated: The past is non-existent.

original: yod du zin kyang dran pa med pa na de dag gis sbyong bar mi rung ste /
analyzed: yod du zin kyang dran pa med pa na de dag gis sbyong bar mi rung ste /
translated: Even if it existed, if there is no memory, it is not suitable for those to train.

original: de'i phyir sngon gyi goms pa dang ldan pa'i ye shes kyi rgyud 'byung ba yod pas rjes su dpag go //
analyzed: de'i phyir sngon gyi goms pa dang ldan pa'i ye shes kyi rgyud 'byung ba yod pas rjes su dpag go //
translated: Therefore, it is inferred that the continuum of wisdom endowed with previous habituation exists because it arises.

original: las kyi mtshan nyid 'gag pa ni mngon sum gyi mtshan ma nyid do //
analyzed: las kyi mtshan nyid 'gag pa ni mngon sum gyi mtshan ma nyid do //
translated: The cessation of the characteristics of karma is the characteristic of direct perception.

original: las kyi mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni de kun gzhi rnam par shes pas 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa'o zhes bsam pas dbye bar byed de /
analyzed: las kyi mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni de kun gzhi rnam par shes pas 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa'o zhes bsam pas dbye bar byed de /
translated: The so-called characteristics of karma are the consciousnesses that engage that all-ground consciousness.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa de dang rgyun 'brel bar gnas te /
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa de dang rgyun 'brel bar gnas te /
translated: That all-ground consciousness abides in continuity with that.

original: de gser bzhin du rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba rkyen gyi bye brag gi mthus dri ma'i rnam pa lta bu de dang de dag chud pa nang 'byed pa'o //
analyzed: de gser bzhin du rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba rkyen gyi bye brag gi mthus dri ma'i rnam pa lta bu de dang de dag chud pa nang 'byed pa'o //
translated: Like gold, it is naturally luminous, and the various stains are like impurities that are removed by the power of specific conditions.

original: de la mtshan nyid kyis tha mi dad par gyur pas na de'i phyir nang glongs shing mnyam par mi 'jog pa'i ma rig pa dang las rnam par smin pa'i mthu las las kyi mtshan nyid mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa skyes nas de dag chad par
analyzed: de la mtshan nyid kyis tha mi dad par gyur pas na de'i phyir nang glongs shing mnyam par mi 'jog pa'i ma rig pa dang las rnam par smin pa'i mthu las las kyi mtshan nyid mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa skyes nas de dag chad par
translated: Since it is not different from the characteristics of the mind, the ignorance of internal contraction and non-equipoise and the power of the ripening of karma give rise to the eye consciousness and so on, which have the characteristics of karma.üîΩThey are cut off,

original: 'gyur ro // de dag chad par gyur kyang don dam pa kun gzhi rnam par shes pa chad pa med do //
analyzed: 'gyur ro // de dag chad par gyur kyang don dam pa kun gzhi rnam par shes pa chad pa med do //
translated: but the ultimate ƒÅlaya consciousness is not cut off.

original: de'i phyir blo gros chen po rnam par shes pa rnams kyi rang gi rigs kyi mtshan nyid 'gag par mi 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir blo gros chen po rnam par shes pa rnams kyi rang gi rigs kyi mtshan nyid 'gag par mi 'gyur gyi /
translated: Therefore, MahƒÅmati, the characteristics of the individual classes of consciousness do not cease,üîΩbut the characteristics of karma cease.

original: las kyi mtshan nyid ni 'gag go zhes pa gser rgyun du 'byung ba lta bu'i kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la yongs su zad pa med de /
analyzed: las kyi mtshan nyid ni 'gag go zhes pa gser rgyun du 'byung ba lta bu'i kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la yongs su zad pa med de /
translated: The ƒÅlaya consciousness, which is like a flowing river, is not completely exhausted.

original: dri ma'i rim pa 'ba' zhig lta bu'i mig la sogs pa 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams myur du skye zhing 'jig pa ste /
analyzed: dri ma'i rim pa 'ba' zhig lta bu'i mig la sogs pa 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams myur du skye zhing 'jig pa ste /
translated: The eye consciousness, etc., which are like the stages of defilement, arise and perish quickly.

original: skad cig pa kha cig ni rgyun du gnas so //
analyzed: skad cig pa kha cig ni rgyun du gnas so //
translated: Some are momentary, but some remain in a continuum.

original: kha cig ni skad cig pa nyid du 'jig pa ste /
analyzed: kha cig ni skad cig pa nyid du 'jig pa ste /
translated: Some are destroyed in the moment itself,

original: chu gzhung du 'bab pa dang / mig gi mchi ma bzhin no //
analyzed: chu gzhung du 'bab pa dang / mig gi mchi ma bzhin no //
translated: like a river flowing into the ocean, or like tears on a face.

original: gal te gcig rgyun du gnas par mi 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te gcig rgyun du gnas par mi 'gyur na /
translated: If they did not remain in a continuum,

original: de'i tshe sngon myangs pa dran par yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i tshe sngon myangs pa dran par yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: then there would be no memory of what was experienced in the past.

original: skyes ma thag pa'i shes rab la sogs pa'i khyad par med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skyes ma thag pa'i shes rab la sogs pa'i khyad par med par 'gyur ro //
translated: There would be no difference between the consciousness of a newborn infant and that of a sage.

original: blang ba dang / dor ba dang / btang snyoms kyi blo rnams la bde ba dang / sdug bsngal bsgrub pa gdon mi za bar sngar yod pa'i phyir skyes ma thag pa rnams kyi rga ba dang / 'jig pa dang / mya ngan gyi rtog pa rnams yul kha cig tu dmigs su @71a * //
analyzed: blang ba dang / dor ba dang / btang snyoms kyi blo rnams la bde ba dang / sdug bsngal bsgrub pa gdon mi za bar sngar yod pa'i phyir skyes ma thag pa rnams kyi rga ba dang / 'jig pa dang / mya ngan gyi rtog pa rnams yul kha cig tu dmigs su @71a * //
translated: Since the mind of acceptance, rejection, and indifference would necessarily be established in pleasure and pain, the ideas of old age, destruction, and sorrow of the newborn would be perceived in some place.

original: yod de / des na rgyun du gnas pa'i rnam par shes pa la snga ma dang phyi mar ldan pa'i sngon gyi goms pa yod pas na thos pa dang / sems pa la sogs pa 'du byed kyis shes rab kyi khyad par du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yod de / des na rgyun du gnas pa'i rnam par shes pa la snga ma dang phyi mar ldan pa'i sngon gyi goms pa yod pas na thos pa dang / sems pa la sogs pa 'du byed kyis shes rab kyi khyad par du 'gyur ro //
translated: Yes, it does, because the consciousness that endures has the previous and later moments, and because of the previous practice, there is a difference in wisdom due to the formative forces of hearing, reflection, and so on.

original: rgyu las zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni mu stegs can gyis rtag pa dang / kun du brtags pa ni ma skyes pas na de med pa'i phyir rgyur mi rung ste /üîΩde ji ltar ni yi ya yi ka khyad par can kun du rtog pa /
analyzed: rgyu las zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni mu stegs can gyis rtag pa dang / kun du brtags pa ni ma skyes pas na de med pa'i phyir rgyur mi rung ste / de ji ltar ni yi ya yi ka khyad par can kun du rtog pa /
translated: The non-Buddhist schools say that the cause is permanent and the imagined is unproduced, so it is not suitable as a cause because it does not exist.

original: dbang po'i byin gyis bdag dang yid kun tu sbyor ba las shes pa skye'o zhes so //
analyzed: dbang po'i byin gyis bdag dang yid kun tu sbyor ba las shes pa skye'o zhes so //
translated: How is that? The special imagination of the non-Buddhists is that consciousness arises from the conjunction of the self, the sense faculties, and the mind.

original: grangs can kun du rtog pa ni sems can dang / rdul dang / mun pa mnyam pa'i dus na gtso bo yin no //
analyzed: grangs can kun du rtog pa ni sems can dang / rdul dang / mun pa mnyam pa'i dus na gtso bo yin no //
translated: The imagination of the SƒÅ·πÉkhya is that when the living being, rajas, and tamas are in equilibrium, it is prakrti.

original: de la chen po 'byung zhes te /
analyzed: de la chen po 'byung zhes te /
translated: From that, mahat arises.

original: de ni blo'i rnam grangs so //
analyzed: de ni blo'i rnam grangs so //
translated: That is a synonym for buddhi.

original: de de ltar sems pa med pa'i rtag pa rnam par shes pa rnams kyi rgyu yin par mu stegs can rnams kun tu rtog go //
analyzed: de de ltar sems pa med pa'i rtag pa rnam par shes pa rnams kyi rgyu yin par mu stegs can rnams kun tu rtog go //
translated: The tƒ´rthikas imagine that it is the cause of the consciousnesses, which are permanent and devoid of thought.

original: de ltar yang gal te thog ma dang / tha ma'i rgyun yon tan dang ldan pa thos pa dang / sems pa la sogs pa'i shes rab kyi khyad par can gyi dngos po 'ga' zhig med par gyur na ni de'i tshe yon tan mngon par 'dus byas kyang rtag pa'i rgyus khyad par du mi 'gyur ba de nyid do //
analyzed: de ltar yang gal te thog ma dang / tha ma'i rgyun yon tan dang ldan pa thos pa dang / sems pa la sogs pa'i shes rab kyi khyad par can gyi dngos po 'ga' zhig med par gyur na ni de'i tshe yon tan mngon par 'dus byas kyang rtag pa'i rgyus khyad par du mi 'gyur ba de nyid do //
translated: If, in this way, there were no special thing that is the cause of the beginning and end of the continuum, such as hearing, reflection, and so on, then even if one cultivates qualities, because the cause is permanent, there would be no difference.

original: sngon gyi goms pas khyad par can du byas pa'i chud pa grags par yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: sngon gyi goms pas khyad par can du byas pa'i chud pa grags par yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: Also, the special thing that is produced by prior habituation would not be renowned.

original: de bas na gtso bo dang / skyes bu dang / dbang po dang / dus dang / rdul phra mor smra bar mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de bas na gtso bo dang / skyes bu dang / dbang po dang / dus dang / rdul phra mor smra bar mi rung ngo //
translated: Therefore it is not tenable to propound a primal matter, a person, a sense faculty, time, or a subtle particle.

original: gtso bo rtag cing gcig par rang bzhin du ma pa dang / rig sngags 'dzin pa mthar smra ba'i skyes bu kun brtags pa yang mi rung ngo //üîΩgnyis pa dang mi gnyis par smra ba po rnams kyi dbang po rgyur kun tu brtags pa yang 'dod chags dang bral ba'am /
analyzed: gtso bo rtag cing gcig par rang bzhin du ma pa dang / rig sngags 'dzin pa mthar smra ba'i skyes bu kun brtags pa yang mi rung ngo // gnyis pa dang mi gnyis par smra ba po rnams kyi dbang po rgyur kun tu brtags pa yang 'dod chags dang bral ba'am /
translated: It is not tenable that the primal matter is permanent, one, and the cause of all, nor is it tenable that the person who holds the spells is the creator.üîΩThe assertion that the creator is the sense faculties is also untenable.

original: 'dod chags dang bcas pa'ang rung ste /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bcas pa'ang rung ste /
translated: Whether one is free from attachment or not,

original: rgyur mi rung ngo //
analyzed: rgyur mi rung ngo //
translated: it is not tenable that the sense faculties are the cause.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba zhig na ni gzhan sdug bsngal bar byas pas dgos pa ci yod /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba zhig na ni gzhan sdug bsngal bar byas pas dgos pa ci yod /
translated: If one is free from attachment, what is the point of causing others to suffer?

original: 'dod chags dang ma bral ba zhig na ni bdag rang mi shes pas 'dod chags kyi bdag nyid sdug bsngal bar 'gyur ba ni phrad pa las bral na sdug bsngal thams cad du bskyed pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang ma bral ba zhig na ni bdag rang mi shes pas 'dod chags kyi bdag nyid sdug bsngal bar 'gyur ba ni phrad pa las bral na sdug bsngal thams cad du bskyed pa yin no //
translated: If one is not free from attachment, then since one does not know oneself, one would be suffering due to attachment.üîΩWhat kind of creator is that?

original: de'i dbang phyug ji lta bu zhig / gal te bsod nams kyi stobs las dbang por byung na ni de'i tshe dbang por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i dbang phyug ji lta bu zhig / gal te bsod nams kyi stobs las dbang por byung na ni de'i tshe dbang por 'gyur ro //
translated: If the sense faculties arise from the power of merit, then at that time they would be the creator.

original: 'on te rgyu med pa las dbang por byung na ni de'i tshe thams cad kyang dbang por 'gyur gyi @71b gcig pu nyid dbang po ma yin no //
analyzed: 'on te rgyu med pa las dbang por byung na ni de'i tshe thams cad kyang dbang por 'gyur gyi @71b gcig pu nyid dbang po ma yin no //
translated: But if the sense faculty arises without a cause, then everything would be a sense faculty, and not just one thing.

original: dus kyang dngos po'i rgyun ma gtogs par med pa dang / rdul phra mo rnams kyang rgyur mi rung ste /
analyzed: dus kyang dngos po'i rgyun ma gtogs par med pa dang / rdul phra mo rnams kyang rgyur mi rung ste /
translated: Time does not exist apart from the continuum of things, and subtle particles are not suitable as causes.

original: thos pas nang sems pa la sogs pa'i 'du byed kyis sngar byas pa'i 'bras bu shes rab la sogs pa byung ba glen pa rnams las ji ltar 'byung /
analyzed: thos pas nang sems pa la sogs pa'i 'du byed kyis sngar byas pa'i 'bras bu shes rab la sogs pa byung ba glen pa rnams las ji ltar 'byung /
translated: The result of the prior action of hearing, reflection, and so on, such as wisdom, arises from the foolish, but how could it arise from them?

original: gang dag yang tshangs pa dang dbang po la sogs pa'i 'gyur bar 'dod pa de dag la grol ba dang / ma grol ba dang / phyug dbul la sogs pa gcig pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang dag yang tshangs pa dang dbang po la sogs pa'i 'gyur bar 'dod pa de dag la grol ba dang / ma grol ba dang / phyug dbul la sogs pa gcig pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro //
translated: Those who assert that Brahma, Ishvara, and so on are the cause of the world would incur the error that the liberated, the nonliberated, the wealthy, the poor, and so on are the same.

original: gnyis par smra ba yang lus dang / byed pa dang / gnas la sogs pa rnams kyi dbyibs kyis khyad par yod pa'i phyir blo tsam gyi skyes bus thog mar byas zhes pa ni byed pa pos thog mar byas pa'i rnam pa ji lta bu'i dbyibs su bzung ba de'i rnam par de lta bur gzung ba med de /
analyzed: gnyis par smra ba yang lus dang / byed pa dang / gnas la sogs pa rnams kyi dbyibs kyis khyad par yod pa'i phyir blo tsam gyi skyes bus thog mar byas zhes pa ni byed pa pos thog mar byas pa'i rnam pa ji lta bu'i dbyibs su bzung ba de'i rnam par de lta bur gzung ba med de /
translated: The creator is the one who first creates the shape, and the shape is apprehended as it is apprehended.

original: nga lha khang la sogs pa la byed pa po thig 'dzin pa la sogs par chud par byed kyi /
analyzed: nga lha khang la sogs pa la byed pa po thig 'dzin pa la sogs par chud par byed kyi /
translated: The creator is the one who creates the temple and so on, and the one who measures the lines and so on.

original: bye ma dang / ri dang / ri bo dang / shing la sogs pa'i dbyibs la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bye ma dang / ri dang / ri bo dang / shing la sogs pa'i dbyibs la ni ma yin no //
translated: The shape of sand, mountains, rocks, trees, and so on is not.

original: dbyibs kyi chos dang bcas pas dbyibs dang mthun pa tsam las rigs kyi khyad par dbye na rjes su mthun pa dang / mi mthun pas gang la de'i bdag nyid dang / de las skyes par 'brel bar bzung ba de nyid rgyur rigs te /
analyzed: dbyibs kyi chos dang bcas pas dbyibs dang mthun pa tsam las rigs kyi khyad par dbye na rjes su mthun pa dang / mi mthun pas gang la de'i bdag nyid dang / de las skyes par 'brel bar bzung ba de nyid rgyur rigs te /
translated: If the shape is distinguished by the property of shape, then the mere conformity with the shape is the cause, and the distinction of type is reasonable.

original: de lta bas na mu stegs can rtag pa dang chad par smra ba rnams las bde bar gshegs pa rgyun smra ba'i khyad par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na mu stegs can rtag pa dang chad par smra ba rnams las bde bar gshegs pa rgyun smra ba'i khyad par rig par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the Well-Gone One should be known as distinct from the tƒ´rthikas who propound eternalism and nihilism, as the one who teaches continuity.

original: gzhan yang blo gros chen po dngos po'i rang bzhin bdun yod de /
analyzed: gzhan yang blo gros chen po dngos po'i rang bzhin bdun yod de /
translated: Moreover, MahƒÅmati, there are seven kinds of natures of things.

original: 'di ltar 'du ba dngos po'i rang bzhin dang / dngos po'i rang bzhin gyi dngos po dang / mtshan nyid kyi dngos po dang / 'byung ba chen po'i rang bzhin gyi dngos po dang / zhing gi dngos po dang / rgyu rkyen gyi dngos po dang /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'du ba dngos po'i rang bzhin dang / dngos po'i rang bzhin gyi dngos po dang / mtshan nyid kyi dngos po dang / 'byung ba chen po'i rang bzhin gyi dngos po dang / zhing gi dngos po dang / rgyu rkyen gyi dngos po dang /
translated: They are: the nature of things that is a collection, the nature of things that is a thing, the nature of things that is a characteristic, the nature of things that is the nature of the great elements, the nature of things that is a field, the nature of things that is a cause and condition,

original: 'grub pa'i dngos po ste bdun no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'grub pa'i dngos po ste bdun no zhes bya ba la /
translated: and the nature of things that is an accomplishment.

original: 'du ba dngos po'i rang bzhin ni kun 'byung gi rnam par ma rig pa dang / las te de'i rgyu las che'o //
analyzed: 'du ba dngos po'i rang bzhin ni kun 'byung gi rnam par ma rig pa dang / las te de'i rgyu las che'o //
translated: The nature of things that is a collection is the cause of the arising of ignorance and karma.

original: de la ma rig par bdag tu chags pa'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: de la ma rig par bdag tu chags pa'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: Among them, ignorance has the characteristic of attachment to self.

original: ma rig pas nor nas mnyam par mi 'jog pa'i sems la mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med pa dang / mi mdzes pa rnams la rtag pa dang / bdag dang / bde ba dang / gtsang ba'i phyin ci log tu gyur pa de de lta bu'i 'khrul pa ni ma rig pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ma rig pas nor nas mnyam par mi 'jog pa'i sems la mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med pa dang / mi mdzes pa rnams la rtag pa dang / bdag dang / bde ba dang / gtsang ba'i phyin ci log tu gyur pa de de lta bu'i 'khrul pa ni ma rig pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The mind that is not in equipoise due to error caused by ignorance, with regard to impermanence, suffering, non-self, and the ugly, is in error with regard to permanence, self, pleasure, and purity. This error is called ignorance.

original: @72a * // de'i rgyu las sdug bsngal gyi mtshan nyid kyi phung po 'phungs pa ni dngos po'i rang bzhin gyi dngos po'o //
analyzed: @72a * // de'i rgyu las sdug bsngal gyi mtshan nyid kyi phung po 'phungs pa ni dngos po'i rang bzhin gyi dngos po'o //
translated: The projection of the aggregates, which have the characteristic of suffering, due to that cause, is the entity of the nature of things.

original: mtshan nyid kyi dngos po ni yang sa bon dang ldan par rtag go //
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyi dngos po ni yang sa bon dang ldan par rtag go //
translated: The entity of characteristics is always endowed with seeds.

original: 'byung ba chen po'i rang bzhin gyi dngos po ni sa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po'i rang bzhin gyi dngos po ni sa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The entity of the nature of the great elements is earth, etc.

original: sra ba dang / rlan pa dang / dro ba dang ; g-yo ba'i bdag nyid du snang ba'o //
analyzed: sra ba dang / rlan pa dang / dro ba dang ; g-yo ba'i bdag nyid du snang ba'o //
translated: It appears as the nature of solidity, fluidity, heat, and motion.

original: zhing gi dngos po ni 'jig rten chags pa'o //
analyzed: zhing gi dngos po ni 'jig rten chags pa'o //
translated: The entity of the field is the formation of the world.

original: rgyu rkyen gyi dngos po ni gang rgyu'i'o //
analyzed: rgyu rkyen gyi dngos po ni gang rgyu'i'o //
translated: The entity of cause and condition is that which is the cause.

original: 'grub pa'i dngos po ni gang de las 'grub pa'o //
analyzed: 'grub pa'i dngos po ni gang de las 'grub pa'o //
translated: The thing that is accomplished is that from which it is accomplished.

original: sems brten cing 'brel te 'byung bar rtag pa'i don du kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i rnam par gzhag pa ni mngon par shes pa skyes pa rnams nyid mkhyen te /
analyzed: sems brten cing 'brel te 'byung bar rtag pa'i don du kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i rnam par gzhag pa ni mngon par shes pa skyes pa rnams nyid mkhyen te /
translated: The establishment of the thoroughly afflicted and the completely purified is known by those who have generated the superknowledges in the sense of the permanence of dependent origination.

original: bdag gi sgra'i rjes su 'brang ba'i tshad ma can no //
analyzed: bdag gi sgra'i rjes su 'brang ba'i tshad ma can no //
translated: The one who has the valid knowledge that follows after the word ‚Äúself.‚Äù

original: blo gros chen po gzhan yang don dam pa bdun te /
analyzed: blo gros chen po gzhan yang don dam pa bdun te /
translated: Moreover, MahƒÅmati, there are seven ultimates:

original: 'di ltar sems kyi spyod yul dang / shes rab kyi spyod yul dang / lta ba nyid kyi spyod yul dang / lta ba gnyis las 'das pa'i spyod yul dang / snang ba med pa'i spyod yul dang / sras kyis las 'das pa'i spyod yul dang /
analyzed: 'di ltar sems kyi spyod yul dang / shes rab kyi spyod yul dang / lta ba nyid kyi spyod yul dang / lta ba gnyis las 'das pa'i spyod yul dang / snang ba med pa'i spyod yul dang / sras kyis las 'das pa'i spyod yul dang /
translated: the domain of mind, the domain of wisdom, the domain of mere view, the domain of transcending the two views, the domain of nonappearance, the domain of transcending the stage of a son,üîΩand the domain of the tathƒÅgatas‚Äô individual self-cognizance.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i so so rang gis rig pa'i spyod yul te zhes bya bar sems kyi spyod yul ni /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i so so rang gis rig pa'i spyod yul te zhes bya bar sems kyi spyod yul ni /
translated: The domain of mind is as follows:

original: sems ni kun gzhi rnam par shes //
analyzed: sems ni kun gzhi rnam par shes //
translated: Mind is the all-base consciousness.

original: ngar sems nyid ni yid yin no //
analyzed: ngar sems nyid ni yid yin no //
translated: The mind that thinks ‚ÄúI‚Äù is the intellect.

original: gang gis yul rnams 'dzin pa ni //
analyzed: gang gis yul rnams 'dzin pa ni //
translated: That which apprehends objects

original: de ni rnam par shes zhes bya //üîΩzhes pa ste /
analyzed: de ni rnam par shes zhes bya // zhes pa ste /
translated: is called consciousness.

original: dri ma dang bcas pa dang / dri ma med pa'i dus kyi sems la 'khor ba dang / rnam par grol ba'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: dri ma dang bcas pa dang / dri ma med pa'i dus kyi sems la 'khor ba dang / rnam par grol ba'i rim pa'o //
translated: The mind, whether it is defiled or undefiled, is the process of cyclic existence or of liberation.üîΩConsciousness is the appearance of the duality of object and subject, which is to say, the appearance of form, etc. ,

original: rnam par shes pa yang mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa gzugs la sogs pa gnyis kyi rnam par snang ba ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa yang mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa gzugs la sogs pa gnyis kyi rnam par snang ba ste /
translated: and the appearance of visual consciousness, etc. ,

original: rmi lam la sogs pa bzhin du phyi'i don med par yang 'byung ngo //
analyzed: rmi lam la sogs pa bzhin du phyi'i don med par yang 'byung ngo //
translated: even in the absence of external objects, as in a dream.

original: sbom po dang phra mo rnam par gzhigs te /
analyzed: sbom po dang phra mo rnam par gzhigs te /
translated: When one analyzes the gross and subtle aspects of form, etc. ,

original: gang gi tshe shes rab kyis shes par bya ba mi dmigs pa de'i tshe mi dmigs pa'i rnal 'byor bdag nyid kyi shes rab kyi spyod yul du mi gnyis pa'i rnal 'byor du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi tshe shes rab kyis shes par bya ba mi dmigs pa de'i tshe mi dmigs pa'i rnal 'byor bdag nyid kyi shes rab kyi spyod yul du mi gnyis pa'i rnal 'byor du 'gyur ro //
translated: and when one does not perceive the objects of knowledge by means of wisdom, then one enters the nondual yoga, the domain of the wisdom of the yoga of nonapprehending.

original: lta ba gnyis kyi spyod yul zhes bya ba ni rtag tu bdag dang bdag gir lta ba'i spyod yul lo //
analyzed: lta ba gnyis kyi spyod yul zhes bya ba ni rtag tu bdag dang bdag gir lta ba'i spyod yul lo //
translated: The domain of the two views is the domain of the views of self and of selfentity.

original: lta ba gnyis las 'das pa'i spyod yul zhes bya ba ni chos dang gang zag la bdag med pa yongs su shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lta ba gnyis las 'das pa'i spyod yul zhes bya ba ni chos dang gang zag la bdag med pa yongs su shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The domain that transcends the two views is so called because it is the thorough knowledge of the selflessness of phenomena and of persons.

original: snang ba med pa'i spyod yul ni @72b sa brgyad yan chad do //
analyzed: snang ba med pa'i spyod yul ni @72b sa brgyad yan chad do //
translated: The domain without appearances is the eighth stage and above.

original: sras kyi sa las 'das pa'i spyod yul zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sras kyi sa las 'das pa'i spyod yul zhes bya ba la /
translated: The domain that transcends the stage of the heir is so called because

original: sras kyis ni btsun gtso byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sa bcu rnams te /
analyzed: sras kyis ni btsun gtso byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sa bcu rnams te /
translated: the heir is the ten stages of the bodhisattvas.

original: de las 'da' ba'i rnal 'byor rnams ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i sa la 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: de las 'da' ba'i rnal 'byor rnams ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i sa la 'jug pa'o //
translated: The yogis who transcend that enter the stage of the Omniscient One.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i so so rang gis rig pa'i spyod yul ni snang ba dang bcas pa dang / snang ba med pa gnyis dang / mi gnyis pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi yul lo //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i so so rang gis rig pa'i spyod yul ni snang ba dang bcas pa dang / snang ba med pa gnyis dang / mi gnyis pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi yul lo //
translated: The domain of the Tathagata's personal knowledge is the domain of the concentration of the two, with appearance and without appearance, and of the non-dual, and the domain of the knowledge of the Omniscient One.

original: don dam par de kho na nyid dang / spang ba dang / blang ba yang dag pa'i yul ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid mkhyen te /
analyzed: don dam par de kho na nyid dang / spang ba dang / blang ba yang dag pa'i yul ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid mkhyen te /
translated: The domain of the ultimate, of reality, of the abandonment and the acceptance, is known by the Omniscient One.

original: bdag cag sgra'i rjes su 'brang ba'o //
analyzed: bdag cag sgra'i rjes su 'brang ba'o //
translated: We follow the sound.

original: 'di dag ni blo gros chen po 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar gyi de bzhin gshegs pa zhes pa la sogs pa la dngos po rang bzhin nyid ni don dam pa'i snying po yin te /
analyzed: 'di dag ni blo gros chen po 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar gyi de bzhin gshegs pa zhes pa la sogs pa la dngos po rang bzhin nyid ni don dam pa'i snying po yin te /
translated: These, Mahamati, are the past, future, and present Tathagatas, etc.

original: bdun pa gnyis la kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba gnyis su gzhag go //
analyzed: bdun pa gnyis la kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba gnyis su gzhag go //
translated: The second pair is the two: afflictions and purification.

original: 'phags pa'i ye shes gang dang ldan nas rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid du rtogs pa'i chos rnams la dgod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i ye shes gang dang ldan nas rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid du rtogs pa'i chos rnams la dgod par byed pa'o //
translated: It is the noble wisdom by which one is able to establish the dharmas that are realized as general and specific characteristics.

original: khyad par gyi mtshan nyid ni /
analyzed: khyad par gyi mtshan nyid ni /
translated: The specific characteristic is

original: sbrang rtsi dang chu la sogs pa 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: sbrang rtsi dang chu la sogs pa 'dzin pa'o //
translated: the grasping of honey, water, etc.

original: spyi ni ka ba dang / phru ba la sogs pa rnams kyi sra ba'o //
analyzed: spyi ni ka ba dang / phru ba la sogs pa rnams kyi sra ba'o //
translated: The general is the solidity of pillars, pots, etc.

original: bdag yul la rnam par rtog pa'i lta ba ni /
analyzed: bdag yul la rnam par rtog pa'i lta ba ni /
translated: The view of the self is the discrimination of objects.

original: rtag pa dang / bdag dang phyi'i don du rnam par rtog par lta bas rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin ma shes na mu stegs can byis pa rnams kyis rmi lam la sogs pa bzhin du bdag gi sems snang ba tsam du gzugs la sogs pa khong du ma chud nas de
analyzed: rtag pa dang / bdag dang phyi'i don du rnam par rtog par lta bas rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin ma shes na mu stegs can byis pa rnams kyis rmi lam la sogs pa bzhin du bdag gi sems snang ba tsam du gzugs la sogs pa khong du ma chud nas de
translated: If the nature of consciousness is not understood due to the view that conceives of permanence, a self, and external objects, childish tƒ´rthikas, like in a dream, do not comprehend that forms and so on are merely appearances of their own minds.üîΩThey conceive of them as external objects.

original: dag gis phyi'i don du rtogs par byed pa ni gnyid kyis ma log pa'i tshe na ni yod /
analyzed: dag gis phyi'i don du rtogs par byed pa ni gnyid kyis ma log pa'i tshe na ni yod /
translated: They say, ‚ÄúIt exists when one is not asleep.

original: rmi lam gyi dus na ni med do zhes te /
analyzed: rmi lam gyi dus na ni med do zhes te /
translated: It does not exist when one is dreaming.‚Äù

original: rang gi sems snang ba ma gtogs pa'i phyir dngos po dang / dngos po med par smra bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang gi sems snang ba ma gtogs pa'i phyir dngos po dang / dngos po med par smra bar 'gyur ro //
translated: They speak of things and nonthings apart from appearances of their own minds.

original: blo gros chen po gzhan yang mi shes pa dang / srid pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rnam par rtog pa'i rgyus srid pa gsum du 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: blo gros chen po gzhan yang mi shes pa dang / srid pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rnam par rtog pa'i rgyus srid pa gsum du 'gyur ba ste /
translated: ‚ÄúMoreover, MahƒÅmati, due to the cause of conceptuality, there is the threefold existence of the nonunderstanding, existence, and so on.

original: log pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang / mnyam par mi 'jog pa'i ma rig pa dang / las rnam par smin pa'i mthu las rtag pa dang / bdag dang / gtsang ba'i phyin ci log gi 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal 'jug go //
analyzed: log pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang / mnyam par mi 'jog pa'i ma rig pa dang / las rnam par smin pa'i mthu las rtag pa dang / bdag dang / gtsang ba'i phyin ci log gi 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal 'jug go //
translated: The suffering of cyclic existence is entered due to the ignorance of the inverted conceptualization, the ignorance of non-equipoise, and the inversions of permanence, self, and purity due to the power of the ripening of karma.

original: ji ltar ldog @73a * //
analyzed: ji ltar ldog @73a * //
translated: How is it reversed?

original: pa de thams cad mkhyen pas sgrub par mdzad pa mi shes pa dang / sred pa dang / las kyi rkyen rnam par log pas so //
analyzed: pa de thams cad mkhyen pas sgrub par mdzad pa mi shes pa dang / sred pa dang / las kyi rkyen rnam par log pas so //
translated: It is reversed by the cessation of the conditions of ignorance, craving, and karma.

original: de la mi shes pa ni yang dag pa ma yin par 'dus pa'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: de la mi shes pa ni yang dag pa ma yin par 'dus pa'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: Among them, ignorance has the characteristic of being a non-real aggregation.

original: mi rtag pas rtag par phyin ci log pa dang / bdag med pa la bdag dang ; sdug bsngal ba la bde ba dang / mi gtsang ba la gtsang bar phyin ci log pa dang / de bzhin du mdzes par mngon du zhen te /
analyzed: mi rtag pas rtag par phyin ci log pa dang / bdag med pa la bdag dang ; sdug bsngal ba la bde ba dang / mi gtsang ba la gtsang bar phyin ci log pa dang / de bzhin du mdzes par mngon du zhen te /
translated: It is the inversion of impermanence as permanence, the inversion of selflessness as self, the inversion of suffering as happiness, and the inversion of impurity as purity. Thus, one adheres to beauty.

original: sred pa las byed do //
analyzed: sred pa las byed do //
translated: From craving, one acts.

original: de ltar phyin ci log gi blos bdag tu sred pas phye ma le ba bzhin du sred par lhung ngo //
analyzed: de ltar phyin ci log gi blos bdag tu sred pas phye ma le ba bzhin du sred par lhung ngo //
translated: Thus, due to the craving for self by the mind of inversion, one falls into craving like a moth into a flame.

original: mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang stong ba dang / bdag med par yongs su shes nas sdug bsngal ldog go zhes so //
analyzed: mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang stong ba dang / bdag med par yongs su shes nas sdug bsngal ldog go zhes so //
translated: Having fully understood impermanence, suffering, emptiness, and selflessness, suffering is stopped.

original: chos dang gang zag la bdag med pa ji ltar yongs su shes par 'gyur ba de thams cad mkhyen pas gsungs pa /
analyzed: chos dang gang zag la bdag med pa ji ltar yongs su shes par 'gyur ba de thams cad mkhyen pas gsungs pa /
translated: The Omniscient One has taught how to fully understand the selflessness of phenomena and persons:üîΩ‚ÄúThe appearances of one‚Äôs own mind are like illusions, clouds, and objects. I will explain the examples.‚Äù

original: rang gi sems snang ba sgyu ma dang / sprin gyi yul dpe bshad par bya'o zhes te gzugs la sogs pa ni sems snang ba nyid de /
analyzed: rang gi sems snang ba sgyu ma dang / sprin gyi yul dpe bshad par bya'o zhes te gzugs la sogs pa ni sems snang ba nyid de /
translated: Form and so on are the appearances of the mind alone.

original: phyi'i don med pa ni rmi lam dang / rab rib dang / sgyu ma dang / sprin dang / gzugs brnyan la sogs pa'i rang bzhin bzhin no //
analyzed: phyi'i don med pa ni rmi lam dang / rab rib dang / sgyu ma dang / sprin dang / gzugs brnyan la sogs pa'i rang bzhin bzhin no //
translated: The nonexistence of external objects is like the nature of dreams, cataracts, illusions, clouds, and reflections.

original: de la sgyu ma'i dpes chos la bdag med par sgrub par mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: de la sgyu ma'i dpes chos la bdag med par sgrub par mdzad pa'o //
translated: Among these, the example of illusion establishes the selflessness of phenomena.

original: sprin gyi dpes mi rtag pa yin par tshad ma'i don nyid du sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: sprin gyi dpes mi rtag pa yin par tshad ma'i don nyid du sgrub pa'o //
translated: The example of clouds establishes the valid cognition of impermanence.

original: blo gros chen po dge slong ngam /
analyzed: blo gros chen po dge slong ngam /
translated: ‚ÄúMahƒÅmati, some monks,

original: bram ze gang la lam byung ba'am /
analyzed: bram ze gang la lam byung ba'am /
translated: brƒÅhmans,

original: yod pa rgyu las 'bras bu mngon pa dang / dngos po yun ring du gnas pa dang / rkyen rnams las phung po dang khams dang / skye mched rnams skye ba dang / gnas pa byung nas kyang 'jig par 'dod de zhes pa ni yi ya yi ka dang /
analyzed: yod pa rgyu las 'bras bu mngon pa dang / dngos po yun ring du gnas pa dang / rkyen rnams las phung po dang khams dang / skye mched rnams skye ba dang / gnas pa byung nas kyang 'jig par 'dod de zhes pa ni yi ya yi ka dang /
translated: The Samkhyas assert that an effect arises from a cause that exists, that a thing endures for a long time, that the aggregates, elements, and sense bases arise from conditions, and that having arisen, they are destroyed.

original: khyad par can rnams med pa las 'bras bu 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes smra bar byed pa dang / grangs can rnams yod pa 'byung ngo zhes so //
analyzed: khyad par can rnams med pa las 'bras bu 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes smra bar byed pa dang / grangs can rnams yod pa 'byung ngo zhes so //
translated: The Vaisheshikas say that effects arise from what is nonexistent, and the Samkhyas say that what exists arises.

original: dngos po byung ba dus kha cig tu gnas zhes pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po byung ba dus kha cig tu gnas zhes pa'o //
translated: Things that have arisen endure for some time.

original: dngos po 'jig pa yang rnam pa gnyis kyi phyir te /
analyzed: dngos po 'jig pa yang rnam pa gnyis kyi phyir te /
translated: Destruction of things is also of two kinds:

original: 'dus pa'i rgyu 'jig pa dang / ma 'dus pa'i rgyu 'jig pa las so //
analyzed: 'dus pa'i rgyu 'jig pa dang / ma 'dus pa'i rgyu 'jig pa las so //
translated: destruction of the cause of aggregation and destruction of the cause of nonaggregation.

original: de la 'dus pa'i rgyu 'jig pa las zhes bya ba ni ji ltar rgyu skrun zhig pa'i phyir snam bu 'jig pa'o //
