analyzed: de la 'dus pa'i rgyu 'jig pa las zhes bya ba ni ji ltar rgyu skrun zhig pa'i phyir snam bu 'jig pa'o //
translated: Among them, destruction of the cause of aggregation is like the destruction of a cloth due to the destruction of its cause.

original: ma 'dus pa'i rgyu 'jig pa zhes bya ba ni ji ltar rgyu spun du sbyor ba zhig @73b pa'i phyir snam bu 'jig pa'o //
analyzed: ma 'dus pa'i rgyu 'jig pa zhes bya ba ni ji ltar rgyu spun du sbyor ba zhig @73b pa'i phyir snam bu 'jig pa'o //
translated: The cause of destruction that is not included in the other three is called ‚Äúthe cause of destruction.‚Äù For example, a cloth is destroyed because the threads that are its cause are separated.

original: grangs can rtog pa ni chos rnam par gnas na ni chos gzhan ldog cing /
analyzed: grangs can rtog pa ni chos rnam par gnas na ni chos gzhan ldog cing /
translated: The SƒÅ·πÉkhya theory is that when a phenomenon remains, another phenomenon ceases.

original: chos gzhan 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: chos gzhan 'byung ba ste /
translated: And another phenomenon arises.

original: med pa ni mi skye /
analyzed: med pa ni mi skye /
translated: That which does not exist does not arise.

original: med pa ni mi 'gag ces so //
analyzed: med pa ni mi 'gag ces so //
translated: That which does not exist does not cease.

original: ne yi ya yi ka dang / khyad par yod pa dang / med pa por smra ba de dag kha cig ni rtog / kha cig ni mi rtog par byed pa rgyu med pa can yod pa ni rtag pa yin zhes te /
analyzed: ne yi ya yi ka dang / khyad par yod pa dang / med pa por smra ba de dag kha cig ni rtog / kha cig ni mi rtog par byed pa rgyu med pa can yod pa ni rtag pa yin zhes te /
translated: Some of the proponents of the NyƒÅya, Vai≈õe·π£ika, and Mƒ´mƒÅ·πÉsƒÅ schools assert that that which is existent is permanent and that that which is nonexistent is not produced.

original: gang la rgyu med cing ma skyes pa de yod pa nyid du mi rung ste /
analyzed: gang la rgyu med cing ma skyes pa de yod pa nyid du mi rung ste /
translated: That which has no cause and is not produced is not suitable to be existent,

original: ri bong gi rva bzhin no //
analyzed: ri bong gi rva bzhin no //
translated: like the horn of a rabbit.

original: de'i 'bras bu yang dus gzhan du gnas par mi rigs te /
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu yang dus gzhan du gnas par mi rigs te /
translated: Also, it is not reasonable for its effect to remain at another time.

original: gal te de gnas pa'i rang bzhin pa yin na dus thams cad du ci ste mi gnas /
analyzed: gal te de gnas pa'i rang bzhin pa yin na dus thams cad du ci ste mi gnas /
translated: If it remains by its very nature, why does it not remain at all times?

original: 'on te gnas pa'i rang bzhin pa yin pa'i mthu nyid kyis 'jig par 'gyur gyi dus gzhan du mi gnas so //
analyzed: 'on te gnas pa'i rang bzhin pa yin pa'i mthu nyid kyis 'jig par 'gyur gyi dus gzhan du mi gnas so //
translated: Or, does it perish by the power of its own nature, and does it not endure for another moment?

original: mdo sde pa rnams kyi thar ba ni mar me med par 'gyur ba bzhin du 'phags pa'i bden par 'ching ba las grol te phung po lnga chad do zhes so //
analyzed: mdo sde pa rnams kyi thar ba ni mar me med par 'gyur ba bzhin du 'phags pa'i bden par 'ching ba las grol te phung po lnga chad do zhes so //
translated: The Sautrantikas say that liberation is like the extinction of a lamp. The aryan is liberated from bondage to the aggregates.

original: rnam par 'jig pa dang chad pa ni skad cig pa'i rgyun chad pa'i don du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par 'jig pa dang chad pa ni skad cig pa'i rgyun chad pa'i don du dgongs pa'o //
translated: The meaning of destruction and annihilation is the cessation of the continuum of momentariness.

original: rgyud nas kyang 'jig par 'dod de /
analyzed: rgyud nas kyang 'jig par 'dod de /
translated: The Samkhyas also assert destruction,üîΩbecause they say:

original: blo gros chen po de dag ni rgyun dang / bya ba dang / skye ba dang / srid pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa dang / lam dang / las dang / 'bras bu dang / bden pa rnam par 'jig pa dang / chad par lta bar 'gyur te zhes pa ni don gyi bya ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: blo gros chen po de dag ni rgyun dang / bya ba dang / skye ba dang / srid pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa dang / lam dang / las dang / 'bras bu dang / bden pa rnam par 'jig pa dang / chad par lta bar 'gyur te zhes pa ni don gyi bya ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Mahamati, they are the views of the annihilation and destruction of the continuum, action, birth, existence, nirvana, the path, karma, result, and the truths, because they do not understand the meaning of action.

original: yod pa la mngon par med de /
analyzed: yod pa la mngon par med de /
translated: They do not exist in the present,

original: phyi'i don med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyi'i don med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because external objects do not exist.

original: de'i rgyun gyis 'bras bu'i dngos po ni mdo sde pa dang / ne yi ya yi ka la sogs pa 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: de'i rgyun gyis 'bras bu'i dngos po ni mdo sde pa dang / ne yi ya yi ka la sogs pa 'dod pa'o //
translated: The SautrƒÅntikas and the NaiyƒÅyikas and others maintain that the effect is a real entity that is the continuation of the cause.

original: mu stegs can rnams ni rtag pa'i dbang po'i byin gyis bdag dang yid kun tu sbyor ba las shes pa skyed par 'dod do //
analyzed: mu stegs can rnams ni rtag pa'i dbang po'i byin gyis bdag dang yid kun tu sbyor ba las shes pa skyed par 'dod do //
translated: The tƒ´rthikas maintain that consciousness is produced from the self, the mind, and the contact of the self with the sense faculties, which are permanent.

original: de bzhin du bdag dang / dbang po dang / yid dang / don sbyor ba bral ba'i phyir ye shes chad ces so //
analyzed: de bzhin du bdag dang / dbang po dang / yid dang / don sbyor ba bral ba'i phyir ye shes chad ces so //
translated: In the same way, because of the absence of contact between the self, the sense faculties, the mind, and objects, the tƒ´rthikas say that pristine wisdom is discontinuous.

original: rgyun la gnas pa'i ye shes la kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba rnam par gzhag pa rnam par 'jog pa yin na rtag pa dang / chad pa por smra ba de dag gi kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba rnam par gzhag par mi rung ngo //
analyzed: rgyun la gnas pa'i ye shes la kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba rnam par gzhag pa rnam par 'jog pa yin na rtag pa dang / chad pa por smra ba de dag gi kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba rnam par gzhag par mi rung ngo //
translated: If pristine wisdom that abides in a continuum is posited as the establishment of the presentation of affliction and purification, then the presentation of affliction and purification of those who propound eternalism and nihilism is not tenable.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gang 'di mngon sum du mi dmigs te /
analyzed: gang 'di mngon sum du mi dmigs te /
translated: Because it is not directly perceived.

original: thog ma dang tha ma mthong ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thog ma dang tha ma mthong ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the beginning and end are not seen.

original: blo gros chen po 'di lta ste /
analyzed: blo gros chen po 'di lta ste /
translated: MahƒÅmati, it is like this.

original: rdza ma gyo @74a * //üîΩmong rgyur pa rdza ma'i bya ba mi byed do //
analyzed: rdza ma gyo @74a * // mong rgyur pa rdza ma'i bya ba mi byed do //
translated: A potsherd, a piece of a pot, does not perform the function of a pot.

original: sa bon tshig pa yang myu gu'i bya ba mi byed ces te /
analyzed: sa bon tshig pa yang myu gu'i bya ba mi byed ces te /
translated: A burnt seed does not perform the function of a sprout.üîΩThe consciousnesses of the eye, etc., are destroyed immediately after arising.

original: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams skyes ma thag tu 'jig par thog ma dang tha ma'i stong pa nyid khong du chud kyang kun gzhi rnam par shes pa rigs kyi mtshan nyid dang ldan pa /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams skyes ma thag tu 'jig par thog ma dang tha ma'i stong pa nyid khong du chud kyang kun gzhi rnam par shes pa rigs kyi mtshan nyid dang ldan pa /
translated: Although one understands the emptiness of the beginning and end, the consciousness of the ground of all, which has the characteristics of a class,

original: lus dang longs spyod gnas snang ba //
analyzed: lus dang longs spyod gnas snang ba //
translated: appears as the body, enjoyments, and the world.

original: kun gzhi kun tu 'byung ba ste //üîΩrnam brgyad rnam dgu de bzhin du //
analyzed: kun gzhi kun tu 'byung ba ste // rnam brgyad rnam dgu de bzhin du //
translated: The ground of all is the universal source.

original: rgya mtsho rlabs rnams bzhin du'o //
analyzed: rgya mtsho rlabs rnams bzhin du'o //
translated: It is like the ocean and its waves.

original: thams cad rgyun gyi rang bzhin du rnam par gnas pa ste /
analyzed: thams cad rgyun gyi rang bzhin du rnam par gnas pa ste /
translated: Everything exists as a continuum.

original: de nyid rmi lam gyi dus na 'dzin pa dang gzung ba'i dngos po brtag pa mu stegs can rnams kyis de ltar khong du mi chud do //
analyzed: de nyid rmi lam gyi dus na 'dzin pa dang gzung ba'i dngos po brtag pa mu stegs can rnams kyis de ltar khong du mi chud do //
translated: The tƒ´rthikas do not understand that at the time of dreams, the things of the apprehended and the apprehender are imputed.

original: de ltar yang khong du mi chud pas bdag rtag pa dang / gcig pu dang / rig pa bo phyi'i don rig par bya bar kun tu rtog ba ni rang gi sems snang ba khong du ma chud pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar yang khong du mi chud pas bdag rtag pa dang / gcig pu dang / rig pa bo phyi'i don rig par bya bar kun tu rtog ba ni rang gi sems snang ba khong du ma chud pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus, because of not understanding that, one imagines the self to be permanent, unitary, and the knower of external objects, because of not understanding that appearances are one‚Äôs own mind.

original: mig la sogs pa'i shes pa rnams kyis mngon sum du med dmigs pa'i ni yi ya yi ka dang / khyad par can rnams 'bras bu rnams kyi thog ma dang / tha ma stong pa nyid du kun tu rtog par byed de /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i shes pa rnams kyis mngon sum du med dmigs pa'i ni yi ya yi ka dang / khyad par can rnams 'bras bu rnams kyi thog ma dang / tha ma stong pa nyid du kun tu rtog par byed de /
translated: One imagines that the beginning and end of effects are empty, because of not perceiving the beginning and end of the objects of the eye consciousness and so on.

original: bum pa dang sa bon la sogs pa gyo mo la sogs par gyur pa dang / bum pa la sogs pa'i sngon dang / tha mar sbrang rtsi dang chu 'dzin la sogs pa'i dgos pa skyed mi nus te /
analyzed: bum pa dang sa bon la sogs pa gyo mo la sogs par gyur pa dang / bum pa la sogs pa'i sngon dang / tha mar sbrang rtsi dang chu 'dzin la sogs pa'i dgos pa skyed mi nus te /
translated: A pot and a seed and so on, having become shards and so on, and a pot and so on, are not able to produce the purpose of holding honey and water and so on at the beginning and end.

original: des na sngon logs su med pa dang / zhom nas med pa'i dus na bum pa la sogs pa med do //
analyzed: des na sngon logs su med pa dang / zhom nas med pa'i dus na bum pa la sogs pa med do //
translated: Therefore, because of not existing previously and because of not existing after being destroyed, a pot and so on do not exist.

original: 'on te thog ma dang / tha ma pa'i dus na /
analyzed: 'on te thog ma dang / tha ma pa'i dus na /
translated: But if at the time of the beginning and the end,

original: dngos po yod na bdag gi bya ba cis na mi byed /
analyzed: dngos po yod na bdag gi bya ba cis na mi byed /
translated: If things exist, why wouldn‚Äôt they perform their own function?

original: de'i steng du yod pa rnams la bya ba med pas na yod pa'ang ji ltar na skye bar 'gyur /
analyzed: de'i steng du yod pa rnams la bya ba med pas na yod pa'ang ji ltar na skye bar 'gyur /
translated: Moreover, since that which exists has no function, how could that which exists arise?

original: grangs can pa rnams kyis smra ba /
analyzed: grangs can pa rnams kyis smra ba /
translated: The SƒÅ·πÉkhyas say:

original: de ste med pa skye bar 'gyur na ni bye ma rnams las mar ci ste mi 'byung /
analyzed: de ste med pa skye bar 'gyur na ni bye ma rnams las mar ci ste mi 'byung /
translated: If that which does not exist arises, why does butter not arise from sand?

original: rus sbal gyi spu dang / ri bong gi rva dang / nam mkha'i autpal la sogs pa med pa rnams cis na 'byung bar mi 'gyur /
analyzed: rus sbal gyi spu dang / ri bong gi rva dang / nam mkha'i autpal la sogs pa med pa rnams cis na 'byung bar mi 'gyur /
translated: Why don‚Äôt nonexistent things such as the hair of a turtle, the horn of a rabbit, and a sky flower arise?

original: de de bzhin du ksha pa na ka dang / spyod pa can rnams spobs pa ji bzhin par yod pa dang / med pa dang / gnyi gar smra bar rtog go //
analyzed: de de bzhin du ksha pa na ka dang / spyod pa can rnams spobs pa ji bzhin par yod pa dang / med pa dang / gnyi gar smra bar rtog go //
translated: In the same way, the Ka≈õmƒ´rans and the ƒÄjƒ´vikas speak with confidence, just as they imagine, about existence, nonexistence, and both.

original: ji ltar 'jig rten rgyang 'phen pas smra ba sa dang / chu dang / me dang / rlung zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar 'jig rten rgyang 'phen pas smra ba sa dang / chu dang / me dang / rlung zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa ma yin te /
translated: Just as the LokƒÅyatas say, ‚ÄúEarth, water, fire, and wind‚Äù are not real.

original: de dag las rnam par shes pa sems pa can mos @74b par byed pa'i mthu bzhin pa dang / chu'i chu bur bzhin du srog 'byung ste /
analyzed: de dag las rnam par shes pa sems pa can mos @74b par byed pa'i mthu bzhin pa dang / chu'i chu bur bzhin du srog 'byung ste /
translated: From them, consciousness, which is endowed with intention, arises like a wave, and the life force arises like a water bubble.

original: sems pa skyes bu'i lus su gsal bar gyur pa dang / de 'dus pa'i lus la dbang por ming gdags so zhes pa'o //
analyzed: sems pa skyes bu'i lus su gsal bar gyur pa dang / de 'dus pa'i lus la dbang por ming gdags so zhes pa'o //
translated: When intention arises, it becomes manifest in the body of a person, and the body that is formed is designated as a sense base.

original: phyi'i don du smra ba de dag thams cad kyis kyang bdag gi sems snang ba khong du ma chud pas yod pa dang / med pa dang / gnyi ga las 'bras bur rnam par rtog go //
analyzed: phyi'i don du smra ba de dag thams cad kyis kyang bdag gi sems snang ba khong du ma chud pas yod pa dang / med pa dang / gnyi ga las 'bras bur rnam par rtog go //
translated: All of these proponents of external objects fail to understand that what appears is one‚Äôs own mind. Therefore, they imagine that effects arise from existence, nonexistence, or both.

original: yod pa dang / med pa dang / byed pa dang byed pa por 'brel te skye bar mi rung ngo //
analyzed: yod pa dang / med pa dang / byed pa dang byed pa por 'brel te skye bar mi rung ngo //
translated: It is not possible for an effect to arise in a relationship of being produced from an existent cause, a nonexistent cause, or a cause that is both existent and nonexistent.

original: yod pa ni bya ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yod pa ni bya ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: An existent effect cannot be produced because it already exists.

original: med pa yang dngos po med pas rnam par rtog pa tsam du zad do //
analyzed: med pa yang dngos po med pas rnam par rtog pa tsam du zad do //
translated: A nonexistent effect cannot be produced because it is a nonentity, and it is mere imagination.

original: med pa byed do zhes ji skad smras pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: med pa byed do zhes ji skad smras pa yin zhe na /
translated: How can you say that a nonexistent effect is produced?

original: dngos po med pa la byed pa ste /
analyzed: dngos po med pa la byed pa ste /
translated: It is produced in the absence of an entity.

original: ji ltar yang mi byed do zhes byed pa bkag pa nyid du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar yang mi byed do zhes byed pa bkag pa nyid du gyur pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIt does not act in any way‚Äù is the negation of action.

original: ji ltar 'dir thams cad mkhyen pas gsungs pa /
analyzed: ji ltar 'dir thams cad mkhyen pas gsungs pa /
translated: As it is said by the Omniscient One:

original: yod dang med las 'bras mi skye //
analyzed: yod dang med las 'bras mi skye //
translated: An effect does not arise from existence or nonexistence.

original: yod med gang yang rkyen gyis min //
analyzed: yod med gang yang rkyen gyis min //
translated: Nor is it from a condition that is both existent and nonexistent.üîΩHow can a thing arise from causes?

original: rgyu rnams kyis kyang dngos po ni skye bar 'gyur ba ji lta zhig /'on de nyid sa dang po'i dbang pos dbu mar sgrub pa /üîΩyod dang med pa dag la yang //
analyzed: rgyu rnams kyis kyang dngos po ni skye bar 'gyur ba ji lta zhig /'on de nyid sa dang po'i dbang pos dbu mar sgrub pa / yod dang med pa dag la yang //
translated: But if it is established as the middle way by the power of the first stage,

original: rkyen gyi don ni mi rung ste //
analyzed: rkyen gyi don ni mi rung ste //
translated: The meaning of condition is not tenableüîΩFor either an existent or a nonexistent.

original: med na rkyen ni su yi yin //
analyzed: med na rkyen ni su yi yin //
translated: If it does not exist, what is a condition?

original: yod na rkyen phyis ci zhig bya //
analyzed: yod na rkyen phyis ci zhig bya //
translated: If it exists, what does the later condition do?

original: de bas na yod pa dang med pa byed pa po byad pa dang 'bral te las su bya ba mi rung ngo /
analyzed: de bas na yod pa dang med pa byed pa po byad pa dang 'bral te las su bya ba mi rung ngo /
translated: Therefore, existence and nonexistence are devoid of an agent and action.

original: gang gi tshe na rgyu'i skad cig la yod pa de'i tshe 'bras bu'i skad cig pa med do //
analyzed: gang gi tshe na rgyu'i skad cig la yod pa de'i tshe 'bras bu'i skad cig pa med do //
translated: When it exists at the moment of the cause, then the moment of the effect does not exist.

original: ji ltar na dngos bo dang / dngos po med pa 'brel par rung /
analyzed: ji ltar na dngos bo dang / dngos po med pa 'brel par rung /
translated: How can a thing and a nonthing be related?

original: skad cig pa gcig ni su dang yang 'brel ba med de //
analyzed: skad cig pa gcig ni su dang yang 'brel ba med de //
translated: One moment does not have any connection with another.

original: snga ma'i 'og tu 'di yod par 'gyur zhes rten cing 'brel te 'byung la /
analyzed: snga ma'i 'og tu 'di yod par 'gyur zhes rten cing 'brel te 'byung la /
translated: It is only in dependence on the prior moment that the subsequent moment occurs.

original: las dang 'bras bu nges par 'brel pa 'ba' zhig go //
analyzed: las dang 'bras bu nges par 'brel pa 'ba' zhig go //
translated: This is the only necessary connection between action and effect.

original: de ltar na gang gis dge ba dang mi dge ba la sogs pa'i 'du byed rnams la kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang bar rnam par gzhag pa yod pa dang med pa ma yin zhing /
analyzed: de ltar na gang gis dge ba dang mi dge ba la sogs pa'i 'du byed rnams la kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang bar rnam par gzhag pa yod pa dang med pa ma yin zhing /
translated: Thus, the distinction between afflicted and pure formations in terms of virtue and nonvirtue and so on is not nonexistent.

original: thams cad las thams cad de ma thag pa ma yin te /
analyzed: thams cad las thams cad de ma thag pa ma yin te /
translated: But not everything can immediately follow from everything.

original: ji lta zhe na /üîΩdga' zhing 'ga' zhig las de ma thag tu 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na / dga' zhing 'ga' zhig las de ma thag tu 'byung ba ste /
translated: How is that?

original: rus sbal gyi spu dang / ri bo dge rva dang / mo gsham gyi bu dang / nam mkha'i autpal la sogs pa ltar rgyu med pa nyid las ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rus sbal gyi spu dang / ri bo dge rva dang / mo gsham gyi bu dang / nam mkha'i autpal la sogs pa ltar rgyu med pa nyid las ni ma yin no //
translated: It is like the following example: A happy person can immediately experience pain, but not the horn of a rabbit, nor a barren woman‚Äôs son, nor a sky flower, and so on.

original: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa yang rgyu med pa las skye ba ma yin te /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa yang rgyu med pa las skye ba ma yin te /
translated: The eye consciousness and so on are not produced without a cause.

original: thog ma dang @75a * //
analyzed: thog ma dang @75a * //
translated: They are not produced from a beginningless primal matter, nor from God, nor from time, nor from nature, nor from a transformation of the elements, nor from self, nor from other, nor from both, nor without a cause.

original: tha ma'i mthar stong yang rgyu rkyen 'dus pa'i rgyu las 'byung bar 'gyur /
analyzed: tha ma'i mthar stong yang rgyu rkyen 'dus pa'i rgyu las 'byung bar 'gyur /
translated: Even though it is empty in the end, it arises from a cause that is a composite of causes and conditions.

original: gsum phrad pas 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar gyi skad cig pa rnams sam /
analyzed: gsum phrad pas 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar gyi skad cig pa rnams sam /
translated: The three meeting together is the characteristic of the present, past, and future moments.

original: byed pa po dang / las dang / byed pa'i mtshan nyid du brtag pa'o //
analyzed: byed pa po dang / las dang / byed pa'i mtshan nyid du brtag pa'o //
translated: Or, it is the characteristic of the agent, action, and instrument.

original: dam bcas pa ma nyams pa ni yod pa dang med pa la rgyu mi rigs te /
analyzed: dam bcas pa ma nyams pa ni yod pa dang med pa la rgyu mi rigs te /
translated: The non-degeneration of the thesis is not tenable for an existent or a non-existent,

original: byed ba po la sogs pa dang ldan pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byed ba po la sogs pa dang ldan pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not tenable that an existent or non-existent has an agent and so on.

original: yod pa dang med pa mtshungs pas na glags phye ste thams cad du thams cad yod pa'am /
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa mtshungs pas na glags phye ste thams cad du thams cad yod pa'am /
translated: Since an existent and a non-existent are the same, there is no reason to assert that everything exists or does not exist in all ways.

original: med par 'gyur ba ni yod pa dang med pa las 'byung bar smra ba la nges pa'i rgyu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: med par 'gyur ba ni yod pa dang med pa las 'byung bar smra ba la nges pa'i rgyu med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For one who asserts that an existent or non-existent arises, there is no reason for certainty.

original: gsum phrad pa'i rkyen zhes bya ba ni gsum phrad ba nyid rkyen yin te rgyu'o //
analyzed: gsum phrad pa'i rkyen zhes bya ba ni gsum phrad ba nyid rkyen yin te rgyu'o //
translated: The condition of the meeting of the three is the condition, the cause, of the meeting of the three.

original: de'i byed pa ni 'das pa la sogs pa'i rim mam lhan cig kyang rung ste /
analyzed: de'i byed pa ni 'das pa la sogs pa'i rim mam lhan cig kyang rung ste /
translated: Its activity is either in a sequence of past and so on or simultaneously.

original: gsum phrad pa'i mtshan nyid ni rgyu rnams nye bar brtag par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: gsum phrad pa'i mtshan nyid ni rgyu rnams nye bar brtag par bya ba yin te /
translated: The characteristics of the coming together of the three are to be examined as causes.

original: mig dang gzugs kyi rkyen gyis mig gi rnam par shes pa 'byung ste /
analyzed: mig dang gzugs kyi rkyen gyis mig gi rnam par shes pa 'byung ste /
translated: Eye consciousness arises from the condition of eye and form.

original: gsum 'dus na reg pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gsum 'dus na reg pa zhes bya ste /
translated: When the three come together, there is contact.

original: de ma thag pa'i rkyen dang / snang ba dang bar chad med pa la sogs pa rgyu yang yod do //
analyzed: de ma thag pa'i rkyen dang / snang ba dang bar chad med pa la sogs pa rgyu yang yod do //
translated: There are also causes such as the immediately preceding condition, the absence of obstruction, and so on.

original: des na rgyun du gnas shing /
analyzed: des na rgyun du gnas shing /
translated: Therefore, the mindstream abides continuously.

original: sngon myangs pa rjes su dran pa la sogs pa'i 'du byed dang ldan pa'i mig la sogs pa gsal ba'i rnam par shes pa dang ldan pa rnam par rtog pa yid shes pa skye zhing 'gag kyang sems pa med cing /
analyzed: sngon myangs pa rjes su dran pa la sogs pa'i 'du byed dang ldan pa'i mig la sogs pa gsal ba'i rnam par shes pa dang ldan pa rnam par rtog pa yid shes pa skye zhing 'gag kyang sems pa med cing /
translated: The conceptual mental consciousness arises and ceases, but it is not volition.

original: rnam par shes pa de dag thog ma dang / tha mar gnas pa'i rgyu kun gzhi rnam par shes pa rgyun yin par rjes su dpag par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa de dag thog ma dang / tha mar gnas pa'i rgyu kun gzhi rnam par shes pa rgyun yin par rjes su dpag par bya'o //
translated: It should be inferred that the cause of the mindstream that abides from beginningless time and the cause of the mind that abides in the end is the all-base consciousness.

original: rmi lam du yang mig la sogs pa dang yul yang der med de /
analyzed: rmi lam du yang mig la sogs pa dang yul yang der med de /
translated: Even in dreams, the eye and so on and the object do not exist there.

original: thams cad kyi bdag nyid de nyid yod par mngon sum rjes su myong ngo //
analyzed: thams cad kyi bdag nyid de nyid yod par mngon sum rjes su myong ngo //
translated: The self, which is the nature of all things, is directly experienced.

original: gang dag kyang ne yi ya yi ga'i mu stegs can rnams dbang po dang / don phrad de nye bar skyes pa'i shes pa bstan du med par 'gyur ba med cing gdon mi za ba'i bdag nyid gang yin pa de ni mngon sum gyi mtshan nyid can gyi shes pa'o zhes rtog pa'o //
analyzed: gang dag kyang ne yi ya yi ga'i mu stegs can rnams dbang po dang / don phrad de nye bar skyes pa'i shes pa bstan du med par 'gyur ba med cing gdon mi za ba'i bdag nyid gang yin pa de ni mngon sum gyi mtshan nyid can gyi shes pa'o zhes rtog pa'o //
translated: The NaiyƒÅyikas and the Vai≈õe·π£ikas imagine that the self is the nature of the direct perception that is the non-manifest, unchanging, and inevitable arising of the consciousness that occurs when the sense faculty and the object meet.

original: khyad par can rnams kyis ni bdag dang / yid dang / dbang bo dang don du phrad pa las gang skye ba ni mngon sum gyi shes par rtog go //
analyzed: khyad par can rnams kyis ni bdag dang / yid dang / dbang bo dang don du phrad pa las gang skye ba ni mngon sum gyi shes par rtog go //
translated: The Vai≈õe·π£ikas imagine that the consciousness that arises from the meeting of the self, the mind, and the sense faculty and object is the definition of direct perception.

original: grangs can rnams kyis ni rna ba dang / bags pa dang / mig dang / sna dang / lce rnams yid kyis byin gyis brlabs te 'jug pa rnams @75b ni mngon sum gyi mtshan nyid can mngon sum tshad ma'o //
analyzed: grangs can rnams kyis ni rna ba dang / bags pa dang / mig dang / sna dang / lce rnams yid kyis byin gyis brlabs te 'jug pa rnams @75b ni mngon sum gyi mtshan nyid can mngon sum tshad ma'o //
translated: The SƒÅ·πÉkhyas imagine that the direct perception that has the nature of direct perception is the engagement of the ear, skin, eyes, nose, and tongue, which are empowered by the mind.

original: spyod pa can rnams kyis ni skyes bu dang dbang po lhan cig tu 'byor te /
analyzed: spyod pa can rnams kyis ni skyes bu dang dbang po lhan cig tu 'byor te /
translated: The proponents of action say that the mind arises together with the person and the sense faculties.

original: blo skye ba de ni mngon sum pa'o //
analyzed: blo skye ba de ni mngon sum pa'o //
translated: That is direct perception.

original: de thog mar byas te rjes su dpag pa la sogs pa'i tshad ma gzhan gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: de thog mar byas te rjes su dpag pa la sogs pa'i tshad ma gzhan gzhag pa'o //
translated: Having made that the first, they posit other means of valid knowledge such as inference.

original: ksha pa na ka rnams kyis ni spyi dang khyad par gyi yul mngon sum pa'o //
analyzed: ksha pa na ka rnams kyis ni spyi dang khyad par gyi yul mngon sum pa'o //
translated: The proponents of the atom say that the object of a universal and a particular is direct perception.

original: thams cad kyi rjes su dpag pa ni tshad mar bzung nas mngon sum du thog mar byas pa las so //
analyzed: thams cad kyi rjes su dpag pa ni tshad mar bzung nas mngon sum du thog mar byas pa las so //
translated: Having accepted inference as a means of valid knowledge for all, they make direct perception the first.

original: 'jig rten rgyang 'phen pa rtog pa ni yul nye ba ni mngon sum pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten rgyang 'phen pa rtog pa ni yul nye ba ni mngon sum pa'o //
translated: The LokƒÅyata philosophers say that a nearby object is direct perception.

original: yul ring ba ni rjes su dpag pa ste /
analyzed: yul ring ba ni rjes su dpag pa ste /
translated: A distant object is inference.

original: de bas na don la gdon mi zab med do zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na don la gdon mi zab med do zhes pa'o //
translated: Therefore, there is no doubt about the meaning.

original: de dag thams cad kyis bdag gi sems snang ba khong du ma chud pa'i phyir don du lhag par bskyed de /
analyzed: de dag thams cad kyis bdag gi sems snang ba khong du ma chud pa'i phyir don du lhag par bskyed de /
translated: Since all of them do not understand that the appearances are their own minds, they generate a separate object.

original: byed pa dang / byed pa po dang / tshad ma dang / gzhal ba dang / rjod pa dang / brjod pa la sogs pa'i tha snyad rnams kun tu rtog go //
analyzed: byed pa dang / byed pa po dang / tshad ma dang / gzhal ba dang / rjod pa dang / brjod pa la sogs pa'i tha snyad rnams kun tu rtog go //
translated: and the conventions of action, agent, valid cognition, object of valid cognition, expression, and object of expression are all conceptual.

original: rmi lam la sogs par yang gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang byed pa dang / byed pa po dang / bskyed pa dang / skyed pa la sogs par snang ba'i rnam par rtog pa yod do //
analyzed: rmi lam la sogs par yang gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang byed pa dang / byed pa po dang / bskyed pa dang / skyed pa la sogs par snang ba'i rnam par rtog pa yod do //
translated: Even in dreams, there are conceptual appearances of object and subject, action and agent, production and producer, and so on.

original: skad cig pa la ni skye ba dang / gnas pa dang / 'jig pa la sogs pa'i chos gud na med do //
analyzed: skad cig pa la ni skye ba dang / gnas pa dang / 'jig pa la sogs pa'i chos gud na med do //
translated: But in the momentary, there is no separate phenomenon such as arising, enduring, and disintegrating.

original: ji ltar dbu ma las 'byung ba //
analyzed: ji ltar dbu ma las 'byung ba //
translated: As it is said in the Madhyamaka:

original: gal te skye ba 'dus byas na //
analyzed: gal te skye ba 'dus byas na //
translated: If arising were conditioned,

original: mtshan nyid gsum ldan der rigs te //
analyzed: mtshan nyid gsum ldan der rigs te //
translated: it would have the three characteristics.

original: 'on te skye ba 'dus ma byas //
analyzed: 'on te skye ba 'dus ma byas //
translated: But if arising were unconditioned,

original: 'dus byas mtshan nyid ji ltar rung //
analyzed: 'dus byas mtshan nyid ji ltar rung //
translated: how could it be a characteristic of the conditioned?

original: des na yod pa dang med pa la byed pa dang byed pa pos bskyed pa la sogs pa'i chos rnams mi rigs so //
analyzed: des na yod pa dang med pa la byed pa dang byed pa pos bskyed pa la sogs pa'i chos rnams mi rigs so //
translated: Therefore, it is illogical for existent and nonexistent things to be produced by action and agent.

original: chos dang gang zag la bdag med pa gnyis la'ang bskyed pa la sogs pa phyi'i don du sgro btags te /
analyzed: chos dang gang zag la bdag med pa gnyis la'ang bskyed pa la sogs pa phyi'i don du sgro btags te /
translated: The two kinds of selflessness of persons and things are also imputed as external objects in the process of their production and so on.

original: de dag gzhan par brtag par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de dag gzhan par brtag par mi bya'o //
translated: They should not be imagined as something else.

original: gang dag gnyis rnam pa'i chos yin pa de dag rmi lam dang mig 'phrul la sogs pa bzhin du thams cad ma skyes pas na de'i phyir yod pa dang med pa skye bar mi rung ngo //
analyzed: gang dag gnyis rnam pa'i chos yin pa de dag rmi lam dang mig 'phrul la sogs pa bzhin du thams cad ma skyes pas na de'i phyir yod pa dang med pa skye bar mi rung ngo //
translated: Since all those which are phenomena of the two kinds are unproduced like dreams, magical illusions, and so on, therefore it is not tenable that the existent and the nonexistent are produced.

original: de dag la zhes bya ba ni yod pa dang med pa la sogs par smra ba rnams la'o //
analyzed: de dag la zhes bya ba ni yod pa dang med pa la sogs par smra ba rnams la'o //
translated: ‚Äú In regard to them‚Äù means in regard to the proponents of the existent, the nonexistent, and so on.

original: med pa mi skye la /
analyzed: med pa mi skye la /
translated: The nonexistent is not produced.

original: med pa 'gag par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: med pa 'gag par mi 'gyur te /
translated: The nonexistent does not cease.

original: grangs can rnams kyi gsum phrad pa ni 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar gyi rnams so //
analyzed: grangs can rnams kyi gsum phrad pa ni 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar gyi rnams so //
translated: The three contacts of the SƒÅ·πÉkhyas are the past, future, and present.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i rang bzhin gyi mtshan nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i rang bzhin gyi mtshan nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The characteristics of the nature of cause and effect and so on.

original: yod pa dang @76a * //
analyzed: yod pa dang @76a * //
translated: The existent and the nonexistent are not produced.

original: med pa'i mtshan nyid yod par zhes pa ni mngon sum yod par byed pa ye yod pa'i spyi'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: med pa'i mtshan nyid yod par zhes pa ni mngon sum yod par byed pa ye yod pa'i spyi'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: This is the general characteristic of the existence of the direct perception of the primordial existence.

original: yon tan dang / rdzas dang / byed pa ldan pa'o //
analyzed: yon tan dang / rdzas dang / byed pa ldan pa'o //
translated: It is endowed with quality, substance, and action.

original: yon tan dang ldan pa ni 'brel pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: yon tan dang ldan pa ni 'brel pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: Endowed with quality is the cause of connection.

original: rdzas dang ldan pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni khyad par te /
analyzed: rdzas dang ldan pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni khyad par te /
translated: Endowed with substance, etc. is the particular.

original: 'das pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid yod par ston to //
analyzed: 'das pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid yod par ston to //
translated: It shows the existence of the characteristics of the past, etc.

original: yod pa dang med pa las 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni dam bcas pa dang 'gal ba ste /
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa las 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni dam bcas pa dang 'gal ba ste /
translated: Arising from existence and non-existence is the contradiction of the thesis.

original: de ste yod na ni ji ltar na 'byung bar 'gyur /
analyzed: de ste yod na ni ji ltar na 'byung bar 'gyur /
translated: If it exists, how can it arise?

original: 'on te med pa 'byung bar 'gyur na dngos po med pa ji ltar na 'byung bar byed /
analyzed: 'on te med pa 'byung bar 'gyur na dngos po med pa ji ltar na 'byung bar byed /
translated: If it arises from non-existence, how can a non-entity arise?

original: cung zad kyang mi byed do zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: cung zad kyang mi byed do zhes bya ba ste /
translated: It does not do anything at all.

original: byed pa 'gag pa'o //
analyzed: byed pa 'gag pa'o //
translated: This is the cessation of action.

original: des na rmi lam dang / mig 'phrul dang 'dra ba'i rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba thog ma dang tha ma'i mthar stong ba dbus su 'dzin pa dang gzung ba gnyis kyi rang bzhin gyis stong ste /
analyzed: des na rmi lam dang / mig 'phrul dang 'dra ba'i rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba thog ma dang tha ma'i mthar stong ba dbus su 'dzin pa dang gzung ba gnyis kyi rang bzhin gyis stong ste /
translated: Therefore, dependent origination, which is like a dream or an illusion, is empty of a beginning and an end. In the middle, it is empty of the nature of both the apprehender and the apprehended.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa 'ba' zhig rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal bar gnas pa ni bdag dang gzhan gyi rgyud kyi dbang dang / rkyen gyi khyad par dang / mnyam par 'jog pa med pas nang glongs pa ni gser dri ma can du 'gyur ba bzhin te /
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa 'ba' zhig rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal bar gnas pa ni bdag dang gzhan gyi rgyud kyi dbang dang / rkyen gyi khyad par dang / mnyam par 'jog pa med pas nang glongs pa ni gser dri ma can du 'gyur ba bzhin te /
translated: The all-base consciousness alone, which is luminous by nature, is the basis of the continuum of self and others. Due to the difference in conditions and the absence of equipoise, it is like gold that has become tarnished.

original: mgo mkhor ba dang / brgyal ba la sogs pa bzhin du rnam pa sna tshogs kyi rnam par snang ngo //
analyzed: mgo mkhor ba dang / brgyal ba la sogs pa bzhin du rnam pa sna tshogs kyi rnam par snang ngo //
translated: It appears in various forms, like a headache or fainting.

original: gang gi tshe shes rab kyis dpyad de /
analyzed: gang gi tshe shes rab kyis dpyad de /
translated: When it is analyzed with wisdom,

original: sbom pa dang / phra ba rnam par phye ste /
analyzed: sbom pa dang / phra ba rnam par phye ste /
translated: the coarse and the subtle are distinguished.

original: shes par bya ba mi dmigs pa de'i tshe bsam pa dang bral zhing snang ba med pa gnyis ba don dam pa'i bden pa yang dag par rig pa nyid gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shes par bya ba mi dmigs pa de'i tshe bsam pa dang bral zhing snang ba med pa gnyis ba don dam pa'i bden pa yang dag par rig pa nyid gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: When the object of knowledge is not observed, then the absence of thought and the absence of appearance, which are the two aspects of the perfect knowledge of ultimate truth, are present.

original: chos dang gang zag la bdag med pa yongs su shes nas shes rab dang / snying rje'i bag chags kyis bskul te sar dbye ba 'byed pa na snang ba dang bcas pa dang / snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin thob nas yid bzhin gyi nor bu rin po che bzhin du sems can thams cad la phan par 'jug pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa gzugs sna tshogs kyi rnal 'byor gyi dbang por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos dang gang zag la bdag med pa yongs su shes nas shes rab dang / snying rje'i bag chags kyis bskul te sar dbye ba 'byed pa na snang ba dang bcas pa dang / snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin thob nas yid bzhin gyi nor bu rin po che bzhin du sems can thams cad la phan par 'jug pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa gzugs sna tshogs kyi rnal 'byor gyi dbang por 'gyur ro //
translated: Having fully understood the selflessness of persons and of phenomena, and having been inspired by the instincts of wisdom and compassion, when one analyzes the divisions of the stages, one attains the concentration that is both with appearance and without appearance. Then one becomes the lord of the yoga of the knowledge of all things, which is like a wish-fulfilling gem, and engages in benefiting all sentient beings.

original: bsod nams dang / ye shes kyi tshogs kyi khyad par las byung ba lta'i mig la sogs pa'i ye shes kyi mngon par shes pa dang ldan zhing stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa yon tan gyi tshogs ma lus pa gzhan gyi don du 'byung ba rmi lam la sogs pa lta bur mig la sogs pa'i shes pa las khyad par can @76b kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa nyid sgyu ma'i rnam par thar par gnas
analyzed: bsod nams dang / ye shes kyi tshogs kyi khyad par las byung ba lta'i mig la sogs pa'i ye shes kyi mngon par shes pa dang ldan zhing stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa yon tan gyi tshogs ma lus pa gzhan gyi don du 'byung ba rmi lam la sogs pa lta bur mig la sogs pa'i shes pa las khyad par can @76b kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa nyid sgyu ma'i rnam par thar par gnas
translated: The wisdom of the ten powers, the four fearlessnesses, and so on, which arises from the special accumulations of merit and wisdom, is endowed with the wisdom of clairvoyance such as the divine eye and so on. The entire collection of qualities arises for the benefit of others, like a dream and so on. The ƒÅlaya consciousness itself, which is superior to the consciousnesses of the eyes and so on, abides in the liberation of illusion.

original: shing snang ba dang bcas pa dang / snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi khyad par du dbye ba na mtha' yas pa'i sems can gyi don du byed pa rnams kyis thams cad mkhyen pa yin no //
analyzed: shing snang ba dang bcas pa dang / snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi khyad par du dbye ba na mtha' yas pa'i sems can gyi don du byed pa rnams kyis thams cad mkhyen pa yin no //
translated: When divided into the special meditative absorptions of appearance and no appearance, it is omniscience through the activities for the benefit of infinite sentient beings.

original: ji ltar de kho na nyid bsdu ba las gsungs pa rigs kyi bu sems 'di ni rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba ste /
analyzed: ji ltar de kho na nyid bsdu ba las gsungs pa rigs kyi bu sems 'di ni rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba ste /
translated: As it is said in the Compendium of Principles: Son of noble family, this mind is naturally luminous.

original: gang gis ji ltar spyod pa de ltar 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gis ji ltar spyod pa de ltar 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: Whatever one does, that is what one will accomplish.

original: so so'i skye bo lta ba dan pas zin pa de dag brtags pa'i sal gnas pa na tshad ma dang gzhal bar rnam par gzhag par yang rtag pa'i bdag dang don du rnam par rtog par byed do //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo lta ba dan pas zin pa de dag brtags pa'i sal gnas pa na tshad ma dang gzhal bar rnam par gzhag par yang rtag pa'i bdag dang don du rnam par rtog par byed do //
translated: Ordinary people, who are caught up in views, when they are in a state of examination, conceive of a permanent self and an object that is a real entity, in terms of the presentation of valid knowledge and the object of valid knowledge.üîΩIn this regard, the permanent self is the object of valid knowledge, and the object of valid knowledge is the object of the sense faculties.üîΩThose who perceive that very thing and think, ‚ÄúI touch it,‚Äù

original: de la rtag pa'i bdag ni tshad ma phyi'i don gzhal ba dang / gang mthong ba de nyid la bdag gis reg go zhes 'jal bar byed pa de dag gis ni /
analyzed: de la rtag pa'i bdag ni tshad ma phyi'i don gzhal ba dang / gang mthong ba de nyid la bdag gis reg go zhes 'jal bar byed pa de dag gis ni /
translated: are the ones who conceive of a permanent self and an object that is a real entity.

original: lus dang longs spyod gnas snang ba //
analyzed: lus dang longs spyod gnas snang ba //
translated: The body, enjoyments, and the abode appear to them as real.

original: kun gzhi sems kyi rgyun dang ldan pa gang gis mi shes pa des na blun pa rnams kyis bdag 'di ltar bde ba dang // sdug bsngal ba'o zhes so sor bshad pa'i phyir rtag pa kho nas rtag par byed na skra dang rtsva la sogs pa bcad nas phyir skyes pa yang so sor shes pa 'jug pas na des rtag pa kho nar bsgrub par mi rung ngo //
analyzed: kun gzhi sems kyi rgyun dang ldan pa gang gis mi shes pa des na blun pa rnams kyis bdag 'di ltar bde ba dang // sdug bsngal ba'o zhes so sor bshad pa'i phyir rtag pa kho nas rtag par byed na skra dang rtsva la sogs pa bcad nas phyir skyes pa yang so sor shes pa 'jug pas na des rtag pa kho nar bsgrub par mi rung ngo //
translated: The foolish, who do not know that the self is the stream of consciousness, which is the foundation consciousness, say, ‚ÄúI am happy,‚Äù or ‚ÄúI am sad.‚Äù If the self were permanent, it would be permanent in the same way, but when hair, grass, and so on, are cut, they grow back. Since this is known, it is not suitable to establish the self as permanent.

original: ne yi ya yi ka la sogs pas gang dag rjes su dpag par kun tu brtags pa de dag kyang de'i bdag nyid pa dang / de las skye bar 'brel ba med de /
analyzed: ne yi ya yi ka la sogs pas gang dag rjes su dpag par kun tu brtags pa de dag kyang de'i bdag nyid pa dang / de las skye bar 'brel ba med de /
translated: The self that is imagined by the NaiyƒÅyika and others is not related to the self as its essence or as arising from it.

original: de bas na sbyor ba la sogs par 'brel bar nges pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na sbyor ba la sogs par 'brel bar nges pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not ascertained that the self is related to the body and so on.

original: de thog mar byas te rjes su dpag pa rnam pa gsum ni snga ma lta bu dang / lhag ma lta bu dang / spyis mthong ba'o //
analyzed: de thog mar byas te rjes su dpag pa rnam pa gsum ni snga ma lta bu dang / lhag ma lta bu dang / spyis mthong ba'o //
translated: The three types of inference are like the previous, like the remainder, and by the power of the fact.

original: de la snga ma lta bu ni gang na rgyus 'bras du dpag pa'o //
analyzed: de la snga ma lta bu ni gang na rgyus 'bras du dpag pa'o //
translated: Like the previous is the inference of the effect from the cause.

original: de ni gang na rgyu yod pa der gdon mi za bar 'bras bu 'byung bar nges pa med do //
analyzed: de ni gang na rgyu yod pa der gdon mi za bar 'bras bu 'byung bar nges pa med do //
translated: It is not certain that where there is a cause, there will be an effect.

original: lhag ma ni bye brag tu dbye ba med do //
analyzed: lhag ma ni bye brag tu dbye ba med do //
translated: The rest are not differentiated.

original: med dang du bar sbyor ba'i mtshan nyid ni 'brel par smra bar byed pa gang na sbyor ba gcig yod pa der sbyor bar byed pa gzhan yang yod par 'gyur ba'i rigs par nges pa med de 'khar ba dang skyes bu bzhin no //
analyzed: med dang du bar sbyor ba'i mtshan nyid ni 'brel par smra bar byed pa gang na sbyor ba gcig yod pa der sbyor bar byed pa gzhan yang yod par 'gyur ba'i rigs par nges pa med de 'khar ba dang skyes bu bzhin no //
translated: The definition of the connection is that it is not certain that where there is one application, there will be another application, as in the case of a stick and a man.

original: spyis rjes su dpag pa ni rgyu dang 'bras bur ma gyur pa'i bya bzhad las chu rjes su dpag pa'o //
analyzed: spyis rjes su dpag pa ni rgyu dang 'bras bur ma gyur pa'i bya bzhad las chu rjes su dpag pa'o //
translated: Inference from the general is, for example, inferring water from the presence of cranes.

original: khyad par can gyi rjes su dpag pa yang sbyor ba dang / yan lag can dang / don gcig tu 'dus pa @77a * //
analyzed: khyad par can gyi rjes su dpag pa yang sbyor ba dang / yan lag can dang / don gcig tu 'dus pa @77a * //
translated: Inference from the particular is also characterized by application, having parts, being a collection of the same object,

original: dang 'ga' ba'i yang mtshan ma can no //
analyzed: dang 'ga' ba'i yang mtshan ma can no //
translated: and being a sign of some.

original: de ni gang na sbyor ba can gcig snang ba de ni gung dang dus dang mi gzhan pa yod par 'gyur ba nges pa med do //
analyzed: de ni gang na sbyor ba can gcig snang ba de ni gung dang dus dang mi gzhan pa yod par 'gyur ba nges pa med do //
translated: It is not certain that where one application appears, there will be another application, time, and non-difference.

original: yan lag can yang rkang pa la lag pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: yan lag can yang rkang pa la lag pa lta bu ste /
translated: The whole is not in the parts, as the hand in the foot.

original: rkang ba'i rgyu dang mtshan ma ni lag pa yin zhes pa de ni mtha' gcig tu nges pa med do //
analyzed: rkang ba'i rgyu dang mtshan ma ni lag pa yin zhes pa de ni mtha' gcig tu nges pa med do //
translated: The cause and the mark of the foot is not the hand.

original: don gcig tu 'dus ba ni gzugs la reg pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: don gcig tu 'dus ba ni gzugs la reg pa lta bu ste /
translated: The one is not in the many, as the tangible in form.üîΩThe tangible is not in such forms as darkness, shadow, light, and illumination.üîΩThe many is not in the one, as the various thoughts in the mind.üîΩThe various thoughts are not in the one mind.

original: de yang mun pa dang / grib ma dang / 'od dang / snang ba la sogs pa'i gzugs la yang reg pa med do //
analyzed: de yang mun pa dang / grib ma dang / 'od dang / snang ba la sogs pa'i gzugs la yang reg pa med do //
translated: The one is not in the one, as the hand in the hand.üîΩThe hand is not in the hand.üîΩThe many is not in the many, as the various thoughts in the various thoughts.üîΩThe various thoughts are not in the various thoughts.üîΩThe various thoughts are not in the various thoughts.üîΩThe various thoughts are not in the various thoughts.

original: 'gal ba zhi khyad par can gyi rnam pa du mar kun tu rtog par byed de /
analyzed: 'gal ba zhi khyad par can gyi rnam pa du mar kun tu rtog par byed de /
translated: The various thoughts are not in the various thoughts.üîΩThe various thoughts are not in the various thoughts.üîΩThe various thoughts are not in the various thoughts.üîΩThe various thoughts are not in the various thoughts.üîΩThe various thoughts are not in the various thoughts.üîΩThe various thoughts are not in the various thoughts.üîΩThe various thoughts are not in the various thoughts.üîΩThe various thoughts are not in the various thoughts.üîΩThe various thoughts are not in the various thoughts.üîΩThe various thoughts are not in the various thoughts.üîΩThe various thoughts are not in the various thoughts.üîΩThe various thoughts are not in the various thoughts.üîΩThe various thoughts are not in the various thoughts.üîΩThe various thoughts are not in the various thoughts.üîΩThe various thoughts are not in the various thoughts.üîΩThe various thoughts are not in the various thoughts.üîΩThe various thoughts are not in the various thoughts.üîΩThe various thoughts are not in the various thoughts.üîΩThe various thoughts are not in the various thoughts.üîΩThe various thoughts are not in the various thoughts.üîΩThe various thoughts are not in the various thoughts.üîΩThe various thoughts are not in the various thoughts.üîΩThe various thoughts are not in the various thoughts.üîΩThe various thoughts are not in the various thoughts.üîΩThe various thoughts are not in the various thoughts.üîΩThe various thoughts are not in the various thoughts.üîΩThe various thoughts are not in the various thoughts.üîΩThe various thoughts are not in the various thoughts.üîΩThe various thoughts are not in the various thoughts.üîΩThe various thoughts are not in the various thoughts.

original: rlung sprin dang kun tu sbyor ba na chang pa'ang bar 'gyur zhes ba ni de lta bu'i char pa dang rnam pa du ma'i char ba yang yod na der char pa gang 'bab pa dang / gang mi 'bab pa de khyad par du smra dgos so //
analyzed: rlung sprin dang kun tu sbyor ba na chang pa'ang bar 'gyur zhes ba ni de lta bu'i char pa dang rnam pa du ma'i char ba yang yod na der char pa gang 'bab pa dang / gang mi 'bab pa de khyad par du smra dgos so //
translated: The various thoughts are not in the various thoughts.üîΩThe various thoughts are

original: 'brel ba gcig spyir mthong ba dang / khyad par du mthong ba dang / snga ma lta bu dang / lhag ma lta bu yang grangs can gyi rje su dpag go //
analyzed: 'brel ba gcig spyir mthong ba dang / khyad par du mthong ba dang / snga ma lta bu dang / lhag ma lta bu yang grangs can gyi rje su dpag go //
translated: The SƒÅ·πÉkhya also infers the self from the observation of the general relation of being a master and the specific relation, such as the relation of the prior and the subsequent.

original: bdag po'i bdag gi dang / 'gyur ba dang / yan lag la sogs pa kun tu brtags pa ni mi brtan pa yin te /
analyzed: bdag po'i bdag gi dang / 'gyur ba dang / yan lag la sogs pa kun tu brtags pa ni mi brtan pa yin te /
translated: The imputation of the self as the master, the transformation, the parts, and so on is unstable.

original: gang na bdag po yod pa der bdag gis te /
analyzed: gang na bdag po yod pa der bdag gis te /
translated: Where there is a master, there is a servant.

original: de'i cung zad kha cig tu mthong ba gzhan du yod par 'gyur bar nges pa med do //
analyzed: de'i cung zad kha cig tu mthong ba gzhan du yod par 'gyur bar nges pa med do //
translated: It is not certain that what is seen in one place will exist elsewhere.

original: de de ltar ksha pa na ka dang / spyod pa can la log la rnams kyi mngon sum gyi thon mar byas ba sbyor ba la sogs par 'brel ba yang gzhan ba la rjes su dpag pa la slu bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: de de ltar ksha pa na ka dang / spyod pa can la log la rnams kyi mngon sum gyi thon mar byas ba sbyor ba la sogs par 'brel ba yang gzhan ba la rjes su dpag pa la slu bar byed pa ste /
translated: Thus, the SƒÅ·πÉkhya, who takes the direct perception of the KƒÅ≈õmƒ´ri and the Caraka as authoritative, is deceived by inference in regard to the relation of the prior and the subsequent, and so on.

original: de'i bdag nyid dang de la sa skyes pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid dang de la sa skyes pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is devoid of being of the nature of that and being produced from that.

original: des na rtag pa dang / bdag dang / phyi'i don kun tu rtog pas mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma dang gzhal ba la sogs par rnam par gzhag bar byed pa lus dang longs spyod dang / gnas su snang ba'i kun gzhi rnam par shes pa mi shes pas rtag pa'i sal lta ba ngan pas zin pa'i rtog pa rnams log pa'i shes pas rtag pa dang /
analyzed: des na rtag pa dang / bdag dang / phyi'i don kun tu rtog pas mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma dang gzhal ba la sogs par rnam par gzhag bar byed pa lus dang longs spyod dang / gnas su snang ba'i kun gzhi rnam par shes pa mi shes pas rtag pa'i sal lta ba ngan pas zin pa'i rtog pa rnams log pa'i shes pas rtag pa dang /
translated: Therefore, the consciousness that appears as the body, enjoyments, and abode, which is the foundation consciousness, is not understood by those who posit the existence of permanent, partless, and independent subtle particles and consciousnesses, the existence of a self, and external objects.

original: bdag dang / bdag gi dang / phyi'i don nas mngon par chags ba'i phyir 'khor bar sdug bsngal myong ngo //
analyzed: bdag dang / bdag gi dang / phyi'i don nas mngon par chags ba'i phyir 'khor bar sdug bsngal myong ngo //
translated: Because of their attachment to the views of permanence, self, mine, and external objects, they experience suffering in cyclic existence.

original: btsun gtso'i byang chub sems dpa' dge sbyong dang / bram ze la la rang bzhin med pa'i sprin dang / mgal me bskor ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa la rang bzhin @77b med pa ni skad cig ma'i phyir ro //
analyzed: btsun gtso'i byang chub sems dpa' dge sbyong dang / bram ze la la rang bzhin med pa'i sprin dang / mgal me bskor ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa la rang bzhin @77b med pa ni skad cig ma'i phyir ro //
translated: Some bodhisattvas, who are the foremost of the virtuous, such as the ≈õrama·πáas and brahmans, understand that the cloud, the firebrand, and so on are essenceless because they are momentary.

original: rmi lam dang / mig 'phrul la sogs pa bzhin du gnyis kyi rnam pa can thams cad dam skyes pa'o //
analyzed: rmi lam dang / mig 'phrul la sogs pa bzhin du gnyis kyi rnam pa can thams cad dam skyes pa'o //
translated: like dreams, magical creations, etc.

original: yang na byed pa po dang las la sogs pa med ba'i phyir ma skyes pa ste /
analyzed: yang na byed pa po dang las la sogs pa med ba'i phyir ma skyes pa ste /
translated: Or, they are unproduced because there is no agent, action, etc.

original: bdag med pa gnyis kyi bshad pa thams cad du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: bdag med pa gnyis kyi bshad pa thams cad du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The explanation of the two selflessnesses should be applied in all cases.

original: gang dag shes rab kyis dpyad de /
analyzed: gang dag shes rab kyis dpyad de /
translated: Those who, by means of wisdom,

original: sbom po dang / phra mo rnam par gzhig pa na de dag 'khor ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa mnyam pa nyid thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sbom po dang / phra mo rnam par gzhig pa na de dag 'khor ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa mnyam pa nyid thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ste /
translated: analyze and destroy the gross and subtle forms of self will attain the equality of cyclic existence and nirvana.üîΩAnd it is said in the same text:

original: dngos dang dngos med mnyam pas ni //
analyzed: dngos dang dngos med mnyam pas ni //
translated: By the equality of entity and non-entity

original: 'phags pa rnams kyi 'bras bu 'byung //
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams kyi 'bras bu 'byung //
translated: the fruits of the Aryas arise.

original: zhes pa'o // 'di nyid du yang gsungs pa /üîΩyod pa'i zlas drangs med pa ste //
analyzed: zhes pa'o // 'di nyid du yang gsungs pa / yod pa'i zlas drangs med pa ste //
translated: And in this very text it is said:üîΩNon-existence is implied by existence

original: yod pa'ang med pa'i zlas drangs so //
analyzed: yod pa'ang med pa'i zlas drangs so //
translated: and existence is implied by non-existence.

original: de bas med par shes mi bya //
analyzed: de bas med par shes mi bya //
translated: Therefore, do not understand non-existence

original: yod par yang ni mi brtag go //
analyzed: yod par yang ni mi brtag go //
translated: and do not imagine existence.

original: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las kyang klog pa /
analyzed: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las kyang klog pa /
translated: The noble Perfection of Wisdom says,

original: dngos pos ni mngon par rtogs ba med dngos po med pas kyang mngon par rtogs pa med de /
analyzed: dngos pos ni mngon par rtogs ba med dngos po med pas kyang mngon par rtogs pa med de /
translated: ‚ÄúThere is no realization through an existent, nor is there realization through a non-existent.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is it?

original: dngos po dang dngos po med par mnyam pas rtogs par 'gyur zhes so //
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med par mnyam pas rtogs par 'gyur zhes so //
translated: It is realized through the equality of existence and non-existence.‚Äù

original: ci smras pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci smras pa yin zhe na /
translated: What is it that is said?

original: dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i rnam par rtog pa spong pa las so zhes thams cad mkhyen pas dgongs par brtag go //
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i rnam par rtog pa spong pa las so zhes thams cad mkhyen pas dgongs par brtag go //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is through abandoning the conception of existence and non-existence.‚Äù This is how the Omniscient One should be understood.

original: ji ltar mdo sde 'di nyid du gsungs pa /
analyzed: ji ltar mdo sde 'di nyid du gsungs pa /
translated: As this very s≈´tra says,

original: mtshan nyid dang ni bya ba dang // dngos bor mya ngan 'das ba med //
analyzed: mtshan nyid dang ni bya ba dang // dngos bor mya ngan 'das ba med //
translated: NirvƒÅ·πáa is not a thing, nor a non-thing, nor a characteristic, nor an action.

original: rnam rtog rnam shes bzlog pa ni //
analyzed: rnam rtog rnam shes bzlog pa ni //
translated: The cessation of conceptual consciousness

original: nga ni mya ngan 'das pa'o //
analyzed: nga ni mya ngan 'das pa'o //
translated: is what I call nirvƒÅ·πáa.

original: thams cad mkhyen pas de skad gsungs pa des ci zhig rtogs par byed ce na /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pas de skad gsungs pa des ci zhig rtogs par byed ce na /
translated: What does this statement by the Omniscient One teach?

original: log pa'i rnam par rtog pa spangs pas mngon par rdzogs pa'i byang chub bo //
analyzed: log pa'i rnam par rtog pa spangs pas mngon par rdzogs pa'i byang chub bo //
translated: It teaches that through abandoning false conceptions, there is complete and perfect awakening.

original: de bas na rtag pa dang / bdag dang / bde ba dang gtsang ba'i dngos por phyin ci log pa'i rnam par rtog pa spong ba mthong yang shes rab kyis mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: de bas na rtag pa dang / bdag dang / bde ba dang gtsang ba'i dngos por phyin ci log pa'i rnam par rtog pa spong ba mthong yang shes rab kyis mi mthong ngo //
translated: Therefore, the abandonment of the discriminations of permanence, self, pleasure, and purity is not seen by insight.

original: ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las byung ba /
analyzed: ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las byung ba /
translated: As it is said in the Perfection of Insight:

original: rnam par sngos pa dang / rnam par dmar pa dang / rnam par gzhigs pa dang / rnam par rnags pa la sogs pa mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis shes rab kyis mi mdzes pa rnams sgom par byad pa na mthong yang mi mthong ngo //üîΩdes na log pa'i rnam par rtog pa spong ba ni nang stong ba nyid dang / phyi stong pa nyid dang / stong @78a * //
analyzed: rnam par sngos pa dang / rnam par dmar pa dang / rnam par gzhigs pa dang / rnam par rnags pa la sogs pa mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis shes rab kyis mi mdzes pa rnams sgom par byad pa na mthong yang mi mthong ngo // des na log pa'i rnam par rtog pa spong ba ni nang stong ba nyid dang / phyi stong pa nyid dang / stong @78a * //
translated: ‚ÄúWhen one cultivates the unlovely by way of not apprehending the blue, the red, the variegated, the bloated, the livid, the festering, and so on, one sees but does not apprehend.‚Äù

original: pa nyid kyi stong ba nyid la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: pa nyid kyi stong ba nyid la sogs pa ste /
translated: The abandonment of false discriminations is the emptiness of non-apprehension, the emptiness of the internal, the emptiness of the external, the emptiness of the internal and external, the emptiness of emptiness, the great emptiness, the emptiness of the ultimate, the emptiness of the conditioned, the emptiness of the unconditioned, the emptiness of what is beyond discrimination, the emptiness of that which is as vast as space, the emptiness of all things, the emptiness of intrinsic nature, the emptiness of all things, the emptiness of non-apprehension, the emptiness of inherent existence, the emptiness of the unapprehendable, the emptiness of non-dispersal, and the emptiness of essential nature.

original: phung por mi gnas pa dang / rnam par 'jog pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: phung por mi gnas pa dang / rnam par 'jog pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because they do not abide in the aggregates and because they are established.

original: phyi'i dngos po phung por gnas pa med pa dang / rnam par mi 'jig pa'i rtag pa yang med do //
analyzed: phyi'i dngos po phung por gnas pa med pa dang / rnam par mi 'jig pa'i rtag pa yang med do //
translated: There is no external entity that endures as a mass, nor is there a permanence that does not disintegrate.

original: 'phags ma shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don gyi bshad pa ni dam pa'i chos kyi 'brel ba la dkar gsungs pa 'di nyid las 'byung ste /
analyzed: 'phags ma shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don gyi bshad pa ni dam pa'i chos kyi 'brel ba la dkar gsungs pa 'di nyid las 'byung ste /
translated: The explanation of the meaning of the noble Perfection of Wisdom comes from this very scripture, the Connected Dharmas:

original: gzugs ni rdul phran gzhigs pa dang // rdul phran cha ni med pa ste //
analyzed: gzugs ni rdul phran gzhigs pa dang // rdul phran cha ni med pa ste //
translated: Form is the analysis of atoms, and atoms have no parts.üîΩThen, what is this appearance?

original: 'o na snang ba 'di ci lags zhes gsol ba'i lan du /
analyzed: 'o na snang ba 'di ci lags zhes gsol ba'i lan du /
translated: In response, it is said:

original: phyi yi dngos po med par yang //
analyzed: phyi yi dngos po med par yang //
translated: Even without external entities,

original: sems ni rnam pa gnyis su snang //
analyzed: sems ni rnam pa gnyis su snang //
translated: the mind appears in two aspects.

original: dpyid kyi ri dags skom pa bzhin //
analyzed: dpyid kyi ri dags skom pa bzhin //
translated: Like a thirsty deer

original: g-yo bas sems ni rmongs par byed //
analyzed: g-yo bas sems ni rmongs par byed //
translated: that is confused by the moving mind.

original: ri dags rnams ni chur 'dzin pa //
analyzed: ri dags rnams ni chur 'dzin pa //
translated: Deer apprehend water

original: de yi dngos po yod pa min //
analyzed: de yi dngos po yod pa min //
translated: that does not exist as an entity.

original: de bzhin rnam shes sa bon ni //
analyzed: de bzhin rnam shes sa bon ni //
translated: In the same way, the seed of consciousness

original: sems spyod yul du g-yo ba dang // so sor snang 'byung byis pa rnams //
analyzed: sems spyod yul du g-yo ba dang // so sor snang 'byung byis pa rnams //
translated: moves in the sphere of the mind, and the arising of individual appearances

original: rang rib rab rib can yin no //
analyzed: rang rib rab rib can yin no //
translated: is the eye disease of the childish.

original: thog ma med pa'i 'khor bar rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba rin po che gser gyi rang bzhin ltar rnam pa ngo bo nyid kyis dag pa'i kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni bdag dang gzhan gyi rgyud kyi dbang gi khyad par gyi shugs dang /
analyzed: thog ma med pa'i 'khor bar rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba rin po che gser gyi rang bzhin ltar rnam pa ngo bo nyid kyis dag pa'i kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni bdag dang gzhan gyi rgyud kyi dbang gi khyad par gyi shugs dang /
translated: In beginningless cyclic existence, the naturally luminous ground consciousness, which is by nature pure, is like a naturally precious gold.üîΩThe power of the special strength of one's own and others' mindstreams, the predispositions of the teachings of the holy and the holy ones, and the formative forces of virtue and nonvirtue are like gold that is covered by stains.

original: dam pa dang / dam pas yin pa'i chos bstan pa'i bag chags dang / dge ba dang / mi dge ba'i 'du byed pa rnams gser dri mas gos ba lta bu'i 'dzin pa dang / gzung bar snang ba thal ba dang / 'dzin pa'i se'u sa btso ba la sogs pa lta bur shes rab kyis dpyad de gnyis kyi dri ma med par bya'o //
analyzed: dam pa dang / dam pas yin pa'i chos bstan pa'i bag chags dang / dge ba dang / mi dge ba'i 'du byed pa rnams gser dri mas gos ba lta bu'i 'dzin pa dang / gzung bar snang ba thal ba dang / 'dzin pa'i se'u sa btso ba la sogs pa lta bur shes rab kyis dpyad de gnyis kyi dri ma med par bya'o //
translated: The appearance of the apprehended and the apprehender should be analyzed with wisdom and made free of the stains of the two.

original: gang gi tshe na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe na /
translated: When?

original: gzugs ni rdul phran gzhigs pa na //
analyzed: gzugs ni rdul phran gzhigs pa na //
translated: When form is analyzed into particles,

original: rdul phran cha ni med pa ste //
analyzed: rdul phran cha ni med pa ste //
translated: the particles are partless.

original: zhes pas phyi rol gyi mi dmigs pa de'i tshe stong pa snang ba med pa gnyis kyi rnam pa dang bral ba sems pa med pa'i don dam pa'i yang dag par rig pa bdag nyid du gnas so //
analyzed: zhes pas phyi rol gyi mi dmigs pa de'i tshe stong pa snang ba med pa gnyis kyi rnam pa dang bral ba sems pa med pa'i don dam pa'i yang dag par rig pa bdag nyid du gnas so //
translated: When the external is not observed, it is free from the aspects of emptiness and non-appearance, and abides as the ultimate reality of the mind, which is the meaning of non-mentation.

original: snying rje'i bag chags kyis bskul bas dge ba'i bag chags mngon par 'du byed pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pa gzugs rnam pa sna tshogs kyi rnal 'byor gyi dbang po'i cho 'phrul rnams kyis yid bzhin gyi nor bu rin po che bzhin du sems can thams cad la don byed do zhes mdo'i sde spros pa'i don du thams cad mkhyen pas @78b dgongs pa'o
analyzed: snying rje'i bag chags kyis bskul bas dge ba'i bag chags mngon par 'du byed pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pa gzugs rnam pa sna tshogs kyi rnal 'byor gyi dbang po'i cho 'phrul rnams kyis yid bzhin gyi nor bu rin po che bzhin du sems can thams cad la don byed do zhes mdo'i sde spros pa'i don du thams cad mkhyen pas @78b dgongs pa'o
translated: Since it is impelled by the latent tendencies of compassion, it creates the latent tendencies of virtue, and through the various forms of the omniscient one's magical power of the lord of yoga, it benefits all sentient beings like a wish-fulfilling jewel. This is the omniscient one's intention regarding the sutra section of the sutras with provisional meaning.

original: // snang ba dang bcas pa dang / snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin la bzhugs te /
analyzed: // snang ba dang bcas pa dang / snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin la bzhugs te /
translated: It is taught that the bodhisattva who has attained the eighth ground abides in the samadhis of appearance and non-appearance,üîΩand that the bodhisattva who has attained the tenth ground abides in the samadhis of the emptiness of emptiness and the ultimate emptiness.

original: rgyu mthun par byed pa dang / chos nyid kyi sangs rgyas kyi khyad par rnams kyis thams cad mkhyen pa rab tu sangs rgyas pa yang sems mnyam par 'jog pa'i rgyud 'dag par mdzad pa'i slad du rnal 'byor pa rnams la chos bshad do //
analyzed: rgyu mthun par byed pa dang / chos nyid kyi sangs rgyas kyi khyad par rnams kyis thams cad mkhyen pa rab tu sangs rgyas pa yang sems mnyam par 'jog pa'i rgyud 'dag par mdzad pa'i slad du rnal 'byor pa rnams la chos bshad do //
translated: The Dharma is taught to yogins in order to purify their mind streams, so that they may attain the perfect enlightenment of omniscience through the power of the concordant cause and the special qualities of the dharmatƒÅ buddha.üîΩAll the nirmƒÅ·πáakƒÅya buddhas, the bhagavƒÅns, teach the Dharma to yogins in order to purify their mind streams, so that they may attain the perfect enlightenment of omniscience through the power of the concordant cause and the special qualities of the dharmatƒÅ buddha.üîΩThe nirmƒÅ·πáakƒÅya buddhas, the bhagavƒÅns, teach the Dharma to yogins in order to purify their mind streams, so that they may attain the perfect enlightenment of omniscience through the power of the concordant cause and the special qualities of the dharmatƒÅ buddha.

original: sprul pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams thams cad mkhyen pa mchog tu yongs su dag cing 'dod chags dang bral ba gzugs rnam pa sna tshogs kyi rnal 'byor gyi dbang po cho 'phrul rnam pa sna tshogs kyis mtha' med pa'i sems can rnams mgu bar mdzad pa'iüîΩphyir gnyis pa dang / mi gnyis pa'i chos rgol ba dang / lan gdab pa dang / tshad ma dang / gzhal bya la sogs pa'i tshul dang / phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba dang /
analyzed: sprul pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams thams cad mkhyen pa mchog tu yongs su dag cing 'dod chags dang bral ba gzugs rnam pa sna tshogs kyi rnal 'byor gyi dbang po cho 'phrul rnam pa sna tshogs kyis mtha' med pa'i sems can rnams mgu bar mdzad pa'iüîΩphyir gnyis pa dang / mi gnyis pa'i chos rgol ba dang / lan gdab pa dang / tshad ma dang / gzhal bya la sogs pa'i tshul dang / phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba dang /
translated: The nirmƒÅ·πáakƒÅya buddhas, the bhagavƒÅns, teach the Dharma to yogins in order to purify their mind streams, so that they may attain the perfect enlightenment of omniscience through the power of the concordant cause and the special qualities of the dharmatƒÅ buddha.üîΩThe nirmƒÅ·πáakƒÅya buddhas, the bhagavƒÅns, teach the Dharma to yogins in order to purify their mind streams, so that they may attain the perfect enlightenment of omniscience through the power of the concordant cause and the special qualities of the dharmatƒÅ buddha.

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi khyad par du 'chad pa dang / snang ba rnam pa sna tshogs kyi rjes su song ba dang / gang zag la bdag med pa kho na nyid la gzhol bar chos 'chad do //
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi khyad par du 'chad pa dang / snang ba rnam pa sna tshogs kyi rjes su song ba dang / gang zag la bdag med pa kho na nyid la gzhol bar chos 'chad do //
translated: He teaches the Dharma in order to make them enter into the special qualities that lead to enlightenment, in order to make them follow the various kinds of light, and in order to make them enter into the reality of the selflessness of personality.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa rnam pa sna tshogs dang / shes rab kyis thabs la mkhas zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe shes rab kyis dpyad de shes par bya ba mi dmigs pa de'i tshe chos kyi sku la bzhugs pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams bsam pa med pa'i snang ba med pa don dam pa'i bdenüîΩpa mi gnyis pa'i chud pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa rnam pa sna tshogs dang / shes rab kyis thabs la mkhas zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe shes rab kyis dpyad de shes par bya ba mi dmigs pa de'i tshe chos kyi sku la bzhugs pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams bsam pa med pa'i snang ba med pa don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis pa'i chud pa ste /
translated: The bodhisattva's various practices, and the skill in liberative art that consists of wisdom, are as follows: When one examines with wisdom and does not perceive anything, then one enters into the Dharma Body of the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, which is the ultimate truth, the non-dual, non-differentiated reality.

original: de ni chos nyid kyi sangs rgyas zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de ni chos nyid kyi sangs rgyas zhes brjod do //
translated: This is called the Dharma Body of the Buddhas.

original: de shes rab dang mthun pa'i btsun gtso'i byang chub sems dpa' gzhan dag kyang dngos po dang / dngos po med pa'i rnam par mi rtog pa'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa mnyam pa nyid thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de shes rab dang mthun pa'i btsun gtso'i byang chub sems dpa' gzhan dag kyang dngos po dang / dngos po med pa'i rnam par mi rtog pa'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa mnyam pa nyid thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: And other Bodhisattvas, who are the chief monks in accord with wisdom, will also attain the equality of cyclic existence and nirvana, abiding in the concentration of non-conceptuality with regard to entity and non-entity.

original: ji ltar dbu ma las 'byung ba //üîΩmya ngan 'das pa'i mtha' gang yin //
analyzed: ji ltar dbu ma las 'byung ba // mya ngan 'das pa'i mtha' gang yin //
translated: As it is said in the Madhyamaka:üîΩWhat is the limit of nirvana?

original: 'khor ba'i mtha' yang gang yin pa //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i mtha' yang gang yin pa //
translated: What is the limit of cyclic existence?

original: de gnyis par na cung zad kyang //
analyzed: de gnyis par na cung zad kyang //
translated: These two are not the slightest bit different,

original: shin tu phra ba yod pa min //
analyzed: shin tu phra ba yod pa min //
translated: not even in the most subtle way.

original: zhes te / gnyis kyi rnam par shes pas mthar dbye ba ni nus kyi gnyis su med pa'i chos nyid la ni ma yin te /üîΩde bas na dngos po dang / @79a * //
analyzed: zhes te / gnyis kyi rnam par shes pas mthar dbye ba ni nus kyi gnyis su med pa'i chos nyid la ni ma yin te / de bas na dngos po dang / @79a * //
translated: The consciousness of duality can make a distinction at the limit, but not in the non-dual reality.

original: dngos po med pa'i rnam par spong ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa yin te /
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i rnam par spong ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, the abandonment of entity and non-entity is nirvana,

original: sems kyi rgyud dag pa nyid do //
analyzed: sems kyi rgyud dag pa nyid do //
translated: the purification of the continuum of mind.

original: gser gyi dri ma thal ba dang / 'jim pa'i se'u sa btso ba la sogs pas rim gyis dri ma spang zhing sbyong ba bzhin du sems kyang mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / mi mdzes pa dang / stong pa bsgoms pas sems yul las bzlog par bya'o //
analyzed: gser gyi dri ma thal ba dang / 'jim pa'i se'u sa btso ba la sogs pas rim gyis dri ma spang zhing sbyong ba bzhin du sems kyang mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / mi mdzes pa dang / stong pa bsgoms pas sems yul las bzlog par bya'o //
translated: Just as gold is purified by removing the impurities gradually, with ashes, clay, and so on, so the mind is purified by removing the impurities gradually, by meditating on impermanence, suffering, ugliness, and emptiness, and by turning the mind away from objects.

original: dge ba mngon par 'du byed pa rnams kyis gnas kyi rim pa dang / yul dang / dus dang / rkyen gyi khyad par snang ba rnams kyis aa mra'i 'bras bu yongs su smin pa bzhin du sems kyang rim gyis yongs su smin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge ba mngon par 'du byed pa rnams kyis gnas kyi rim pa dang / yul dang / dus dang / rkyen gyi khyad par snang ba rnams kyis aa mra'i 'bras bu yongs su smin pa bzhin du sems kyang rim gyis yongs su smin par 'gyur ro //
translated: By the performance of wholesome actions, the mind gradually matures, like a mango fruit, through the appearance of the stages of the place, the object, the time, and the special conditions.

original: dngos po kha gcig gi mun pa dus du mar yul du 'phrogs pa rnams kyang nyi ma dang zla ba'i 'od kyis cig car zad par 'gyur ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dngos po kha gcig gi mun pa dus du mar yul du 'phrogs pa rnams kyang nyi ma dang zla ba'i 'od kyis cig car zad par 'gyur ba bzhin no //
translated: Just as the darkness of many things, stolen in many places, is destroyed at once by the light of the sun and moon.

original: ji bzhin du yang me tog ku mu ta dang / padmo 'od kyis rgyas par byed pa de bzhin du thams cad mkhyen pa yang sems can rnams kyi sems la skal ba yod pa dang / med pa mkhyen par mdzad de /
analyzed: ji bzhin du yang me tog ku mu ta dang / padmo 'od kyis rgyas par byed pa de bzhin du thams cad mkhyen pa yang sems can rnams kyi sems la skal ba yod pa dang / med pa mkhyen par mdzad de /
translated: Just as the sun causes the kumuda and padma flowers to open and close, so the Omniscient One knows the potential and non-potential of the minds of sentient beings.

original: nyi mas padmo'i tshal gyi padmo rim gyis cig car rgyas par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: nyi mas padmo'i tshal gyi padmo rim gyis cig car rgyas par byed pa yin no //
translated: The sun causes the lotus grove to open and close in sequence and all at once.
