original: de ste yang tshangs pa dang / dbang po la sogs pa chad pa'i bdag nyid kyi dngos po rtag pa nyid yin na ni rgyu med pas na yod par mi rigs te /
analyzed: de ste yang tshangs pa dang / dbang po la sogs pa chad pa'i bdag nyid kyi dngos po rtag pa nyid yin na ni rgyu med pas na yod par mi rigs te /
translated: If, on the other hand, Brahma, Ishvara, etc. were permanent entities with an interrupted nature, they would not be reasonable as existent because of being causeless.

original: mo gsham gyi bu dang / ri bong gi rva dang / nam mkha'i autpal la sogs pa bzhin du ma skyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mo gsham gyi bu dang / ri bong gi rva dang / nam mkha'i autpal la sogs pa bzhin du ma skyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are not produced, like the son of a barren woman, the horn of a rabbit, a sky-lotus, etc.

original: des na rgyu dang bcas pa'i chud pa rnams nyid kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang bar gzhag pa'i rigs so //
analyzed: des na rgyu dang bcas pa'i chud pa rnams nyid kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang bar gzhag pa'i rigs so //
translated: Therefore, it is reasonable to posit only those with causes as afflicted and purified.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa rgyun 'brel par 'jug pa rnams dge ba dang / mi dge ba mngon par 'du byed pa rnams kyis khyad par can du rigs pas na mi rtag pa rnams kyi 'khrul pa yongs su zad de /
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa rgyun 'brel par 'jug pa rnams dge ba dang / mi dge ba mngon par 'du byed pa rnams kyis khyad par can du rigs pas na mi rtag pa rnams kyi 'khrul pa yongs su zad de /
translated: The continuum of the foundation consciousness is engaged in a connected series, and it is qualified by the formation of virtue and nonvirtue. Therefore, it is reasonable that the confusion of impermanent things is completely exhausted.

original: yongs su dag pa kho na de dag la 'thad do //
analyzed: yongs su dag pa kho na de dag la 'thad do //
translated: Only the completely pure is tenable for them.

original: de bas na bdag dang gzhan gyi rgyud kyi dbang dang / rkyen gyi khyad par gyi mthus mgo 'khor ba dang / brgyal ba la sogs pa bzhin du de dag gi rnam pa sna tshogs kyi rnam pa yod pa shes rab kyis dpyad de /
analyzed: de bas na bdag dang gzhan gyi rgyud kyi dbang dang / rkyen gyi khyad par gyi mthus mgo 'khor ba dang / brgyal ba la sogs pa bzhin du de dag gi rnam pa sna tshogs kyi rnam pa yod pa shes rab kyis dpyad de /
translated: Therefore, by the power of the special conditions of one‚Äôs own and others‚Äô continuums, like the spinning of a wheel or fainting, and so on, the various aspects of those [appearances] are analyzed with wisdom.

original: sbom po dang phra mo rnam par gzhigs pa na gang gi tshe mi dmigs pa de'i tshe chud pa rnams rgyun 'brel bar 'jug pa bsam pa dang bral zhing snang ba med pa gnyis su med pa'i don dam pa'i bden pa rang @79b gis gnas so //
analyzed: sbom po dang phra mo rnam par gzhigs pa na gang gi tshe mi dmigs pa de'i tshe chud pa rnams rgyun 'brel bar 'jug pa bsam pa dang bral zhing snang ba med pa gnyis su med pa'i don dam pa'i bden pa rang @79b gis gnas so //
translated: When the coarse and subtle are dissected and not observed, then the connected continuum of the mind is free from thought, free from appearances, and the ultimate truth of nonduality naturally abides.

original: snying rje'i bag chags kyis glengs pa na mchog tu yongs su dag cing 'dod chags dang bral ba thams cad mkhyen pa rnal 'byor gyi dbang po de dag gi gzugs rnam pa sna tshogs 'byung ngo //
analyzed: snying rje'i bag chags kyis glengs pa na mchog tu yongs su dag cing 'dod chags dang bral ba thams cad mkhyen pa rnal 'byor gyi dbang po de dag gi gzugs rnam pa sna tshogs 'byung ngo //
translated: When the latent impressions of compassion are aroused, the forms of those lords of yoga, the omniscient ones, who are utterly pure and free from attachment, arise in various ways.

original: de lta bur yang de dag la snang ba dang bcas pa dang / snang ba med pa gnyis pa dang / mi gnyis pa'i ting nge 'dzin du dbye bar 'byed pa na rab tu dga' ba'i sa'i dbang por 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta bur yang de dag la snang ba dang bcas pa dang / snang ba med pa gnyis pa dang / mi gnyis pa'i ting nge 'dzin du dbye bar 'byed pa na rab tu dga' ba'i sa'i dbang por 'gyur te /
translated: In that way, when they are divided into two‚Äîwith appearance and without appearance‚Äîand nondual samƒÅdhi, they become the lords of the stage of the utterly joyful one.

original: bdag dang gzhan gyi yon tan gyi tshogs chen po 'byung ba'i sangs rgyas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan gyi yon tan gyi tshogs chen po 'byung ba'i sangs rgyas su 'gyur ro //
translated: They become buddhas, from whom great accumulations of qualities for oneself and others arise.

original: de bas na byang chub sems dpas bdag gi grub pa'i mtha' la mkhas par bya'i gzhan gyi grub pa'i mtha' rnams la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na byang chub sems dpas bdag gi grub pa'i mtha' la mkhas par bya'i gzhan gyi grub pa'i mtha' rnams la ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, bodhisattvas should be skilled in their own tenets and not in the tenets of others.

original: rtag pa dang / bdag dang / tshangs pa dang / dbang po la sogs pa ma skyes pas na ri bong gi rva bzhin du med par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rtag pa dang / bdag dang / tshangs pa dang / dbang po la sogs pa ma skyes pas na ri bong gi rva bzhin du med par rig par bya'o //
translated: Since the self, the supreme principle, the creator, and so forth are not born, they should be known to be nonexistent, like the horn of a rabbit.

original: de nas yang blo gros chen pos gsol ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de nas yang blo gros chen pos gsol ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Then again, MahƒÅmati made a request, and so forth.

original: kun tu brtags pa dang / gzhan gyi dbang dang / yongs su grub pa'i rang bzhin shes rab kyis dpyad par bya ste /
analyzed: kun tu brtags pa dang / gzhan gyi dbang dang / yongs su grub pa'i rang bzhin shes rab kyis dpyad par bya ste /
translated: The imagined, the dependent, and the perfected natures should be analyzed with wisdom.

original: ming dang / mtshan ma dang / rnam par rtog pa dang / de bzhin nyid dang / yang dag pa'i ye shes dang / chos lnga de dag kun tu brtags pa dang / gzhan gyi dbang dang / yongs su grub pa'i khyad par du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: ming dang / mtshan ma dang / rnam par rtog pa dang / de bzhin nyid dang / yang dag pa'i ye shes dang / chos lnga de dag kun tu brtags pa dang / gzhan gyi dbang dang / yongs su grub pa'i khyad par du shes par bya'o //
translated: Those five dharmas‚Äîname, sign, conceptualization, suchness, and right wisdom‚Äîshould be known as the distinctions of the imagined, the dependent, and the perfected.

original: de la kun tu brtags pa ni ji srid du rnam par rtog pa rnams shes par yod pa de srid du kun tu brtags pa'o //
analyzed: de la kun tu brtags pa ni ji srid du rnam par rtog pa rnams shes par yod pa de srid du kun tu brtags pa'o //
translated: Among them, the imagined is as long as the conceptualizations exist.

original: gzhan gyi dbang las kyi mtshan nyid ni gsal ba'i rnam pa gnyis kyi rnam pas stong pa ni yongs su grub pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang las kyi mtshan nyid ni gsal ba'i rnam pa gnyis kyi rnam pas stong pa ni yongs su grub pa'o //
translated: The characteristic of the relative is the emptiness of the two aspects of manifestation. The fulfilled is the perfected.

original: de la ming kun tu brtags par bsdu'o //
analyzed: de la ming kun tu brtags par bsdu'o //
translated: Among these, the name is included in the imagined.

original: mtshan ma dang rnam par rtog pa ni gzhan gyi dbang du'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma dang rnam par rtog pa ni gzhan gyi dbang du'o //
translated: The sign and the discrimination are in the relative.

original: de bzhin nyid dang / yang dag pa'i ye shes ni yongs su grub par ro //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid dang / yang dag pa'i ye shes ni yongs su grub par ro //
translated: Reality and right knowledge are in the perfected.

original: ji ltar dgongs pa nges par 'grel ba las 'byung ba /
analyzed: ji ltar dgongs pa nges par 'grel ba las 'byung ba /
translated: As it is said in the Samdhinirmocana:

original: rigs kyi bu rang bzhin med pa rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu rang bzhin med pa rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: ‚ÄúSon of the family! There are three kinds of unreality:

original: mtshan nyid rang bzhin med pa dang / skye ba rang bzhin med pa dang / don dam pa rang bzhin med pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid rang bzhin med pa dang / skye ba rang bzhin med pa dang / don dam pa rang bzhin med pa'o //
translated: unreality of characteristic, unreality of origination, and ultimate unreality.

original: rtag pa dang / bdag dang / phyi dang / yan lag can dang / rdul phra mo'i bye brag ni mtshan nyid du gang dag gis dngos po rnams rnam par rtog par byed pa de dag gis med pas na mtshan nyid kyi rang bzhin med pa'o //
analyzed: rtag pa dang / bdag dang / phyi dang / yan lag can dang / rdul phra mo'i bye brag ni mtshan nyid du gang dag gis dngos po rnams rnam par rtog par byed pa de dag gis med pas na mtshan nyid kyi rang bzhin med pa'o //
translated: The unreality of characteristic is the nonexistence of those characteristics by which things are imagined to be permanent, a self, external, wholes, or made of subtle particles.

original: byed pa dang / byed pa pos stong pa nyid pas na rmi lam dang mig 'phrul @80a * //
analyzed: byed pa dang / byed pa pos stong pa nyid pas na rmi lam dang mig 'phrul @80a * //
translated: Because it is empty of an agent and an object of action, it is like a dream and an optical illusion.üîΩ

original: la sogs pa bzhin gzhan gyi dbang gi las kyi rnam pa yang skye bar mi rung ngo //
analyzed: la sogs pa bzhin gzhan gyi dbang gi las kyi rnam pa yang skye bar mi rung ngo //
translated: and because of the emptiness of the agent and action, the aspect of the dependent nature is not suitable to arise, like a dream, an optical illusion, and so forth.

original: rnam pa gnyis kyi chud pa yongs su dag pa ni don dam pa'i rang bzhin med pa ste /
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis kyi chud pa yongs su dag pa ni don dam pa'i rang bzhin med pa ste /
translated: The purity of the aspect of the two is the ultimate naturelessness,

original: gnyis kyi rnam pa dang bral ba nyid do //
analyzed: gnyis kyi rnam pa dang bral ba nyid do //
translated: which is the freedom from the aspect of the two.

original: ji ltar mdo sde 'di nyid du gsungs pa /
analyzed: ji ltar mdo sde 'di nyid du gsungs pa /
translated: As it is said in this very s≈´tra:

original: brtags pa'i dngos pos dngos po skye med kun //
analyzed: brtags pa'i dngos pos dngos po skye med kun //
translated: All things are unarisen, due to the nature of the imagined.

original: gzhan dbang rten nas mi rnams rnam rtog ste //
analyzed: gzhan dbang rten nas mi rnams rnam rtog ste //
translated: The dependent is the conception of humans, based on conditions.

original: gang tshe gzhan dbang rnam rtog bral dag pa //
analyzed: gang tshe gzhan dbang rnam rtog bral dag pa //
translated: When the dependent is free from conception, it is pure,

original: grub pa de bzhin nyid par mdor ngas bstan //
analyzed: grub pa de bzhin nyid par mdor ngas bstan //
translated: and I have taught that it is the ultimate, suchness, in brief.

original: zhes pa'o // gang gi tshe na shes rab kyis sbom po dang / phra mo rnam par phye ste /
analyzed: zhes pa'o // gang gi tshe na shes rab kyis sbom po dang / phra mo rnam par phye ste /
translated: When the gross and subtle are distinguished by means of wisdom,

original: 'khrul pa'i gzugs stong par mthong ba de'i tshe rnam par 'khrul ba log nas yang dag par rig pa mi gnyis pa nyid gnas so //
analyzed: 'khrul pa'i gzugs stong par mthong ba de'i tshe rnam par 'khrul ba log nas yang dag par rig pa mi gnyis pa nyid gnas so //
translated: When the empty nature of the illusory form is seen, then the error is reversed and the nondual perfect knowledge abides.

original: de nas snying rje'i bag chags kyis bskul nas thams cad mkhyen pa gzugs rnam pa sna tshogs kyi rnal 'byor gyi dbang po mchog tu yongs su dag cing 'dod chags dang bral ba cho 'phrul chen pos mtha' yas pa'i sems can gyi rgyud mgu bar mdzad cing /
analyzed: de nas snying rje'i bag chags kyis bskul nas thams cad mkhyen pa gzugs rnam pa sna tshogs kyi rnal 'byor gyi dbang po mchog tu yongs su dag cing 'dod chags dang bral ba cho 'phrul chen pos mtha' yas pa'i sems can gyi rgyud mgu bar mdzad cing /
translated: Then, impelled by the latent tendencies of compassion, the lord of yogins, the omniscient one, who is completely pure and free from attachment to the various aspects of form, delights the mind-streams of infinite sentient beings with the great miracle.

original: snang ba dang bcas pa dang / snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi bye brag las 'khor ba yod kyi bar du gzhan gyi don du rgyun du bzhugs so //
analyzed: snang ba dang bcas pa dang / snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi bye brag las 'khor ba yod kyi bar du gzhan gyi don du rgyun du bzhugs so //
translated: And, from the distinctions of the samƒÅdhi with appearance and without appearance, he continuously abides for the benefit of others for as long as sa·πÉsƒÅra exists.

original: de nas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams mya ngan las 'das pa las mi bzhugs shing /
analyzed: de nas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams mya ngan las 'das pa las mi bzhugs shing /
translated: Then, the bhagavƒÅn buddhas do not remain in nirvƒÅ·πáa.

original: 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa mnyam pa nyid brnyes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa mnyam pa nyid brnyes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is said that they attain the sameness of sa·πÉsƒÅra and nirvƒÅ·πáa.

original: rkyen gyis ma brtsams zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi dbang la skye ba'i rang bzhin med par gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: rkyen gyis ma brtsams zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi dbang la skye ba'i rang bzhin med par gsungs pa'o //
translated: The statement not produced by conditions means that the other-dependent does not have the nature of arising.

original: phyi nang gi yul rnam par dben pa zhes bya ba ni mi gnyis pa'i chud pa la rnam pa med pa nyid do //
analyzed: phyi nang gi yul rnam par dben pa zhes bya ba ni mi gnyis pa'i chud pa la rnam pa med pa nyid do //
translated: The statement the external and internal objects are void means that the non-dual consciousness is devoid of aspects.

original: de ste phyir yul med na snang ba ci zhig ces pa dang / de'i phyir gzungs pa sems phyi rol tu lta bas so //
analyzed: de ste phyir yul med na snang ba ci zhig ces pa dang / de'i phyir gzungs pa sems phyi rol tu lta bas so //
translated: If the external object does not exist, what is the appearance? and Therefore, the mind, which is the apprehender, is seen externally.

original: sems nyid rnam pa gnyis su snang zhes pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: sems nyid rnam pa gnyis su snang zhes pa'i bar du'o //
translated: The mind itself appears as the two aspects.

original: de ltar gnyis kyi rnam pa mi dmigs pas mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa rnams rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa'i rim pa'i ting nge 'dzin 'thob po //
analyzed: de ltar gnyis kyi rnam pa mi dmigs pas mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa rnams rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa'i rim pa'i ting nge 'dzin 'thob po //
translated: Thus, by not objectifying the two, those who abide in the samƒÅdhi of signlessness attain the samƒÅdhis of the stages of joy and so forth.

original: byed pa dang ldan pa'i skye ba dang bral zhes bya ba ni byed pa po dang / las dang / byed pas bskyed pa la sogs par 'brel ba dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: byed pa dang ldan pa'i skye ba dang bral zhes bya ba ni byed pa po dang / las dang / byed pas bskyed pa la sogs par 'brel ba dang bral ba'o //
translated: The statement free from the arising of an agent means free from the connection of agent, action, and instrument, and so forth.

original: mu stegs can gyi gnas su nye bar 'gro zhes bya ba ni mu stegs can thams cad rangs par mdzad pa'i phyir dbang po'i gzugs kyis de dag @80b la chos 'chad par mdzad do //
analyzed: mu stegs can gyi gnas su nye bar 'gro zhes bya ba ni mu stegs can thams cad rangs par mdzad pa'i phyir dbang po'i gzugs kyis de dag @80b la chos 'chad par mdzad do //
translated: Approaching the abode of the tirthikas means that, in order to please all the tirthikas, he teaches the Dharma to them in the form of Indra.

original: gnas 'phos pa zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin gyi rim gyis gnas 'pho ba'o //
analyzed: gnas 'phos pa zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin gyi rim gyis gnas 'pho ba'o //
translated: The change of abode means the change of abode through the stages of samadhi.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i spu ni chos kyi sku'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i spu ni chos kyi sku'o //
translated: The Tathagata's hair is the Dharma body.

original: rjes su 'brang ba rab tu thob pa rnams kyi zhes pa ni gang gi tshe phung po la sogs pa'i skye ba la sogs pa spros pa mi mthong ba de'i tshe snang ba med pa'i sangs rgyas kyis la 'jug par 'gyur ba ni sems tsam yongs su 'dzin
analyzed: rjes su 'brang ba rab tu thob pa rnams kyi zhes pa ni gang gi tshe phung po la sogs pa'i skye ba la sogs pa spros pa mi mthong ba de'i tshe snang ba med pa'i sangs rgyas kyis la 'jug par 'gyur ba ni sems tsam yongs su 'dzin
translated: Those who have attained the state of following means that when they do not see the proliferation of arising, etc. of the aggregates, etc., at that time they enter into the Buddha's state without appearance, and by apprehending mere mind,

original: pas sa la 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: pas sa la 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: they enter the stages.

original: ting nge 'dzin du 'brel pa'i rim pa der sems rnams 'jog par byed do //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin du 'brel pa'i rim pa der sems rnams 'jog par byed do //
translated: They place their minds in that stage, which is connected with samadhi.

original: bdag gi sems snang ba'i spyod yul dang rnam par bral bar byed pa ni gang gi tshe shes rab kyis dmigs pa mi mthong ba'o //
analyzed: bdag gi sems snang ba'i spyod yul dang rnam par bral bar byed pa ni gang gi tshe shes rab kyis dmigs pa mi mthong ba'o //
translated: The statement, ‚ÄúThe mind is freed from the domain of appearances,‚Äù means that when wisdom does not see an objective referent, the mind is freed from the domain of appearances.

original: thams cad brjod pa ni dam pa'i chos kyi 'grel pa dang / dam pa'i chos kyi tshig ces bya ba dang / dam pa'i chos kyi spyod pa dang zhes bya ba dang / mtshan nyid thams cad spyod ces bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: thams cad brjod pa ni dam pa'i chos kyi 'grel pa dang / dam pa'i chos kyi tshig ces bya ba dang / dam pa'i chos kyi spyod pa dang zhes bya ba dang / mtshan nyid thams cad spyod ces bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: The statement, ‚ÄúAll is explained,‚Äù means that all is explained in the commentary on the holy Dharma, in the words of the holy Dharma, in the practice of the holy Dharma, and so on, up to the practice of all characteristics.

original: mtshan nyid dang / mtshan mar bya ba gcig pa dang / tha dad par mi rung ba ni sngar bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: mtshan nyid dang / mtshan mar bya ba gcig pa dang / tha dad par mi rung ba ni sngar bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: The statement, ‚ÄúThe characteristic and the characteristicized are not suitable as identical or different,‚Äù is as explained above.

original: rgya mtsho'i rlabs lta bur kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams so //
analyzed: rgya mtsho'i rlabs lta bur kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams so //
translated: The statement, ‚ÄúThe consciousnesses that engage the store consciousness are like waves in a great ocean‚Äù means that the store consciousness is like the ocean and the consciousnesses that engage the store consciousness are like waves in the ocean.

original: rang gi sems snang ba la 'dzin par khong du ma chud pa ni sems kyi snang ba bdag nyid kyi yin te de 'dzin pa dang / de las gzhan pa rnam par dag pa dang / rnam pa gzhan med par ston par byed de de ni tshad ma gcig gi bya ba yin te /
analyzed: rang gi sems snang ba la 'dzin par khong du ma chud pa ni sems kyi snang ba bdag nyid kyi yin te de 'dzin pa dang / de las gzhan pa rnam par dag pa dang / rnam pa gzhan med par ston par byed de de ni tshad ma gcig gi bya ba yin te /
translated: It is shown that there is no other pure aspect apart from that, and that is the function of one valid cognition.

original: thams cad mkhyen pas gzhan spong ba'i rang gi mtshan nyid par dgongs par brtag go //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pas gzhan spong ba'i rang gi mtshan nyid par dgongs par brtag go //
translated: It should be understood that the Omniscient One intends the exclusion of other as the characteristic of that.

original: 'dzin pa ni gzhan rnam par dgag pa'o //üîΩgnas ngan len ni 'khrul pa'i rang bzhin te /
analyzed: 'dzin pa ni gzhan rnam par dgag pa'o // gnas ngan len ni 'khrul pa'i rang bzhin te /
translated: Grasping is the exclusion of other.üîΩThe negative reflex is the nature of error.

original: de'i bag chags mngon par chags pa'o //
analyzed: de'i bag chags mngon par chags pa'o //
translated: Its latent impressions are the attachment.

original: rnam par shes pa ni 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams so //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ni 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams so //
translated: Consciousness is the active consciousnesses.

original: de'i rang bzhin ni rgyu ste kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin ni rgyu ste kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: Its nature is the cause, which is the store-consciousness.

original: rmi lam la sogs pa bzhin du dbyer med pas de'i ngo bo nyid du 'jog go //
analyzed: rmi lam la sogs pa bzhin du dbyer med pas de'i ngo bo nyid du 'jog go //
translated: Since it is inseparable from that, it is posited as its essence, like a dream, etc.

original: gzugs rnam pa sna tshogs kyi mtshan nyid ni kha dog dang dbyibs su rab tu phye ba'o //üîΩde la ngo mtshar gyi phyir mig gdangs pas rnam par shes pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gzugs rnam pa sna tshogs kyi mtshan nyid ni kha dog dang dbyibs su rab tu phye ba'o // de la ngo mtshar gyi phyir mig gdangs pas rnam par shes pa 'byung ngo //
translated: The characteristic of form is the various aspects of color and shape.üîΩThe eye consciousness arises from the eye faculty, which is the cause of the eye consciousness, and from the form that is the object of the eye consciousness.üîΩThe eye consciousness arises from the eye faculty, which is the cause of the eye consciousness, and from the form that is the object of the eye consciousness.üîΩThe eye consciousness arises from the eye faculty, which is the cause of the eye consciousness, and from the form that is the object of the eye consciousness.

original: chu'i klung lta bu'i kun gzhi rnam par shes pa skad cig ma 'brel bar 'byung ba las rlabs dang 'dra ba'i dbang po'i chud pa rnams 'byung ngo //üîΩthams cad mkhyen pas de dang @81a * //
analyzed: chu'i klung lta bu'i kun gzhi rnam par shes pa skad cig ma 'brel bar 'byung ba las rlabs dang 'dra ba'i dbang po'i chud pa rnams 'byung ngo // thams cad mkhyen pas de dang @81a * //
translated: The eye consciousness arises from the eye faculty, which is the cause of the eye consciousness, and from the form that is the object of the eye consciousness.üîΩThe eye consciousness arises from the eye faculty, which is the cause of the eye consciousness, and from the form that is the object of the eye consciousness.üîΩThe eye consciousness arises from the eye faculty, which is the cause of the eye consciousness, and from the form that is the object of the eye consciousness.üîΩThe eye consciousness arises from the eye faculty, which is the cause of the eye consciousness, and from the form that is the object of the eye consciousness.üîΩThe eye consciousness arises from the eye faculty, which is the cause of the eye consciousness, and from the form that is the object of the eye consciousness.üîΩThe eye consciousness arises from the eye faculty, which is the cause of the eye consciousness, and from the form that is the object of the eye consciousness.üîΩThe eye consciousness arises from the eye faculty, which is the cause of the eye consciousness, and from the form that is the object of the eye consciousness.üîΩThe eye consciousness arises from the eye faculty, which is the cause of the eye consciousness, and from the form that is the object of the eye consciousness.üîΩThe eye consciousness arises from the eye faculty, which is the cause of the eye consciousness, and from the form that is the object of the eye consciousness.üîΩThe eye consciousness arises from the eye faculty, which is the cause of the eye consciousness, and from the form that is the object of the eye consciousness.

original: mtshungs par mdzad pa mig gi rnam par shes pa la ji ltar gzud pa de ltar lus kyi dbang po la sogs pa thams cad kyi rdul phra mo dang / spu'i khung bu la gnas te 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams cig car ram /üîΩrim gyis yul me long du gzugs brnyan snang ba bzhin no //
analyzed: mtshungs par mdzad pa mig gi rnam par shes pa la ji ltar gzud pa de ltar lus kyi dbang po la sogs pa thams cad kyi rdul phra mo dang / spu'i khung bu la gnas te 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams cig car ram / rim gyis yul me long du gzugs brnyan snang ba bzhin no //
translated: The eye consciousness arises from the eye faculty, which is the cause of the eye consciousness, and from the form that is the object of the eye consciousness.

original: de la yang me long gi gzugs su kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: de la yang me long gi gzugs su kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la dgongs pa'o //
translated: The eye consciousness arises from the eye faculty, which is the cause of the eye consciousness, and from the form that is the object of the eye consciousness.üîΩThe eye consciousness arises from the eye faculty, which is the cause of the eye consciousness,

original: sngon gzugs su snang ba'i sdug bsngal bag chags yongs su smin pa ni gzugs brnyan gyi gzugs su 'jug pa rnam par shes pa rnams te /
analyzed: sngon gzugs su snang ba'i sdug bsngal bag chags yongs su smin pa ni gzugs brnyan gyi gzugs su 'jug pa rnam par shes pa rnams te /
translated: The consciousnesses that enter into the form of reflections are the consciousnesses that have fully matured the habitual tendencies for the suffering of forms that appeared previously.

original: der so sor snang ngo //
analyzed: der so sor snang ngo //
translated: They appear individually there.

original: sngar yul du snang ba'i rlung gis btab pa'i bag chags yongs su smin pas rgya mtsho'i rlabs tha dad pa bslang ba bzhin du sems kyi rgya mtsho kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i rlabs ni dbang po'i chud pa ste kun gzhi'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: sngar yul du snang ba'i rlung gis btab pa'i bag chags yongs su smin pas rgya mtsho'i rlabs tha dad pa bslang ba bzhin du sems kyi rgya mtsho kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i rlabs ni dbang po'i chud pa ste kun gzhi'i rgyu'o //
translated: The waves of the ocean of mind, the consciousness of the ground of all, are the consciousnesses of the ground of all, which are the cause of the ocean of the ground of all.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni de'i bya ba'i mtshan nyid yod pa ste /
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni de'i bya ba'i mtshan nyid yod pa ste /
translated: The consciousness of the ground of all is the existence that has the characteristic of its function.

original: gang dag phan tshun gyi rgyur ldan pa'o //
analyzed: gang dag phan tshun gyi rgyur ldan pa'o //
translated: They are mutually possessing causes.

original: de ni kun gzhi dang 'jug pa'i chud pa gcig gi rgyu gcig yin no zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: de ni kun gzhi dang 'jug pa'i chud pa gcig gi rgyu gcig yin no zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: That is, the consciousness of the ground of all and the consciousnesses of the six active sense consciousnesses are the cause of each other.

original: las kyi mtshan nyid ni 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: las kyi mtshan nyid ni 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: The characteristic of karma is the active consciousnesses.

original: rigs kyi mtshan nyid ni kun gzhi rnam par shes par bsgrubs pa'o //
analyzed: rigs kyi mtshan nyid ni kun gzhi rnam par shes par bsgrubs pa'o //
translated: The characteristic of the potential is the consciousness of the ground of all.

original: khong du mi chud pa ni rnam par shes pa lnga'i tshogs te rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khong du mi chud pa ni rnam par shes pa lnga'i tshogs te rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The five groups of consciousness do not comprehend, because they are non-discursive.

original: rgyu dang yul bye brag med pa'i mtshan nyid khong du chud pa ni rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa yin gyi rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang yul bye brag med pa'i mtshan nyid khong du chud pa ni rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa yin gyi rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: The comprehension of the characteristic of the absence of difference of cause and object is discursive consciousness.

original: rgyu la rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: rgyu la rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: There are two kinds of causes:

original: shes par byed pa dang / skyed par byed pa ste /
analyzed: shes par byed pa dang / skyed par byed pa ste /
translated: the cause of production and the cause of manifestation.

original: ji ltar dud pas mi dang / sa bon gyis myu gu la'o //
analyzed: ji ltar dud pas mi dang / sa bon gyis myu gu la'o //
translated: For example, smoke and a seed are the causes of fire and a sprout.

original: ming zhes pa ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: ming zhes pa ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: Name is the mental consciousness.

original: yang la yang rnam pa gnyis te gzugs ma yin pa'i phung po rnams dang / ming dang mtshan ma la sogs pa'i chos lnga rnams te /
analyzed: yang la yang rnam pa gnyis te gzugs ma yin pa'i phung po rnams dang / ming dang mtshan ma la sogs pa'i chos lnga rnams te /
translated: There are two kinds of form: the four aggregates which are not form and the five dharmas beginning with name and sign.

original: yid de dag gi nang du song zhing khyab pa'o //
analyzed: yid de dag gi nang du song zhing khyab pa'o //
translated: The mental consciousness is included in and pervades them.

original: bdag nyid ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga po ste bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag nyid ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga po ste bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The five groups of consciousness are the cause of the mental consciousness, because they produce it.

original: de dag ces pa la sogs pa ni gcig la gcig rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba yin kyang ltos pa'i rnam par rtog pa med de /
analyzed: de dag ces pa la sogs pa ni gcig la gcig rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba yin kyang ltos pa'i rnam par rtog pa med de /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthese‚Äù and so on indicates that, although they are mutually dependent, there is no conceptualization of dependence.

original: de dag ni sa lu ljang ba'i mdo sde bzhin no //
analyzed: de dag ni sa lu ljang ba'i mdo sde bzhin no //
translated: This is like the ≈öƒÅlu Sprout S≈´tra.

original: rang gi sems ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ste /
analyzed: rang gi sems ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ste /
translated: One‚Äôs own mind is the storehouse consciousness.

original: de snang ba nyid la phyi'i don du rnam par rtog par mngon par zhen pas yid @81b kyi rnam par shes pa dang lhan cig tu zhugs pas na dbang po'i rnam par shes pa 'ba' zhig ni gtso ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de snang ba nyid la phyi'i don du rnam par rtog par mngon par zhen pas yid @81b kyi rnam par shes pa dang lhan cig tu zhugs pas na dbang po'i rnam par shes pa 'ba' zhig ni gtso ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is engaged together with the mental consciousness, the sense consciousnesses are not primary, since they are conceptualized and imagined to be external objects in the appearance of that .

original: shin tu phra bar rgyu'i bag chags ni nges par 'jug pa'i dbang po'i shes pa mnyam par gzhag pas chud pa'i mthur byed pa'i don lta bu ste /
analyzed: shin tu phra bar rgyu'i bag chags ni nges par 'jug pa'i dbang po'i shes pa mnyam par gzhag pas chud pa'i mthur byed pa'i don lta bu ste /
translated: The extremely subtle causal latent impressions are like the object that is the power of the engaged sense consciousnesses that are in equipoise.

original: de snang ba nyid la phyi'i don du rnam par rtog par byed pa dang / shin tu phra bar 'gyur ba bdag gi mthur zhugs zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: de snang ba nyid la phyi'i don du rnam par rtog par byed pa dang / shin tu phra bar 'gyur ba bdag gi mthur zhugs zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: Because they are conceptualized as external objects in the appearance of that , they are said to be ‚Äúengaged as one‚Äôs own power‚Äù and so on up to ‚Äúextremely subtle.‚Äù

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa rgyu zhing 'jug pa zhes bya ba la rgyu ba ni chud pa'o //
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa rgyu zhing 'jug pa zhes bya ba la rgyu ba ni chud pa'o //
translated: The alaya consciousness is said to be the cause and basis of the arising of the other seven consciousnesses.

original: gzhan du na sa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa la shes rab ni 'phags pa'i ye shes la mkhas pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan du na sa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa la shes rab ni 'phags pa'i ye shes la mkhas pa ste /
translated: The meaning of the other verses is as follows: ‚ÄúThe characteristic of the earth‚Äù and so on. Wisdom is the knowledge of the ƒÅryas.

original: log pa'i shes pa bzlog pa'i don du shes rab kyi tshig go //
analyzed: log pa'i shes pa bzlog pa'i don du shes rab kyi tshig go //
translated: The word ‚Äúwisdom‚Äù is used to counter wrong knowledge.

original: spros pa dang bral ba zhes bya ba ni snang ba dang bcas pa dang snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin thob pa rnams kyis zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: spros pa dang bral ba zhes bya ba ni snang ba dang bcas pa dang snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin thob pa rnams kyis zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúFree from conceptual elaboration‚Äù means that those who have attained the samƒÅdhi with and without appearances.

original: nags tshal stug po zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni shes rab kyi rnal 'byor med pa rnams kyis 'dod chags dang bral ba'i chos tsam gyi rnam pa 'di lta bu'i chos yang dag pa nyid mthong bar mi nus so //
analyzed: nags tshal stug po zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni shes rab kyi rnal 'byor med pa rnams kyis 'dod chags dang bral ba'i chos tsam gyi rnam pa 'di lta bu'i chos yang dag pa nyid mthong bar mi nus so //
translated: ‚ÄúDense forest‚Äù and so on. Those who do not have the yoga of wisdom are unable to see the suchness of phenomena, which is merely the dharma of freedom from attachment.

original: rgyal bas mdun du byas pa rnams kyis zhes bya ba ni bsnyen par byas pa rnams kyis so //
analyzed: rgyal bas mdun du byas pa rnams kyis zhes bya ba ni bsnyen par byas pa rnams kyis so //
translated: ‚ÄúThose who have made the Victor their front‚Äù means those who have made him their object of worship.

original: yang na gang dag gis rgyal ba mdun du byas pa rnams kyis zhes tshig bsdu'o //
analyzed: yang na gang dag gis rgyal ba mdun du byas pa rnams kyis zhes tshig bsdu'o //
translated: Or else, those who have the Victor as their leader.

original: rang gi sems snang ba'i rang bzhin nyid rnam par rtog pa'i spyod yul te yul lo //
analyzed: rang gi sems snang ba'i rang bzhin nyid rnam par rtog pa'i spyod yul te yul lo //
translated: The nature of the appearance of one‚Äôs own mind is the domain of conceptual thought.

original: ji ltar rgya mtsho'i dpa' rlabs rnams //
analyzed: ji ltar rgya mtsho'i dpa' rlabs rnams //
translated: Just as waves arise from the ocean,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rgya mtsho las rlabs rnams 'byung ba tha dad pa ma yin pa ltar ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rgya mtsho las rlabs rnams 'byung ba tha dad pa ma yin pa ltar ro //
translated: and so on. Just as waves arise from the ocean, and are not different from it,üîΩblue, red, salt,

original: sngon po dmar po lan tshva dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni ji ltar 'od zer rnams gzugs kyi yul du gar 'char ba de'i kha dog lta bur snang ba ste /
analyzed: sngon po dmar po lan tshva dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni ji ltar 'od zer rnams gzugs kyi yul du gar 'char ba de'i kha dog lta bur snang ba ste /

analyzed: kha dog de ni 'od zer rnams dang gcig pa yang ma yin /
translated: that color is neither the same as the rays of light,

analyzed: tha dad pa yang ma yin pa de bzhin du kun gzhi rnam par shes pa las shes pa bdun rnams so //

original: lan tshva ni kha dog du ma'o //
analyzed: lan tshva ni kha dog du ma'o //
translated: Salt has many colors.

original: de lta bur yang gnas sbyar ba //
analyzed: de lta bur yang gnas sbyar ba //
translated: It is to be applied in the same way.

original: autpal sngon po'i tshal snang bas //
analyzed: autpal sngon po'i tshal snang bas //
translated: The appearance of a forest of blue lotuses,üîΩand so on.

original: nyi ma'i rkang pa sngon por byas //üîΩmtshon cha dam pos bcings pa yi //
analyzed: nyi ma'i rkang pa sngon por byas // mtshon cha dam pos bcings pa yi //
translated: The sun is made blue by the feet.üîΩLike a chain and a lock,

original: lcags thag lcags sgrog bzhin du'o //
analyzed: lcags thag lcags sgrog bzhin du'o //
translated: it is bound by the best of weapons.

original: rkang pa ni 'od zer rnams so zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dge ba dang mi dge ba la sogs pa'i bag chags kyis bsags pas na sems te /üîΩsems ni kun gzhi rnam par @82a * //
analyzed: rkang pa ni 'od zer rnams so zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dge ba dang mi dge ba la sogs pa'i bag chags kyis bsags pas na sems te / sems ni kun gzhi rnam par @82a * //
translated: The feet are the light rays, and so on. The mind is so called because it is accumulated by the propensities of virtue and nonvirtue, and so on.üîΩThe mind is the foundation consciousness.

original: shes // ngar sems nyid de yid yin no //
analyzed: shes // ngar sems nyid de yid yin no //
translated: The mind that thinks ‚ÄúI‚Äù is the mental faculty.

original: gang gis yul rnams 'dzin ba ni //
analyzed: gang gis yul rnams 'dzin ba ni //
translated: That which apprehends objects

original: de ni rnam par shes zhes bya //
analyzed: de ni rnam par shes zhes bya //
translated: is called consciousness.

original: zhes pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ste /
translated: Thus it is.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis de ltar tha snyad kyi phyir brjod pa'i mtshan ma tha dad par gsungs pa yin gyi /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis de ltar tha snyad kyi phyir brjod pa'i mtshan ma tha dad par gsungs pa yin gyi /
translated: The BhagavƒÅn has said that the different characteristics of verbal expression are for the sake of conventional usage.

analyzed: don dam par ni brgyad po tha dad ma yin mtshan zhes te //
translated: But in the ultimate sense, the eight are not different.

original: shes pa rnams kun gzhi rnam par shes pa las tha dad pa'i bdag nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes pa rnams kun gzhi rnam par shes pa las tha dad pa'i bdag nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //

original: mtshan nyid ni so so'i mtshan ma ste /
analyzed: mtshan nyid ni so so'i mtshan ma ste /
translated: The characteristics are the individual characteristics.

original: mtshan nyid kyi gzhi dang mtshan nyid tha dad pa med pas mtshan nyid tha dad pa ma yin pa rnams te /
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyi gzhi dang mtshan nyid tha dad pa med pas mtshan nyid tha dad pa ma yin pa rnams te /
translated: They are not different characteristics, because the basis of characteristics and the characteristics are not different.

original: ji ltar dbu ma las 'byung ba //üîΩmtshon bya mtshan nyid gal te gzhan //
analyzed: ji ltar dbu ma las 'byung ba // mtshon bya mtshan nyid gal te gzhan //
translated: As it is said in the Madhyamaka:üîΩIf the characterized and the characteristic were different,

original: mtshan la mtshan nyid med par 'gyur //
analyzed: mtshan la mtshan nyid med par 'gyur //
translated: the characteristic would be without a characterized.

original: gcig na'ang de gnyis mi 'grub ste //
analyzed: gcig na'ang de gnyis mi 'grub ste //
translated: If they were the same, the two would not be established.

original: tha dad na yang gzhan du med //
analyzed: tha dad na yang gzhan du med //
translated: If they were different, there would be no other.

original: rgya mtsho dang ni dpa' rnams ni //
analyzed: rgya mtsho dang ni dpa' rnams ni //

original: rnam par shes pa ni dbang po'i shes pas dge ba dang / mi dge ba'i 'bras bu rig pa dang yang dag par tshor ba ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ni dbang po'i shes pas dge ba dang / mi dge ba'i 'bras bu rig pa dang yang dag par tshor ba ste /
translated: Consciousness is the cognition of the sense organs, the knowledge of the results of virtue and vice, and the true experience of them.

original: sems can rnams kyi lnga bos snang ba dmigs pa la phyi'i zhes rjod par byed do //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi lnga bos snang ba dmigs pa la phyi'i zhes rjod par byed do //
translated: The five of sentient beings are called external because they are the objects of perception.

original: rgya mtsho dang dpa' rlabs rnams tha dad pa ma mchis na kun gzhi dang dbang po'i shes pa rnams sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa de mchis pa de dag ji ltar na mthun pa'i chos lags /

translated: If the ocean and the waves are not different, then how are the alaya and the sense consciousnesses the same with regard to the form of blue, etc.?

original: sngon bo la sogs pa'i kha dog sems la 'jug par bshad pa ni mtshan nyid kyi don du'o //
analyzed: sngon bo la sogs pa'i kha dog sems la 'jug par bshad pa ni mtshan nyid kyi don du'o //
translated: The explanation that the color of blue, etc., enters the mind is in terms of the characteristic.

original: su 'tshal bar bgyi ba'i slad du byis pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: su 'tshal bar bgyi ba'i slad du byis pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: It is for the sake of those who desire to know.

original: de la 'jug pa med pa ni kha dog go //
analyzed: de la 'jug pa med pa ni kha dog go //
translated: The absence of entry into that is color.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gzung ba spangs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gzung ba spangs pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is the abandonment of the apprehended.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa gzung ba'i rnam pa la 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa 'dzin pa'i rnam ba rnams 'jug go //
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa gzung ba'i rnam pa la 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa 'dzin pa'i rnam ba rnams 'jug go //
translated: The consciousnesses that engage the aspects of the apprehended, i.e., the ƒÅlaya consciousness, engage the aspects of the apprehender.

original: rgya mtsho yod pas dpa' rlabs 'jug pa bzhin pas na mthun pa'i chos so //
analyzed: rgya mtsho yod pas dpa' rlabs 'jug pa bzhin pas na mthun pa'i chos so //
translated: Since they are like waves that occur because of the existence of the ocean, they are similar dharmas.

original: rgyu gsungs pa /
analyzed: rgyu gsungs pa /
translated: The cause is stated:

original: lus dang longs spyod gnas snang ba //
analyzed: lus dang longs spyod gnas snang ba //
translated: The body, enjoyments, and the appearance of the abode.

original: zhes te / @82b sems kun gzhi rnam par shes pa gang yin pa der 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams 'jug ste /
analyzed: zhes te / @82b sems kun gzhi rnam par shes pa gang yin pa der 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams 'jug ste /
translated: The consciousnesses that engage the ƒÅlaya consciousness, i.e., the mind, engage it.

original: der gnyis kyi rnam pa kho na yod pa ma yin zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: der gnyis kyi rnam pa kho na yod pa ma yin zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the aspects of the two are not different.

original: me long du gzugs tha mi dad pa dang / rmi lam gyi chud pa rang bzhin gyi gzugs tha mi dad par snang ba de bzhin du cig car snang ba yin te lhan cig tu snang bar nges pa na sems rang gis gzung ba dang tha mi dad pa ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i tshad ma'o //
analyzed: me long du gzugs tha mi dad pa dang / rmi lam gyi chud pa rang bzhin gyi gzugs tha mi dad par snang ba de bzhin du cig car snang ba yin te lhan cig tu snang bar nges pa na sems rang gis gzung ba dang tha mi dad pa ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i tshad ma'o //
translated: Just as reflections in a mirror and the water in a dream appear simultaneously without being different from the form, so the mind is not different from its own object. This is the valid knowledge of omniscience.

original: yul dang rnam par mi ldan pas //
analyzed: yul dang rnam par mi ldan pas //
translated: Since it is not associated with objects,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'gyur ba rnam pa sna tshogs las yul rnam pa sna tshogs 'byung ngo //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'gyur ba rnam pa sna tshogs las yul rnam pa sna tshogs 'byung ngo //
translated: Thus, from the various transformations, the various objects arise.

original: rmi lam la sogs pa dang khur skam ring po bzhin du rim dang cig car ro //
analyzed: rmi lam la sogs pa dang khur skam ring po bzhin du rim dang cig car ro //
translated: Like a dream, etc., and like a long load, they are sequential and simultaneous.

original: lnga po rnams la snang bar mngon //
analyzed: lnga po rnams la snang bar mngon //
translated: The five are manifest in the appearance.

original: zhes pa ni cig car ro //
analyzed: zhes pa ni cig car ro //
translated: This is simultaneous.

original: mnyam par gzhag pa ni g-yel bar gnas pa'i yid bzhin te /
analyzed: mnyam par gzhag pa ni g-yel bar gnas pa'i yid bzhin te /
translated: The mind that is concentrated is the mind that is distracted.

original: de la mnyam pa cig car du gyur te /
analyzed: de la mnyam pa cig car du gyur te /
translated: In that, the five are equal and simultaneous.

original: lnga po rnams kyis myong ba'i rim pa med pa ni ltad mo lta ba bzhin no //
analyzed: lnga po rnams kyis myong ba'i rim pa med pa ni ltad mo lta ba bzhin no //
translated: The absence of the sequence of experience is like watching a show.

original: mtshan 'gyed pa bzhin du sems can mgu bar mdzad pa'i slad du chos rnam pa sna tshogs ci'i slad du gsungs /
analyzed: mtshan 'gyed pa bzhin du sems can mgu bar mdzad pa'i slad du chos rnam pa sna tshogs ci'i slad du gsungs /
translated: Like a debate, the Dharma is taught in various ways in order to please sentient beings.

original: tshon la ri mo yod pa min //
analyzed: tshon la ri mo yod pa min //
translated: The color does not have the design.

original: zhes te / rgyu la 'bras bu yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: zhes te / rgyu la 'bras bu yod pa ma yin te /
translated: The result does not exist in the cause.

original: de'i 'bras bu mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because its result is not observed.

original: des ni grangs can gyis yod pa las 'bras bu 'byung ba bkag pa'o //
analyzed: des ni grangs can gyis yod pa las 'bras bu 'byung ba bkag pa'o //
translated: This refutes the SƒÅ·πÉkhya assertion that the result arises from what exists.

original: yang dag la ni yi ge med //
analyzed: yang dag la ni yi ge med //
translated: In reality, there are no syllables.

original: ces bya ba ni brjod du med cing mi gnyis pa yang dag par rig pa'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni brjod du med cing mi gnyis pa yang dag par rig pa'o //
translated: This is the inexpressible, nondual reality.

original: bshad pa dag ni 'khrul pa'o //
analyzed: bshad pa dag ni 'khrul pa'o //
translated: The explanations are mistaken.

original: zhes pa ni gzugs kyi phung po med pas na sgra yang med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes pa ni gzugs kyi phung po med pas na sgra yang med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since there is no form aggregate, there is also no sound.

original: snang ba dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin gzhan gyi dbang gi rnam pa sna tshogs kyi chos la gnas te /
analyzed: snang ba dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin gzhan gyi dbang gi rnam pa sna tshogs kyi chos la gnas te /
translated: The yogins and yoginƒ´s, abiding in the various phenomena of the dependent nature, which is the samƒÅdhi with appearances,

original: spyi'i mtshan du yang dag par ston to //
analyzed: spyi'i mtshan du yang dag par ston to //
translated: teach the general characteristics.

original: ci'i slad du rnal 'byor pa rnams la spyi'i mtshan nyid du ston zhes de skad du sogs pa gsungs ba /üîΩso so rang rig gang dag ni //
analyzed: ci'i slad du rnal 'byor pa rnams la spyi'i mtshan nyid du ston zhes de skad du sogs pa gsungs ba / so so rang rig gang dag ni //
translated: Why do they teach the general characteristics to the yogins and yoginƒ´s?

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The text says, ‚ÄúThe individual self-awareness‚Ä¶‚Äù and so forth.

original: rgyal ba'i sras la 'di skad bstan gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rgyal ba'i sras rnams la gnyis su med pa'i spyi'i rnam par ston to //
analyzed: rgyal ba'i sras la 'di skad bstan gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rgyal ba'i sras rnams la gnyis su med pa'i spyi'i rnam par ston to //
translated: ‚ÄúThe victors‚Äô heirs are taught this‚Ä¶‚Äù and so forth teaches the nondual general characteristics to the victors‚Äô heirs.

original: byis pa rnams la ni phung po la sogs pa gnyis kyi rnam par spyir sgro btags te ston to //
analyzed: byis pa rnams la ni phung po la sogs pa gnyis kyi rnam par spyir sgro btags te ston to //
translated: To the immature, he teaches in general by superimposing the two, the aggregates, etc.

original: gzhan gyi dbang la gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po med kyang sgyu ma la sogs pa bzhin du ston to //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang la gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po med kyang sgyu ma la sogs pa bzhin du ston to //
translated: To those who are not immature, he teaches the dependent nature, which is like an illusion, even though it is devoid of the aggregates of form, etc.

original: sems tsam nyid snang ba'i chos rnams kyis @83a * //üîΩphyi'i don du mos pa mgu bar bya ba'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa'i zung bor ston to //
analyzed: sems tsam nyid snang ba'i chos rnams kyis @83a * // phyi'i don du mos pa mgu bar bya ba'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa'i zung bor ston to //
translated: To those who are devoted to the teaching of mind only, he teaches the reality nature, which is the nonduality of the grasped and the grasper.üîΩTo those who are devoted to the teaching of the nonduality of the grasped and the grasper, he teaches the nonduality of the cognized and cognition.üîΩTo those who are devoted to the teaching of the nonduality of the cognized and cognition, he teaches the nonduality of the imagined and the reality.

original: zab mo'i chos la mos pa'i phyir rnams la mos pa'i mi gnyis pa ste /üîΩsman pas rnam pa du ma'i thabs kyi sman btang ba bzhin no //
analyzed: zab mo'i chos la mos pa'i phyir rnams la mos pa'i mi gnyis pa ste / sman pas rnam pa du ma'i thabs kyi sman btang ba bzhin no //
translated: To those who are devoted to the teaching of the nonduality of the imagined and the reality, he teaches the nonduality of the perfected and the reality.üîΩTo those who are devoted to the teaching of the nonduality of the perfected and the reality, he teaches the nonduality of the perfected and the dependent.üîΩTo those who are devoted to the teaching of the nonduality of the perfected and the dependent, he teaches the nonduality of the perfected and the imagined.üîΩTo those who are devoted to the teaching of the nonduality of the perfected and the imagined, he teaches the nonduality of the dependent and the imagined.üîΩTo those who are devoted to the teaching of the nonduality of the dependent and the imagined, he teaches the nonduality of the three natures.üîΩTo those who are devoted to the teaching of the nonduality of the three natures, he teaches the nonduality of the four noble truths.üîΩTo those who are devoted to the teaching of the nonduality of the four noble truths, he teaches the nonduality of the five aggregates.

original: rtog pa can ni rtag pa dang / bdag la sogs par smra ba dang / 'phags pa nyan thos rnams phyi'i don du smra ba rnams kyi gnas 'bos pa'i kun gzhi rnam bar shes pa mi gnyis pa ni yul ma yin no //
analyzed: rtog pa can ni rtag pa dang / bdag la sogs par smra ba dang / 'phags pa nyan thos rnams phyi'i don du smra ba rnams kyi gnas 'bos pa'i kun gzhi rnam bar shes pa mi gnyis pa ni yul ma yin no //
translated: To those who are devoted to the teaching of the nonduality of the five aggregates, he teaches the nonduality of the six sense bases.üîΩTo those who are devoted to the teaching of the nonduality of the six sense bases, he teaches the nonduality of the seven factors of enlightenment.üîΩTo those who are devoted to the teaching of the nonduality of the seven factors of enlightenment, he teaches the nonduality of the eightfold noble path.üîΩTo those who are devoted to the teaching of the nonduality of the eightfold noble path, he teaches the nonduality of the

original: rang gi sems snang ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzugs la sogs pa rang gi sems la snang bas mdzes pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i mtshan nyid ni mi gnas par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rang gi sems snang ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzugs la sogs pa rang gi sems la snang bas mdzes pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i mtshan nyid ni mi gnas par rig par bya'o //
translated: The phrase one's own mind appears as and so on means that one should understand that the characteristic of the conceptualization of beauty and so on is not a real entity, because form and so on appear to one's own mind.

original: gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la sems ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la sems ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: Moreover, the mind is the store consciousness.

original: der spyod pa'i bdag nyid ni shes rab po //
analyzed: der spyod pa'i bdag nyid ni shes rab po //
translated: The nature of its activity is wisdom.

original: 'di ni 'di kho na nyid do zhes gdon mi za ba'i mtshan nyid ni ye shes so //
analyzed: 'di ni 'di kho na nyid do zhes gdon mi za ba'i mtshan nyid ni ye shes so //
translated: The characteristic of pristine awareness is the certainty that this is the way things really are.

original: de la gnas te shes par bya ba sbom po dang phra mo gang gi tshe gang du mi dmigs pa de'i tshe snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin rtogs par 'gyur ba de lta bur 'phags pa'i ye shes kyi mtshan nyid gsum la brtson par bya'o //
analyzed: de la gnas te shes par bya ba sbom po dang phra mo gang gi tshe gang du mi dmigs pa de'i tshe snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin rtogs par 'gyur ba de lta bur 'phags pa'i ye shes kyi mtshan nyid gsum la brtson par bya'o //
translated: One should strive in the three characteristics of the pristine awareness of the noble ones, which is to be known as follows: When and where the gross and subtle objects of knowledge are not apprehended, then the meditative absorption of the absence of appearances is realized.

original: sngon gyi sangs rgyas kyi smon lam dang / bdag gi smon lam mthun par gdab par bya ba ni bzang po spyod pa'i smon lam bzhin du'o //üîΩji ltar mi g-yo ba'i sa snang ba med pa las langs te smon lam rnams kyis gzhan gyi don mdzad pa'o //üîΩso so rang gis rig pa de yang mi gnyis pa dang rnam pa gnyis su med pa gzhan gyi dbang gi rang bzhin ting nge 'dzin las skyes pa yang shes so //üîΩbong bu 'theng po lta bu ni sngon gyi shin tu phra mor rgyu ba spangs te mi g-yo bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: sngon gyi sangs rgyas kyi smon lam dang / bdag gi smon lam mthun par gdab par bya ba ni bzang po spyod pa'i smon lam bzhin du'o // ji ltar mi g-yo ba'i sa snang ba med pa las langs te smon lam rnams kyis gzhan gyi don mdzad pa'o // so so rang gis rig pa de yang mi gnyis pa dang rnam pa gnyis su med pa gzhan gyi dbang gi rang bzhin ting nge 'dzin las skyes pa yang shes so // bong bu 'theng po lta bu ni sngon gyi shin tu phra mor rgyu ba spangs te mi g-yo bar gyur pa'o //
translated: The prayer to be in accord with the former Buddhas‚Äô prayers and one‚Äôs own prayers is like the Prayer of Good Actions.üîΩThe prayer to be in accord with the former Buddhas‚Äô prayers and one‚Äôs own prayers is like the Prayer of Good Actions.üîΩThe prayer to be in accord with the former Buddhas‚Äô prayers and one‚Äôs own prayers is like the Prayer of Good Actions.üîΩThe prayer to be in accord with the former Buddhas‚Äô prayers and one‚Äôs own prayers is like the Prayer of Good Actions.

original: des snang ba med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rnam par thar pa gsum thob pa'i nyan thos rnams dang / mu stegs can thams cad la'ang snang ba med pa'i bsam gtan yod do //
analyzed: des snang ba med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rnam par thar pa gsum thob pa'i nyan thos rnams dang / mu stegs can thams cad la'ang snang ba med pa'i bsam gtan yod do //
translated: The prayer to be in accord with the former Buddhas‚Äô prayers and one‚Äôs own prayers is like the Prayer of Good Actions.üîΩThe prayer to be in accord with the former Buddhas‚Äô prayers and one‚Äôs own prayers

original: de la rig 'dzin pa'i mtha' smra ba dang / zhi ba dang / mthu bo cher smra ba mi gnyis par smra ba rnams la snang ba med pa'i mtshan nyid can mi gnyis pa'i bsam gtan yod do //
analyzed: de la rig 'dzin pa'i mtha' smra ba dang / zhi ba dang / mthu bo cher smra ba mi gnyis par smra ba rnams la snang ba med pa'i mtshan nyid can mi gnyis pa'i bsam gtan yod do //
translated: The VedƒÅntins, the Mƒ´mƒÅ·πÉsakas, and the NaiyƒÅyikas and Vai≈õe·π£ikas all agree that there is a nondual concentration that has the characteristic of nonappearance.

original: de bas na 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i gtsug lag mang du thos nas yongs su 'dris pa las 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de bas na 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i gtsug lag mang du thos nas yongs su 'dris pa las 'byung ngo //
translated: Therefore, it arises from the study of many scriptures, both mundane and supramundane, and from the practice of those.

original: sngon gyi sangs rgyas kyi @83b smon lam rnams la rang gi smon lam du byin gyis brlabs pa las 'byung ngo //
analyzed: sngon gyi sangs rgyas kyi @83b smon lam rnams la rang gi smon lam du byin gyis brlabs pa las 'byung ngo //
translated: It arises from the transformation of one‚Äôs own prayers into the prayers of the buddhas of the past.

original: so so rang gis rig pa 'phags pa'i ye shes kyi mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni sngar smos pa bzhin du bshad pa'o //
analyzed: so so rang gis rig pa 'phags pa'i ye shes kyi mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni sngar smos pa bzhin du bshad pa'o //
translated: The characteristic of the knowledge of the noble ones, which is the knowledge of each one for himself, is as explained above.

original: chos thams cad la mngon par zhen pa med pa zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe na gzhan gyi dbang la sgyu ma lta bur shes pa de'i tshe chos thams cad la mngon par zhen bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos thams cad la mngon par zhen pa med pa zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe na gzhan gyi dbang la sgyu ma lta bur shes pa de'i tshe chos thams cad la mngon par zhen bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The absence of attachment to any phenomenon is as follows: when one knows the relative to be like an illusion, one does not become attached to any phenomenon.

original: sgyu ma lta bu'i snang ba dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyu rnams kyis sa bcu ste /
analyzed: sgyu ma lta bu'i snang ba dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyu rnams kyis sa bcu ste /
translated: The ten stages are by the causes of samadhi together with illusory appearances.

original: sbyin ba la sogs pa'i tshogs rdzogs par byas nas sangs rgyas kyis khong du chud pa'i rtogs pa rgyu ba la sogs pa 'byung ste /
analyzed: sbyin ba la sogs pa'i tshogs rdzogs par byas nas sangs rgyas kyis khong du chud pa'i rtogs pa rgyu ba la sogs pa 'byung ste /
translated: Having completed the accumulations of generosity and so forth, the realizations comprehended by the Buddhas arise, such as the movement of the channels and so forth.

original: snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin la sa'i rim pa med pa ni ji ltar 'dir gsungs pa //
analyzed: snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin la sa'i rim pa med pa ni ji ltar 'dir gsungs pa //
translated: The stages of the grounds do not exist in the non-appearing samadhi, as it is said:

original: snang ba med la rim ci yod //
analyzed: snang ba med la rim ci yod //
translated: What stages are there in the non-appearing?

original: ces so // tshig brgya rtsa brgyad rab tu phye ba'i gnas zhes bya ba ni brtag pa dang / gzhan gyi dbang dang yongs su grub ba'i mtshan nyid 'phags pa'i ye shes kyi dngos bo rab tu mngon pa'i rang bzhin te /
analyzed: ces so // tshig brgya rtsa brgyad rab tu phye ba'i gnas zhes bya ba ni brtag pa dang / gzhan gyi dbang dang yongs su grub ba'i mtshan nyid 'phags pa'i ye shes kyi dngos bo rab tu mngon pa'i rang bzhin te /
translated: The so-called ‚Äúplace of the complete analysis of one hundred and eight words‚Äù is the nature of the fully manifest entity of the noble wisdom, the characteristics of the imagined, the dependent, and the thoroughly established.

original: kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i bden pa'i gzhi'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i bden pa'i gzhi'o //
translated: It is the basis of the conventional and ultimate truths.

original: de la 'phags pa'i ye shes kyi dbang po'i rang bzhin ni snang ba dang bcas pa dang / snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin du byed pas phye ba'o //
analyzed: de la 'phags pa'i ye shes kyi dbang po'i rang bzhin ni snang ba dang bcas pa dang / snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin du byed pas phye ba'o //
translated: The nature of the faculty of the wisdom of the noble ones is distinguished by the meditative stabilization with appearance and without appearance.

original: tshig brgya rtsa brgyad la sogs par kun tu brtags pa sgra dang don gyi tha snyad ni gzhan gyi dbang snang ba la 'jug pa rnam pa sna tshogs su 'byed par dris pa de la grub pa gnyis su med pa'i 'phags pa'i ye shes su lan glan no
analyzed: tshig brgya rtsa brgyad la sogs par kun tu brtags pa sgra dang don gyi tha snyad ni gzhan gyi dbang snang ba la 'jug pa rnam pa sna tshogs su 'byed par dris pa de la grub pa gnyis su med pa'i 'phags pa'i ye shes su lan glan no
translated: The conventional expressions of words and meanings that are imagined in one hundred and eight words and so on are the dependent. The reply to the question that distinguishes the various ways of engaging in appearance is the wisdom of the noble ones that is free from the two extremes.

original: // gang la gnas shing zhes bya ba ni kun tu brtags ba dang / gzhan gyi dbang la sogs pa mtshan nyid gsum la ni rang gi mtshan nyid ni sra ba dang / gsher ba dang / dro ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: // gang la gnas shing zhes bya ba ni kun tu brtags ba dang / gzhan gyi dbang la sogs pa mtshan nyid gsum la ni rang gi mtshan nyid ni sra ba dang / gsher ba dang / dro ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúabiding in‚Äù refers to the three natures, the imagined, the dependent, and so on. The individual characteristics of the elements are solidity, fluidity, heat, and so on.

original: spyi'i mtshan nyid ni mi rtag ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: spyi'i mtshan nyid ni mi rtag ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The general characteristics are impermanence and so on.

original: yongs su brtags par rtogs par rab tu phye ba de nyid du mu stegs can rnams kyi rtag pa dang bdag la sogs pa rnam par 'gro ba'i rnam par rtog pa de gzhag go //
analyzed: yongs su brtags par rtogs par rab tu phye ba de nyid du mu stegs can rnams kyi rtag pa dang bdag la sogs pa rnam par 'gro ba'i rnam par rtog pa de gzhag go //
translated: In that very analysis of the realization of the thoroughly imagined, the eternalism, self, etc. of the tƒ´rthikas are to be placed.

original: bye brag shin tu rtogs pa gang gis zhes bya ba ni mtshan nyid rnam pa gsum gyis chos la bdag med pa rab tu rgyu ba shin tu sbyangs te /
analyzed: bye brag shin tu rtogs pa gang gis zhes bya ba ni mtshan nyid rnam pa gsum gyis chos la bdag med pa rab tu rgyu ba shin tu sbyangs te /
translated: By means of the thorough understanding of the distinctions, one becomes skilled in the thorough analysis of the movement of the selflessness of phenomena through the three aspects of the characteristics.üîΩBy means of wisdom, one becomes skilled in the thorough analysis of the movement of the selflessness of phenomena through the three aspects of the characteristics.

original: shes rab kyis dpyad de bdag med pa nyid khong du chud pas mkhas par 'gyur ro //üîΩ'phags pa nyan thos la sogs pa rnams kyi bdag gi don gyi bsam gtan gyi bde ba las 'das te gzhan gyi don du don dam @84a * //
analyzed: shes rab kyis dpyad de bdag med pa nyid khong du chud pas mkhas par 'gyur ro // 'phags pa nyan thos la sogs pa rnams kyi bdag gi don gyi bsam gtan gyi bde ba las 'das te gzhan gyi don du don dam @84a * //
translated: Having analyzed with wisdom and comprehended selflessness, one becomes skilled.

original: pa sangs rgyas kyi sar de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi sku gang ye shes kyis shin tu rnam par dag pa'i chos can shes rab kyis dpyad par bsam du med do //
analyzed: pa sangs rgyas kyi sar de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi sku gang ye shes kyis shin tu rnam par dag pa'i chos can shes rab kyis dpyad par bsam du med do //
translated: Having transcended the happiness of concentration for one's own benefit of the noble ≈õrƒÅvakas and so forth, for the benefit of others, on the ultimate buddha ground, the dharmakƒÅya of the tathƒÅgata, which is characterized by the purity of wisdom, is to be thoroughly analyzed by wisdom and contemplated.

original: chos lnga dang rang bzhin rtogs pa las rnam pa ma log pa ni gnyis su med pa mtshan ma med cing kun tu brtags pa dang / gzhan gyi dbang gis rnam par 'byed ba dang bral zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: chos lnga dang rang bzhin rtogs pa las rnam pa ma log pa ni gnyis su med pa mtshan ma med cing kun tu brtags pa dang / gzhan gyi dbang gis rnam par 'byed ba dang bral zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: The non-reversal of the aspects from the realization of the five dharmas and the nature is the non-duality, the signlessness, and the freedom from the imagined and the discrimination of the other-dependent.

original: sgyu ma'i spyod yul zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni snang ba dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin rdzogs longs spyod pa'i sku dang / sprul pa'i sku mdzes pa so sor thob bo //
analyzed: sgyu ma'i spyod yul zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni snang ba dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin rdzogs longs spyod pa'i sku dang / sprul pa'i sku mdzes pa so sor thob bo //
translated: The ‚Äúrealm of illusion‚Äù and so forth refers to the attainment of the beauty of the samadhi with appearance, the enjoyment body, and the emanation body.

original: blo gros chen po 'di la mu stegs kyi lta ba can mu stegs can la la med pa la mngon par zhen pa dag cing bya ba la sogs pa ni ji ltar zhib ba rnams smras pa /
analyzed: blo gros chen po 'di la mu stegs kyi lta ba can mu stegs can la la med pa la mngon par zhen pa dag cing bya ba la sogs pa ni ji ltar zhib ba rnams smras pa /
translated: ‚ÄúHere, Mahamati, some non-Buddhist philosophers, attached to non-existence, speak of action and so forth as follows:

original: dngos po med pas thar par smras //
analyzed: dngos po med pas thar par smras //
translated: They say that non-existence is liberation.

original: dngos por rtog las 'ching ba ste //
analyzed: dngos por rtog las 'ching ba ste //
translated: One is bound by the conception of existence.

original: de bas dngos po yongs spangs nas //
analyzed: de bas dngos po yongs spangs nas //
translated: Therefore, having abandoned existence,

original: stong pa'i dngos por 'jug par gyis //
analyzed: stong pa'i dngos por 'jug par gyis //
translated: One should enter into the existence of emptiness.

original: steng stong 'og kyang stong ba dang // dbus su gnas med stong pas na //
analyzed: steng stong 'og kyang stong ba dang // dbus su gnas med stong pas na //
translated: and empty in the middle, without any core.

original: dngos med gtogs pa kun stong pa //
analyzed: dngos med gtogs pa kun stong pa //
translated: It is empty of all that is included in the unreal.

original: de ni ting nge 'dzin spyod yul lo //
analyzed: de ni ting nge 'dzin spyod yul lo //
translated: This is the domain of samƒÅdhi.

original: bdag stong dang ni yid stong dang // phyi stong rnal 'byor rig pa ste //
analyzed: bdag stong dang ni yid stong dang // phyi stong rnal 'byor rig pa ste //
translated: The emptiness of self, the emptiness of mind, and the emptiness of external things‚ÄîüîΩthis is the knowledge of the yogin.

original: stong sus su yis mngon shes pa //
analyzed: stong sus su yis mngon shes pa //
translated: Whoever realizes emptiness

original: nges par de ni grol bar 'gyur //
analyzed: nges par de ni grol bar 'gyur //
translated: will certainly be liberated.

original: brtags pa dang gzhan gyi dbang dang / yongs su grub pa'i rang bzhin mngon par mi shes pas gzhan gyi dbang ltar yongs su grub pa la rtog go //
analyzed: brtags pa dang gzhan gyi dbang dang / yongs su grub pa'i rang bzhin mngon par mi shes pas gzhan gyi dbang ltar yongs su grub pa la rtog go //
translated: Because of not understanding the imagined, the dependent, and the perfected natures, one imagines the perfected nature to be like the dependent nature.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i blo'i rgyu ni sgra dang don yin te /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i blo'i rgyu ni sgra dang don yin te /
translated: The cause of the conceptual mind is sound and meaning.

original: de zad pa'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: de zad pa'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: up to ‚Äúthe nature of their exhaustion.‚Äù

original: gang shes ba'i yul yin pa de thams cad med do zhes par dgongs pa'i don du mngon no //
analyzed: gang shes ba'i yul yin pa de thams cad med do zhes par dgongs pa'i don du mngon no //
translated: It is clear that the intended meaning is that everything that is the object of cognition is nonexistent.

original: 'di skad ces smras pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad ces smras pa yin te /
translated: This is what is said:

original: shes pa dang shes par bya ba'i mtshan nyid kyi chos ri bong gir gar med kyang rmi lam dang / mig 'phrul bzhin 'gro bar snang ngo zhes so //
analyzed: shes pa dang shes par bya ba'i mtshan nyid kyi chos ri bong gir gar med kyang rmi lam dang / mig 'phrul bzhin 'gro bar snang ngo zhes so //
translated: Although there is no such thing as a dharma that has the nature of an object of knowledge and a knower, still, like a dream or an optical illusion, the appearance of beings occurs.

original: gzhan yang 'byung ba la sogs pa ni gang khyad par can la sogs pas rtog par byed pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang 'byung ba la sogs pa ni gang khyad par can la sogs pas rtog par byed pa'o //
translated: Moreover, the VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas imagine that the elements and so on are the cause of the arising of the sense faculties and so on.

original: 'byung ba ni sa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba ni sa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The elements are earth and so on.

original: yon tan ni gzugs la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: yon tan ni gzugs la sogs pa'o //
translated: The qualities are form and so on.

original: rdul ni shin tu phra ba'o //
analyzed: rdul ni shin tu phra ba'o //
translated: The particles are the most subtle.

original: de dang sbyor ba'i yon tan las skyes ba'i rdul gnyis ni rdul lo //
analyzed: de dang sbyor ba'i yon tan las skyes ba'i rdul gnyis ni rdul lo //
translated: Two particles joined together is a dyad.

original: de bzhin du rdul gnyis pa dang / gsum pa la sogs pa rim gyis sbom po yan lag gi rdzas gru @84b gsum dang / gru bzhi dang / zlum po la sogs pa'i dbyibs su gnas par rtog par byed do //
analyzed: de bzhin du rdul gnyis pa dang / gsum pa la sogs pa rim gyis sbom po yan lag gi rdzas gru @84b gsum dang / gru bzhi dang / zlum po la sogs pa'i dbyibs su gnas par rtog par byed do //
translated: In the same way, two dyads and so on gradually increase in size, and the shape of the substances of the limbs, such as the triangular pelvic bone, the quadrangular chest, and the round stomach, and so on, come to exist.

original: de yang rdzas kho na la sogs par spyir yang rtog go //
analyzed: de yang rdzas kho na la sogs par spyir yang rtog go //
translated: Moreover, they imagine that substances and so on are generally the cause of the arising of the sense faculties and so on.

original: ri bong gi rva med pa dang / sbom po'i phyi'i rdzas ba glang gi rva yod do snyam du rtog pa blo gros chen po de dag yod pa dang med pa'i mtha' gnyis kyi lta bar lhung zhing rang gi sems kyi khams kyi yul du rnam par rtog pa gang yod pa des dngos po dang
analyzed: ri bong gi rva med pa dang / sbom po'i phyi'i rdzas ba glang gi rva yod do snyam du rtog pa blo gros chen po de dag yod pa dang med pa'i mtha' gnyis kyi lta bar lhung zhing rang gi sems kyi khams kyi yul du rnam par rtog pa gang yod pa des dngos po dang
translated: MahƒÅmati, those thoughts fall into the view of the two extremes of existence and non-existence, and by that which exists as the object of the realm of one‚Äôs own mind,

original: dngos po med pa'i tha snyad rnams brtas par byed de 'phel bar byed ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i tha snyad rnams brtas par byed de 'phel bar byed ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: the conventions of existence and non-existence are increased, which means they are expanded.

original: lus la sogs pa ni sems tsam la rnam par rtog pa yod pas phyi rol gyi sgro btags te ldog pa las ri bong gi rva med do zhes rtog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lus la sogs pa ni sems tsam la rnam par rtog pa yod pas phyi rol gyi sgro btags te ldog pa las ri bong gi rva med do zhes rtog par 'gyur ro //
translated: The body and so forth are mere mind, but because of the existence of conceptualization, external reifications are eliminated, and the thought that the rabbit‚Äôs horns do not exist arises.

original: gang dag yang med pa ni yod pa las rnam par log pa'i dngos po rnams rtog pa de dag gis rtog par mi bya ste /
analyzed: gang dag yang med pa ni yod pa las rnam par log pa'i dngos po rnams rtog pa de dag gis rtog par mi bya ste /
translated: Those who think that non-existence is a thing that is the opposite of existence should not conceptualize.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: phan tshun ltos pa'i rgyu'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phan tshun ltos pa'i rgyu'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are mutually dependent causes.

original: yod pa ldog pas med pa ste //
analyzed: yod pa ldog pas med pa ste //
translated: Non-existence is by the elimination of existence.

original: med pa ldog pas yod pa ste //
analyzed: med pa ldog pas yod pa ste //
translated: Since non-existence is refuted, existence is established.

original: rang dbang du don dam par yod pa dang med pa gnyi gar yang mi 'grub po //
analyzed: rang dbang du don dam par yod pa dang med pa gnyi gar yang mi 'grub po //
translated: Neither existence nor non-existence are established as independent, ultimate realities.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar yod pa dang med pa yin pas na rtog par mi bya ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar yod pa dang med pa yin pas na rtog par mi bya ste /
translated: Since existence and non-existence are like this, one should not conceptualize them.

original: dngos po dang dngos po med par rtog par mi bya ba ni dbu ma'i ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med par rtog par mi bya ba ni dbu ma'i ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: The non-conceptualization of entities and non-entities is the meditative concentration of the middle way.üîΩIn this way, he states that the imputation of external entities as existent is established as non-existent by other reasonings.

original: de de ltar phyi'i dngos po yod par btags pa de ji ltar med par 'gyur ba rigs par zhen pa gzhan gyis bsgrub par gsungs pa rdul phra rab kyi bar du brtags na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de de ltar phyi'i dngos po yod par btags pa de ji ltar med par 'gyur ba rigs par zhen pa gzhan gyis bsgrub par gsungs pa rdul phra rab kyi bar du brtags na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The investigation of subtle particles, etc.

original: sbom po yan lag can gyi rdzas las brtsams te rdul phra mo'i gzugs kyi bar du sbom pa dang / phra ba de thams cad phyogs kyi char dbye bas phye ba na stong zhing 'phags pa'i ye shes kyi spyod yul las rnam par log pa yin te /
analyzed: sbom po yan lag can gyi rdzas las brtsams te rdul phra mo'i gzugs kyi bar du sbom pa dang / phra ba de thams cad phyogs kyi char dbye bas phye ba na stong zhing 'phags pa'i ye shes kyi spyod yul las rnam par log pa yin te /
translated: Beginning with gross substances that have parts, all that is gross and subtle, up to the form of subtle particles, is empty when divided into directional parts. It is utterly devoid of the domain of noble wisdom.

original: de bas na ba glang gi rva yod do zhes brtag par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na ba glang gi rva yod do zhes brtag par mi bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it should not be investigated whether the ox has horns.

original: dngos po mi dmigs te med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rgyu'o //
analyzed: dngos po mi dmigs te med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rgyu'o //
translated: The reason is: ‚Äúbecause the non-apprehension of an entity is non-existence.‚Äù

original: rnam par rtog pa mi 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa mi 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa ni /
translated: ‚ÄúThe non-occurrence of conceptualization‚Äù and so forth.

original: gang phyir sgra ni brjod pa las //
analyzed: gang phyir sgra ni brjod pa las //
translated: Because the word is from the expression,

original: gang tshe don gang rtog par byed //
analyzed: gang tshe don gang rtog par byed //
translated: when one conceives of a certain object,

original: de ni sgra yi don du smras //
analyzed: de ni sgra yi don du smras //
translated: that is said to be the meaning of the word.

original: don gyi mtshan nyid gzhan min no //
analyzed: don gyi mtshan nyid gzhan min no //
translated: The characteristic of the object is not different.

original: zhes by'a ka ra na pa rtog par byed de /
analyzed: zhes by'a ka ra na pa rtog par byed de /
translated: Thus, VyƒÅkara·πáa conceives.

original: gang na yod pa dang dgag pa'i tshul sgra 'jug pa der tshig gi don yod pa'am med pa'o zhes brtag go //
analyzed: gang na yod pa dang dgag pa'i tshul sgra 'jug pa der tshig gi don yod pa'am med pa'o zhes brtag go //
translated: Where the mode of existence or non-existence of a word is engaged, there the meaning of the word exists or does not exist.üîΩHaving heard the sign of the non-occurrence of conceptualization,

original: rnam par rtog pa mi 'byung ba'i mtshan ma thos nas zhes pa ni 'jug pa'i mtshan ma med pas don med @85a * //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa mi 'byung ba'i mtshan ma thos nas zhes pa ni 'jug pa'i mtshan ma med pas don med @85a * //
translated: since the sign of engagement does not exist, the object does not exist.

original: do zhes rjes su dpag pa 'jug go zhes pa'o //
analyzed: do zhes rjes su dpag pa 'jug go zhes pa'o //
translated: Thus, inference engages.

original: de de lta bu'i snga ma'i phyogs bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
