analyzed: de de lta bu'i snga ma'i phyogs bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said that the former position is like that.

original: blo gros chen po rnam par rtog pa mi 'byung ba las ltos te de med pa ma yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: blo gros chen po rnam par rtog pa mi 'byung ba las ltos te de med pa ma yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: MahƒÅmati, it is not that it does not exist, but it is in dependence on the non-arising of conceptualization.

original: de ji lta bu zhes pa dang / rgyu gsungs pa de ni rnam par rtog pa 'byung ba'i rgyu ste zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de ji lta bu zhes pa dang / rgyu gsungs pa de ni rnam par rtog pa 'byung ba'i rgyu ste zhes pa'o //
translated: He asks, What is that like? and states the cause: That is the cause for the arising of conceptualization.

original: de ni brjod par bya ba las rnam par rtog par byung ste /
analyzed: de ni brjod par bya ba las rnam par rtog par byung ste /
translated: That is, conceptualization arises from the expressible.

original: ji ltar slob dpon dharma k'irtis sgrub pa /
analyzed: ji ltar slob dpon dharma k'irtis sgrub pa /
translated: As master Dharmikaƒ´rti establishes:

original: thog ma med pa'i bag chags las //
analyzed: thog ma med pa'i bag chags las //
translated: From beginningless latent tendencies,

original: rnam rtog 'byung bar yod gnas pa //
analyzed: rnam rtog 'byung bar yod gnas pa //
translated: conceptualization arises and abides.

original: sgra don chos ni rnam pa gsum //
analyzed: sgra don chos ni rnam pa gsum //
translated: The three types of phenomena, sound and meaning,

original: dngos dang dngos med gnyi ga gnas //üîΩzhes pa ste /üîΩgang na brjod par bya bar brtag pa'i don du ma brtsams pa der sgra mi 'jug go //
analyzed: dngos dang dngos med gnyi ga gnas // zhes pa ste / gang na brjod par bya bar brtag pa'i don du ma brtsams pa der sgra mi 'jug go //
translated: abide as both entity and non-entity.üîΩWhere there is no investigation of meaning for the sake of expression, sound does not operate there.

original: sgra mi 'jug pa'i phyir don med ces bya bar mi rung ngo //
analyzed: sgra mi 'jug pa'i phyir don med ces bya bar mi rung ngo //
translated: Because sound does not operate, it is not suitable to say that there is no meaning.

original: blo gros chen po rnam par rtog pa ni de'i rva las brten te byung ba'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gang la brten te rnam par rtog pa byung ba de la ltos pas na de med pa ma yin te /
analyzed: blo gros chen po rnam par rtog pa ni de'i rva las brten te byung ba'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gang la brten te rnam par rtog pa byung ba de la ltos pas na de med pa ma yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúMahƒÅmati, conceptualization arises based on its horn‚Äù and so on means that since conceptualization arises in dependence on something, it is not non-existent.

original: de brten pa'i rgyu yin pas na tha dad pa dang / tha dad pa ma yin pa rnam par spangs pa'o //
analyzed: de brten pa'i rgyu yin pas na tha dad pa dang / tha dad pa ma yin pa rnam par spangs pa'o //
translated: Since it is the cause of what is based on it, it is free from being different or not different.

original: de ni rgyu las gzhan pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni rgyu las gzhan pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not different from the cause.

original: gzhan pa ma yin par gyur na ni gzhan ma bzlog pa las byung ba ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan pa ma yin par gyur na ni gzhan ma bzlog pa las byung ba ma yin te /
translated: If it were not different, it would not arise from the reversal of what is different.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i khyad par du med par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i khyad par du med par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there would be no distinction between cause and effect.

original: de la ltos te zhes bya ba ni brjod par bya ba la ltos te'o //
analyzed: de la ltos te zhes bya ba ni brjod par bya ba la ltos te'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn dependence on that‚Äù means in dependence on the object of expression.

original: gal te rnam par rtog pa las brjod par bya ba tha dad par gyur pa ni de'i tshe ri bong gi rva'i rgyu las byung ba ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te rnam par rtog pa las brjod par bya ba tha dad par gyur pa ni de'i tshe ri bong gi rva'i rgyu las byung ba ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the object of expression were different from conceptualization, then it would not arise from the cause of the rabbit‚Äôs horn.

original: de ste tha dad pa ma yin na shes pa gal te brjod par bya ba las rnam par rtog pa tha mi dad par gyur pa ni de'i rgyu las byung ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de ste tha dad pa ma yin na shes pa gal te brjod par bya ba las rnam par rtog pa tha mi dad par gyur pa ni de'i rgyu las byung ba zhes bya ste /
translated: If, on the other hand, it is not different, then consciousness, if it is not different from the object of expression, is said to arise from its cause.

original: rgyu ni gzhan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu ni gzhan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The cause is different.

original: rdul phra rab kyi bar du rab tu brtags na mi dmigs pas rva dang rnam par rtog pa tha mi dad pa'i phyir rva med pa bzhin du de yang med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rdul phra rab kyi bar du rab tu brtags na mi dmigs pas rva dang rnam par rtog pa tha mi dad pa'i phyir rva med pa bzhin du de yang med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Since it is not perceived when analyzed down to the most subtle particles, like the nonexistence of a horn, it is not different from the conceptualization.

original: de gnyis ka'i dngos po med na zhes pa ni sgra dang don gnyis ka'i dngos po med pas ci la ltos ta ri bong gi rva med ces bya /
analyzed: de gnyis ka'i dngos po med na zhes pa ni sgra dang don gnyis ka'i dngos po med pas ci la ltos ta ri bong gi rva med ces bya /
translated: If both of those are nonexistent, then since the entities of both sound and meaning are nonexistent, in dependence on what is it said that the sound of a rabbit‚Äôs horn does not exist?

original: de las gzhan pa'i rva dang sgra med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i rva dang sgra med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no horn or sound that is different from those two.

original: blo gros chen po gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gal te phan tshun du ltos nas yod pa dang med pa mi 'gyur na ni de'i tshe ri bong gi rva med la de las gzhan pa'i rva yod do zhes smra bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: blo gros chen po gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gal te phan tshun du ltos nas yod pa dang med pa mi 'gyur na ni de'i tshe ri bong gi rva med la de las gzhan pa'i rva yod do zhes smra bar mi bya'o //
translated: ‚ÄúMahƒÅmati, if existence and nonexistence were not due to mutual dependence, then one could not say that the horn of a rabbit does not exist and the horn of another animal does exist.‚Äù

original: rgyu mi mnyam zhes bya ba ni phan tshun du brten pa'i @85b phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu mi mnyam zhes bya ba ni phan tshun du brten pa'i @85b phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúThe cause is not equal‚Äù means that they are mutually dependent.

original: nam mkha'i dngos po yongs su rtogs pa las mi mkhas pa rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni thogs pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs kyi yul gyi dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin tsam ni nam mkha' yin no zhes thams cad mkhyen pas dgongs pa'i don te /
analyzed: nam mkha'i dngos po yongs su rtogs pa las mi mkhas pa rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni thogs pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs kyi yul gyi dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin tsam ni nam mkha' yin no zhes thams cad mkhyen pas dgongs pa'i don te /
translated: ‚ÄúThe unwise, due to not understanding the nature of space‚Äù and so on means that the nature of space is merely the absence of the object that is impeded form. This is the intended meaning of the Omniscient One.

original: thogs pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs kyi yul nyid nam mkha' ste /
analyzed: thogs pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs kyi yul nyid nam mkha' ste /
translated: Space is the object of impeded form.

original: gang gis thogs pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs bstsal ba'i tshe sgu bur brtag pa ste /
analyzed: gang gis thogs pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs bstsal ba'i tshe sgu bur brtag pa ste /
translated: When impeded form is removed, space is conceived as a gap.

original: des na dngos po gzhan bar rgyur ba lnga pa'am /
analyzed: des na dngos po gzhan bar rgyur ba lnga pa'am /
translated: Therefore, it is a different thing, one of the five elements.

original: gzugs ma gtogs par nam mkha' med do zhes thams cad mkhyen pas sgrub bar gsungs pa /
analyzed: gzugs ma gtogs par nam mkha' med do zhes thams cad mkhyen pas sgrub bar gsungs pa /
translated: The Omniscient One has said that apart from form, there is no space.

original: gzugs rnams kyi 'byung ba'i rjes su zhugs pa'i phyir gzugs nyid kyang nam mkha' ste /
analyzed: gzugs rnams kyi 'byung ba'i rjes su zhugs pa'i phyir gzugs nyid kyang nam mkha' ste /
translated: Form itself is space, because it is included in the origination of form.

original: de'i gzugs ma gtogs par nam mkha'i dngos po gzhan med pas na nam mkha' nyid gzugs zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de'i gzugs ma gtogs par nam mkha'i dngos po gzhan med pas na nam mkha' nyid gzugs zhes bya ste /
translated: Since there is no other entity of space apart from form, space is called form.

original: sbu bur gnas pa la dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: sbu bur gnas pa la dgongs pa'o //
translated: This is the intended meaning of the statement about the space in a pot.

original: gzhag pa dang gzhi'i tshul du nam mkha' dang gzugs so so'i rnam pa tha dad pa rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhag pa dang gzhi'i tshul du nam mkha' dang gzugs so so'i rnam pa tha dad pa rig par bya'o //
translated: Space and form should be understood as having different aspects, in terms of their placement and basis.

original: sgra'i don du ste /
analyzed: sgra'i don du ste /
translated: In terms of the meaning of the word.

original: dngos po'i don nyid du yod pa yang ma yin no zhes dgongs pa'i don to //
analyzed: dngos po'i don nyid du yod pa yang ma yin no zhes dgongs pa'i don to //
translated: It is not that they exist as the meaning of entities. This is the intended meaning.

original: dngos po dang dngos po med par gzugs dang nam mkha' rjes su zhugs pas de ltar na gcig gi gnas gcig yin no //
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med par gzugs dang nam mkha' rjes su zhugs pas de ltar na gcig gi gnas gcig yin no //
translated: Form and space are included in entity and non-entity. Thus, they are the same in one place.

original: 'byung ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni nam mkha'i dngos po med pas na der mi gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: 'byung ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni nam mkha'i dngos po med pas na der mi gnas pa yin te /
translated: As for the statement beginning with originating, since there is no entity of space, it does not abide there.

original: de dag la yang nam mkha' med pa ma yin pa ni byung ba'i yul du nam mkha' yod par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de dag la yang nam mkha' med pa ma yin pa ni byung ba'i yul du nam mkha' yod par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: And in regard to them, it is not that space does not exist, for space exists as the objective domain of arising.

original: de bzhin du zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' dang ri bong gi rva dag ni brtags pa'i dngos por chos mtshungs par gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' dang ri bong gi rva dag ni brtags pa'i dngos por chos mtshungs par gsungs pa'o //
translated: Just like that means that space and the rabbit's horns are said to be similar in being imputed entities.

original: de ltar ba glang gi rva la sogs pa yod pas ba lang gi rva la ltos te ri bong gi rva med par gyur na ni ba lang gi rva ci las ltos te med par 'gyur zhes dgongs nas gsungs pa /
analyzed: de ltar ba glang gi rva la sogs pa yod pas ba lang gi rva la ltos te ri bong gi rva med par gyur na ni ba lang gi rva ci las ltos te med par 'gyur zhes dgongs nas gsungs pa /
translated: Thus, thinking if the non-existence of the rabbit's horns in dependence on the cow's horns is due to the existence of the cow's horns, then in dependence on what do the cow's horns exist? he says:

original: ba lang gi rva la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: ba lang gi rva la sogs pa ste /
translated: The cow's horns and so on.

original: rva sbom po rdul phra mor phye ba na khang pa dang / sde dang nags tshal la sogs pa bzhin du stong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rva sbom po rdul phra mor phye ba na khang pa dang / sde dang nags tshal la sogs pa bzhin du stong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When the coarse horn is divided into subtle particles, it becomes empty like a house, an army, a forest and so on.

original: rdul phra mo yang phyogs kyi char gzhigs na rdul phra mo yang mi gnas te stong bar 'gyur ro zhes ba ni shes rab kyis chos la bdag med par bsgrub pa'o //
analyzed: rdul phra mo yang phyogs kyi char gzhigs na rdul phra mo yang mi gnas te stong bar 'gyur ro zhes ba ni shes rab kyis chos la bdag med par bsgrub pa'o //
translated: And when the subtle particle is divided into directional parts, the subtle particle also does not endure and becomes empty. This is the establishment of the selflessness of phenomena by wisdom.

original: de yang de lta bu'i chos can no zhes bya ba ni phan tshun du gcig ltos te chos dang chos @86a * //
analyzed: de yang de lta bu'i chos can no zhes bya ba ni phan tshun du gcig ltos te chos dang chos @86a * //
translated: Moreover, ‚Äúsuch a subject‚Äù is mutually dependent, and the subject and object of refutation are also mutually dependent.üîΩ

original: can dang / mtshan mar bya ba dang / mtshan nyid la sogs pa gang rtog pa de rang bzhin tha dad par mi 'grub pas na de thams cad stong pa'o //
analyzed: can dang / mtshan mar bya ba dang / mtshan nyid la sogs pa gang rtog pa de rang bzhin tha dad par mi 'grub pas na de thams cad stong pa'o //
translated: Moreover, such a subject means that when one relies on the other, the subject and the object, the characteristic and the characterized, etc. are imagined, since they are not established as having different natures, they are all empty.

original: ri bong dang pa lang gi rva zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni brtags pa dang gzhan gyi dbang gi dngos po la lta ba'i rnam par rtog pa dang bral bar bya'o //
analyzed: ri bong dang pa lang gi rva zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni brtags pa dang gzhan gyi dbang gi dngos po la lta ba'i rnam par rtog pa dang bral bar bya'o //
translated: As for the horn of a rabbit, the horn of a cow, etc., one should be free from the conceptual thought that views imagined and dependent entities.

original: de la rtog pa dang bral bar bya'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de la rtog pa dang bral bar bya'o zhes pa'o //
translated: There, it is said, one should be free from conceptual thought.

original: de la rtag pa dang / bdag dang / nam mkha' dang / ri bong gi rva la sogs pa ni sa brtags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la rtag pa dang / bdag dang / nam mkha' dang / ri bong gi rva la sogs pa ni sa brtags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: There, the permanent, the self, space, the horn of a rabbit, etc. are imagined, because they are imagined.

original: ba lang gi rva dang rmi lam dang / mig 'phrul dang / rab rib la sogs pa'i rang bzhin pa rnams ni gzhan gyi dbang nyid de gsal bas na don gyi bya ba byed do //
analyzed: ba lang gi rva dang rmi lam dang / mig 'phrul dang / rab rib la sogs pa'i rang bzhin pa rnams ni gzhan gyi dbang nyid de gsal bas na don gyi bya ba byed do //
translated: The nature of the horn of a cow, dreams, magical illusions, cataracts, etc. are dependent, because they are manifest and perform the function of objects.

original: rang gi sems snang ba'i rnal 'byor bstan par bya'o zhes pa ni phyi'i don med pas na 'di skad du gsungs pa /
analyzed: rang gi sems snang ba'i rnal 'byor bstan par bya'o zhes pa ni phyi'i don med pas na 'di skad du gsungs pa /
translated: The statement I will teach the yoga of the appearance of one's own mind is made because there are no external objects.

original: rang gi sems snang ba la rnam par rtog pa rjes su rtog pa'i yid du'ang 'gyur bar bya'o zhes pas te /
analyzed: rang gi sems snang ba la rnam par rtog pa rjes su rtog pa'i yid du'ang 'gyur bar bya'o zhes pas te /
translated: It is also the mind that conceives of the appearance of one's own mind as external objects.

original: rang gi sems snang ba las lhag pa'i phyi'i don rnam par rtog par ma byed cig ces pa'o //üîΩsna tshogs snang ba yod pa min //
analyzed: rang gi sems snang ba las lhag pa'i phyi'i don rnam par rtog par ma byed cig ces pa'o // sna tshogs snang ba yod pa min //
translated: Do not conceive of external objects that are other than the appearance of one's own mind!

original: zhes bya ba la snang ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la snang ba'i phyir te /
translated: The statement The various appearances do not exist is made because of the appearance of the mind.

original: ci mchis zhes pa dang / gsungs pa dang / sna tshogs kyi sems yod do zhes dgongs pa'i don to //üîΩsnang ba las ni sems 'byung ste //
analyzed: ci mchis zhes pa dang / gsungs pa dang / sna tshogs kyi sems yod do zhes dgongs pa'i don to // snang ba las ni sems 'byung ste //
translated: The statement What is it? and the statement The various minds exist are the intended meanings.

original: zhes bya ba ni rang gi yan lag nyid las 'byung gi phyi'i don las ni ma yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩji ltar na zhes pa dang / gsungs pa /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rang gi yan lag nyid las 'byung gi phyi'i don las ni ma yin pa'i phyir ro // ji ltar na zhes pa dang / gsungs pa /
translated: The statement The mind arises from appearance is made because it arises from its own parts, not from external objects.

original: lus dang longs spyod gnas snang ba //
analyzed: lus dang longs spyod gnas snang ba //
translated: The statement How? and the statement The body, the enjoyments, and the place appear are the intended meanings.

original: kun gzhi mi las snang ba yin //
analyzed: kun gzhi mi las snang ba yin //
translated: The statement The foundation consciousness appears to the mind is made because the foundation consciousness appears to the mind.

original: zhes te / rmi lam la sogs pa bzhin pas na phyi'i don med do zhes so //
analyzed: zhes te / rmi lam la sogs pa bzhin pas na phyi'i don med do zhes so //
translated: Thus, because of being like a dream, etc., there are no external objects.üîΩHow is it that there are no external objects?

original: ji ltar na phyi'i don med ces pa dang / gsungs pa /
analyzed: ji ltar na phyi'i don med ces pa dang / gsungs pa /
translated: It is said:

original: sems dang yid dang rnam par shes //
analyzed: sems dang yid dang rnam par shes //
translated: Mind, thought, and consciousness,üîΩNature, five dharmas,

original: rang bzhin dang ni chos lnga dang // bdag med mi gnyis dag pa yang //
analyzed: rang bzhin dang ni chos lnga dang // bdag med mi gnyis dag pa yang //
translated: and the two selflessnesses and purity

original: rnam par 'dren pas rab tu gsungs //
analyzed: rnam par 'dren pas rab tu gsungs //
translated: are taught by the Leader.

original: zhes te / de la rang bzhin ni chos kyi dbyings te /
analyzed: zhes te / de la rang bzhin ni chos kyi dbyings te /
translated: Therein, nature is the dharmadhatu,

original: dag pa dang ma dag pa ste /
analyzed: dag pa dang ma dag pa ste /
translated: pure and impure,

original: ye shes dang gang chud pa yin pa'o //
analyzed: ye shes dang gang chud pa yin pa'o //
translated: and is the container of wisdom.

original: sems la sogs pa'i shes pa brgyad ni sngar bshad zin to //
analyzed: sems la sogs pa'i shes pa brgyad ni sngar bshad zin to //
translated: The eight consciousnesses, mind, etc., have been explained above.

original: bdag med pa ni gang zag la bdag med pa'o //
analyzed: bdag med pa ni gang zag la bdag med pa'o //
translated: Selflessness is the selflessness of the person.

original: mi gnyis pa dag ni chos la bdag med pa'o //
analyzed: mi gnyis pa dag ni chos la bdag med pa'o //
translated: Nonduality is the selflessness of dharmas.

original: mi gnyis pa yang gzhan gyi dbang dang sgyu ma la sogs pa'i rang bzhin pa nyid yod de /
analyzed: mi gnyis pa yang gzhan gyi dbang dang sgyu ma la sogs pa'i rang bzhin pa nyid yod de /
translated: Nonduality also exists as the nature of the other-dependent and illusion, etc.

original: dngos po dang dngos po med pa med pas na de gcad pa'i don du don @86b dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis pa'i ye shes dag pa bar dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med pa med pas na de gcad pa'i don du don @86b dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis pa'i ye shes dag pa bar dgongs pa'o //
translated: Since neither entity nor non-entity exist, the ultimate truth is the pure non-dual intuition which is the object of the elimination of those.

original: ming dang mtshan ma la sogs pa lnga ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: ming dang mtshan ma la sogs pa lnga ni bshad zin to //
translated: The five, name, sign, etc., have already been explained.

original: ring po dang thung du la sogs pa ni rgyu dang dpe dang bcas te 'das pa'i don ring po dang / thung ngu la sogs pa bzhin no zhes tshigs su bcad pas gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: ring po dang thung du la sogs pa ni rgyu dang dpe dang bcas te 'das pa'i don ring po dang / thung ngu la sogs pa bzhin no zhes tshigs su bcad pas gsungs pa'o //
translated: Long and short, etc., are like the past object, long and short, etc., as stated in the verse with the cause and example.üîΩExistence and non-existence in mutual dependence is like the horns of a rabbit, which are non-existent, and the horns of a bull, which are existent.

original: gcig la gcig ltos te yod pa dang med par 'gyur ba ni rdul phran du ni rdzas bshig ste /
analyzed: gcig la gcig ltos te yod pa dang med par 'gyur ba ni rdul phran du ni rdzas bshig ste /
translated: When the substance is destroyed into atoms,

original: phyogs kyi char phye ba na /
analyzed: phyogs kyi char phye ba na /
translated: and when it is divided into directional parts,

original: gzugs la rnam par brtag mi bya //
analyzed: gzugs la rnam par brtag mi bya //
translated: form should not be imagined.

original: zhes te / ba lang gi rva la sogs pa stong pas na de la ltos te ri bong gi rva ltag las na 'gyur /
analyzed: zhes te / ba lang gi rva la sogs pa stong pas na de la ltos te ri bong gi rva ltag las na 'gyur /
translated: Since the horns of a cow, etc., are empty, in dependence on them, the horns of a rabbit are non-existent.

original: de ltar phyi'i don med pas sems tsam po nyid 'ba' zhig ste /
analyzed: de ltar phyi'i don med pas sems tsam po nyid 'ba' zhig ste /
translated: Thus, since external objects do not exist, there is only mind-only.

original: de yang / 'khrul pa rnams kyi lta ba ngan pas bsal mi 'gyur //
analyzed: de yang / 'khrul pa rnams kyi lta ba ngan pas bsal mi 'gyur //
translated: The bad views of the confused are not removed.

original: zhes te / rnyog ma bsal te chu bzhin du dangs par 'gyur bas na yongs su dag par 'gyur zhes pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: zhes te / rnyog ma bsal te chu bzhin du dangs par 'gyur bas na yongs su dag par 'gyur zhes pa'i bar du'o //
translated: Since the turbidity is removed, like water, it becomes clear. Therefore, it is said to become completely pure.

original: rtog pa ni tshad ma dang / gzhal ba la sogs pa phyi'i don du lta bas rnam par gzhag par rnam par rtog gi / sems tsam du snang ba la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rtog pa ni tshad ma dang / gzhal ba la sogs pa phyi'i don du lta bas rnam par gzhag par rnam par rtog gi / sems tsam du snang ba la ni ma yin no //
translated: Conceptualization is established by the view of external objects such as valid knowledge and the object of comprehension, but not by the appearance of mind only.

original: nyan thos phyi'i gzugs la mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / mi gtsang ba dang / mi mdzes par rtog par byed do //
analyzed: nyan thos phyi'i gzugs la mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / mi gtsang ba dang / mi mdzes par rtog par byed do //
translated: The ≈õrƒÅvakas conceptualize external form as impermanent, suffering, impure, and ugly.

original: don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis pa'i ye shes rnam par mi rtog cing snang ba med pa ni 'phags pa sa'i dbang po bdag med pa gnyis rtogs pa rnams kyi so sor bdag gis rtogs pa'i spyod yul yin te /
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis pa'i ye shes rnam par mi rtog cing snang ba med pa ni 'phags pa sa'i dbang po bdag med pa gnyis rtogs pa rnams kyi so sor bdag gis rtogs pa'i spyod yul yin te /
translated: The nondual wisdom of ultimate truth, which is nonconceptual and nonappearing, is the object of individual knowledge of the noble lords of the stages who realize the two types of no-self.

original: yang dag par rig pa'i rang bzhin mar me ltar bdag nyid du snang ba'o //
analyzed: yang dag par rig pa'i rang bzhin mar me ltar bdag nyid du snang ba'o //
translated: It is the appearance of the nature of correct knowledge, which is like a lamp.

original: rang gi sems snang ba'i rgyud rnam par dag par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni kha cig gser la sogs pa sa'i se'u la sogs pas btso ba bzhin du rim gyis dri ma med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang gi sems snang ba'i rgyud rnam par dag par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni kha cig gser la sogs pa sa'i se'u la sogs pas btso ba bzhin du rim gyis dri ma med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Some think that like gold and so on being refined by a smith and so on, it becomes stainless gradually.üîΩSome think that it is instantaneous, like a lamp illuminating the contents of a house and so on.

original: kha cig ni cig car te mar mes khyim gyi yo byad la sogs pa snang bar byed pa bzhin no zhes 'phags pa blo gros chen pos de ltar bsams te thams cad mkhyen pa de la de skad du gsol ba'o //
analyzed: kha cig ni cig car te mar mes khyim gyi yo byad la sogs pa snang bar byed pa bzhin no zhes 'phags pa blo gros chen pos de ltar bsams te thams cad mkhyen pa de la de skad du gsol ba'o //
translated: The noble one, the great being, thinking in this way, asked the Omniscient One.

original: bzhad gad la sogs par rim gyis 'jug pa ni gang gi tshe na glu mi len te /
analyzed: bzhad gad la sogs par rim gyis 'jug pa ni gang gi tshe na glu mi len te /
translated: Gradually engaging in laughter and so on is when one does not sing.

original: de ltar na bya ba kha cig ni rim du 'byung /
analyzed: de ltar na bya ba kha cig ni rim du 'byung /
translated: Thus, some actions occur gradually.

original: kha cig ni cig car 'byung ste /
analyzed: kha cig ni cig car 'byung ste /
translated: Some occur instantaneously.

original: ji ltar me long gi nang du gzugs sna tshogs snang ba rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes pas cig car snang ba ste /
analyzed: ji ltar me long gi nang du gzugs sna tshogs snang ba rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes pas cig car snang ba ste /
translated: Just as various forms appear in a mirror simultaneously through non-conceptual consciousness,

original: 'dzin zhes bya ba'i don no //
analyzed: 'dzin zhes bya ba'i don no //
translated: the meaning of grasping.

original: de ltar rigs pa'i rim par song ba'i sa'i dbang po rnams kyi @87a * //
analyzed: de ltar rigs pa'i rim par song ba'i sa'i dbang po rnams kyi @87a * //
translated: Thus, the Tathagata purifies the mind-streams of the lords of the stages, who have gone through the stages of reasoning,

original: nyon mongs pa med pa'i mi shes pa'i rgyud de mi snang ba'i sems kyi rgyud rnams de bzhin gshegs pas sbyong ngo //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa med pa'i mi shes pa'i rgyud de mi snang ba'i sems kyi rgyud rnams de bzhin gshegs pas sbyong ngo //
translated: from the continuum of ignorance that is without afflictions, from the continuum of mind that is without appearance.

original: rang gi sems snang ba'i gnas ngan len gyi bag chags dang bral ba mig gi ling tog dang bral ba bzhin pa'i bsam du med pa'i ye shes can rnams la rgyal ba'i spyod yul bzhin du thams cad mkhyen pa'i yul cig car ston to //
analyzed: rang gi sems snang ba'i gnas ngan len gyi bag chags dang bral ba mig gi ling tog dang bral ba bzhin pa'i bsam du med pa'i ye shes can rnams la rgyal ba'i spyod yul bzhin du thams cad mkhyen pa'i yul cig car ston to //
translated: To those who have the wisdom that is inconceivable, who are free from the latent tendencies of the negative tendencies of the appearances of their own minds, who are like those who are free from the cataracts of the eyes, the object of omniscience is shown all at once, like the domain of the Victorious Ones.

original: shes par bya ba'i yul thams cad dus bcu'i dbang phyug rnams kyi dar la me tog lta bu'i sgrib pa bsal te /
analyzed: shes par bya ba'i yul thams cad dus bcu'i dbang phyug rnams kyi dar la me tog lta bu'i sgrib pa bsal te /
translated: In all the objects of knowledge, the lords of the ten times, like flowers in the sky, clear away the obscurations

original: sangs rgyas kyi sar gzud par mdzad do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sar gzud par mdzad do //
translated: and lead them to the stage of buddhahood.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa la /
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa la /
translated: In the foundation consciousness and so forth,

original: lus dang gnas dang / longs spyod kyi yul ni lus dang sa dang / mig la sogs pa'i shes pa'i shes par bya ba rnams de cig car 'byung ngo //
analyzed: lus dang gnas dang / longs spyod kyi yul ni lus dang sa dang / mig la sogs pa'i shes pa'i shes par bya ba rnams de cig car 'byung ngo //
translated: The body, place, and objects of enjoyment are the body, earth, and objects of cognition such as the eye, etc.

original: rgyu dang 'dra ba'i sangs rgyas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni mi gnyis pa'i mtshan nyid mngon par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las langs te yid kyi so sor snang ba rdzogs longs spyod pa rnam par snang mdzad kyi sku las sgyu 'dra ba sprul pa'i sku 'byung
analyzed: rgyu dang 'dra ba'i sangs rgyas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni mi gnyis pa'i mtshan nyid mngon par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las langs te yid kyi so sor snang ba rdzogs longs spyod pa rnam par snang mdzad kyi sku las sgyu 'dra ba sprul pa'i sku 'byung
translated: The Buddha who is similar to the cause, etc., refers to the fact that the emanation body arises from the enjoyment body of Vairocana, the mental appearance of the perfect enlightenment of nonduality,

original: ste / yul du zhugs par gshang ba'i sems can rnams chos rnam pa sna tshogs bstan pas cig car yongs su smin par byas te /
analyzed: ste / yul du zhugs par gshang ba'i sems can rnams chos rnam pa sna tshogs bstan pas cig car yongs su smin par byas te /
translated: and having entered the realm, simultaneously brings to full maturity those sentient beings who are to be trained by teaching the various aspects of the Dharma.

original: 'og min gyi gnas na gzhal med khang gi pho brang du rnam par snang mdzad kyi sku snang ba rnal 'byor du sbyor ba gang dag la yod pa de dag la thos pa dang / sems pa dang / bsgom pa la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin thob pa rnams kyis gzhog go //
analyzed: 'og min gyi gnas na gzhal med khang gi pho brang du rnam par snang mdzad kyi sku snang ba rnal 'byor du sbyor ba gang dag la yod pa de dag la thos pa dang / sems pa dang / bsgom pa la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin thob pa rnams kyis gzhog go //
translated: Those who are in the palace of the Akani·π£·π≠ha realm, who are endowed with the body of Vairocana, who are engaged in yoga, who have attained meditative concentration such as listening, reflection, and cultivation, they are established.

original: rnal 'byor du sbyor zhes bya ba ni snang ba dang bcas pa dang / snang ba med pa'i rnal 'byor gnyis su dgongs par brtag go //
analyzed: rnal 'byor du sbyor zhes bya ba ni snang ba dang bcas pa dang / snang ba med pa'i rnal 'byor gnyis su dgongs par brtag go //
translated: It should be understood that engaged in yoga refers to both the yoga with appearance and the yoga without appearance.

original: chos nyid kyi sangs rgyas ni mi gnyis pa'i byang chub kyi ting nge 'dzin gyi sku las bzhengs te snang ba dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin la bzhugs pa'i rnam par snang mdzad kyi sku ni sgyu dang 'dra ba'i sprul pa'i sku'i 'od zer rnams kyis rnam par
analyzed: chos nyid kyi sangs rgyas ni mi gnyis pa'i byang chub kyi ting nge 'dzin gyi sku las bzhengs te snang ba dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin la bzhugs pa'i rnam par snang mdzad kyi sku ni sgyu dang 'dra ba'i sprul pa'i sku'i 'od zer rnams kyis rnam par
translated: The dharmatƒÅ buddha, having arisen from the body of the meditative concentration of nondual enlightenment, the body of the meditative concentration with appearance, the body of Vairocana, is beautified by the light rays of the illusory emanation body.

original: mdzes so // rnam par snang bar mdzad pas na rnam par snang mdzad ces bya'o //
analyzed: mdzes so // rnam par snang bar mdzad pas na rnam par snang mdzad ces bya'o //
translated: Because he illuminates, he is called Vairocana.

original: 'phags pa so so rang gis rig pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni gnyis su med pa chud pa'i rang bzhin gyi chos kyi sku ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa so so rang gis rig pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni gnyis su med pa chud pa'i rang bzhin gyi chos kyi sku ste /
translated: The noble one's own-cognition characteristic is the dharmakƒÅya nature, which is the non-dual inclusion,

original: mar me ltar rab tu snang ba'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: mar me ltar rab tu snang ba'i bdag nyid do //
translated: the nature of the light like a lamp.

original: ji ltar na yang so so rang gis rig pa'i mtshan nyid rang bzhin lags zhes pa dang / de'i phyir gsungs @87b pa yod pa dang / med pa'i lta ba ngan pa bzlog pas zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ji ltar na yang so so rang gis rig pa'i mtshan nyid rang bzhin lags zhes pa dang / de'i phyir gsungs @87b pa yod pa dang / med pa'i lta ba ngan pa bzlog pas zhes bya'o //
translated: As for how is it the own-nature of the noble one's own-cognition characteristic? and therefore it is said to be the reversal of the bad views of existence and non-existence,

original: ji ltar rgya che ba'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las 'byung ba dngos pos mngon par rtogs pa ma yin /
analyzed: ji ltar rgya che ba'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las 'byung ba dngos pos mngon par rtogs pa ma yin /
translated: How is it that in the extensive perfection of wisdom it is said that the realization is not by means of existence,

original: dngos po med pas kyang med pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dngos po med pas kyang med pa ma yin te /
translated: nor is it by means of non-existence,

original: ci zhe na dngos po dang dngos po med pas mnyam pas so //
analyzed: ci zhe na dngos po dang dngos po med pas mnyam pas so //
translated: but rather by means of the equality of existence and non-existence?

original: de nyid kyi sngon gyi smon lam gyis sems can gyi don du bya ba gzhal du med do //
analyzed: de nyid kyi sngon gyi smon lam gyis sems can gyi don du bya ba gzhal du med do //
translated: It is just that, by one's previous aspirations, one's activity for the benefit of sentient beings is immeasurable.

original: chos nyid 'dra bar 'byung ba'i sangs rgyas ni gnyis su med pa'i ting nge 'dzin las bzhengs pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa snang ba dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin la bzhugs te /
analyzed: chos nyid 'dra bar 'byung ba'i sangs rgyas ni gnyis su med pa'i ting nge 'dzin las bzhengs pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa snang ba dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin la bzhugs te /
translated: The Buddha who is the same as reality arises from the samadhi of nonduality and abides in the samadhi of light, omniscience.

original: rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid du rtogs pa rnams kyi khyad par ston to //
analyzed: rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid du rtogs pa rnams kyi khyad par ston to //
translated: He teaches the distinctions of the realizations of the general and specific characteristics.

original: chos thams cad kyi zhes bya ba dang 'brel to //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi zhes bya ba dang 'brel to //
translated: This is connected to ‚Äúall phenomena.‚Äù

original: de la rang gi mtshan nyid ni sra ba dang / brlan pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la rang gi mtshan nyid ni sra ba dang / brlan pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Therein, the specific characteristics are solidity, fluidity, and so on.

original: spyi'i mtshan nyid ni mi rtag pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: spyi'i mtshan nyid ni mi rtag pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The general characteristics are impermanence and so on.

original: de dag gi khyad par ro //
analyzed: de dag gi khyad par ro //
translated: Those are the distinctions.

original: rang gi sems snang ba ni rmi lam dang / mig 'phrul dang / rab rib dang / mgo 'khor ba dang / brgyal ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin ltar gzugs la sogs pa snang ba la bag chags kyi rgyu dang mtshan nyid dang 'brel cing phyi'i don med par ston to //
analyzed: rang gi sems snang ba ni rmi lam dang / mig 'phrul dang / rab rib dang / mgo 'khor ba dang / brgyal ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin ltar gzugs la sogs pa snang ba la bag chags kyi rgyu dang mtshan nyid dang 'brel cing phyi'i don med par ston to //
translated: The appearances of one‚Äôs mind are like the nature of dreams, illusions, cataracts, dizziness, fainting, and so on. Forms and so on appear connected to the characteristics of the cause of traces. It is taught that external objects do not exist.

original: de nas 'di skad ces smras pa yin te /
analyzed: de nas 'di skad ces smras pa yin te /
translated: Then, he said this:

original: rang gi sems snang ba ni snang ba nyid yin te /
analyzed: rang gi sems snang ba ni snang ba nyid yin te /
translated: One‚Äôs own mind appears as appearances.

original: de dag gi rgyu ni bag chags yin pa dang / mtshan nyid ni mtshan mar 'brel to //
analyzed: de dag gi rgyu ni bag chags yin pa dang / mtshan nyid ni mtshan mar 'brel to //
translated: Their cause is latent tendencies, and their characteristic is the connection with signs.

original: yongs su brtags pa'i rang bzhin la mngon par zhen pa'i rgyu las byung ba ni rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa la sogs par rtog pa ni rgyu las 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: yongs su brtags pa'i rang bzhin la mngon par zhen pa'i rgyu las byung ba ni rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa la sogs par rtog pa ni rgyu las 'byung ba ste /
translated: Arising from the cause of the conception of the nature of the imagined is the conception of permanence, impermanence, and so on.

original: rtag pa dang mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i yul gyi dngos po rnams de'i gzugs ma gtogs par med do //
analyzed: rtag pa dang mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i yul gyi dngos po rnams de'i gzugs ma gtogs par med do //
translated: Apart from the form of that, the things of objects such as permanence and impermanence do not exist.

original: ji ltar na yang phyi'i don med ces pa dang / gsungs pa /
analyzed: ji ltar na yang phyi'i don med ces pa dang / gsungs pa /
translated: How is it that external objects do not exist?

original: sgyu ma'i yan lag rnam pa mang po'i skyes bu de'i bdag nyid ma yin pa sna tshogs la mngon par zhen pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni ji bzhin du sgyu ma la sogs pa'i phyi'i dngos por mi 'byung zhing /
analyzed: sgyu ma'i yan lag rnam pa mang po'i skyes bu de'i bdag nyid ma yin pa sna tshogs la mngon par zhen pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni ji bzhin du sgyu ma la sogs pa'i phyi'i dngos por mi 'byung zhing /
translated: The many branches of the illusion are not the nature of that person, because the various things conceived do not exist.

original: rang gi sems kyi snang ba tsam nyid yin pa de bzhin du 'gro ba thams cad kyi rang gi sems snang ba tsam nyid do //üîΩblo gros chen po gzhan yang yongs su brtags zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: rang gi sems kyi snang ba tsam nyid yin pa de bzhin du 'gro ba thams cad kyi rang gi sems snang ba tsam nyid do // blo gros chen po gzhan yang yongs su brtags zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Just as it is for one‚Äôs own mind, so it is for the minds of all beings.

original: 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid ni rtag pa dang / bdag dang / rdul phra mo dang / yan lag can dang / @88a * //
analyzed: 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid ni rtag pa dang / bdag dang / rdul phra mo dang / yan lag can dang / @88a * //
translated: Moreover, Mahamati, the imagined is the characteristic of the elements, such as permanence, self, atoms, the possessor of parts,

original: rdzas la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rdzas la sogs pa'o //
translated: substance, and so on.

original: gzhan gyi dbang ni sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam par rang bzhin gsal ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang ni sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam par rang bzhin gsal ba'o //
translated: The dependent is the nature of the elements, such as blue, and so on, which is clear.

original: de nyid du rtag pa dang / bdag dang bde ba dang / gtsang ba'i dngos por mngon par chags pa las rnam par rtog pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de nyid du rtag pa dang / bdag dang bde ba dang / gtsang ba'i dngos por mngon par chags pa las rnam par rtog pa 'byung ngo //
translated: From attachment to that very thing as having the nature of permanence, self, bliss, and purity, conceptualization arises.

original: ji ltar thams cad mkhyen pas 'di nyid du gsungs pa /
analyzed: ji ltar thams cad mkhyen pas 'di nyid du gsungs pa /
translated: As the Omniscient One has said in this very text:

original: rtag pa yi ni rang bzhin gyis //
analyzed: rtag pa yi ni rang bzhin gyis //
translated: ‚ÄúBy the nature of permanence,

original: dngos po thams cad ma skyes te //
analyzed: dngos po thams cad ma skyes te //
translated: all things are unborn.

original: gzhan dbang la ni brten nas ni //
analyzed: gzhan dbang la ni brten nas ni //
translated: Based on the dependent,

original: mi yi rnam rtog skye ba'o //
analyzed: mi yi rnam rtog skye ba'o //
translated: the conceptualization of humans arises.‚Äù

original: de nyid du dpe gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid du dpe gsungs pa /
translated: The example is stated right there:

original: rtsva dang shing dang gyo mo la brten te sgyu ma 'byung zhes so //
analyzed: rtsva dang shing dang gyo mo la brten te sgyu ma 'byung zhes so //
translated: ‚ÄúAn illusion arises in dependence on grass, sticks, and clods.‚Äù

original: de'i rgyu dang gzugs gsung bar mdzad pa /
analyzed: de'i rgyu dang gzugs gsung bar mdzad pa /
translated: He states its cause and form:

original: sngags dang mi ldan pa las zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: sngags dang mi ldan pa las zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúFrom that which is not endowed with mantra,‚Äù and so on.

original: gang dag la 'khrul pa'i sa bon yongs su ji ltar smin pa rim dang cig car du de dag la de ltar du ston to //
analyzed: gang dag la 'khrul pa'i sa bon yongs su ji ltar smin pa rim dang cig car du de dag la de ltar du ston to //
translated: The seeds of error are fully ripened in stages and instantaneously in those [beings].

original: sgyu ma byed pas sems can thams cad la gzugs kyi yan lag gi lus rnams kyis sde bzhin du gzugs rnam pa sna tshogs 'chad pa'i phun sum tshogs pa sgyu ma'i skyes bu'i lus rang bzhin gcig tu ma grub par ston to //
analyzed: sgyu ma byed pas sems can thams cad la gzugs kyi yan lag gi lus rnams kyis sde bzhin du gzugs rnam pa sna tshogs 'chad pa'i phun sum tshogs pa sgyu ma'i skyes bu'i lus rang bzhin gcig tu ma grub par ston to //
translated: The magician, with the bodies of all sentient beings, which are the limbs of form, demonstrates the perfection of various forms, the bodies of illusory beings, which are not established as a single nature.

original: sems can gyi lus su gang gi gzugs 'dus pa de'i gzugs ni khang pa dang / sde dang / nags tshal la sogs pa bzhin du gcig pa ma yin /
analyzed: sems can gyi lus su gang gi gzugs 'dus pa de'i gzugs ni khang pa dang / sde dang / nags tshal la sogs pa bzhin du gcig pa ma yin /
translated: The form of that which is assembled into the body of a sentient being is not one, like a house, an army, a forest, and so on.

original: de bas na de ltar rnam par rtog pa rnam pa sna tshogs kyis rnam par brtag pa ste /
analyzed: de bas na de ltar rnam par rtog pa rnam pa sna tshogs kyis rnam par brtag pa ste /
translated: Therefore, in this way, the various conceptual thoughts are conceptualized.

original: ji bzhin du 'khrul ba'i gzugs la nges par 'dzin pa de bzhin du de la rnam par rtog go //üîΩji bzhin du sems can rnams kyi gzugs la sna tshogs kyi rnam par 'byung ba lta bur dngos po'i rang bzhin yang dag par de'i bdag nyid ma yin pa bzhin du gzhan gyi dbang la brten te rnam par rtog pa'i rnam par 'byung ba gzhan gyi dbang sngon
analyzed: ji bzhin du 'khrul ba'i gzugs la nges par 'dzin pa de bzhin du de la rnam par rtog go // ji bzhin du sems can rnams kyi gzugs la sna tshogs kyi rnam par 'byung ba lta bur dngos po'i rang bzhin yang dag par de'i bdag nyid ma yin pa bzhin du gzhan gyi dbang la brten te rnam par rtog pa'i rnam par 'byung ba gzhan gyi dbang sngon
translated: Just as one grasps the form of error as it is, so one conceptualizes it.

original: po la sogs pa'i rnam par mdzes pa dang mi mdzes pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i mtshan nyid du grub pa mngon par zhen pas bag chags la yongs su rtog cing bya ba 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: po la sogs pa'i rnam par mdzes pa dang mi mdzes pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i mtshan nyid du grub pa mngon par zhen pas bag chags la yongs su rtog cing bya ba 'byung ba ste /
translated: Just as the form of sentient beings arises in various ways, so the nature of things, not being of that nature, arises in the form of conceptual thoughts based on the dependent nature. The dependent nature, which is the basis for the arising of conceptual thoughts, is established as the characteristic of conceptual thoughts, such as beautiful and ugly.üîΩBy clinging to that, one conceptualizes habitual tendencies and actions arise.

original: bag chags las 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bag chags las 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: From habitual tendencies, they arise.

original: 'di ni zhes bya ba la rnam par rtog pa la sogs pa rnams kyis bshad pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ni zhes bya ba la rnam par rtog pa la sogs pa rnams kyis bshad pa ste /
translated: This is explained by this and so forth.

original: snang ba dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis sku'i gsung gi rnam par rtog pa rgya che ba chos kyi sku'i phrin las gang du 'byung zhes pa dang / gsungs pa /
analyzed: snang ba dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis sku'i gsung gi rnam par rtog pa rgya che ba chos kyi sku'i phrin las gang du 'byung zhes pa dang / gsungs pa /
translated: The extensive conceptualization of the body and speech of the samadhi with appearance is the activity of the dharmakaya. Where does it arise?

original: chos nyid kyi sangs rgyas ni @88b zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: chos nyid kyi sangs rgyas ni @88b zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The buddhahood of dharmata is the buddhahood of dharmata is... and so on.

original: de la sems kyi rang bzhin gyi mtshan nyid dang bral ba zhes pa ni lus dang longs spyod dang / gnas su snang ba'i kun gzhi rnam par shes pa gnyis kyi rnam pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: de la sems kyi rang bzhin gyi mtshan nyid dang bral ba zhes pa ni lus dang longs spyod dang / gnas su snang ba'i kun gzhi rnam par shes pa gnyis kyi rnam pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: There, free from the characteristics of the nature of the mind means free from the aspects of the two consciousnesses: the alaya consciousness that appears as the body, enjoyments, and abode.

original: 'phags pa so so rang gis rig pa'i spyod yul rnam par gzhog go zhes bya ba ni snang ba med cing gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi rtog pa bzhin du bzhengs pa'i ye shes kyi rnam par shes pa mar me bzhin du rang gis rang du snang
analyzed: 'phags pa so so rang gis rig pa'i spyod yul rnam par gzhog go zhes bya ba ni snang ba med cing gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi rtog pa bzhin du bzhengs pa'i ye shes kyi rnam par shes pa mar me bzhin du rang gis rang du snang
translated: The domain of the arya's individual knowledge is established means that the consciousness of the wisdom that arises like the nonappearance and nonduality of wisdom appears as one's own light, like a lamp.

original: ba'i bdag nyid nges par 'jug pa'i shes pa yang dag par rig pa bzhin du yang dag par rig pa'i rang bzhin mi gnyis pa spyir sgra'i don gyi rnam par yul med cing mi gnyis pa'i mtshan nyid pa yin no zhes rnam par gzhog go //
analyzed: ba'i bdag nyid nges par 'jug pa'i shes pa yang dag par rig pa bzhin du yang dag par rig pa'i rang bzhin mi gnyis pa spyir sgra'i don gyi rnam par yul med cing mi gnyis pa'i mtshan nyid pa yin no zhes rnam par gzhog go //
translated: The cognition that definitely engages the nature of the object is nondual in nature, like the four correct knowledges. It is the general object of the meaning of words, the characteristic of nonduality, and the absence of objects.

original: so so rang gis rig pa chud pa nyid de'i spyod yul te /
analyzed: so so rang gis rig pa chud pa nyid de'i spyod yul te /
translated: The domain of that is the individual intuitive awareness.

original: yul yin gyi gzhan yod pa ma yin no zhes zlog par byed pa'i gsung ngo //
analyzed: yul yin gyi gzhan yod pa ma yin no zhes zlog par byed pa'i gsung ngo //
translated: It is the object, not the existence of something else.

original: de ltar chos kyi sku'i rnal 'byor yang dag par rtog pa ni rdzogs longs spyod pa'i sku'i phrin las su rnam par gzhag par bstan nas 'phrul pas sprul pa'i sku'i phrin las rnam par gzhag par mdzad pa ni 'phrul pas sprul pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa
analyzed: de ltar chos kyi sku'i rnal 'byor yang dag par rtog pa ni rdzogs longs spyod pa'i sku'i phrin las su rnam par gzhag par bstan nas 'phrul pas sprul pa'i sku'i phrin las rnam par gzhag par mdzad pa ni 'phrul pas sprul pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa
translated: Thus, having taught the yoga of the dharmakƒÅya as the correct realization, it is presented as the activity of the sƒÅmbhogikakƒÅya. The presentation of the activity of the nairmƒÅ·πáikakƒÅya is as follows.

original: ste / sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / rnam par thar pa dang / phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched la sogs pa'i chos bshad par mdzad do //
analyzed: ste / sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / rnam par thar pa dang / phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched la sogs pa'i chos bshad par mdzad do //
translated: He teaches the perfections such as generosity, the emancipations, the aggregates, the elements, the sense-fields, etc.

original: phyi dang rnam par shes pa gnyis kyi rnam par mos pa ji bzhin pa'i sems can rnams la rgol ba dang / lan gdab pa'i cho 'phrul rnams kyis kyang ston to //
analyzed: phyi dang rnam par shes pa gnyis kyi rnam par mos pa ji bzhin pa'i sems can rnams la rgol ba dang / lan gdab pa'i cho 'phrul rnams kyis kyang ston to //
translated: He teaches by means of the miracles of reading others' thoughts and of instruction to those sentient beings who are disposed to the external and the internal.

original: rnam par shes pa 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni mi gnyis pa yang dag par rig pa tsam mo //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni mi gnyis pa yang dag par rig pa tsam mo //
translated: The characteristic of the engagement of consciousness is the mere knowledge of non-duality.

original: mu stegs can gyi lta ba dang mthun pa las 'das pa'i mtshan nyid ni rtag pa dang / bdag dang / phyi'i don las 'das pa ste /
analyzed: mu stegs can gyi lta ba dang mthun pa las 'das pa'i mtshan nyid ni rtag pa dang / bdag dang / phyi'i don las 'das pa ste /
translated: The characteristic of transcending the views of the heterodox is the transcendence of permanence, of self, and of external objects.

original: chos dang gang zag la bdag med par ston to //
analyzed: chos dang gang zag la bdag med par ston to //
translated: He teaches the selflessness of the person and of the dharmas.

original: snang ba med cing mi gnyis par chud pa'i chos kyi sku las bzhengs te snang ba ji bzhin pa ltar zhing snang ba dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin sgyu ma'i rnam par thar pa la zhugs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyis dmigs pa med cing dmigs pa dang bral
analyzed: snang ba med cing mi gnyis par chud pa'i chos kyi sku las bzhengs te snang ba ji bzhin pa ltar zhing snang ba dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin sgyu ma'i rnam par thar pa la zhugs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyis dmigs pa med cing dmigs pa dang bral
translated: Having risen from the dharmakaya, which is nonapparent and nondual, the buddhas, who have entered the illusion-like liberation of samadhi that is just as it appears, with appearances and fields, have no reference point and are free from reference points.üîΩ

original: ba gnyis su med par thugs su chud pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ba gnyis su med par thugs su chud pa bzhin no //
translated: Having arisen from the dharmakƒÅya, which is non-appearance and non-dual, the buddhas who have entered the liberation of illusion-like samƒÅdhi, which is appearance just as it is, together with the appearance of the field, have realized non-apprehending and freedom from apprehending as non-dual.

original: de nyid kyi khyad par ston pa ni bya ba dang / dbang po dang / tshad ma'i mtshan nyid thams cad la rnam par log pa zhes @89a * //
analyzed: de nyid kyi khyad par ston pa ni bya ba dang / dbang po dang / tshad ma'i mtshan nyid thams cad la rnam par log pa zhes @89a * //
translated: The teaching on the distinctive features of that is ‚Äúthe complete reversal of all characteristics of activity, faculties, and valid cognition.‚Äù

original: pa ste / byed pa po dang / las dang / byed pa dang bral ba'i phyir bya ba thams cad la rnam par log pa'o //
analyzed: pa ste / byed pa po dang / las dang / byed pa dang bral ba'i phyir bya ba thams cad la rnam par log pa'o //
translated: Since it is free from agent, object, and action, it is the complete reversal of all activity.

original: shes par bya ba med pa'i phyir dbang po tshad ma'i mtshan nyid rnam par log pas na de'i phyir de ltar byis pa rnams kyi yul ma yin zhes bya ste /
analyzed: shes par bya ba med pa'i phyir dbang po tshad ma'i mtshan nyid rnam par log pas na de'i phyir de ltar byis pa rnams kyi yul ma yin zhes bya ste /
translated: Since there is nothing to be cognized, the characteristics of the faculties and valid cognition are completely reversed. Therefore, it is said that it is not the domain of the childish.

original: rnal 'byor gyi dbang po rnams las thabs du mar rab tu snang bar mdzad pa ni de'i phrin las so //
analyzed: rnal 'byor gyi dbang po rnams las thabs du mar rab tu snang bar mdzad pa ni de'i phrin las so //
translated: The manifestation of the Lord of Yogins in many ways is his activity.

original: nyan thos kyi theg pa la rnam pa gnyis te zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi theg pa la rnam pa gnyis te zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: In the ≈örƒÅvaka Vehicle there are two types, and so on.

original: 'phags pa so so rang gis rig pa'i khyad par gyi mtshan nyid ni stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i rnam par thar pa thob pa rnams kyis mi gnyis pa yang dag par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa so so rang gis rig pa'i khyad par gyi mtshan nyid ni stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i rnam par thar pa thob pa rnams kyis mi gnyis pa yang dag par rig par bya'o //
translated: The defining characteristic of the ƒÅryas' individual knowledge is to be understood as non-dual perfect knowledge by those who have attained the liberation of emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness.üîΩFor those who cling to external objects, the defining characteristic of clinging to the nature of conceptual things is the nature of things

original: gang dag kyang phyi'i don du mngon par zhen pa de dag gi dngos po rnam par rtog pa'i rang bzhin la mngon par zhen pa'i mtshan nyid ni lus la dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa rnam par rtog pa rnams kyis dngos po'i rang bzhin la
analyzed: gang dag kyang phyi'i don du mngon par zhen pa de dag gi dngos po rnam par rtog pa'i rang bzhin la mngon par zhen pa'i mtshan nyid ni lus la dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa rnam par rtog pa rnams kyis dngos po'i rang bzhin la
translated: as conceptualized by the applications of mindfulness to the body and so on.

original: mngon par zhen pa ni lus dang / tshor ba dang / sems dang / chos rnams la mtshan nyid rnam pa gnyis su yongs su lta ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon par zhen pa ni lus dang / tshor ba dang / sems dang / chos rnams la mtshan nyid rnam pa gnyis su yongs su lta ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Attachment is the thorough affliction of the body, feelings, mind, and dharmas due to the twofold characteristic of viewing.

original: chos dang gang zag la bdag med pa'i khyad par du 'byed pa ste /
analyzed: chos dang gang zag la bdag med pa'i khyad par du 'byed pa ste /
translated: It is the distinction between the selflessness of dharmas and the selflessness of persons.

original: ji ltar 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las gsungs pa /
analyzed: ji ltar 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las gsungs pa /
translated: As it is said in the noble Perfection of Wisdom:

original: mi rtag pa dang / bdag med pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / mi mdzes par bsgom pa de yang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis so //
analyzed: mi rtag pa dang / bdag med pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / mi mdzes par bsgom pa de yang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis so //
translated: The cultivation of impermanence, selflessness, suffering, and the unattractive is also by way of non-apprehension.

original: de'i phyir na de ltar der thog mar stong pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir na de ltar der thog mar stong pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, in that way, emptiness is mentioned first there.

original: stong pa dang / bdag med pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / mi rtag pa'i yul gyi bden pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: stong pa dang / bdag med pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / mi rtag pa'i yul gyi bden pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of seeing the truth of the object of emptiness, selflessness, suffering, and impermanence.

original: skye ba ni srid pa dang / longs spyod pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye ba ni srid pa dang / longs spyod pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Birth is due to being separated from existence and enjoyment.

original: phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched dang / rang dang spyi'i phyi rol rnam par 'jig pa med pa'i mtshan nyid kyi phyir te /üîΩde la rang gi mtshan nyid ni gzugs la rnam pa gnyis sam /
analyzed: phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched dang / rang dang spyi'i phyi rol rnam par 'jig pa med pa'i mtshan nyid kyi phyir te / de la rang gi mtshan nyid ni gzugs la rnam pa gnyis sam /
translated: because of the characteristic of the non-destruction of the aggregates, elements, sense-fields, and of the general and particular external.

original: rnam pa nyi shu zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa nyi shu zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Therein, the particular characteristic is the twofold form, or the twenty kinds, etc.

original: gzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa spyi'i mtshan nyid ni mi rtag pa dang / bdag med pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa spyi'i mtshan nyid ni mi rtag pa dang / bdag med pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The general characteristic of form, feeling, etc. is impermanence, selflessness, etc.

original: phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid rnam pa de lta bu yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mthong nas rang gi sems skyo ba'i 'og tu sems mnyam par 'jog go //
analyzed: phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid rnam pa de lta bu yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mthong nas rang gi sems skyo ba'i 'og tu sems mnyam par 'jog go //
translated: Having seen the aggregates, elements, sense-fields, etc. in this way, just as they are, one becomes disgusted with one's own mind, and then one settles the mind in evenness.

original: rang gi @89b sems mnyam par gzhag nas zhes bya ba ni sems mnyam par gzhag pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes par 'gyur bas na bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa la sogs pa rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang gi @89b sems mnyam par gzhag nas zhes bya ba ni sems mnyam par gzhag pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes par 'gyur bas na bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa la sogs pa rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Having settled one's own mind in evenness means that by settling the mind in evenness one will understand just as it is, and so one will realize the meditative concentrations, the liberations, etc.

original: bag chags bsam gyis mi khyab pa yongs su gyur pas gang 'chi 'pho ba de dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: bag chags bsam gyis mi khyab pa yongs su gyur pas gang 'chi 'pho ba de dang bral ba'o //
translated: It is the transformation of inconceivable habitual tendencies, and it is free from death and transmigration.

original: yang na dbang po rno bas bsam gtan la sogs pa rnams kyis bsam du med pa'i bag chags yongs su gyur pa shas che bas na 'chi 'pho dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: yang na dbang po rno bas bsam gtan la sogs pa rnams kyis bsam du med pa'i bag chags yongs su gyur pa shas che bas na 'chi 'pho dang bral ba'o //
translated: Or else, it is free from death and transmigration because of the predominance of the transformation of habitual tendencies that cannot be imagined by means of the meditative concentrations, etc.

original: 'phags pa so so rang gis rig pa ni bde ba yang dag par tshor ba ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa so so rang gis rig pa ni bde ba yang dag par tshor ba ste /
translated: The noble individual intuitive wisdom is the true experience of bliss.

original: rnam par 'phrul pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par 'phrul pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is free from magical creations.

original: rnam pa de 'dra ba'i bde ba thams cad dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la bde bas yang log par rtog pa dka' ba'i bde ba yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa de 'dra ba'i bde ba thams cad dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la bde bas yang log par rtog pa dka' ba'i bde ba yin no //
translated: All such forms of bliss and the bliss of the formless meditative concentrations are difficult to imagine because they are inverted.

original: 'gog pa la snyoms par 'jug pa'i bde ba yang da ltar gyi tshe la bde bar gnas pa'i don du bzhag pa de yang khong du chud nas kyang sems can gyi don la ltos te byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis mngon sum du mi bya ste /
analyzed: 'gog pa la snyoms par 'jug pa'i bde ba yang da ltar gyi tshe la bde bar gnas pa'i don du bzhag pa de yang khong du chud nas kyang sems can gyi don la ltos te byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis mngon sum du mi bya ste /
translated: The bliss of the meditative concentration on cessation is posited as the meaning of abiding in bliss in this life. Having understood that, the bodhisattvas do not actualize it because they are concerned with the welfare of sentient beings.

original: bslab par mi bya der gnas par ni mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bslab par mi bya der gnas par ni mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that one should not train in that, nor should one abide in that.

original: dngos po rnam par rtog pa'i rang bzhin la mngon par chags pa zhes bya ba ni smos par bshad pa 'chang pa yang rig par bya ste /
analyzed: dngos po rnam par rtog pa'i rang bzhin la mngon par chags pa zhes bya ba ni smos par bshad pa 'chang pa yang rig par bya ste /
translated: The phrase attachment to the nature of conceptualized things should be understood as stated, and also as attachment to the nature of verbal expression.

original: phyi'i dngos por rnam par rtog pas rang bzhin la mngon par chags pa'o //
analyzed: phyi'i dngos por rnam par rtog pas rang bzhin la mngon par chags pa'o //
translated: It is attachment to the nature of external things through conceptualization.

original: 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa'i gzugs ni kha dog dang dbyibs kyi rang bzhin pa yin te /
analyzed: 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa'i gzugs ni kha dog dang dbyibs kyi rang bzhin pa yin te /
translated: The form of the elements and the form derived from the elements has the nature of color and shape.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyis zhib tu sgrub par mdzad pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyis zhib tu sgrub par mdzad pa 'di lta ste /
translated: This is established in detail by omniscience, as follows:

original: sngon po dang ser po zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: sngon po dang ser po zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: blue, yellow, and so on.

original: byed pa med par 'byung ba ni byed pa po dang / las dang / byed pa dang bral ba rnams te /
analyzed: byed pa med par 'byung ba ni byed pa po dang / las dang / byed pa dang bral ba rnams te /
translated: Arising without action is free from agent, action, and activity.

original: ji ltar gsungs pa /
analyzed: ji ltar gsungs pa /
translated: As it is said:

original: 'du byed thams cad skad cig pa //
analyzed: 'du byed thams cad skad cig pa //
translated: All formations are momentary.üîΩHow can the impermanent be an agent?

original: mi brtan byed pa ga la zhig / gang byung byed pa de nyid de //
analyzed: mi brtan byed pa ga la zhig / gang byung byed pa de nyid de //
translated: Whatever arises is just that.

original: byed pa por yang de nyid brjod //
analyzed: byed pa por yang de nyid brjod //
translated: And it is also called the agent.

original: rigs pa dang lung dang / tshad ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: rigs pa dang lung dang / tshad ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Reason, scripture, and valid cognition, etc.

original: rigs pa dang lung ni rigs pa dang ldan pa'i lung la ste /
analyzed: rigs pa dang lung ni rigs pa dang ldan pa'i lung la ste /
translated: Reason and scripture are in the case of a scripture that has reason.

original: thog mar dge zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: thog mar dge zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Such as virtuous in the beginning, etc.

original: tshad ma ni mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa ste /
analyzed: tshad ma ni mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa ste /
translated: Valid cognition is direct perception and inference.

original: skad cig mar 'jig pa dang / bdag med pa la sogs par sgrub par byed pa'o @90a * //
analyzed: skad cig mar 'jig pa dang / bdag med pa la sogs par sgrub par byed pa'o @90a * //
translated: Such as momentary destruction, selflessness, etc.

original: de de ltar phung po la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid khong du chud nas de la mngon par zhen pa btsun gtso'i byang chub sems dpas yongs su spang bar bya ba ni bzlog par bya'o //
analyzed: de de ltar phung po la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid khong du chud nas de la mngon par zhen pa btsun gtso'i byang chub sems dpas yongs su spang bar bya ba ni bzlog par bya'o //
translated: Having thus understood the characteristics of the aggregates, etc., the bodhisattva who is foremost in purity should abandon and reverse the attachment to them.

original: ji ltar bzlog par bya zhes pa dang / der gsungs pa /
analyzed: ji ltar bzlog par bya zhes pa dang / der gsungs pa /
translated: How should one reverse it? It is said there:

original: chos la bdag med pa'i mtshan nyid la rjes su gzhug ces so //
analyzed: chos la bdag med pa'i mtshan nyid la rjes su gzhug ces so //
translated: One should engage in the characteristic of the selflessness of phenomena.

original: gang zag la bdag med par ni phyi'i don du smra ba'i nyan thos pa rnams gnas so //
analyzed: gang zag la bdag med par ni phyi'i don du smra ba'i nyan thos pa rnams gnas so //
translated: As for the selflessness of the person, the ≈õrƒÅvakas who speak of external objects abide in that.

original: chos la bdag med pa ni zhi ba pa dang / gtogs 'dod pa dang / rig sngags 'dzin pa'i mthar smra ba po rnams gnas so //
analyzed: chos la bdag med pa ni zhi ba pa dang / gtogs 'dod pa dang / rig sngags 'dzin pa'i mthar smra ba po rnams gnas so //
translated: The selflessness of phenomena is the abode of the ≈örƒÅvakas, the Pratyekabuddhas, and the Vedantins.

original: de lta ba gnyis las sems can rnams rigs pas bzlog ste /
analyzed: de lta ba gnyis las sems can rnams rigs pas bzlog ste /
translated: From these two views, sentient beings are to be turned back by means of reasoning.

original: sa dang sa'i rim par mtshams sbyor ba la gnas par bya ba ni 'jug pa la sogs pa'i nyes pa spong du bcug ste /
analyzed: sa dang sa'i rim par mtshams sbyor ba la gnas par bya ba ni 'jug pa la sogs pa'i nyes pa spong du bcug ste /
translated: They are to be established in the stages of the grounds, having been made to abandon the faults of engagement, etc.

original: rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa'i sar rim gyis dgod par bya'o //
analyzed: rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa'i sar rim gyis dgod par bya'o //
translated: They are to be gradually placed on the grounds of the joyful, etc.

original: de la rim zhes bya ba ni 'jungs pa'i gnyen por sbyin pa dang / ngang tshul ngan pa'i gnyen por tshul khrims dang / ngan du smra ba la sogs pa khro ba'i gnyen por ji mi snyam zhing bzod pa dang / le lo'i gnyen por brtson 'grus dang /
analyzed: de la rim zhes bya ba ni 'jungs pa'i gnyen por sbyin pa dang / ngang tshul ngan pa'i gnyen por tshul khrims dang / ngan du smra ba la sogs pa khro ba'i gnyen por ji mi snyam zhing bzod pa dang / le lo'i gnyen por brtson 'grus dang /
translated: Therein, the so-called stages are as follows: Generosity is the antidote to stinginess; morality is the antidote to immorality; patience is the antidote to anger, etc., in that one is indifferent to the abuse, etc. of others; effort is the antidote to laziness;

original: mnyam par mi 'jog pa'i gnyen por bsam gtan dang / ma rig pa'i gnyen por shes rab dang / thabs med pa'i gnyen por shes rab kyis thabs la mkhas pa dang / smon pa med pa'i gnyen por bzang po spyod pa'i smon lam dang / rnal 'byor gyi lam gyi stobs chung ba'i gnyen por stobs dang /
analyzed: mnyam par mi 'jog pa'i gnyen por bsam gtan dang / ma rig pa'i gnyen por shes rab dang / thabs med pa'i gnyen por shes rab kyis thabs la mkhas pa dang / smon pa med pa'i gnyen por bzang po spyod pa'i smon lam dang / rnal 'byor gyi lam gyi stobs chung ba'i gnyen por stobs dang /
translated: The antidote to non-equipoise is meditative concentration; the antidote to ignorance is wisdom; the antidote to lack of skill in means is skill in means through wisdom; the antidote to lack of aspiration is the aspiration of good conduct; the antidote to the weakness of the path of yoga is the powers;

original: nyon mongs pa dang / nyon mongs pa med pa'i mi shes pa thams cad kyi gnyen por ye shes te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang / nyon mongs pa med pa'i mi shes pa thams cad kyi gnyen por ye shes te /
translated: and the antidote to all the ignorance of afflictions and non-afflictions is knowledge.

original: sa bcu'i rim gyis mtshams sbyor ba'i khyad par bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs la dgod par bya zhing sbyin pa la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa bcu'i tshogs rnams kyis sangs rgyas su dgod par bya'o //
analyzed: sa bcu'i rim gyis mtshams sbyor ba'i khyad par bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs la dgod par bya zhing sbyin pa la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa bcu'i tshogs rnams kyis sangs rgyas su dgod par bya'o //
translated: One should establish them in the accumulations of merit and knowledge, which are the special connections with the stages of the ten grounds, and one should establish them in buddhahood through the accumulations of the ten perfections such as generosity.

original: rtag pa bsam gyis mi khyab ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: rtag pa bsam gyis mi khyab ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The line beginning ‚Äúpermanent, inconceivable‚Äù and so on.

original: rtag pa ni rgyun rtag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag pa ni rgyun rtag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Permanent means permanent continuum.

original: mi rtag pa ni skad cig ma'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi rtag pa ni skad cig ma'i phyir ro //
translated: Impermanent means momentary.

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa ni bsam mi nus pa'o //
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa ni bsam mi nus pa'o //
translated: The inconceivable is that which cannot be conceived.

original: mu stegs byed pa rnams rgyu rnams la rtag pa dang / bsam gyis mi khyab par smra'o zhes pa ni gleng ba'o //
analyzed: mu stegs byed pa rnams rgyu rnams la rtag pa dang / bsam gyis mi khyab par smra'o zhes pa ni gleng ba'o //
translated: The non-Buddhists say that the causes are permanent and inconceivable.

original: lha chen po dang / gtogs 'dod dang / tshangs pa dang / bdag dang / rdul phra mo la sogs pa ni gnas kyi dkyil 'khor gyi dngos po rnams kyi rgyu @90b rtag pa dang / bsam gyis mi khyab pas nus so zhes mi gnyis par smra ba rnams rtog pa dang /
analyzed: lha chen po dang / gtogs 'dod dang / tshangs pa dang / bdag dang / rdul phra mo la sogs pa ni gnas kyi dkyil 'khor gyi dngos po rnams kyi rgyu @90b rtag pa dang / bsam gyis mi khyab pas nus so zhes mi gnyis par smra ba rnams rtog pa dang /
translated: The non-Buddhists who speak in this way imagine that the great god, PrajƒÅpati, BrahmƒÅ, the self, the subtle particle, and so on, are the permanent and inconceivable cause of the entities of the ma·πá·∏çala of abodes.

original: rgyu rnams kyi rgyu ma rig pa'i mthu bsam gyis mi khyab po zhes mi gnyis par smra pa rnams kyang smra'o //
analyzed: rgyu rnams kyi rgyu ma rig pa'i mthu bsam gyis mi khyab po zhes mi gnyis par smra pa rnams kyang smra'o //
translated: The non-Buddhists who speak in this way also say that the cause of the causes is the inconceivable power of ignorance.

original: gnyis par smra ba rnams kyang rdul gnyis pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis rdul phra mo rnams la yan lag med kyang yan lag dang bcas pa'i rdzas rtsom par byed ces de skad du glengs pa der thams cad mkhyen pas spongs bar gsungs pa /
analyzed: gnyis par smra ba rnams kyang rdul gnyis pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis rdul phra mo rnams la yan lag med kyang yan lag dang bcas pa'i rdzas rtsom par byed ces de skad du glengs pa der thams cad mkhyen pas spongs bar gsungs pa /
translated: The Omniscient One said to refute that:

original: mu stegs byed pa rnams rgyun ni rtag pa dang / bsam gyis mi khyab pa nyid thob par mi 'gyur ro zhes so //
analyzed: mu stegs byed pa rnams rgyun ni rtag pa dang / bsam gyis mi khyab pa nyid thob par mi 'gyur ro zhes so //
translated: ‚ÄúThe tƒ´rthikas do not attain the continuum, permanence, and inconceivability.‚Äù

original: de'i rgyu gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i rgyu gsungs pa /
translated: The reason for that is stated:

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúWhy is that?‚Äù

original: rgyu'i rang gi mtshan nyid dang ldan pa ma yin te zhes bya ba ni de'i rgyu'i rang gi mtshan nyid dang ldan pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rgyu'i rang gi mtshan nyid dang ldan pa ma yin te zhes bya ba ni de'i rgyu'i rang gi mtshan nyid dang ldan pa ma yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúIt is not endowed with the characteristics of a cause‚Äù means it is not endowed with the characteristics of a cause of that.

original: rtag pa la rgyu med pas na ri bong gi rva ltar dngos po med pa'o zhes so //
analyzed: rtag pa la rgyu med pas na ri bong gi rva ltar dngos po med pa'o zhes so //
translated: Since there is no cause for permanence, it is a nonentity, like the horn of a rabbit.

original: thams cad mkhyen pas tshad ma'i don nyid du gsungs pa /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pas tshad ma'i don nyid du gsungs pa /
translated: The Omniscient One said that the meaning of valid knowledge is:üîΩ‚ÄúThe nondeceptive object is the object of valid knowledge.‚Äù

original: blo gros chen po gang gis rtag pa dang / bsam gyis mi khyab pa de'i rgyu'i rang gi mtshan nyid dang mi ldan pa ni rtag pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa ri bong gi rva ltar ma skyes pas na rang bzhin med pa'i phyir rang bzhin gang gis mngon par bya //
analyzed: blo gros chen po gang gis rtag pa dang / bsam gyis mi khyab pa de'i rgyu'i rang gi mtshan nyid dang mi ldan pa ni rtag pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa ri bong gi rva ltar ma skyes pas na rang bzhin med pa'i phyir rang bzhin gang gis mngon par bya //
translated: ‚ÄúMahƒÅmati, that which is permanent and inconceivable is not endowed with the characteristics of a cause, like the horn of a rabbit, it is not produced, and therefore it is essenceless. By what essence would it be manifested?

original: byed pa po'am /
analyzed: byed pa po'am /
translated: By what agent?

original: shes par byed pa mngon par byed pa'i rgyu gang gis rjes su dpag par bya /
analyzed: shes par byed pa mngon par byed pa'i rgyu gang gis rjes su dpag par bya /
translated: By what cause of manifestation that is to be inferred?

original: ma skyes pa ni dngos po med pas na rtag pa dang / bsam gyis mi khyab pa'o zhes rtag pa dang / bsam gyis mi khyab par smra bar mi rung ngo //
analyzed: ma skyes pa ni dngos po med pas na rtag pa dang / bsam gyis mi khyab pa'o zhes rtag pa dang / bsam gyis mi khyab par smra bar mi rung ngo //
translated: Since the unproduced is a nonentity, it is permanent and inconceivable. Thus it is not suitable to propound permanence and inconceivability.

original: de ste rgyu'i rang gi mtshan nyid ni rag lus pa'o zhes brgya la mu stegs byed pas khas len na de'i tshe de las gzhan pa'i byas pa can bzhin du mi rtag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ste rgyu'i rang gi mtshan nyid ni rag lus pa'o zhes brgya la mu stegs byed pas khas len na de'i tshe de las gzhan pa'i byas pa can bzhin du mi rtag par 'gyur ro //
translated: If, on the other hand, the tƒ´rthikas accept that the characteristics of a cause are dependent, then at that time, like something produced that is different from that, it would be impermanent.

original: nga'i zhes bya ba la sog pa pas ni rang gi phyogs kyi khyad par gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: nga'i zhes bya ba la sog pa pas ni rang gi phyogs kyi khyad par gsungs pa'o //
translated: The phrase mine, etc. indicates the particularity of one's own position.

original: rtag pa ni rgyun rtag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag pa ni rgyun rtag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Permanence means that the continuum is permanent.

original: gang na bsam pa med pa de ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa ste /
analyzed: gang na bsam pa med pa de ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa ste /
translated: That which is inconceivable is that which is beyond the scope of thought.

original: don dam pa'i bden pa gnyis su med pa yang dag par rig pa de ni rtag pa bsam gyis mi khyab pas de ni dbang po'i shes pa 'jug pa yang dag par 'jug par shes pa bzhin no //
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pa gnyis su med pa yang dag par rig pa de ni rtag pa bsam gyis mi khyab pas de ni dbang po'i shes pa 'jug pa yang dag par 'jug par shes pa bzhin no //
translated: That is the inconceivable permanence of the ultimate truth, which is nondual and perfectly known, like the knowledge of the engagement of sense consciousness.

original: don dam pa'i rgyu mtshan nyid dang ldan pa ni mi gnyis par yang dag par rig pa'i mtshan nyid pas na mi gnyis par yang dag par rig pa'i mtshan nyid kyi dngos po'i mtshan nyid kyi dngos po'o //üîΩdngos po dang dngos po med pa dang bral ba ni yod pa dang med @91a * //
analyzed: don dam pa'i rgyu mtshan nyid dang ldan pa ni mi gnyis par yang dag par rig pa'i mtshan nyid pas na mi gnyis par yang dag par rig pa'i mtshan nyid kyi dngos po'i mtshan nyid kyi dngos po'o // dngos po dang dngos po med pa dang bral ba ni yod pa dang med @91a * //
translated: The characteristic of the ultimate is nonduality, because it is perfectly known as having the characteristic of nonduality. Therefore, it is the characteristic of things that have the characteristic of nonduality.

original: pa'i rnam par rtog pa med pa'o //
analyzed: pa'i rnam par rtog pa med pa'o //
translated: Free from existence and nonexistence means free from the concepts of existence and nonexistence.
