original: 'phags pa so so rang gis rig pa'i mtshan nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni yang dag par rig pa rang bzhin gnyis su med pa'i phyir yongs su grub par dgongs pa yin gyi gzhan gyi dbang dngos po dang dngos po med pa dang bral zhing gnyis su
analyzed: 'phags pa so so rang gis rig pa'i mtshan nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni yang dag par rig pa rang bzhin gnyis su med pa'i phyir yongs su grub par dgongs pa yin gyi gzhan gyi dbang dngos po dang dngos po med pa dang bral zhing gnyis su
translated: The term ‚Äúbecause of the nature of the individual‚Äôs own knowledge‚Äù means that the thoroughly established nature is the intended meaning because the two natures of correct knowledge are nondual.üîΩ

original: med pa sgyu ma la sogs pa'i rang bzhin ni ma yin no //
analyzed: med pa sgyu ma la sogs pa'i rang bzhin ni ma yin no //
translated: Because of the nature of the noble individual self-awareness, the thoroughly established nature is intended as the non-dual nature of correct knowledge, not as the dependent nature free from entity and non-entity, non-dual, and having the nature of illusion, etc.

original: chud pa'i rang bzhin ni yang dag par rig pa'i dngos po nyid yang dag par na mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: chud pa'i rang bzhin ni yang dag par rig pa'i dngos po nyid yang dag par na mtshan nyid do //
translated: The nature of the container is the entity of correct knowledge, which is the characteristic in reality.

original: des na mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: des na mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it has characteristics.

original: gang na mtshan nyid dang ldan pa med pa des na rnam pa gnyis dang ma bral bas na mtshan nyid dang ldan pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang na mtshan nyid dang ldan pa med pa des na rnam pa gnyis dang ma bral bas na mtshan nyid dang ldan pa ma yin te /
translated: Where there is no having of characteristics, there is no having of characteristics due to not being free from the two,

original: mngon par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: mngon par brjod par bya'o //
translated: and it should be expressed.

original: mu stegs byed pa rtag par smra ba ma gtogs pa'i skad cig ma'i rgyun gsungs pa rgyu dang ldan pa yin gyi /
analyzed: mu stegs byed pa rtag par smra ba ma gtogs pa'i skad cig ma'i rgyun gsungs pa rgyu dang ldan pa yin gyi /
translated: Except for the tƒ´rthikas who propound permanence, the teaching of momentary continua is endowed with causes.

original: rgyu med pa las byung ba ni ma yin no zhes so //
analyzed: rgyu med pa las byung ba ni ma yin no zhes so //
translated: It does not arise without a cause.

original: ji ltar na yang mi gnyis pa'i ye shes kyi rgyu don dam pa'i ye shes yin zhes pa dang gsungs pa yod pa dang bral bas na zhes so //
analyzed: ji ltar na yang mi gnyis pa'i ye shes kyi rgyu don dam pa'i ye shes yin zhes pa dang gsungs pa yod pa dang bral bas na zhes so //
translated: How is it that the cause of non-dual knowledge is the ultimate knowledge?

original: don dam pa ma yin pa'i gzhan gyi dbang ni yod pa dang med pa gnyis kyi rnam pa yin te /
analyzed: don dam pa ma yin pa'i gzhan gyi dbang ni yod pa dang med pa gnyis kyi rnam pa yin te /
translated: The dependent nature that is not ultimate is of the aspect of both existence and non-existence.

original: de las 'das pa'i yongs su grub pa dngos po dang dngos po med pa dang bral ba thams cad du khyab pa brjod du med pa ste /
analyzed: de las 'das pa'i yongs su grub pa dngos po dang dngos po med pa dang bral ba thams cad du khyab pa brjod du med pa ste /
translated: Beyond that, the perfected nature is free from existence and non-existence, all-pervading, and inexpressible.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa byung yang rung /üîΩma byung yang rung ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa byung yang rung / ma byung yang rung ste /
translated: Whether the TathƒÅgata appears or not,

original: chud pa'i rgyun gyi chos nyid de ni ye nas gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: chud pa'i rgyun gyi chos nyid de ni ye nas gnas pa yin te /
translated: this reality of the stream of dependent origination has always existed.

original: dbang po la sogs pas ma byas pas na ma byas pa dang / 'dus ma byas pas na nam mkha'i chos su brtag go //
analyzed: dbang po la sogs pas ma byas pas na ma byas pa dang / 'dus ma byas pas na nam mkha'i chos su brtag go //
translated: Since it is not created by faculties and so forth, it is uncreated, and since it is unconditioned, it should be considered a space-like quality.

original: de bzhin nyid ces bya ba ni mi gnyis pa'i chos nyid do //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid ces bya ba ni mi gnyis pa'i chos nyid do //
translated: Suchness is the non-dual reality.

original: dngos po mi rtag pa'i mtshan nyid kyi rgyu las gyur pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni mi rtag pa'i dngos po rnams kyi mtshan nyid kyi rang bzhin 'byung ba'i rgyu yod de /
analyzed: dngos po mi rtag pa'i mtshan nyid kyi rgyu las gyur pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni mi rtag pa'i dngos po rnams kyi mtshan nyid kyi rang bzhin 'byung ba'i rgyu yod de /
translated: ‚ÄúBecause of the cause of the characteristic of impermanent things‚Äù and so on means that the nature of the characteristic of impermanent things exists as a cause.

original: des na de dag mi rtag pa'o //
analyzed: des na de dag mi rtag pa'o //
translated: Therefore, they are impermanent.

original: rgyu dang ldan pa ma yin par yod pa ni rtag pa ste zhes pa ni rtag pa'i rgyu de las med de /
analyzed: rgyu dang ldan pa ma yin par yod pa ni rtag pa ste zhes pa ni rtag pa'i rgyu de las med de /
translated: ‚ÄúThat which exists without a cause is permanent‚Äù means that permanent things do not have that cause.

original: des na bdag gis byas pa'i rgyu'i mtshan nyid kyis rab tu phye ba'i rtag pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des na bdag gis byas pa'i rgyu'i mtshan nyid kyis rab tu phye ba'i rtag pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, they are not permanent, distinguished by the characteristic of a cause created by themselves.

original: de dag gi rgyu med do zhes don 'di 'byung ste /
analyzed: de dag gi rgyu med do zhes don 'di 'byung ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThey do not have a cause‚Äù means that this is the meaning.

original: de rgyu ma phye bas na rtag go zhes mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa bzhin du brtag pa 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
analyzed: de rgyu ma phye bas na rtag go zhes mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa bzhin du brtag pa 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
translated: Since that cause is not distinguished, it is permanent. This is just a hypothesis, like the son of a barren woman and so on.

original: rgyu dang bral ba rnams ni ma skyes pas na ri bong gi rva bzhin du med pa nyid do //
analyzed: rgyu dang bral ba rnams ni ma skyes pas na ri bong gi rva bzhin du med pa nyid do //
translated: Since those that are free from a cause are not produced, they are just nonexistent, like the horn of an ass.

original: mu stegs byed pa rnams rtag pa dang / @91b bsam gyis mi khyab pa rtog pa ni dus thams cad du gnas pas na rtag pa bsam pa dang bral ba'i phyir bsam gyis mi khyab pa ste /
analyzed: mu stegs byed pa rnams rtag pa dang / @91b bsam gyis mi khyab pa rtog pa ni dus thams cad du gnas pas na rtag pa bsam pa dang bral ba'i phyir bsam gyis mi khyab pa ste /
translated: The tƒ´rthikas imagine permanence and inconceivability, because they maintain that everything exists at all times, and because they are free from imagination, they are inconceivable.

original: mi gnyis pa rnam par mi rtog pa dang / snang ba thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir shes pa ni de lta bur yang grol ba la sogs pa gcig pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi gnyis pa rnam par mi rtog pa dang / snang ba thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir shes pa ni de lta bur yang grol ba la sogs pa gcig pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro //
translated: Since consciousness is nondual, nonconceptual, and free from all appearances, it would be the same as liberation, and so on.

original: tshad ma snga ma'i don nyid zhib tu gsungs pa /üîΩblo gros chen po de ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: tshad ma snga ma'i don nyid zhib tu gsungs pa / blo gros chen po de ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The meaning of the previous valid cognition is taught in detail:

original: byas pa'i dngos po med pas rtag pa nyid du mthong nas rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma'i blos ma byas pa ni rtag par 'gyur zhes de ltar na ni nga'i yang rgyu nyid kyi ste /
analyzed: byas pa'i dngos po med pas rtag pa nyid du mthong nas rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma'i blos ma byas pa ni rtag par 'gyur zhes de ltar na ni nga'i yang rgyu nyid kyi ste /
translated: ‚ÄúMahƒÅmati, if, seeing permanence because of the nonexistence of a fabricated thing, you think that the unfabricated is permanent with the mind of the valid cognition of inference, then in that case, mine too is a cause,

original: ma byas pas byas pa'i dngos po rnams 'jig pa'i mtshan nyid du med pas rtag par mthong nas rgyu med par bstan pa'i phyir rtag pa ste /
analyzed: ma byas pas byas pa'i dngos po rnams 'jig pa'i mtshan nyid du med pas rtag par mthong nas rgyu med par bstan pa'i phyir rtag pa ste /
translated: In order to demonstrate that they are without cause, they are permanent.

original: mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa bzhin dngos po med pa nyid de /
analyzed: mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa bzhin dngos po med pa nyid de /
translated: They are just like the son of a barren woman and so forth, which are simply non-existent.

original: de lta bas na 'phags pa'i lhas don de nyid smras pa /
analyzed: de lta bas na 'phags pa'i lhas don de nyid smras pa /
translated: Thus, ƒÄryadeva states the same point:

original: rten 'bral 'byung yod med pa ni //üîΩnams kyang su zhig gang du yang //
analyzed: rten 'bral 'byung yod med pa ni // nams kyang su zhig gang du yang //
translated: That which is devoid of a basis and does not arise

original: cung zad yod pa ma yin te //
analyzed: cung zad yod pa ma yin te //
translated: is not existent in any way whatsoever.

original: des na de ni rtag pa'o //
analyzed: des na de ni rtag pa'o //
translated: Since it is permanent,

original: rgyu med pa ni dngos po med //
analyzed: rgyu med pa ni dngos po med //
translated: it is without cause.

original: rgyu ldan pa yang rtag pa min //
analyzed: rgyu ldan pa yang rtag pa min //
translated: That which has a cause is not permanent.

original: des na rgyu med grub pa med //
analyzed: des na rgyu med grub pa med //
translated: Therefore, that which is without cause is not established.

original: yang dag rig pas grub med gsungs //
analyzed: yang dag rig pas grub med gsungs //
translated: The perfect knower said that it is not established.

original: de ste rgyu dang mtshan nyid dang ldan pa zhig yin na ni zhes bya ba ni gal te rtag pa dang bsam gyis mi khyab pa bsgrub pa'i rgyu zhig yod na ni de'i tshe rung ngo zhes de ni thams cad mkhyen pas dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: de ste rgyu dang mtshan nyid dang ldan pa zhig yin na ni zhes bya ba ni gal te rtag pa dang bsam gyis mi khyab pa bsgrub pa'i rgyu zhig yod na ni de'i tshe rung ngo zhes de ni thams cad mkhyen pas dgongs pa'o //
translated: If it had a cause and the nature of a cause, then it would be tenable, if there were a cause for establishing permanence and inconceivability.

original: rtag pa dang bsam gyis mi khyab pa bsgrub pa'i rgyu gang yang med pas na de'i phyir nye bar bsdu bar mdzad pa /
analyzed: rtag pa dang bsam gyis mi khyab pa bsgrub pa'i rgyu gang yang med pas na de'i phyir nye bar bsdu bar mdzad pa /
translated: Since there is no cause at all for establishing permanence and inconceivability, therefore, the summary is made:

original: rgyu'i rang gi mtshan nyid kyi dngos po med pa zhes te /
analyzed: rgyu'i rang gi mtshan nyid kyi dngos po med pa zhes te /
translated: ‚ÄúThe non-existence of the nature of a cause.‚Äù

original: gang gis sgrub par byed pa de'i dngos po med pas na de med pa'i phyir de ma skyes pas ri bong gi rva ltar dngos po med do zhes tshad ma'i don to //
analyzed: gang gis sgrub par byed pa de'i dngos po med pas na de med pa'i phyir de ma skyes pas ri bong gi rva ltar dngos po med do zhes tshad ma'i don to //
translated: Since there is no entity of that which establishes it, because of its non-existence, it is non-arisen, like the horn of a rabbit. This is the meaning of valid cognition.
